plot: The INCOMPARABLE CHERRELLE will be Dishing Tea with Big Meach today as we get into those things that have kept her out of the papers and perhaps off the scene for a while. We will explore how she and Alexander Oneal become the DUET COUPLE of the late 80s and 90s and how she has made a mark on the music industry. PLUS, we will get into how FAMILY stay together in this business as we explore her relationship with her cousin, PEEBLES.

title: "Disneyland" (1954) {A Story of Dogs (#1.6)}
plot: As the episode implies, this episode is mostly about dogs. The first half of this episode is a behind-the-scenes look at "Lady and the Tramp", which would be released next summer. The second half is on the highlights of Disney's first canine star, Pluto.

title: "Disneyland" (1954) {The Girl Who Spelled Freedom (#30.5)}
plot: In the mid 1970's, a young girl's family must endure a nightmarish life in her native country of Cambodia under the domination of the brutal Khmer Rouge regime. But things change for the better when an American family agrees to sponsor their immigration to the United States of America. They soon prove to have some difficulty adjusting to their new home as with language barriers and survival habits that are not necessary anymore, but are hard to break. While they are learning, one of the daughters struggles harder than the others and is personally driven to become a champion contender in spelling bees.

title: "Ditte & Louise" (2015)
plot: Two actresses in their forties, meet at a casting. Since they are both struggling to get jobs they decide to team up and make their own thing. But it's uphill, and they're certainly over the hill, in the eyes of the industry. Despite their differences, the two women become friends.

title: "Diver Dan" (1961) {The Magnet (#1.40)}
plot: Trigger steals the file Sam the Sawfish uses to sharpen his nose. When Trigger shows the file to Baron Barracuda the two villains are startled when they see the tool flying through the water until it is stuck on a large rock. When Sam swims by looking for his file, his nose becomes attached to the same outcropping. Baron deduces that the rock has some mysterious attraction to metal and decides to lure Diver Dan into a trap by tickling Sam until he calls for help.

title: "Division 4" (1969) {The Big Spender (#1.3)}
plot: 19-year old Kay Dixon is attracted by the glamorous life of big-spending racketeer Max Foley, who tries to set up a floating cabaret. Kay finds herself in the ugly world of prostitution, exploitation and violence with no apparent way out. Police investigate Foley when a criminal associate of his is bashed.

title: "Do Not Be Afraid" (2007)
plot: Women, restaurants, carefree life, drugs and friends. That is a former high-ranking political worker Arman Aramyan's son life. Among all of this - there is her big love Mari. She is the only light in his life. Escape from the law enforcement, involuntary volunteer in the militia war. On the verge of life and death - a spoiled but brave boy Yerevan becomes wise and courageous warrior. Return to Yerevan. Again the struggle of life, and measured, but in Yerevan, which has become a stranger to him. Love that has to wait. And the war again. The fate of the fall of military companies is decided in this battle.

title: "Doc Martin" (2004) {Hazardous Exposure (#6.6)}
plot: After vying with Jennifer for customer attention, Sally learns that she is finally allowed to practice alone and resume her old job, so she is keen to see off her rival. Jennifer plans to leave Port Wenn, but a marriage proposal from Bert changes her mind. Hypochondriac Malcolm Rayner complains of a cough, which leads Martin, given that Malcolm was a builder, to consider his possible exposure to asbestos and to order X-rays of his lungs. Malcolm, believing he is dying, gets drunk and arrested by Joe, who panics, posting asbestos warnings around the village. When he impales himself on his staple gun, Martin rescues him, but his blood phobia makes him vomit. A bigger blow for the doctor is the arrival of his mother, Margaret, who coldly informs him that his father has died. Nor is she very good with baby James, though she seems anxious to make amends. Martin is wary. Martin's insomnia continues and his blood phobia is seemingly getting worse. Louisa suggests that he go see the psychiatrist Ruth suggested. Martin treats Malcolm Rayner for a possible lung infection, possibly caused by the asbestos he used to insulate homes in the area. When Malcolm tells Joe Penhale about it the police constable starts distributing posters with a health warning. He even manages to staple his hand to a post necessitating Martin help. The sight of blood sickens him however. To top it all off, Martin's mother arrives unexpectedly. Elsewhere, Sally Tishell has received permission to work without supervision meaning Jennifer will now be leaving. Bert has a plan to keep her in the village.

title: "Doc" (2001) {Rules of Engagement (#4.5)}
plot: Captain Steven Doss launches Operation Rules Of Engagement as a way of asking Tippy to marry him. Clint treats a young boy named Jordan for ADD. He notices something else is wrong when Jordan doesn't hear Clint calling his name. Clint tells Jordan's parents that he has auto immune inner ear disease.

title: "Doctor Finlay" (1993) {Stolen Lives (#2.3)}
plot: When Alec Gant dies, Janet finally learns what had happened to her best friend Hannah who disappeared when they were only 15 years old. Hannah was pregnant at the time and Janet, along with another good friend Elspeth Strickland, had assumed she had run away with the father of the child. Instead they learn from Hannah's mother, who knew nothing of her daughter's whereabouts, that Hannah's father had her put away in an insane asylum where, 38 years later, she still resides. They arrange for Hannah to come home but after being away for so long, she has trouble re-adapting to life in the community. It is also apparent that several are afraid of the secrets she may reveal. For Dr. Finlay, he has to come to terms with the truth when he sees the name of one of the doctors who committed the 15 year-old in the first place. Arden House is in a bit of turmoil as well as the workmen have started on Dr. Finlay's renovations.

title: "Doctor Who" (1963) {Arc of Infinity: Part One (#20.1)}
plot: On Gallifrey, someone on the high council is perpetrating a treasonous act - transmitting the Doctor's bio-extract from the space/time matrix to an anti-matter being. On Earth, two English lads spend their last night in Amsterdam sleeping in a crypt where they're attacked by an alien creature under the same anti-matter being's control.

title: "Doctor Who" (1963) {Nightmare of Eden: Part One (#17.13)}
plot: A cruise ship loaded with passengers to the planet Azure collides with a trade ship as it comes out of warp, leaving the two ships merged but unstable. The Doctor, Romana and K-9 arrive to help out but discover there's also a problem with unidentified smugglers running a cargo of vraxoin, a forbidden organic drug that's as highly addictive as it is fatal. It instills the user with warm complacency and total apathy - the very qualities currently displayed by the cruise ship's bemused co-pilot.

title: "Doctor Who" (1963) {The Curse of Fenric: Part One (#26.8)}
plot: The Doctor and Ace arrive at a Naval base on the cost of Northumerland towards the end of World War II. The Time lord and his young companion pretend to be from the war office. The purpose of which is that the Doctor wishes to meet the wheelchair bound Dr. Judson who's work at breaking German Cyphers is very important to the war effort. This is achieved through the use of the Ultima machine. An invention of the crippled genius's. Unknown however to the Doctor, Ace and Judson. A platoon of Russian soldiers lead by Captain Sorin have secretly arrived on the coast of Northumberland. Their goal: To steal the Ultima Machine. But unknown to the Doctor. The theft of the Ultima Machine has been partly devised by Commander Millington. The bases supreme commanding officer. A ruthless, military man who is unnaturally obsessed with Norse Mythology. For centuries ago a Viking ship moored on the very shores, next to where the base stands. Carrying with it an evil curse. The Time Lord soon realize he and everyone else on the base is embroiled in a deadly game. One that began centuries ago and will finally come to an end on the shores of England.

title: "Doctor Who" (1963) {The Stones of Blood: Part Two (#16.10)}
plot: The Doctor and Romana's lives have already been imperiled. Now megalithic creatures from planet Ogros begin to attack under the directives of a mysterious master. Investigating the history of the area, Romana notices that for centuries only women have owned the land and nearby manor and wonders if there's any significance to this.

title: "Doctor Who" (1963) {Warriors' Gate: Part Two (#18.18)}
plot: Three humorless men from a damaged bulk freighter find the TARDIS. Wearily, Romana returns with them to appraise the situation of their damaged ship but, because she's a time sensitive, winds up as a living navigational component to replace their time-sensitive Tharil (lion-man) who escaped. Meanwhile the Doctor, having found a gateway, is having a time with Gundans, robot soldiers programmed to kill.

title: "Doctor Who" (2005) {The Bells of Saint John (#7.7)}
plot: A chance phone call reunites the Doctor with Clara in the present day. A mysterious organization, lead by the evil Miss Kizlet, sends robots known as "Spoonheads" to steal the minds of people who use the company's WiFi. The Doctor and Clara must work together to find the location of the organization and destroy it before the whole world is trapped by the WiFi. The Doctor is living in 1207 in a monastery contemplating how he might get in touch with Clara when the telephone on the TARDIS rings. It's Clara, living in the present day, seeking assistance with her Internet connection. She has no memory of the Doctor and is again working as a nanny. The Doctor pays her a visit and soon concludes that a living sentient computer is stealing people's souls using wifi and the Internet. The unknown power controlling the wifi tries to convince the Doctor that he cannot win. When Clara is taken, the Doctor has every intention of getting her back.

title: "Doctor Who: Fan Series" (2010) {Ballad of the Doctor (#2.3)}
plot: The Doctor and Banes dived into the Fort in which was the place where Banes' friend went missing on a school trip. They have discovered something. They have discovered that the Star has been behind the whole thing. Lee and Nicky are locked away underground. 1941 is about to collide with the year 2011. Can the Doctor stop it this time?

title: "Doctor at Large" (1971) {Congratulations- It's a Toad! (#1.6)}
plot: Paul has an idea for a pregnancy advisory service, using toads in his demonstration. Unfortunately the samples he brings to the surgery are frogs and not toads and soon they are everywhere. Dr. Mackendrick comes to the surgery and heartily disapproves of Paul's idea, feeling it could get him struck off. However a tadpole has escaped into an ice bucket and the cube of ice with the tadpole in it has found its way into Mackendrick's drink. The other doctors must get it out without his noticing.

title: "Doctor in Charge" (1972) {In Place of Strife (#2.8)}
plot: Painters arrive to decorate the ward and, as they are in white coats, Duncan mistakes them for new students. The painters do their work but go home at five, leaving a bare patch, which Duncan paints in. Next day the irate painters down tools in protest at his non-union interference. The doctors put the furniture back in place, causing the porters to also down tools. Soon all the hospital's manual workers are on strike so Sir Geoffrey suspends Duncan to appease them. This causes the doctors to go on strike.

title: "Doctor on the Go" (1975) {Bunny Makes the World Go Round (#2.7)}
plot: Duncan is desperate to get together five unusual medical cases so that he can present them at an exam. However his frantic efforts to acquire them are somehow misunderstood so that he ends up, not with medical anomalies but cute soft toys, as fluffy bunnies and cuddly Teddy bears fill up his ward - a fact which is not going to endear him to Loftus.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {A Forced Marriage (#16.164)}
plot: As Naz Banga is rushed to hospital after being knocked unconscious Jimmi attends to his wife Priya's injuries. DC Indhu Choudry believes her to be a battered wife who attacked her husband but Priya claims that Naz is two-timing her with violent girlfriend Dawn Fraser, who was responsible for assaulting him. Jimmi and Indhu disagree over who is the actual victim until the truth emerges. Elsewhere Emma has a lovely night out with Franc, even though he gets her to dish the dirt on their colleagues.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Age Concern (#17.209)}
plot: At Sid's mental health awareness display Daniel meets an old friend, Roy Lewis, who is worried about sexual performance given the age gap between himself and his new partner. Daniel sees Roy with a young girl and gets the wrong end of the stick until he finally learns the truth. Daniel also offers Niamh and Ben hope regarding a possible cure for Harry whilst Sid makes Ayesha an offer.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Bad Influence (#16.199)}
plot: Teen-aged skate-boarder Alfie Benton tells Jimmi he has a premonition that something bad will befall him and it comes true when Jimmi discovers that the boy has internal bleeding. Jimmi must discover whether Alfie's depressive mother, his younger brother or a jealous skate-boarding rival was the attacker whilst Daniel accepts a two month locum period in Australia and Brenda confronts Ayesha over Tracey's offer.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Box Clever (#14.149)}
plot: Al meets an old school-friend Eddie Croker, whose sister Lottie has breast cancer. She also believes that there is a whale in a box in her kitchen and she cannot leave the house as she must look after it. To Eddie's annoyance Al seems to be playing along with her but this is a ruse to gain her trust and diagnose that she has been hallucinating as a side effect of her treatment. Finally he gets her to hospital, where she expresses her gratitude. Kevin plans to meet up with Nadia but she puts him off, claiming she is having a 'family' evening.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Charming (#13.74)}
plot: Zara smells a rat when her old friend announces her impending nuptials. She's been with her boyfriend for such a short time. Zara tries to prove that he's not really in love with her, in typical Zara style, and results! Heston goes to see one of his favorite novelists - her mother has dementia and thinks she's Scottish!

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Crisis of Faith (#16.189)}
plot: Emma goes to the aid of schoolgirl Faith who is having an asthma attack and who tells Emma she feels unwanted by her foster parents Steph and Paul Wright as Steph is expecting a baby. In fact the couple are keen to adopt Faith but she runs off and Emma needs to track her down to tell her. With Al out of the running Howard shadows Franco on his own whilst Heston and Valerie discover the election results.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Doctor Love (#14.126)}
plot: Davey Love, the radio DJ known as Doctor Love comes to the surgery for his check-up during a seventy-two hour broadcasting marathon and ends up by getting the doctors involved. Jas, uncertain about her relationship with Aran, asks her mother for her advice and discovers that her parents' romance did not progress smoothly, whilst Rob and DCI Lynn Driver prepare to get into their roles as a married couple to trap Andrei Mitkov, the baby trafficker.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Fast and Furious (#16.56)}
plot: Hasan Haruna is perturbed by the eating habits of his diabetic mother Khadija and anorexic sister Yesemi and takes them to the surgery. Both women claim that they have to fast for Ramadan or else bad things will befall them but Niamh and Al tell them that they must eat or else they will become ill. Niamh later finds out more about Ramadan and tries to effect a compromise but is not wholly successful. Karen meanwhile discovers that she needs to wear glasses.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Friend and Neighbour (#14.12)}
plot: Frank's neighbor goes round to see him. He can't get an answer, so calls the police. They then find Frank dead. Two relatives who have been informed decide that the house is now theirs, and demand access. Frank's neighbor though, is being secretive, as there is something in the garden shed that he wants. Daniel is left at home with baby Joe, together with a list of instructions from Zara. Heston has a new security alarm fitted.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Hasta La Vista (#11.192)}
plot: Julia gets an unexpected visit from Mac's relatives, on the scrounge from Spain. Its Jimmi's first day back at work after the hostage taking, and Karen's first day back after the shooting. Immie meets Elise, who helps her open up, and Rob is suspended. Cherry and Ruth decide to teach Charlie a lesson, after continuous sexual innuendo.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {If Tomorrow Never Comes (#12.140)}
plot: It's 2006, and Jimmi has arranged a going away party for a patient and good friend of his. She's going to America. Unfortunately it all ends very badly. In 2010, on the fourth anniversary of her death, her killer is released from prison, and Jimmi has to deal with him when he takes an overdose.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Keep Us Together (#14.150)}
plot: Heston sees Tanya and Craig, a young couple seemingly anxious for a child, but Craig's sperm count is very low. In fact Tanya's true partner is the older Esther, an old friend of Heston and Craig was only a donor. Esther asks Heston to contribute his sperm but, advised by Emma and noticing how much the two women argue, he declines. Nadia introduces her surly brother Zarif to Kevin but when Kevin learns the couple only approached him as a possible bone marrow donor for their sick father Kevin is angry and walks out on them.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Living Together (#18.31)}
plot: Jimmi's friend Kate is perturbed that her boyfriend Mike is seeing somebody else and persuades him to play sleuth to find out though the outcome is more complicated than expected. Mrs Tembe's introduction of a self-service check-in machine does not meet with general approval whilst Ruhma and her family move in permanently with Heston.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Missing (#16.149)}
plot: Franc is in his corner shop when an inept robber attempts a hold-up but is foiled by the cynical shop-keeper. Franc's act of kindness to the would-be criminal elicits unexpected responses from both the man himself and the shop owner. After a falling out with Mrs Tembe Al offers to play Santa Claus at her church Christmas party whilst Ayesha begins to realize that she too is drinking too much.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Nighthawks: Part One (#17.168)}
plot: Anthony takes his male colleagues to a wine tasting and wins their approval when they gang up on the pretentious organizer whilst Heston and Ruhma enjoy their dinner date. Accompanied by a less than happy Karen Ayesha is charmed by bar pick-up Jackson, unaware that he has a partner and child and is a liar and - with brother-in-law Dion, a thief who preys on women.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Out of Control (#11.33)}
plot: Michelle tries to help a young student out of a potentially fatal friendship, when she gets involved in dangerous slimming websites. Ruth helps with Julia's garden, whilst Julia and the partners decide that she needs to be assessed before she does. Melody gets the task, much to Michelle's annoyance.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Primes and Misdemeanours (#11.178)}
plot: Daniel helps a student and his autistic brother, both of whom are heavily into maths. Sissy tells Jimmi that she wants to have a baby and start a family, with him! Heston keeps pussyfooting around Lily, and Charlie meets Michelle, and is slightly obsessed with certain parts of her!

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Run for Your Life (#15.52)}
plot: Maureen Oldgate is a tireless campaigner in her efforts to raise funds for Letherbridge hospice but Chris fears that she is putting her charity work above the needs of her son Darren,himself a cancer sufferer. When Darren has an accident whilst his partner Sue is out and his mother has failed to visit Maureen has to put things in a new perspective. Heston chides Liam for behaving irresponsibly by staging a political protest outside the surgery but has to back-track when Kevin finds an old photo of Heston himself in his student protest days. Rob takes Howard fishing and is equally annoyed by his non-stop talking and his beginner's luck in catching a fish. Heston gets angry when he discovers Liam has videoed pouring milk over himself outside the Mill, especially when it ends up on the Internet. Chris sees Darren, who's having radiotherapy, and his fund raising mother. Rob & Howard go fishing.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Slings and Arrows (#18.42)}
plot: After successfully house-hunting with Zara Mrs Tembe goes to watch Al play on behalf of his injured friend Pete in a crucial darts tournament. With Pete's bossy wife Tracey in the opposing team Al finds himself being blackmailed into losing but fortunately Mrs Tembe gives him good advice. Meanwhile Karen and Rob get a mixed reaction when, practising their fostering skills, they baby-sit for Ruhma's children.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Sugar (#17.206)}
plot: Fleeing a shopkeeper schoolboy Leo Campbell is almost run over by van driver Tim Williams, who takes him to see Al. Leo has a fit but the white stuff in his pockets turns out to be sugar he has stolen for his diabetic mother. Meanwhile Valerie chooses her wedding dress and Heston feels increasingly side-lined by Anthony.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {The Collectors (#14.108)}
plot: A Bailiff and his new trainee female assistant try and reclaim money from an old man. They don't believe his story, only all he has is an expensive train set. The collector injured his back earlier and should really be resting. Howard has a new intercom system installed at the Mill. Jas tries to contact her ex, but no-one knows where he is!

title: "Doctors" (2000) {The Invisible Man (#15.205)}
plot: Special constable Howard gets involved when nervous Helen Morris insists that the man she has seen outside her house is Toby, the husband she is certain is dead. Now calling himself Gabe Toby admits that he and Helen are divorced but he knows her to be unstable and has come to check that she is all right. Karen agrees to go fishing with Rob whilst Mandy, advised by Kevin to get rid of Lois, ends up kissing her instead.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {The Nun's Tale (#12.192)}
plot: Zara's cousin Kay turns up to stay. She's a trainee nun, though she seems to have gone a bit wayward! She's on the search for men! Daniel gets very annoyed when he finds out that Simon has handed in his resignation and nobody told him. Cherry tries to get Jimmi to go to the 'Love Station'. Barry turns up at the Mill to see Daniel. He tries to chat up Zara, and wants a penis extension.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {The Way to a Man's Heart (#14.76)}
plot: It's the second round of 'Supachef' and Rob and Karen, and Mrs Tembe and Elaine face up against a woman who is determined to win at all costs. Her partner is not as determined though and she soon gets more than she bargained for. Daniel is distraught now that Zara has left with baby Joe - will she ever come back?

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Trophy Girlfriend (#11.102)}
plot: One of Michelle's patients, a student, tells her that she may have been raped. Her drink may have been spiked, so Michelle goes to the Students Union to find out more. Zara helps Sue to track down her husband to give him a piece of her mind, and find him on the golf course.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {War Zone: Part One (#15.93)}
plot: Recently discharged from the services Howard's old army pal Gareth comes to stay with him and is shocked to find his ex-girlfriend Jade Falkner is working as an escort for seedy night-club owner Freddie Afridi. He goes to her house to beg her to stop but she resents his interference. A reluctant Howard agrees to accompany Gareth to the club, where a pregnant Jade crumples in pain and they take her to hospital.

title: "Doctors" (2000) {Yes M'Lady (#12.210)}
plot: It's Immie's art project showing, but it doesn't get the reaction she was hoping for, especially from Jack! After the most terrible feedback, she decides she needs a treat. Cherry deals with a seemingly devoted butler who is trying to make his delusional, dying mistress' last days as comfortable as possible, despite arguments from her son. He seems to think that the butler is after her money!

title: "Dog Whisperer with Cesar Millan" (2004) {Cotton, Ricky & Jordan, and Duke & Lila (#4.2)}
plot: Cesar meets Cotton, an American Eskimo watchdog who takes his role too far; a Shiba Inu with a mean streak named Ricky; and Lila, a boxer who was attacked by another dog one day in the park, and has since become more aggressive. Will Cesar be able to block this belligerent boxer?s bad attitude?

title: "Dog the Bounty Hunter" (2003) {And Baby Makes Three (#8.1)}
plot: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner. Dog now knows that only Leland's fleet feet can catch this criminal. And when the fugitive is finally cornered, Leland is in for the fight of his life!

title: "Dog the Bounty Hunter" (2003) {Make a Wish (#4.3)}
plot: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse. Dog and the team then start their search for Jacob, a fugitive who's abandoned his wife and children.

title: "Dog the Bounty Hunter" (2003) {The Montrose Files: The Million Dollar Man, Part 1 (#7.56)}
plot: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Wyoming in pursuit of a gun-loving survivalist with a million dollar bond on his head. Will Dog's plan of using brains over brawn work?

title: "Doggie Moms" (2011) {Life Has Gone to the Dogs! (#1.5)}
plot: It's another busy week for the Moms and their dogs, from Karen and Eli's outdoor photo-shoot with a fashion photographer to Leslie making ends meet by donning a gorilla suit and singing happy birthday. Erika gives Cubby swimming lessons just in time for vacation and all of the Doggie Moms throw a doggie house party. No matter where life takes them, the ladies show us some of the crazy things they do for their dogs.

title: "Doki" (2014) {Oto-nardo Da Vinci/Ghost Hunting (#2.7)}
plot: Oto is trying to build a working model of a tank, from designs by Leonardo DaVinci. But the tank won't roll. He followed the plans exactly, so why won't Oto's tank work? Anabella suggests they ask a friend of hers for help, so they visit FLORENCE, ITALY. Where Oto joins a secret society for fans of the renaissance genius. Oto figures out why his hero's plans don't work - by relying on his own logic and creativity. Meanwhile Gabi and Fico fill in for their new Italian friend, by running his pizzeria while he helps Oto. When Mundi is startled by a Fico prank, she insists she isn't afraid of ghosts. They don't even exist. Oto and Anabella disagree they definitely believe in ghosts./Doki wonders do ghosts really exist? Mundi vows to prove they don't, with a trip to a so-called 'ghost town' in TOMBSTONE, ARIZONA, U.S.A. As they explore the old mining town, they encounter plenty of unusual happenings. But some are merely pranks by Fico, and ALL have logical explanations. In the end, they realize a ghost hunting.

title: "Dolce Vita" (1995)
plot: Christina is a middle-aged woman, whose daughter Dorita is in Italy for studies. Going to visit Dorita, she meets a young man on the boat and they end up in bed together. Upon returning to Greece, she tells her best friend Sasa about the stranger she met, but the biggest surprise comes when Dorita also returns to Greece and meets her boyfriend to her family...

title: "Dominion" (2014) {Son of the Fallen (#2.5)}
plot: After discovering the truth behind Julian's army, Alex confronts an impossible decision as he spearheads a plan to intercept Michael and Gabriel, who have breached the walls of New Delphi in pursuit of their mutual target. Claire begins the negotiation process with the revolting V1's as David attempts to restore his legacy by any means necessary. Finally, a familiar face returns to Vega just in time to see it change forever.

title: "Don't Blink" (2015) {Mind Games and Blister Burns (#1.13)}
plot: Morgan Strebler gets some serious blisters on his fingers with this burning trick. At CityWalk, Jonathan Pendragon finds a beautiful assistant in the strangest of places, John George with his traveling card trick, followed by Kyle Marlett using napkins and markers with Michael Nouri to do some unbelievable mentalism. Plus, Chipper Lowell risks losing a hand if he guesses a card incorrectly, Draven mind fuses a couple of objects, while Trigg Watson shows his seasonal skills with cups of water. Finally, Michael Turco shows us some special sandals and Tom Burgoon has fun with magical dots!

title: "Don't Trust the B---- in Apartment 23" (2012) {Mean Girls... (#2.10)}
plot: June wants a friend, to share a sidewalk cappuccino, but catty roommate Chloe rejects her, so she brings home three ditsy friends from her Pilates class, with whom Chloe just doesn't hit it off. Especially not with Stephanie. Then, an unidentified girl lies murdered in the park, June assumes it's Stephanie, and could it be Chloe's handiwork? Also, James does a community outreach gig helping out a downtown girl who is bullied by her peers, but his less than heroic efforts leave her stranded.

title: "Donkey Kong Country" (1997) {Vote of Kong-fidence (#2.8)}
plot: Bluster's not so sure that Donkey Kong should automatically be the Future Ruler of Kongo Bongo and wants it put to a vote. The idol of Inka Dinka Doo thinks is a fine idea as well;and "Everyone is in the running;to make the outcome all the more stunning". And since "everyone" is in the running;King K. Rool throws his hat into the election ring.While Donkey Kong feels that he will win simply because he's the most popular;Blaster and King K. Rool start campaigning hard. Both have platforms and discuss current island issues. Everybody loves THEM! This reduces Donkey Kong to a smear campaign. Hmmm;wonder what the outcome will be?

title: "Doombringer" (2014) {Rise of the Revenant: Part 1 (#1.1)}
plot: Rejected by Hell and banished from Heaven, the Doombringer is mankind's last hope. Fighting between two worlds, he must stop the Apocalypse by defeating the four Horsemen and their minions. His comrades; Strife, Sorrow, Fear and Pain are his only allies. Together they must face an army of undead soldiers known as, Revenants before the seventh seal is broken and the end of days befalls mankind.

title: "Doomwatch" (1970) {The Battery People (#1.11)}
plot: Doomwatch hears that in South Wales, tough ex-miners have taken to drinking gin instead of their usual beer, and are unresponsive to their wives' sexual advances, instead preferring to attend secret cock-fighting tournaments. After Quist is asked by the minister to look into the situation, as it is happening within his constituency, he and his team trace the cause to the local fish-farm, which is using a special chemical to dissolve the bones in the fish. Unfortunately, this has led to the workforce becoming sterile.

title: "Dora the Explorer" (2000) {Isa's Unicorn Flowers}
plot: A unicorn named Unicornio slides into Isa's garden on a rainbow where Dora and Isa are planting unicorn flowers! Uh oh...Unicornio's rainbow disappears and he has to get back to his mami. Help Dora and Isa get Unicornio back to his forest and bring unicorn flowers to his mami! And meet Dora's friend Mei from China as she helps the trio by teaching them a dragon dance. It's an adventure to remember!

title: "Double Exposure" (2010) {I'm Gonna Smash the Ringflash! (#1.3)}
plot: After an eight-hour wait and faced with angry staff and escalating overtime costs, Markus, Indrani and GK do everything they can to keep it together amidst a wild and unpredictable shoot with Lindsay Lohan. The chaos has Markus and Indrani at each other's throats, but as their partnership falters, another partnership begins when a secret admirer of Indrani decides to make his move during a sexy Out Magazine shoot with male supermodels Alex Lundqvist and Mark Van der Loo.

title: "Down Home with the Neelys" (2008) {Somethin' Outta Nothin' (#2.3)}
plot: The Neelys are turning everyday foods into something special. Pat and Gina cook up an Easy Lemon Pasta and Broccoli Soup. Their daughter, Shelbi, joins them in the kitchen for Grilled BBQ Potato Skins and an Everything But the Kitchen Sink Sundae!

title: "Downton Abbey" (2010) {(#5.4)}
plot: Violet and Isobel visit the soup kitchen Rose is running for the Russian refugees and Isobel is surprised when Violet confesses that Prince Kuragin once asked her to run away with him. Isobel herself is flattered by Lord Merton's sincere marriage proposal but asks for time to consider whilst Mary travels to London to reject Tony's offer. He is persistent but by chance she meets and dines with Charles Blake. Edith hears that Michael may be alive but in prison in Germany for opposing Fascists, though is upset when the Drewes refuse to let her see Marigold. Bricker's reappearance angers Robert, as does Sarah Bunting's continual challenge to his authority, causing him to ban her from the house. Baxter discovers that Barrow is attempting to 'cure' his homosexuality whilst the police continue to rake up Green's death, especially as, whilst in London with Mary, Anna visited the spot where he was killed. Violet and Isobel visit Rose at the shelter and of course see her former admirer Prince Kuragin. She tells Isobel that he once asked her to run away with him.The war memorial is under construction but Mrs. Patmore can do little to add her nephews name to the site. Rose's father returns from his posting to Bombay and she learns that her parents are getting a divorce. Isobel receives a proposal of marriage from Lord Merton who freely admits that he is very much in love with her. After the incident in London, Lord Grantham is not very pleased to hear that Simon Bricker is returning to Downton. Thomas has returned from his leave and is up to something peculiar in his room. Lady Mary goes to London to tell Gillingham she will not marry him but he won't take no for an answer. Lady Edith learns Michael's office may be getting closer to learning what has happened to him. Sarah Bunting is invited to dinner but she again confronts Lord Grantham.

title: "Dr. Drew's Lifechangers" (2011) {I'm Black and I Refuse to Date My Race}
plot: A look at problems that are ruining the black community and what can ultimately be done to change them. Dr. Drew enlisted the help of relationship expert and matchmaker Paul Carrick Bunson, to offer help and advice to black men and women (and an audience of African-Americans) who are upset about how both sexes communicate and treat each other in relationships.

title: "Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist" (1995) {Undercover (#4.13)}
plot: Laura has been taking many afternoons off without saying where she's going. Dr. Katz and Ben are both naturally suspicious, and Ben sets out to be a detective to find out what she's been doing. He doesn't find anything in his "detective work", though; Laura admits she's been going to traffic school when confronted by Dr. Katz.

title: "Dr. Kildare" (1961) {Something Old, Something New (#5.24)}
plot: A young woman is injured in a car accident in which her boyfriend is killed. Upon examination it is discovered that she is pregnant and terminally ill. The girl doesn't want her mother to know about the pregnancy, and the mother does not want her daughter to know about her prognosis. First of two parts.

title: "Dr. Phil" (2002)
plot: Dr. Phillip C. McGraw's show draws on his 25 years of experience in psychology, sociology and observation. Beginning his TV career as the resident expert on human behavior on Oprah Winfrey's daily talk show, Dr. Phil continues to deal with real issues in his blunt style.

title: "Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman" (1993) {Promises, Promises (#4.7)}
plot: Sully's best friend asks him to come to Nevada to help him. Loren suffers a stroke and Dr. Mike believes that he can recover if he works at it, but Loren's negative attitude prevents any progress.

title: "Dr. Simon Locke" (1971) {Losers, Weepers (#3.6)}
plot: Dr. Simon Locke is called to treat a severely beaten woman. Persistent questioning by the physician reveals that Phyllis and Delbert are siblings who run a badger scheme. Their current target is a local politician who doesn't take kindly to being blackmailed.

title: "Drag Race: Untucked!" (2010) {Lip Synch Extravaganza Eleganza (#5.2)}
plot: A backstage look at elimination day on _"RuPaul's Drag Race" (2009)_ (qv). The team (of four queens) who won the main challenge play a game where one holds a picture of another contestant while the other three ask "yes or no" questions to try to figure out who it is. The "bottom" nine contestants perform two team lip syncs for the judges on the main stage. One queen talks more about revealing that they "are a transgendered woman" and receives a special video message from their mother. Another contestant is "read to filth" and attempts to defend herself.

title: "Dragnet" (1951) {The Big Shoplift (#3.28)}
plot: There seems to be a lot of recent theft at retail stores in the city, and Jack Webb and his partner are on the case. The detectives question a salesperson from a big department store downtown, and she denies any involvement. They talk to a woman who was at the bus station, who saw another woman leave a parcel which contained a fur coat. Eventually Webb talks to a teenage girl, who saw a woman discard boxes of new items in a vacant lot. The girl knows the woman's identity, and soon the officers are interrogating the shoplifter, a doctor's wife with a lot of time on her hands.

title: "Dragon Ball Z" (1996) {Time Struggle (#15.4)}
plot: Before he can unleash his fury on the remaining Z-Fighters, Majin Buu is coaxed into the Hyperbolic Time Chamber. Inside, Trunks and Goten are training diligently, but will they have enough time to perfect their new moves before Majin Buu arrives?

title: "Dragon Ball Z: Doragon bôru zetto" (1989) {Piccolo's Resolution!! The Last Measure in His Reserve (#3.12)}
plot: Krillin heals everyone with senzu beans. Vegeta flies off in a rage and Piccolo goes to the Lookout to speak with Kami. Krillin, Trunks, and Tien go to pick up Goku, who is still fighting the virus while Maron leaves Roshi's house. Gohan drops off Bulma, baby Trunks, and Yajirobe at Dr. Brief's house.

title: "Dragon Ball" (1995) {Look Out for Launch (#1.15)}
plot: Before Roshi will train Goku and Krillin, they must find him a date. While flying over the desert they find and rescue Launch, a girl with a split personality--one a harmless innocent, the other a fugitive robber--and they take her back to the island with them.

title: "Dragon Flyz" (1996) {Into Hell's Gate (#1.17)}
plot: While out getting information on the volcano Hell's Gate about to erupt, Apex gets a mental message from Blaze Wind and Sky Fury that there is amber in the area. The others join them to grab it while they can, but Dreadwing ambushes them near the volcano. Near the amber, they have to battle both him and the elements to get out alive, let alone take it back to Airlandis.

title: "Dragons et princesses" (2010) {Ivan Tsarévitch et la Princesse Changeante (#1.10)}
plot: Ivan's father lies dying, three golden plums from the Tsar's garden the only cure for his ailment. But the garden is protected by many traps and tests, most notorious of all the changing princess, whom is said to reduce all men to insanity.

title: "Drake & Josh" (2004) {The Bet (#2.1)}
plot: Drake and Josh make a bet to swear off junk food and Video Games. Megan makes both of them swear to dye their hair pink. When Drake and Josh's mom and dad discover them making a bet, they both make a bet as well. When things get really crazy, Drake and Josh can't hold onto their bet much longer and decide to break it! Drake is hooked on Junk Food. And Josh is hooked on video Games. They both swear to give up those things until one of them cracks. Whoever loses will dye his hair pink. Drake gets a rash from not eating junk food and Josh gets a Game Sphere and Megan tries to make things worse.

title: "Dream Defenders" (2011) {Big Man on Campus (#1.18)}
plot: When Chad - a student with a reputation as a bully - transfers to Meridian High, there's mass panic. Only Zoey knows he's really quiet & good-natured. When Icela uses a Dreamwalking Chad to terrorize everyone, it's up to Zane & Zoey to set things right.

title: "Dream Team" (1997) {The Hand That Rocks the Cradle (#8.27)}
plot: As Jodie is examined by the paramedics, Gina finds Dean and tells him what's happening. He tells her he will find Frank whilst she goes and tells Don, who is commentating with Sky. Lee scores against Arsenal just as Dean and Frank arrive at the hospital. Don gets the message and Gina tells him Jodie knows he was behind the Frank story, and that Curtis was the only other one who knew. She adds that was the moment Jodie fell ill, before Gina walks away disgusted. At half time Viv sends Scott to fetch Frank so he can be put on to continue Harchester's good form, and he returns to tell Viv that Frank has gone because Jodie has miscarried. At the hospital Frank is told that Jodie has lost the baby and is fine, at least physically, so Frank goes in to be with her.

title: "Drifters" (2013) {Big Break (#4.3)}
plot: Aspiring actress Bunny gets a part in a film and takes Laura, feigning illness to claim sick pay, and Meg with her, getting them jobs as extras. However the film turns out to be a porn flick and Bunny's protests lead to her being sacked and Laura getting her big break.

title: "Drop Dead Diva" (2009)
plot: Deb, a shallow model's sudden demise results in her being reincarnated as Jane, a plus size lawyer with astonishing intelligence. As Deb sees life through Jane's eyes, she realizes it doesn't matter how big you are, just how you accept it and know you're beautiful no matter what people say. Deb Dobkins an aspiring model and Jane Bingum an overworked lawyer have nothing in common but on the same day when fate brought them together Deb's soul transferred in a new home in Jane's body. Now that Deb is in Jane she develops a new brain, a new wardrobe, she has a Gaurdian Angel named Paul and her girlfriend Stacy. She thought she was there for a reason, well she hoped she was right A beautiful model woman who is about to audition to be on The Price is Right suddenly died and sent to Limbo. She wasn't ready for her afterlife so she had to evacuate the area and her spirit took form by another life of a brilliant Lawyer from Harrison and Parker industries miss Jane Bingum. While adapting a new life and got her best friend back, with a guardian angel and Grayson Ever since Greyson lost the love of his life and discovered for the first time ever when he died, he got her back with another life as well. He took the life of a jailhouse inmate mister Ian Holt and reannounced his love for Jane as much as he did for Deb

title: "Drop Dead Diva" (2009) {Truth & Consequences (#6.1)}
plot: As she struggles to find out how much Grayson (Jackson Hurst) knows about her and Deb, Jane (Brooke Elliott) uncovers a dark secret that could land a client (guest star Jessica Tuck) in prison. Old tensions are renewed when Owen's (Lex Medlin) estranged brother (guest star Colin Egglesfield) asks him to sue a strip club.

title: "Drugs, Inc." (2010) {Pittsburgh Smack (#7.8)}
plot: 'Ghost' is a kingpin who moves huge amounts of heroin into Pittsburgh, PA. But the police are making it harder and now Ghost has competition from wannabe hustlers ready to muscle in on the market. There is a big market of pill heads out of town and Ghost thinks they are ripe for exploitation. But he hasn't figured in the most aggressive narcotics cops in PA: The Attorney General's Drug Task Force. And they are waiting for him.

title: "Dual Survival" (2010) {Deadly Dunes (#4.3)}
plot: Marooned in a sea of sand dunes, Joe and Cody traverse the unforgiving desert and trek deep into the mountains of Oman. Threatened by dehydration and heatstroke, their journey shows how nomads have survived for millennia in this hyper-arid land.

title: "Duck Dodgers" (2003) {Duck Deception/The Spy Who Didn't Love Me (#1.1)}
plot: Duck Dodgers accidentally explodes the ship's energy core, sending the crew adrift. Duck Dodgers must escort a beautiful secret agent to a Martian-controlled planet. To prove his love for the lady spy, Dodgers volunteers to destroy an enemy radio tower.

title: "Duck Dynasty" (2012) {Return of the Beavers (#6.8)}
plot: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice, but when Willie tells the instructor that he always wanted to learn karate, he is invited to join the class for the day.

title: "Duckman: Private Dick/Family Man" (1994) {Ebony, Baby (#4.15)}
plot: Duckman decides he wants to be a part of the fashion world - so he attends a show. Mesmerised by an African American goddess/private eye named Ebony Sable, he finds himself entangled in a world of murder, power and lust. Guest voices include Tisha Campbell as Ebony Sable, Ice-T as Kwanzi, Montel Jordan, Taj Mahal, Jeremy Piven, Taylor Negron, Shebaka and Leila Kenzle.

title: "Due South" (1994) {The Duel (#2.16)}
plot: A man Vecchio investigated for murder years ago but was unable to prove it but was convicted for another crime, has just been released from prison. And he claims that the evidence that was used to convict him was planted. Vecchio denies it. Fraser looks into it and notices some inconsistencies. Vecchio tries to catch him breaking the law but instead Vecchio is the one who gets in trouble. Later a lot of Vecchio's old friends get threats and Vecchio knows he's the one doing it but can't prove it.

title: "Dusza Zemsty" (2010) {(#1.2)}
plot: After getting a message from the Informant, Desert went to the place where he was told. Suddenly it turns out that also kidnapped Vadiego. From now on Desert will have to save my friend. After a few minutes he reached a secure place where he found one member of the kidnappers. Desert after negotiations easy learns where Vadi.

title: "Dynasty" (1981) {Colorado Roulette (#8.22)}
plot: Adam is absolved of suspicion in the kidnapping of his son when Leslie calls him to say that Sean has taken the baby and is holding her captive. Finding the location of the call through a wire tap, Adam and Steven hurry to the desolate mountain cabin. They find Leslie badly beaten, but Sean has already taken off with the baby.

title: "Dynasty" (1981) {The Downstairs Bride (#3.20)}
plot: Upon hearing that Kirby has married Jeff, Joseph tells his daughter she has ruined her life. Blake suggests to Alexis they call a truce to their battle over Steven; Alexis offers Steven a share in Colbyco. Adam informs Fallon he doesn't consider Steven emotionally capable of handling the family business.

title: "Dystopia: Capitol City" (2016) {Innocence Lost (#1.9)}
plot: When Kaveh and Octavia search for Eliza they discover that Anna, Margaret's daughter is also missing. As tensions rise, Walter runs away to be with his father in the Chatham District and Ariel reveals that there could be a more sinister answer to the missing children than they first realized.

title: "E! News Daily Documentaries" (1993)
plot: E! News Documentaries presented a series of three critically acclaimed documentary specials hosted and Executive Produced by Ron Reagan Jr. They were: "See How They Run" a 60 minute documentary special exploring how the media covers the presidental race. "The Greatest Export" a 60 minute documentary exploring how entertainment is America's greatest export "What They Don't Want You To See" a 60 minute expose on television censorship

title: "E/R" (1984) {Brotherly Love (#1.17)}
plot: The staff relaxes at Houlihan's, a local hangout near the hospital. Howard is looking forward to catching up with his younger brother Sam but becomes jealous when Sam develops a romantic interest in Dr. Sheridan. After much teasing from the staff, Eve has to set the record straight with Howard. Julie and Maria struggle to get along now that they have become roommates in order to save money.

title: "ER" (1994) {Benton Backwards (#7.4)}
plot: Benton is unable to find a job after Romano negatively influences local hospitals. He reluctantly agrees to accept Romano's demeaning offer of a per diem job at County with no benefits. Kovac and Abby are attacked by a mugger with a steel pipe. Injured, Kovac protects Abby and smashes the robber's head on the ground repeatedly.

title: "ER" (1994) {Good Touch, Bad Touch (#4.5)}
plot: Carol Hathaway would like to start a clinic within the ER that would specialize in women's and children's health issues, but Kerry Weaver tells her she'll have to find funding for the project. Carter may have a solution for her however. Peter Benton is getting used to fatherhood, but is falling behind in his work. Mark Greene has to give a deposition in the malpractice suit against him and is stressed. He also takes inappropriate action to quiet an unruly patient. Dr. Robert "Rocket" Romano returns to County General.

title: "ER" (1994) {Now What? (#10.1)}
plot: On his return to Chicago, Carter gets a downright chilly reaction from Abby who asks him to return her apartment key. At work, they tip toe around one another, neither really willing to discuss their feelings. A new med student, Neela Rasgotra arrives for her ER rotation. Dr. Pratt is paying too much attention to her for Dr. Chen's taste. A woman passes out at the wheel of her car severely injuring herself and the three children in the car with her. Neela makes a good call in the case. Carter treats a man whose HIV has become full-blown AIDS. The ER itself is a bit chaotic due to major reconstruction. The ER desk receives a call from Africa saying that Luka Kovac has been killed. Carter decides to return to the Congo to retrieve his body.

title: "ER" (1994) {The Greater Good (#10.6)}
plot: Pratt and Kovac clash over a miscarriage-prone young woman, Denny (ALLISON SMITH), who arrives to deliver a premature baby. Pratt wants to make heroic efforts to save the unborn child, while Kovac is adamantly against spending vast amounts of money to keep the forever sickly baby alive.

title: "ESPN SportsCentury" (1999) {Dale Earnhardt Jr.}
plot: A profile of Dale Earnhardt Jr. The third-generation NASCAR star captured consecutive Busch Series crowns in 1998-99 before joining his father on the Cup circuit, where he won in just his 12th start. Earnhardt excelled immediately in restrictor-plate racing at Daytona and Talladega.

title: "Early Edition" (1996) {Occasionally Amber (#4.18)}
plot: Chuck comes back to Chicago and announces he's engaged to a girl named Jade. When Gary meets her, he's shocked because Jade is Amber, the jewel thief he encountered a while ago and allowed to escape. Gary's not sure what to do especially when Detective Brigatti whose career was nearly ruined by her learns she's back and wants to take her down.

title: "Earth: Final Conflict" (1997) {Scorpions Dream (#1.9)}
plot: Dr. Larry Clark is a bio engineer. He is responsible for breeding the skrills and is very passionate about it. Boone however has a rather unpleasant message for him. The companions decided to terminate work on the alpha series, the source for the gamma series that Boone and Sandoval are using. They are to be put in cryogenic storage, because their preservation instincts are too high. When Clark prepares them for shipment, one of them suddenly attaches itself. It shouldn't be possible, but Da'an tells they are something more than a manufactured weapon. Da'an seems concerned and orders Sandoval and Boone to find Clark. Meanwhile Clark helps a woman with the use of his skrill and falls in love.

title: "East West 101" (2007) {The Price of Salvation (#3.5)}
plot: Detective Sonny Koa is enlisted to help the son of a friend, Sam, who's involved with Maori gangsters. When the kid is implicated in a violent robbery, Sonny must walk a fine line between his obligations as a cop and his obligations to his community. Meanwhile, Malik is focused on nailing the armed robbery gang. He has a suspect in custody who knows the truth, but he refuses to talk.

title: "Eastwick" (2009) {Reaping and Sewing (#1.2)}
plot: Darryl Van Horne proudly, playfully poses near-nude for Roxie, while her 'boytoy' handyman Chad jealously hits his own finger out of jealousy on the odd jobs Darryl gave him as a favor to her. Back home, he now insists on his own drawer. Raymond Gardener gets back into bed with nurse Kat, but to his disappointment she still claims their steady relationship is over due to his laziness, which Darryl surprisingly fixes by recreating a job for him in the closed factory he bought. Newcomer Gus isn't the scarred brute the witches expected, but a welcome gentleman historian. Will St.David protest at insinuations that he raped a witch's daughter. Will's obedient date offers don't satisfy, newspaper archive data suggest Darryl stole a drowned boy's identity.

title: "Ebert Presents: At the Movies" (2010) {(#2.17)}
plot: Christy and Ignatiy review "Melancholia," "J. Edgar," and "Elite Squad: The Enemy Within". Roger reviews "Into the Abyss" and does a Great Movies segment on "This Is Spinal Tap". In the Hot & Now segment, Ignatiy recommends "Putty Hill" and Christy recommends "Blue Velvet". Kartina Richardson discusses Lars von Trier's Golden Heart trilogy ("Breaking the Waves", "The Idiots", and "Dancer in the Dark"). Also, Christy and Ignatiy respond to viewer mail.

title: "Ecopolis" (2008) {Hungry City (#1.6)}
plot: Nobel prize-winning energy scientist Dan Kammen explores 4 pioneering technologies aimed at transforming imaginary future megacity, Ecopolis. How do we keep the city's 18 million hungry mouths supplied with food and water, without trashing the city?

title: "Edge of War" (2012) {EDGE OF WAR: Saddam vs the Ayatollah (#1.4)}
plot: The Persian Gulf. Ancient. Rich. Dangerous. And from the dawn of time, home to brash and brutal rulers. This is the story of two such leaders - with a deep and deadly hatred for each other. These are the events that lead them to battle. This is the beginning of the Iran/Iraq War. In Iraq, strongman Saddam Hussein is happy hosting the exiled Khomeini when the Ayatollah is making trouble for the Shah of Iran. But when Khomeini and his Shi'ite brethren agitate for revolution inside Iraq itself, Saddam tosses the cleric out. Hussein continues to consolidate power within Iraq - terrorizing friend and foe alike. His murderous secret police enthusiastically dispatch his deadly decrees. Pretending to be devout, the secular Saddam casts himself as the new big man in the Arab world. In 1979, Ayatollah Khomeini returns from exile in France to take total power in Iran, enjoying a jubilant welcome from Iranians of all political stripes. Professing to be a man of God, Khomeini soon reveals a darker and deadlier face. When Khomeini sees his Shi'ite brethren being brutally evicted from Iraq by Saddam's sycophants, he grows increasingly hostile - attacking Saddam's embassies around the world. The promise of eternal bliss makes bold his extremist followers. In this tale of empires and extremes, of killers and Korans, of God and guns - no one is spared. Death is no deterrent for he who does not fear death. And so nearly a million people die, turning the ancient desert sand red with blood.

title: "Eek! the Cat" (1992) {Eek's International Adventure (#1.8)}
plot: Mom takes Wendy Elizabeth, J.B and Eek on a plane in order to visit Uncle Vic's potato farm. While on the plane, Eek encounters Sasha, who is a spy. She mistakes Eek for a famous secret agent known as 'The cat'. Together they try and stop a villain known as 'the brain'.

title: "Eftyhismenoi mazi" (2007)
plot: A widowed man (Giannis Bezos) with 3 boys falls back inlove with his ex girlfriend (Katerina Lehou) after she's been divorced and has 2 girls. They get married and all move into the same house, but the boys don't take too well to having to share their house, and the girls aren't exactly happy that they have to live with annoying boys. Meanwhile the father is having money troubles with the bruery he runs with his brother.

title: "Ek Nayi Ummeed: Roshni" (2015) {Dr. Sameer Humiliates Roshni (#1.41)}
plot: Roshni is disappointed at being humiliated by Dr Sameer and refuses to assist him. Mona assures Roshni of Dr Sameer's concern for the Leela hospital. At Mona's insistence, Roshni assists Dr Sameer. Dr Malhotra stops Roshni from handling an emergency case.

title: "Ekkusu bonbâ" (1980) {Callinean: A Battle with No Tomorrow! (#1.21)}
plot: Makara's battlecruiser and X-Bomber are engaged in a grim struggle. Professor Hagen is now in X-Bomber, commanding operations. At the same time, the Royal Palace is under attack from Alliance fighters and Caliban's Death Ball. Dai-X engages the Death Ball but its initial attacks are repelled; Dai-X is finally able to break through its defences but has nothing in reserve to combat Makara's ship and help X-Bomber. Though the King is reluctant to use Hagen's laser cannon, he eventually agrees and the assault is repelled when Makara's ship takes a direct hit. X-Bomber returns to Callinian, but the King tells Hagen that the time has arrived for hi

title: "El Vato" (2016) {El corrido de Chino Prison (#1.7)}
plot: Vato receives an offer from Wendy Lozada, who has already launched her recording company. At the same time, a person contacts Vato to inform him that his father, who is in jail, is sick. Finally, Vato agrees to go see his father. They have an encounter were Vato sees himself reflected on his father and his mistakes. Pollo uses Wendy's offer to negotiate with Lolo, who ends up making Vato an offer. They now have the dilemma of choosing with whom to sign. The FBI approaches Wendy; they know she is dealing with "mafiosos."

title: "El manantial del milagro" (1974)
plot: After Matilde's mother death, with whom she had the difficult relations, she finds a new job as a governess of Paula, a strange child. The girl is neglected by Pablo, her father, who is very busy with his business, and by her aunts and uncle Miguel. This one is the twin brother of Pablo. Pablo isn't really a widower, because his wife is in the clinic with schizophrenia. All story revolves about a wonderful fountain that Matilde and Luz (Pablo's stepmother) want to use to make the thermal baths. Pablo and Paula are affectionate to Matilde, but Pablo is killed by Mafia and his twin brother takes his place to protect his family. Matilde and Miguel fall in love...

title: "Elementary" (2012) {A Burden of Blood (#4.8)}
plot: A lady is asphyxiated to death, and Holmes and Watson find out that she was pregnant and her husband was sterile. This leads to further complications including her family history; meanwhile Holmes helps Detective Bell who needs some financial support for his mother. Holmes and Watson are working the murder of a woman who was found in her car dead and killed in a peculiar manner. The M.E. tells him that she had a tubal ligation but somehow got pregnant. So they go to her husband and Holmes can see he could not be the father and refuses to say anything. So they try to find out whom she's been seeing and they learn she was planning to go to a prison. When they go there they learn, a convict who is a serial killer is her father and the way she was killed was the same way he killed his victims. So they wonder could someone who knew one of his victims killed her for revenge?

title: "Elementary" (2012) {The Rat Race (#1.4)}
plot: Sherlock eagerly exacts an excessive price and expenses when hired by one of the Wall Street investment companies he deeply despises to find a missing executive. Having found out the man had an adulterous love nest, where he apparently died from a heroin OD, Holmes convinces NYPD captain Toby Gregson that must be a staged murder and fits a pattern of suspiciously stageable accidents killing executives in several of the form's branches throughout the US. Tying them together proves dangerous, with a surprising culprit. Watson's improved observation skill finally really helps out.

title: "Elite Model Look Spain" (2014) {Elite Model Look Spain 2015 (#3.1)}
plot: Organized by Elite Model Management Barcelona, Elite Model Look 2015 is a competition that's looking for the girl with the "it" factor to represent Spain. From castings to model boot camp, we'll show you some of the most ambitious models looking for a chance to prove themselves in the industry.

title: "Ella Bella Bingo" (2011) {The Fat Cat (#2.7)}
plot: Ella wants to play but, where is Henry? She eventually finds him in the woods playing with his new friend, a large black and white cat named Jack. Ella and Henry decide that Jack must be hungry so go off to Ella's apartment to get fish and milk. But, when they return, he has disappeared. Henry is very upset to have lost his new friend and they search everywhere in Sunshine Gardens for him but, to no avail. Later, they meet Mrs Berg who gives them a precious clue to where he may be found.

title: "Ella" (2010) {(#1.144)}
plot: Jens's hand moves a few times while Ella tells him about 'dad' Willem, who meanwhile is reluctant to act against her. Norbert fails to understand his meeting with Barbara (Clio) or to convince Ella it's suspicious. Lucas and Anthony meet again, unexpectedly, as separately booked guests on Walter Capiau's TV talk show. What starts as a promising reconciliation soon goes pear-shaped as each considers the other should obviously sacrifice his career for their relationship. Frederico hugs jasper enthusiastically when offers to put up 50,000 Euros from his savings for their dream house, but Jasmine's twisted pride refuses a 'sick payback' for her kidney.

title: "Ella" (2010) {(#1.20)}
plot: Nicolas makes crystal clear to Linda he doesn't expect to find a friend, and to Clio cut orchids are a sacrilege. Cindy's flippant refusal of legal counsel and lack of preparation doomed her labor court trial from the start, but her cocky style looks like she'll even be slapped for contempt of court. Dr. Lukas Vervloet refuses to involve the clinic in Dr. Werner Wolfs' rabbit eye transplant follow-up project.

title: "Ella" (2010) {(#1.75)}
plot: Jens appears in a dream to Ella, recovered and welcoming her to his happily reunited family. In Fact his sister tells she was out-casted after she and her boyfriend caused an accident under narcotic influence, leaving her under electronic surveillance. Nicolas makes reluctant Clio help Linda continuing the mystery eyes quest. Anthony discovers the competition resorts to advertising and price cuts, but his karaoke king talent may save the day by making a radio spot.

title: "Ellen" (1994) {Emma (#5.8)}
plot: While attending a Hollywood social party with Paige, Ellen spots British actress Emma Thompson making out with another woman and afterward convinces Paige to hire her as Emma's personal assistant while she's in town to film a movie and to receive a Lifetime Achievement Award. Ellen then convinces Emma to "come out," to the public, against Paige's protest. But Emma soon reveals to Ellen that it's not the only sordid secret that she hides of her past. At the banquet, Sean Penn appears with a surprise revelation of his own.

title: "Ellen" (1994) {The Promotion (#1.5)}
plot: At her mother's advice, Ellen tries kissing up to her no-nonsense bookstore boss, Susan, by buying a gift for her newborn baby. But Ellen's job is threatened when she makes disparaging remarks about Susan's baby and her maid overhears this who makes the threat to Adam. Meanwhile, Holly and Anita plan to travel to Mexico to buy some paintings to sell them to a shady art dealer for large sums back in Los Angeles.

title: "Elmiro Miranda Show" (2012) {The Ego (#1.4)}
plot: After last show's success, each member of the crew tries to pull that responsibility of the success to themselves. That way they end to create a ego war, stopping speaking to each other, even on air, which lowers dramatically their quality.

title: "Emergency!" (1972) {All Night Long (#6.24)}
plot: John tries to create his own TV game show. The firemen (in the field) assist an elderly musician experiencing heart trouble, Dixie explains to Lt. Crockett about the patient's diagnosis. Then, an auto accident with three injuries caused by running a stop sign, and a tightrope walker gets stuck between two buildings.

title: "Emergency!" (1972) {Musical Mania (#2.11)}
plot: John takes up bagpipes after Chet jokes with him about playing the squad's horn. John and Roy treat a gardener suffering from tetanus, a driver of an ice cream truck trapped after a wreck, a girl who overdosed on barbiturates who later dies, a pilot of a glider who crashed, and free a man trapped under his house. Dixie and Dr. Early talk to a couple whose son is suffering from lead poisoning, later found to be also suffering from deprivation dwarfism, and the father refuses to treat his son with experimental growth hormones. After Chet cracks a joke about John playing the Squad horn, John takes up the bagpipes, trombone, and guitar. Paramedics help a gardener suffering from tetanus. The father of a boy suffering from lead poisoning is reluctant to have it treated. The firemen rescue the driver of an ice cream truck. A schoolgirl dies from an overdose. A glider pilot crash lands. A man working under his house is trapped.

title: "Emergency!" (1972) {What's a Nice Girl Like You Doing...? (#7.9)}
plot: Gage and DeSoto travel to San Francisco, where they observe some topnotch women paramedics in action during major rescue missions. An injured worker is stranded on the Golden Gate bridge. Ambulance squads treat a heart attack victim at a dance bar and an epileptic at a coffee shop. A bad driver causes a traffic accident involving an ambulance carrying the heart patient, resulting in his death and five other injuries. Johnny dates a nurse interested in a long-term relationship. Careless workers and deadly chemicals combine to spark an explosive fire at a pier on the Embarcadero.

title: "Emily Owens M.D." (2012) {Emily and... The Love of Larping (#1.9)}
plot: Will's intent to spend a weekend with wicked Cassandra makes Emily admit some jealousy, but it seems too late, and he sets her up for a blind date. Mica's emotions are uprooted by the experience of not being able to cure his mother. A computer programmer maintains his elf king pseudonym from a LARP realm, like a counterpart, whose emotional confession changes the rules.

title: "Emmerdale Farm" (1972) {(#1.3539)}
plot: Zoe, along with Ashley, have now told Joseph about the death of his father Chris and he apparently took the news remarkably well but he doesn't know that step-mother Charity is suspected of killing him. Ashley worries that Zoe maybe is falling back into her schizophrenic state again. Lisa have come home from "grannie" Clegg and becomes worried that Steph is taking over her position at the factory. When she later comes home from work she sees a familiar face in the house. Charity discovers where Cain and their daughter Debbie have been staying most of the time after Chris' death on 17th September. DI Keysell and DS Pugh finds out that Chris died of poison and makes an arrest. Also, Steph finds a potential buyer for Eric. Finally, Robert, Elaine and Donna clear the air of secrets.

title: "Emmerdale Farm" (1972) {(#1.3620)}
plot: Gordon comes and picks Aaron up prematurely after the kid got through a message to his dad that he wants to come home. Chas thinks that Gordon has managed to turn Aaron against her. Marlon do a deal with Scott to buy the Marsden place so he can get away from Charity, making the chance of Tricia coming back a bit bigger. It looks as if Marlon is just wasting his money though because Tricia have had the last straw and plans on leaving the village tomorrow after finding out that Steph tried to get Marlon all these months ago and that he has kept it a secret from her. The police informs Eric that his wife's credit car have been used in Aberdeen but it wasn't Gloria who used it but instead some teenage boy.

title: "Empire of the Tsars: Romanov Russia with Lucy Worsley" (2016) {The Road to Revolution (#1.3)}
plot: Lucy Worsley concludes her history of the Romanov dynasty, investigating how the family's grip on Russia unraveled in their final century. She shows how the years 1825-1918 were bloody and traumatic, a period when four tsars tried - and failed - to deal with the growing pressure for constitutional reform and revolution.

title: "Emu's Wide World" (1987) {(#1.5)}
plot: Rod and Emu are making a scarecrow. Grotbags plans to draw Emu to her Gloomy Castle by splashing Rod with magnetic paint. Count Georgio has taken up residence on his small piece of land, which happens to be located in the hall of Whimsical castle. This means Boggle and Hortensia have to pay a toll every time they pass through it.

title: "En daarmee basta" (2005) {(#2.19)}
plot: Ruben has moved back in, putting Bert in the mood for a garden party, but none of the kids feels like helping him barbecue, let alone fuzz about his ambition to do so in perfectly classy style. Bert runs into trouble and out of time, so the dinner ends up far more modest, even moved inside.

title: "Endeavour" (2012) {Prey (#3.3)}
plot: When Danish Ingrid Hjort, au pair to Dr Hector Lorenz, goes missing after her evening class Thursday suspects a link with an earlier case in the same vicinity which left a girl in a coma. Ingrid's sometime boyfriend Philip Hathaway worked as groundsman for the wealthy Mortmaigne family but has an alibi and then young Ricky Parker is found dead with his hand severed. There is evidence that a big cat is on the loose, particularly after two grisly deaths on the Mortmaigne estate and the news that a family member hoped to open a safari park in the grounds and Morse and his colleagues must prevent further fatalities as they face danger in a maze

title: "Enertips" (2012) {The Green Gas (#1.12)}
plot: Darkhand is seriously worried, the majority of the citizens of Tipsville are passing on his Light Gas (made from the most polluting fuels on the planet) to Green Gas which is being sold by Openhand. But Backhand gets and idea to manipulate the public. Using the seductive voice of Charlotte Thumbhanson (which he gets from a very popular TV show), Backhand calls one by one all the citizens convincing them to change companies. The strategy seems to be so successful that even Matthew Handy himself and Openhand change to Light Gas. But Patty discovers the stratagem and allies herself with Charlotte Thumbhanson to bring the truth to light.

title: "Enlisted" (2014) {Paint Cart 5000 vs. the Mondo Spider (#1.9)}
plot: Second Lieutenant Tyson Schneeberger tricks the platoon into being test dummies for his experimental automobile, "Mondo Spider," causing its victims to run for the latrine. So Pete attempts to rescue them. Meanwhile, Sgt. Major Cody asks Derrick to take his self-portrait, but he turns out to be a very difficult subject. Pete's men are utterly desperate to be selected to test whiz kid lieutenant Tyson Schneeberger's cool 'toy', a spider-shaped robot vehicle, so they have Derrick demand and Randy beg until Pete publicly eats humble pie to land the job, yet the lieutenant, hosting a lavish lobster dinner, steals his hero popularity. Perez finds out however that they won't use the cool machine but be Tyson's targets from it, to test a crowd control weapon that causes intestinal agony and loss ow bowl control. Derrick grumpily misses the 'fun' as sergeant Cody commanders him as personal portrait photographer, but finds out that's a well-meant 'fatherly' ploy.

title: "Enterprise" (2001) {Dead Stop (#2.4)}
plot: After the encounter with the Romulan minefield, Enterprise is severely damaged. Engineer Trip fears the worst. With the ship only capable of warp 2.5, traveling back to Jupiter will take practically forever and he doesn't have the necessary components to make the repairs himself. Captain Archer decides to send out a distress call and it isn't long before he gets a response from the Tellarites. They give the coordinates of a strange repair station. Upon approaching Enterprise is scanned. The atmosphere and the docking port are automatically changed to Enterprise' specs. The station is able to repair Enterprise in only 36 hours. The price, only 200 liters of plasma, seems rather low for all the work. Too low?

title: "Enterprise" (2001) {The Forgotten (#3.20)}
plot: Enterprise has arrived on time for the appointment with Xindi Degra. Captain Archer invites them to their ship, while he does his best to convince both Degra and Arboreal Jannar that the destruction of Earth is actually part of the grand scheme of the sphere builders to conquer the universe. While Jannar remains reluctant, Degra seems to be slightly won over. Trip Tucker is having a hard time keeping Enterprise in shape and is also having difficulties with writing a letter to the parents of crewman Taylor, informing of her death. Then trouble arises when out of the blue a Reptilian ship arrives.

title: "Entertainment Tonight" (1981) {(#35.223)}
plot: The death of 'Garry Marshall (I)' (qv); 'Shannen Doherty' (qv)'s heath battle; the cast of _Star Trek Beyond (2016)_ (qv); 'Margot Robbie' (qv)'s hot men; 'Barbra Streisand' (qv)'s tour secrets; 'Robert Redford (I)' (qv) (_Pete's Dragon (2016)_ (qv)); 'Tatyana Ali' (qv)'s wedding; the breakup of 'Lady Gaga' (qv) and 'Taylor Kinney' (qv).

title: "Entertainment Tonight" (1981) {(#36.63)}
plot: No charges will be filed against 'Brad Pitt' (qv); 'Kanye West' (qv)'s breakdown; _"Dancing with the Stars" (2005/I)_ (qv) winners; _Passengers (2016/I)_ (qv), starring 'Chris Pratt (I)' (qv) and 'Jennifer Lawrence (III)' (qv); 'Natalie Portman' (qv) (_Jackie (2016/V)_ (qv)); behind the scenes of _"Good Morning America" (1975)_ (qv); 'Michael Jackson (I)' (qv)'s son, 'Prince Michael (I)' (qv); _Beaches (1988)_ (qv) remake, _Beaches (2017) (TV)_ (qv).

title: "Entertainment Tonight" (1981) {(2015-10-06)}
plot: Rumors of a 'Nick Jonas' (qv)-'Kate Hudson (I)' (qv) romance; 'Bindi Irwin' (qv)'s dance tribute to her father, 'Steve Irwin (I)' (qv); 'Tom Bergeron' (qv) replaced as host, by 'Alfonso Ribeiro (I)' (qv), due to a family emergency; 'Hugh Jackman' (qv) talks about _Pan (2015)_ (qv); a look at _Woodlawn (2015)_ (qv); 'Britney Spears' (qv) will appear on _"Jane the Virgin" (2014); 'Rihanna (I)' (qv) appears in Vanity Fair; actors who used yo-yo diets to get acting roles; 'Cathriona White' (qv) was secretly married at the time of her death; 'Witney Carson' (qv) engaged to her high-school sweetheart.

title: "Entourage" (2004) {Date Night (#1.4)}
plot: Ari wakes Eric with a phone call to remind him that tonight is the all-important opening night for Vince's movie. Immediately after Eric hangs up, Emily unexpectedly drops off fan mail, but with ulterior motives. Drama introduces the guys to his latest lady friend back at the house and then they discuss their plans for the evening over breakfast at a diner. Vince's major work for the day is a stop at Big Boy's Neighborhood, a local radio show. As a result of the appearance, Vince secures a date for himself with Justine Chapin. While everybody gets ready for the night's activities, Ari video conferences with Eric to tell him that matinée numbers for Vince's movie have been "less than stellar" because it is in direct competition with the latest Pixar feature. Kristen also calls to confess to Eric that she might still harbor feelings for him. Turtle resorts to desperate measures to get a date for their night of bowling, and it does not go unspoiled. After bowling, the large group makes a stop at a night club where, one by one, the boys find themselves alone. The night does not end on a bad note, however, and Ari arrives with some good news.

title: "Eon Kid" (2007) {The Grand Wrestling Tournament (#1.7)}
plot: Forced to compete in the Orange Valley wrestling championship, Marty wonders how he will handle matches against super-powerful wrestlers. Meanwhile, the General's minions continue to seek out Marty's location while the army seeks out the General's minions.

title: "Episodes" (2011) {Episode One (#1.1)}
plot: BAFTA-winning sitcom Lyan's Boys script writers Sean and Beverly Lincoln are startled by US studio boss Merc Lapidus's offer to work on a remake in Hollywood. Sean persuades suspicious Bev, who is at least impressed by the grand, albeit fake, residence they get to use, despite the insufferably dull security guard. Their superb Shakespearian lead star Julian Bullard was supposed to be part of the deal, but Lapidus insists on a 'formality audition', which goes wrong on account of accent prejudices. The Brits are startled to hear the studio intends to sign up sitcom (Friends, Joey) star 'Matt LeBlanc (I)' (qv). Yet by now they know the studio isn't committed to anything content-wise. Sean and Beverly Lincoln are a happily married English couple who are also the creators of a hit British TV show. Their life seems complete...that is, until a hugely powerful and charismatic US television network president persuades them to move to Los Angeles and recreate their show for American television. Things begin to unravel as soon as Sean and Beverly arrive in L.A. It soon becomes clear that the network executive has never even seen their show. To make matters worse, he insists that they replace their brilliant lead actor, an erudite Royal Shakespeare veteran with...Matt LeBlanc!

title: "Erfsondes" (2012)
plot: Season 5 Five years after the night of the shooting at Eugene's house there are a lot of unanswered questions and unresolved issues. The Spencers' lives have changed dramatically in the aftermath of what seems to be a family murder committed by Chris Spencer. Thandeka is still haunted by that terrible night. Ma Rose has moved back to Johannesburg where she stays on Ansie's property in a little cottage. Ansie drives Ma Rose round the bend when she overextends her rights as a landlady but the two women lean on one another in mysterious ways. Ricci and Wong return from Paris to find Ma Rose in a vulnerable state. She is unable to come to terms with the loss of the little girl she fostered while working in an orphanage home. Can life go on without Kate and who really shot her and the children?

title: "Escaping Polygamy" (2014)
