plot: Simone and Sipowicz investigate a case where two transvestites witnessed a murder that they say was committed by a 'gay-basher' who's supposed to have been in jail for a previous crime. Meanwhile, Fancy's former foster son is arrested and charged with possession of a kilogram of heroin. He tries to make a deal with Sgt. Ray Kahlins, the "blow hard" from the DEA who worked out of the squad room the previous year, to nab the drug dealers. Medavoy finally asks out Abby Sullivan, the beat cop from the anti-crime unit upstairs. But she turns him down by revealing that she is a lesbian. Elsewhere, Russell gets more deeper involved in her undercover work which puts a strain on her relationship with Simone. But the psycho Jimmy's malevolence puts Russell's life in danger when he puts a drug in her drink.

title: "Nachtwacht" (2015) {De Draak (#2.4)}
plot: Schemermeer's treasure hunter Remko digs up a marble egg, but ignores the pit releases a monstrous shadow, which soon possesses innkeeper Julia, who starts misbehaving oddly. After Cooper arrests the elf for apparently attempting o steal the egg, Cooper arrests her but scares Remko out of filing a complaint, but the egg is stolen be another. Vega realizes when the boys show that prize, it's a dragon's egg, which can allow the escaped shadow to fully materialize again and terrorize the region. Indeed a magical fight for the egg is inevitable after the shadow steals it and nearly kills Vega in the process.

title: "Nagato Yuki-chan no Shoshitsu" (2015) {His Uncertainty (#1.15)}
plot: The summer break is finally here. North Highâ€ôs Literature Club sets out to vacation at the Tsuruya familyâ€ôs summer house on the beach. Can Yuki spend time alone with Kyon? Will Kyon be able to get over his awkward feelings towards Yuki?

title: "Naked City" (1958) {Howard Running Bear Is a Turtle (#4.27)}
plot: American Indians employed in NYC as "high floor construction workers" are a close knit group that follow tribal customs. A loveless arranged marriage that has not worked out eventually leads to a fatal fight between a husband and the tribesman she really loves.Rather than telling the NYPD the truth, the tribe "honors" the dead man by saying nothing.

title: "Naked Science" (2004) {Five Years on Mars (#5.18)}
plot: This program describes the travels, adventures, challenges and discoveries of Spirit and Opportunity as they explore the surface of Mars. Along the way they climb hills, crawl into craters, get stuck in the sand, break down, make some some amazing discoveries and give their caretakers back home some exciting days and sleepless nights. And their story continues.

title: "Naked in a Fishbowl" (2010) {Reconcilable Differences (#1.4)}
plot: Bonnie, Sophie, Jean, and Sara take a field trip to Coney Island to help Chloe finalize her divorce, and they discover that marriages are a lot like roller coasters: fun, fast and nauseating. Recorded Live June 28th, 2010 at the SoHo Playhouse in NYC.

title: "Nanny 911" (2004) {The O'Melia Family (#4.4)}
plot: Stay-at-home Mom, Judy, is outnumbered five to one while her husband is working two jobs. Nanny Stella works with mom to bring consistency and determination to her parenting while helping her understand that nothing is perfect and she should feel proud of even the smallest accomplishments she makes.

title: "Naruto" (2002) {Aiya shibaraku! Ero-sennin toujou! (#1.53)}
plot: While Ebisu trains Naruto on how to walk on water in a hot spring, he spies somebody trying to peep on women in a hot spring. Ebisu attacks him, only to be defeated quickly. Since Naruto's teacher has been knocked out, Naruto demands that the stranger become his teacher instead, but he has other plans. Naruto's Sexy Jutsu may be just the thing to get this pervert's attention.

title: "Naruto: Shippûden" (2007) {Hole (#17.10)}
plot: The fighting rages between Naruto, who stands at the vanguard of the Allied Shinobi Forces, and the team of Madara and Obito. Ten Tails' relentless attack is wearing down Naruto, and his chakra begins to dissipate. Meanwhile, Kakashi and Obito face each other in a different Kamui dimension.

title: "Naruto: Shippûden" (2007) {The Eight Inner Gates Formation (#20.7)}
plot: Guy Sensei has unleashed the Eight Inner Gates, opening all chakra limiters placed on the body in order to achieve power ten times greater than the hokages. His opponent is Madara Uchiha, who threatens to place the world under a deep sleep by fulfilling his Infinite Tsukuyomi. Madara, only lacking his left rinnegan to achieve full Six Paths mode, has tremendous power as is shown when he survives Might Guys Eight Inner Gates Unleashed Taijutsu. During Might Guy's and Madara's battle, Naruto is visited by someone deep within his subconscious, within his inner mind. This person has been very influential throughout the history of the ninja world, and at this moment reveals some very important information in the hopes of turning the tide of the Fourth Great Ninja War.

title: "Nase Maalo" (1999) {Nerds (#2.8)}
plot: Beni's band is invited to compete to appear live on radio. All they need is one good song, so Beni asks for help from his Internet song-writing partner, who calls himself Cobain. Beni doesn't know that Cobain is actually Mehmet, a shy Turkish boy. Mehmet's father is very proud that he is learning to play classical Turkish music and is unaware that Mehmet secretly longs to play rock-and-roll guitar. When Mehmet shows up at Beni's rehearsal, Beni and the band take him for some "nerd" and knock him around. After a second meeting, Beni realizes that the "nerd" is Cobain and apologizes. Mehmet tells Beni the band can use his song if he can play with them. Zana, the singer, refuses and walks out, so Karmen threshes Zana to a TV quiz show where the audience has to guess who she is by her looks; they can't. Zana goes to Mehmet's house to invite him to play but accidentally reveals Mehmet's secret to his father. Finally, Mehmet joins the band, which adopts the name Beni and the Nerds. Mehmet's father attends their performance.

title: "Nash Bridges" (1996) {The Counterfeiters (#2.15)}
plot: Nash and the SIU uncover a counterfeiting group where the money is top-of-the-line Supernote quality. Moving in to bust the group, they discover a fake SIU gang impersonating the police. Cooperation becomes tense as suspicions abound over who and what to trust. In the interim, as Nick gets in over his head financially with his horse costs, Nash reluctantly agrees to work with Joe on an off-duty case searching for a Super Bowl ring. However, Nash and Joe soon find themselves impersonating a gay couple as the case develops differently than Nash anticipated.

title: "Nashville" (2012) {The Wayfaring Stranger (#5.1)}
plot: Rayna and Deacon face a new normal with Maddie now back home and Highway 65 struggling financially. Rayna takes a gig in Silicon Valley, performing for tech mogul Zach Welles, and faces questions about the future of her own musical career. The shocking news about Juliette creates a wave of emotions throughout Nashville.

title: "National Geographic Specials" (1965) {In the Shadow of Vesuvius}
plot: This documentary explores the history of Mount Vesuvius and is destruction of the Ancient Roman city of Pompeii in 79 A.D. as well as the destruction of its sister city Herculaneum on the souther slope of the volcano. Although the inhabitants had ample warning only those living in Herculaneum heeded the signs of the upcoming disaster. Remains of the city's unfortunate inhabitants as well as the ruins of their once-proud city are shown.

title: "Natural Curiosities" (2013) {Strange Parents (#2.9)}
plot: David presents two animal species who redistributed parental roles and properties most unusually. First sea-horses, where the male has a pouch to brood the eggs, a still largely unexplained role reversal with strong couple bonding, exponent of an evolution among its related precursors. Next hyenas, where females are larger, stronger, dominant but hard to distinguish as their external sex organs resemble a male's.

title: "Natural Heroes" (2004) {Texas Gold (#3.5)}
plot: Diane Wilson - mother of five, fourth generation fisher-woman, and self-proclaimed "unreasonable woman" uses hunger strikes and civil disobedience to battle the giants of the petro-chemical industry in the most toxic place in America. Surviving imprisonment, surveillance and harassment, Diane believes that putting your life at risk is where change happens.

title: "Natural World" (1983) {Honey Hunting in Nepal (#27.17)}
plot: As a 'honey hunter' Jimmy Doherty must scale a massive cliff to reach the home of more than two million bees and dangle 200 feet up to get their honey. If successful, the reward is not only to learn more about these amazing bees, but also to taste one of nature's finest bounties, beautiful wild honey.

title: "Natural World" (1983) {Victoria Falls: The Smoke That Thunders (#28.2)}
plot: Wildlife documentary. A tale of life on the Zambezi River, set against the epic backdrop of Victoria Falls. The story is told from the point of view of a local fisherman, Mr White, who has fished these waters for 69 years, and whose riverside companions are elephants, baboons, hippos and kingfishers. Follow the fortunes of these animals through his eyes, and learn how their lives are ruled by the moods of the river and the rains.

title: "Nature Shock" (2008) {The Revengeful Elephant}
plot: The psychological effects of war are no longer just a human condition. Africa is cultivating gangs of juvenile delinquents, wreaking havoc in the wild. 30 years of poaching and conservation management is beginning to backfire, resulting in 'abnormal' violent behavior in African elephants. In Kenya, elephants are targeting and killing Masai tribe's cattle. In South Africa, 58 rhinos are killed in a single park over just two years. And in Western Uganda a village is suffering indiscriminate and violent attacks by local elephants - where, previously they had roamed peacefully. What is provoking Africa's gentle giant to these violent outbursts?

title: "Nature" (1982) {Unforgettable Elephants (#25.9)}
plot: We have seen them dressed in costumes and dancing at circuses, living solitary lives at zoos or giving our children a thrill with a ride on their back. But the largest land animals live a life that is completely foreign to us when left to their own in the wild -- one complete with battles and births, kidnappings and camaraderie. More than fifteen years ago, Martyn Colbeck began to document in film and photos the lives of African elephants. For the better part of two decades, he has grown particularly close to the elephant matriarch, Echo, and her close-knit family, who have never failed to astonish, amuse, and inspire him. The family seems to accept Colbeck into their world, and perhaps even considers him one of their own. The result is that he can record unimpeded the gentle love, and tight bonds that elephants feel for each other. Colbeck's film gives us a glimpse into the complex world of elephant society. We meet Echo and begin to understand the importance of such a majestic matriarch to her devoted clan. He shows us their language and ways of communication. And he captures remarkable scenes such as the rare birth of a crippled calf that the family desperately and collectively tries to help to its feet. The film causes us to question if this could be about more than simply survival. Is there a deeper emotion we have just been privileged enough to witness through Colbeck's lens? In scene after moving scene, Colbeck makes us fall in love with Echo, Erin, Enid, Ely, and the rest of this loving family. He conveys through his film and in a special interview with NATURE what complicated, powerful, tender, funny -- and, yes, unforgettable -- creatures elephants are.

title: "Nazi Hunters" (2010) {Kurt Lischka (#1.6)}
plot: Nazi Hunters looks at how German housewife Beate Klarsfeld and her husband Serge helped track down former Paris Gestapo chief Kurt Lishka. Lishka ordered the arrest and murder of over 33,000 Jews lived as a free man in Germany for years before his eventual arrest in Cologne.

title: "Ned and Stacey" (1995) {Promotional Rescue (#1.17)}
plot: Ned manages to get a reluctant Eric a promotion after Amanda asks Ned to put in a good word to his bosses. Stacey is less than impressed at her new job writing for an airline magazine. Eric doesn't play ball as Ned attempts to score a big account by under quoting the budget, until Ned lets the cat out of the bag that Eric only got the promotion because of him. Stacey tries to calm the situation by using positive re-enforcement that she learns at an interview.

title: "Neighbours" (1976) {Lesson Five (#1.5)}
plot: Sharon and David paint their apartment, with the help of their neighbors. Mr. Kashtan is napping at the yard, while Benny is bored and cannot find any quiet activity to do, but it is not him who wakes up Mr. Kashtan. Mr. Cohen shows Bella a very special doll - Susie Surprise.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5279)}
plot: Frazer's patient presence finally gets Ringo ready to return, even their mother encourages them. Oliver tells Elle the fact that Carmella is expecting his baby shouldn't change anything, but she concludes that's the end for them. Susan may 'not' look forward to the perks, Karl's HQ undercover snooping turns uneasy when his self-declared ambitious secretary first flirts, then catches him. Ned's attempt to get quality time with Janae is constantly frustrated by Mikey and Lou's mad hat scheme.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5339)}
plot: Ringo can't accept Fitzy taking full blame and being sacked for drawing the cartoon, so after some hesitation he takes the blame and the detention. That stirs the real culprit, a girl in his class, to confess and share his detention. At Susan's trial, the kids testify enthusiastically in her favor, but she has another dizzy spell.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5402)}
plot: Marco is furious that Oliver 'uses Mia to get to him'. Carmella soon believes Ollie, who convinces Mia it only started as a ploy. Marco owns up his infertility. Carmie resents the lie, but realizes she has a perfect family with him. Karl and co still can't convince Toadie nor console Steph, who fails to stoop him from moving out again.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5467)}
plot: Elle has thrown Paul out, Olliver moves out, fires Kirsten and resigns, as Paul does too. Ned does everything possible to spare Mikey, who can't understand why his ma is shunned and attacked by everyone. Fitzy gets chicken pocks and worries about his imaginary baby.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5526)}
plot: Silly teacher Katsis needlessly worries Toadie and pretend pseudo-parental partner Dan about slightly sexy girl photographs healthily horny scamp Callum got from Nicola's own PC. Ex-con Pete Ferguson is hospitalized, obviously wounded during a break-in at Steve's veterinary surgery. Nicola tortures a confession out of him by withholding pain killer injections. She gets away with it behind Karl's back, police sergeant Ray Moller becomes her passive accomplice. Josh's ploy gets temperamental Declan in more trouble.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5587)}
plot: Karl is absentminded, even about the wedding bills, because of a medical diagnoses: Harold probably has prostate cancer. Susan risks her report job to write an article on the Parkers' side behind Paul's back. Principal Andrew ignores Renecca's nonsense and suspends Dan and Libby for failing to support his zero tolerance on violence in school.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5647)}
plot: Zeke injury isn't serious, he heals completely in no time. Ringo sincerely apologizes and offers to be mates again, in vain. Lucas presents flirt Lisa to Elle, who fields delivery man Mark Chaplin as 'perfect date'. Declan mediates to help Steve and Didge make up and talk about the non-final divorce prospect. Zeke is forced to go to therapy, then runs off to shake hands with Ringo and invite him to move back in, but only to get Karl and Susan off his back.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5708)}
plot: The wedding party is dragged home by the parents, disappointed to have missed the wedding. Only Miranda openly wines and scolds, until a compromise is found: a semi-reenactment, during the wedding reception which Miranda is allowed to organize, with Mikey as ring-bearer. Declan is looking forward to his budget-honeymoon. Dan and Zeke are excessively forgiving about insecure Sunny's Korean 'sense of honor'.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5770)}
plot: When the standard DNA test proves inconclusive, James organizes an $8,000 one which Donna insists on, although she can't afford it. Ben and Callum forgot to buy father's day presents and ruined the breakfast. Susan would pay, but Karl makes that gardening chores, so they drift off to busking, which wrecks Donna's garage sale, driving her to steal the balance from Elle. Steph can't understand why Lyn went to Oakie the day after she bought the Parker house, until Elle tells about Paul's check.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5831)}
plot: The Dingo mates stress over their grades, Zeke's reluctance to call back Mia from the party and the girls raiding their food stash. Having broken up, Dan and Libby are miserable, seeking comfort are more with exes Lucas viz. Steph, leading up to adultery. Declan's grades mean no university.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5892)}
plot: Andrew squirms to make Paul let him stay, but Donna meanly sides against him, then realizes he's far worse off win the fathers department. Zeke helps Donna with her dad-search and Susan cheating at golf so Karl would give up his Italian sunglasses. Lucas sneers at Steph after seeing Toadie with Sonya and canine Rocky, but she's rushed to hospital, where Dr. Doug finds her and the baby healthy. Sonya drops by for truth-time but is turned away.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.5953)}
plot: Ever-loyal Andrew spares no effort to help Paul make a good impression on Diana. Tash wants his attention more then she tries to help, which would have turned out disastrously without help from Chris and Summer. Michael reassures Tash about Andrew's supposed disinterest. Paul tries to blackmail Toadie by threatening to reveal dear dealings to Steph, but she gets the story from Toad. Paul however pays P.I. Russell Walsh to find worse skeletons in the disloyal lawyer's closet.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6013)}
plot: Lou makes Lucas jump trough hoops to test if he's a suitable stand-in if he has to return to his daughter out of state. Declan suffers more rudeness from Kate, Steph even worse from Libby, who also acts jealous about Lucas, whose attempt to distract and console Steph mate-wise seems to backfire.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6075)}
plot: After the flashing incident, Mark Brennan surprises Kate by not dumping her, but choosing their affair over career prospects. It takes them a while to work out (actualy Lucas does) that his clothes' disappearance after a hot night is Sofie's doing, just as a prank and to admire him towel-only. Sonya uses the incident as an excuse to give Jade her marching orders before Callum's return. But Zeke makes sure she's invited to stay with the Kennedys. Rebecca ignores Declan's warning Paul will find out about her affair with Mike and ruin them all.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6136)}
plot: Andrew is obviously not his his cool self, but dares not backtrack on partner Tomas's party drug dealing. Only Tasha realizes what's up when she breaks her 'perpetual grounding' to attend the party. Michael is furious at her latest disobedience but believes her and calls the police. The Kennedys invite depressed Toadie for a cheer up-dinner, but it's disturbed by hints at Sonya, Karl's brutal help with Lyn's packing and Libby's vegetarian relapse.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6196)}
plot: Needing a third rent-sharer, Kyle and Jade interview candidates. The only one both like, a nurse, is scared off by Lou who invited himself to shower just because Kyle put off repairing his due to the interviewing. Pushed by Toadie and questioned by Lou about father's urn, Lucas goes trough an old photo-album which rekindles some happy memories of sports with him and big brother Dan.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6256)}
plot: Kyle grudgingly follows Paul's instructions to flaunt his perfect body and allow the gay boss of the heritage inspectors to pet it, but toasts afterward on the charm sacrifice's result: they promise to oppose the development project. Rhys is amused that Lorraine mistook Jade's Superwoman costume skirt for a cleaning cloth and accordingly ruined it, Malcolm to find Jade locked herself in after commandeering Lorraine to make her another for Sonya's S-theme birthday party, where Lucas finds his Spartacus costume far from original. Tauntingly informed by Paul, Peter Noonan orders Toadie, still on probation, to join him for crisis consultation stat, never mind the party.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6316)}
plot: Kyle is worried sick when he discovers Jade doesn't even respect doctors orders, so he breaks up her untimely gym session in the park. Next he gets her to explain her physical shyness stems from a boyfriend with loose hands, but even Sonya never heard about him. Andrew organizes a post-exams party starring the nearly unknown band Red Cotton. Sophie blackmails him into making overprotective guardian Paul allowing her to attend under Andrew's strict supervision, but Paul turns up and the ingrate vixen ignores their terms and publicly kisses Corey O'Donohue.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6377)}
plot: After the party, half Ramsey Street looks vandalized. Aiden rebukes Chris for constantly running to Tash's aide even before she asks, without due gratitude, yet stands by his boyfriend tirelessly and sleeps over with him. Paul abuses his newspaper to blame everything on the precinct merger, but Ajay suspects foul play, which both their girls could have fallen victim too, and Susan finds proof Paul is the wicked Conrad Jacskon.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6438)}
plot: After Troy's death, Rhys initially blames Karl for not having kept him in hospital, the apologizes. Ed signs up for Andrew's gambling plans after testing Tasha's commitment. Callum needs closure, probably feeling guilty, so Toadie agrees to give Troy, who has no other family, a proper funeral, but Jade gets Sonya's surprising veto vote.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6499)}
plot: Harley can't stand by as Callum, wrongly suspected of his till-theft, is punished with endless chores. Putting back most cash doesn't work, so he owes up. Kyle feels Harley's a lost cause and orders him to pack and return home, but when even Callum, admitting to his own unruly past, suggests more clemency, a last chance is granted. Rhys is taken off the surgery board, forced to have his hand tested again and told it's over in his chosen field. Vanessa may never be forgiven for ruining his life and seeks comfort in Lucas's arms.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6582)}
plot: Kyle has no plans to see Rhys's double date again, but Sheila invites her in his place and makes sure that scares off Georgia. Paul advises candor to Ajay when Priya gets inappropriate text messages, but when she insists on secrecy helps her set a trap. Karl decides to spill the beans about Sara, to her dismay, in an attempt to win Susan back, but she finally serves him divorce papers.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6645)}
plot: Paul got municipal permission for his real estate project and puts grateful Mason to menial work. Lucas Ajay smells a rat about Paul paying for Mason's lawyer and offers to plead his case pro bono, but the knave already accepted and refuses to fire Tim Collins. has an intense conversation with Vanessa, decides to stay a steady parents couple after all and agrees to break completely with Steph, so she cancels her shop job and resolves to cater.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6706)}
plot: Desperate failing to raise Robbo's blackmail, Mason tells Paul about his or actually unsuspecting Amber's peril and is promised help, but is told to buy time. Callum is 'treated' to an 'infantile' sixteenth birthday party against his expressed wish. the knavish 'party boy' childishly takes out on the adult guests his frustration over Imogen, whom he invited despited Bailey's wise warning, turning down last-minute. Ex-gambling-addict Lucas is desperate to pay Paul for his new apartment, so it's very tempting when a mate tells him about poker winnings at Robbo's.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6766)}
plot: Surprised that Hudson agreed to a jail visit, Chris goes, is relieved he's still loved and not blamed, yet shattered when Hudson concludes they must break up as Chris shouldn't wait for him. Kyle is touched when Sheila offers him grandmother's wedding ring, yet warns it's far too soon to propose to Georgia and hides it for his lover, but dog Bossy stuffs it into the couch. Paul gets Therese to sign, within hours, a contract as general manager of Lassiter's group, just before imposing a parking fee which stirs a huge protest from Charlie's and Harold's stakeholders.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6826)}
plot: Brennan scolds her latest ex Kyle for 'messing up' Kate after her kiss and run, but soon acknowledges that's nonsense, yet even helped by Paul, he can't get her to talk properly, let alone explain. Karl neglected to get a municipal permit for the hospital charity junk sale, but Paul gives him 'for a small favor later'. Finding there the self-made earrings he made for Georgia, Kyle bitterly assumes she dumped every reminder of him, but she frantically looks for them when she finds out Toadie threw them in the junk pile by mistake.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6888)}
plot: Daniel gets Paul to reward more hotel chores with the use of a storage room as dark room, then convinces Amber to share the 'magical' experience of old-fashioned analogue-photograph-developing. Mark reports Sienna as suspect of Kate's murder to the police, but Matt even revokes all courtesy information and seizes his evidence, while Paul blames him for having attracted the murderer. Mark is left a mental mess, so Sonya chooses to stay with him and miss out on a fancy restaurant dinner with Toadie, who agrees to turn it into a 'working lunch' with Naomi after she sabotages his plan to go with a major client.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.6946)}
plot: Josh jumps at an occasion to earn a penny and get distraction from the explosive home situation since Paige entered the picture, so he accepts carrying a shipping for Kathy's firm in, hired by Naomi. She notices his clumsy dating site attempt, coaches him, strikes out herself with Grant and moves on the stud she first called too young in the elevator. Paul's initial skepticism about Chris as possible father for Lucy's child wish gives way when the knave proves great care and responsibility in considering it, concluding after conflicting advice from the Cannings and Georgia they'll need more time to make up their minds. Karl enjoys his new 'celebrity author' status and refuses to pull the plug, amused to hear that Susan is embarrassed by cheeky innuendo from school imps.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.7009)}
plot: In terror for Chris's amended statement, the Willis family prepares for Josh's trial. Chris appears and pleads against a jail term for the truly remorseful knave, who indeed gets off with a community service and suspended jail. Nate bonds even further with Chris by opening up over his war experience. Patricia and Sheile still turn on Josh, Toadie and even their family.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.7070)}
plot: Kyle convinces Matt, who is drink moodily, feeling he let Bailey and the whole family down, he's not a failed father. Dimato's generous hush bonus allows Matt to pretend backward overtime premiums enable them to pay the mortgage at least half a year younger. Paige chickens Bailey into accepting Brad's offer to join a school running program, but he overdoes it until he drops in need of medical assistance. Nick skilfully flatters Georgia by asking her 'fundraising expert' help and treating her to food and ballet tickets for her and unamused Kyle.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.7130)}
plot: Despite Tyler's kind efforts, the mechanic basics course Mark booked with Naomi but has to miss on urgent duty is a far cry from the dating hits Paul suggested previously, she even claims compensation for a ruined designer handbag. Ezra's reign of terror is ended when Chloe confirms Clem's abuse charge so Mark arrests him and Quill hands his transition manager job to Terese pending trial.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.7190)}
plot: Mortified by his catching-up Internet nude past, Ben withdraws from the competition and wants to return home to the country, but Tyler cracks u when questioned by Karl and ends up motivating Ben to turn his position by making a cool warning video and re-entering as star guitarist. Terese meanly bugs Brad so badly that Daniel and Imogen run from the dinner he supposedly 'sabotaged' but Josh calmly warns her she's wrecking a good marriage, yet is grimly dismissed.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.7251)}
plot: Ben confesses to shuttered Karl and Susan that he tried to topple the false fire alert prank and accidentally must have started the real fire, and is brought to Mark for informal questioning and after consulting Toadie as lawyer, formally interviewed at the precinct. After Karl is attacked even for apologizing for Ben to the Willis family, where Brad's return as father and 'nurse' is needed with Terese and Amber's baby in hospital, Piper confides into Lauren that Ben is covering for her. Sonya arranges for Steph, whose song idea helped her with Nell's bathing phobia, to meet and hopefully make up with Lucas's wife.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {(#1.7312)}
plot: After Doug stumbles to the pub alone, Josh works out he forgetfully left Dusan behind and brings him to hospital for a reassuring checkup while Imogen goes find unconscious Susan. Josh also finds and frees Paul and Terese, who join the frantic search for Jimmie, who turns up OK after his encounter with a woman, also brought to hospital for a checkup, whom Amy recognizes discretely as her mother Nene Williams. Without her pills, Steph blatantly ignores Todie's advise and bluntly confronts Philippa, herself a lawyer who knows arbiter Michael Arnold, and infuriates her by scolding Max's mental past.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {Alpha Bravo (#1.5163)}
plot: Janae and Boyd's marriage is once again tested when Boyd accuses Janae of messing with Glenn's car. Janae vows to give Boyd another chance, but will he be flung back into the arms of Glenn? Lolly is desperate to get Pepper's name cleared, and is horrified to learn that she was the cause of Glenn's car accident. Pepper is determined to prove that Rosie is not a lesbian, so she strings Frazer into another one of her crazy schemes. Janae acts outraged when Boyd calls her the logical car sabotage suspect, motive and opportunity, but Steiger isn't so easily brushed aside, that takes tears, then she gives Boyd two weeks to 'do whatever it takes' to choose, he consults Karl. Ringo and Lolly are delighted his support gave her the strength to confront Sandy, she assures him he shouldn't be ashamed to admit to Rachel he can't swim, girls love a boy's vulnerable courage all the more. Pepper assures Frazer Rosie is no dike but a 'saysbian', claiming lesbianism to hide her own confusion, but promises to resolve his be a 'sure' test, measuring her heart-rate when exposed to each in underwear, while Karl proves an ambulant office disaster- Rosie's. Susan's good news still doesn't enthusiasm Pepper to return to teaching. Poor Frazer experiences how painful sweetly offered help to a Timmins girl can be, they compare desperation. To Paul's delighted surprise, Boyd visits Glenn in hospital- and not just politely...

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {Das Vote (#1.5101)}
plot: Zeke wisely stops Susan and Rachel from rushing to Karl's aid; Rach decides to 'bond' with Karl by asking his help with a genetics assignment, although she already handed it in last week. Now the fake engagement is known, Will supports honest Frazer's bid to keep the room, Rosie somehow justifies liar Pepper's claim. Both parties pull all the stops to charm the other house-mates, especially Ned who holds the deciding vote, but unfortunately just can't enjoy being 'courted'. Katya's plan to shoot her blackmailing ex Guy Sykes in the bush has backfired literally: she is found by hikers and rushed to hospital, where Karl's diagnosis remains undecided.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {Hello Lolly (#1.5134)}
plot: Lou returns to Ramsay Street with his daughter Lolly but she isn't as sweet as she seems. The mysterious stranger lurking in Erinsborough turns out to be Frazer's younger brother, Ringo. Will he get in the way of Frazer and Rosie's relationship? Katya is admitted to hospital after getting bashed. She finally confesses all of her criminal connections to the police. As if Fraser weren't miserable enough because of the list incident, which Pepper tries to minimize as 'endearing quirks that will win Rosie over in the long run', he nearly has a fit when the door is rung by no other then Ringo Brown- his kid brother, who heard from their brother Johnie about George 'Frazer' whose ex Rosie is; the 16 year-old wants his cool brother & mate back, for good. Susan isn't impressed by Karl's idea of relaxing, Pepper betrays his malingering. Lou tells his daughter Lolly isn't happy with maritally stressed ma Sandy anymore, and he already agreed to take her in- 'uncle' Harold accepts; Susan welcomes her to Erinsborough high; she seems all good will and sounds helpful, but dumps an emptied wallet in the trash... Paul's home cooking effort is cheerfully tolerated anyhow. Katya is in hospital after an assault, she didn't actually see but suspects Guy; Ned visits and offers a new start, kissing. Meanwhile Rosie tells Paul he carries too much history; when she delights Frazer, Ringo assumes the identity of kid brother 'Rick Yeats'.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {Marry-Go-Round (#1.4964)}
plot: Karl has the gal, now Izzy has told him the watch he gave away was Paul's $20,000 gift, to ask it back from Boyd, first 'to replace it with a more trendy one', then because it was too expensive to give away, but Max insists a gift is given- or at least plays that game for a while. Dylan is determined to get in dad Kim's contraband DVD business, but is not interested in Harold's pleading for reconciliation with Sky; after Janae was mad enough to tell him he's not even 'dependable' enough to be together again, Boyd agrees to talk to Sky, whose irrational victim routine ends up disgusting even Harold. When Bree tells the truth to Zeke, it brings them even closer together. Boyd is dumb enough to propose to Janae offering a ring on bended knee.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {Secret Guardin' (#1.4892)}
plot: After Steph dumped him, Max feels guilty but also lashes out at Karl, who actually warned him in advance, and won't even listen to Boyd; he also slips out to Kim the infidelity in their marriage isn't necessarily on his part. Jane gets family support now her tests results are due, and from Boyd who realizes if she's positive, he's at risk too, and Karl confirms he should get tested but could suffer medical practice restrictions if not negative. Janelle loves Dylan's adult attitude, even after Kim's stupidity, and suggests to call the hot dog business Dyl-Dogs or even Hot Dogs, Hot Bodies and go sell to bare-chested and take Sky or Janae in scanty dress to male clientèle. Sky drowns Dylan's potential jealousy towards Ned's character in real-life kisses. When Kim asks Janelle about her fidelity, inspired by Bree's new version of the novel's ending after an idea by Sky, Janelle denies but Janae gives her heaps as cheap tart hypocrite and worst example. Even a loving phone-call to daughter Summer can't calm Max's despair while Boyd keeps the bar afloat.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {The Marrow Escape (#1.5170)}
plot: After more shortsighted abuse from Pepper and Rosie, who admits she was wrong about Janae's kiss, Frazer tells her it's over because they fundamentally mistrust him, without true respect. After an extraterrestrial wedding-equivalent ceremony aptly described by Harold as weird but touching, Stingray's transplant to baby Kerry seems to go wrong, but he pulls trough. Connor sent packages from China, no actual news. Steiger surprises Ned, on the trail of Paul's plot, while his PC is still there; Frazer tells Ned only Ringo is great at breaking passwords.

title: "Neighbours" (1985) {We Are Davo (#1.5218)}
plot: Zeke is amused how Ringo tries to be an even more sensitive 'feinist' boyfriend, and how Rachel milks Karl for $50 each when begged to pretend he's their uncle when he successfully interviews for a sales rep job with family men-hater David 'Davo' Mather, Susan scolds him- till she reads the lucrative contract. Paul's tip to Eden Hills hotel allows it to underbid Ray Krebs's hospital for patient offspring daycare. Carmella confesses she told a nursing colleague and is furious Oliver blames her a first but Elle guesses it's Paul and confronts dad. Paul cues them how to win the contract after all.

title: "Neon Naege Banhaesseo" (2011) {Don't Cry (#1.12)}
plot: Only Im Tae-joon finds delight in Kim Suk-hyun's resignation (basking in success while Suk-hyun heads out to get drunk). As Tae-joon takes over the school centennial celebration (quickly dismissing Lee Gyu-won and Lee Shin from it), students revisit the Suk-hyun/Gyu-won affair rumor and doubt its validity. As news of the resignation spreads, sponsors start pulling out; so, before finances disappear entirely, the school president orders Suk-hyun's return. Joon-hee, seeing so much harm come from the lie that Hee-joo ordered him to make, can no longer live with it and confesses. Tae-joon, now with the situation and so many turned against him, vengefully switches to a new target - Hee-joo - whom he discovers trying to mask a serious throat infection.

title: "Never the Twain" (1981) {A Nose for Quality (#3.3)}
plot: Imperious Lady Devereaux calls in on Simon whilst in the next door shop elderly Mrs Piggit offers Oliver pieces for sale but seeing the Rolls parked outside Oliver wrongly assumes that she is the aristocrat. He is surprised to find that she lives in a council flat but he does pick up some valuable Netsuke whereas Simon's visit to the real Lady Devereaux to outwit his rival proves to be a wasted journey. At least Simon can take comfort from the fact that the Netsukes are fakes.

title: "New Classics with Chef Rob Feenie" (2000) {A Sunset Picnic Sail (#4.7)}
plot: Vancouver from a boat is an experience not to be missed. But if you don't own a yacht then it helps to know how to cook. In exchange for a wonderful sunset cruise up Indian Arm; Rob and Marnie agree to supply the picnic. And what a picnic it is - an enormous platter of antipasti - everything from marinated olives to roasted shallots, and grilled eggplant- two types of chicken, a blue cheese and green apple coleslaw, followed by an angel food cake with strawberries and mint.

title: "New Girl" (2011) {Models (#2.5)}
plot: Instead of celebrating Cece's birthday watching a movie, Cece wants to go out. Jess joins the models at a wild party at the bar. The next day, Cece is not able to model at a car show, so Jess steps in at the last minute. It does not go well.

title: "New Street Law" (2006) {(#2.5)}
plot: When Al Ware doesn't show up for work, Jack decides to stop by his flat to see what the problem might be. What he finds is Al's partner Steve dead on the floor. Al's story is that after he and his partner had a fight the night before, he went out by himself for a drink and then went straight to bed on his return home without checking to see if Steve was in. Jack is of the view that once Al admits to the fight, Al will be charged with murder so they concocts a story for the police. Annie and Charlie defend a young man who is charged with raping a teenage at a party. Two other youths were allowed to plead guilty to lesser charges but the prosecution is determined to get a conviction. He maintains his innocence but the barristers feel he's not telling them the whole story.

title: "New Tricks" (2003) {Lost in Translation (#8.3)}
plot: DNA from an unidentified man killed in 1996 and staked to a cross is linked to pathology laboratory assistant Anna King, who explains that it must be her brother, David Celaj, fourteen years her senior, with whom she fled Albania as a little girl before Mr. and Mrs. King adopted her and he disappeared from her life. David was a police interpreter in the case of murder suspect and fellow Albanian Michael Luga, who walked free when a witness withdrew her statement. The team believe that Luga killed David but Brian's accidental discovery of the role of scarecrows in Albanian customs leads the investigation elsewhere whilst Gerry's adventures in French cuisine land him an unexpected dinner date. Sandra and her team re-open the case of a man whose burned remains were found in February 1996. He was estimated to be 25 to 30 years old and markings indicated he may have been the victim of a stabbing with the body tied to a wooden cross. A witness had seen a light in the area and there were no missing persons reports that matched the victim. Now however, a DNA test has linked the victim to Anna King, a fingerprint specialist with the Greater London Forensic Service. King however was originally from Albania and was adopted and had no family other a brother, David. Her adoptive parents know little of David but he worked for the police as an interpreter. David was interpreting in a high profile investigation but the solution to the crime is to be found in age old customs and blood feuds from the old country. Meanwhile, Gerry tries to get a date with his French cookery teacher but ends up with her mother.

title: "New York vs Los Angeles" (2016)
plot: "New York vs Los Angeles" pits the two very different, but also very much the same, locales against each other, head on. Stephanie Haney and Jackie Iadonisi take you on a guided tour of the two most major cities in the U.S. and decided each week which one wins out.

title: "Newman Street" (2014) {(#1.11)}
plot: Dooshima is diagnosed with malaria; Dr Sophie treats her with ACT malaria drug. Andy talks to Funke about his ambitions; to his surprise he gets a breakthrough. Akpos and Amerika caught by Mama Ejiro sneaking girls out of the house. She sees them as irresponsible boys. Meanwhile at Seabreeze, Usman introduces an external agent with vast experience.

title: "NewsRadio" (1995) {Massage Chair (#3.3)}
plot: WNYX is exceeding it's budget and Mr. James tells Dave he has to get rid of the free snacks in the break room. Dave tells Mr. James this will lead to a revolt lead by Bill and that the staff will consider Dave the bad guy, but Mr. James sees no other options. Pretty soon, Bill is indeed the leader of a revolt of the whole staff - save Lisa who doesn't want to be involved because she's involved with Dave - and tells Dave what their demands are. However, Bill demands a massage chair instead of free snacks in the break room. Meanwhile, Joe tries to get Catherine to go on a date with him by fixing her not-broken desk.

title: "Nexo Knights" (2015) {The Book of Total Badness (#1.9)}
plot: In a dark, destroyed part of the kingdom, Jestro arrives at the ruins of a huge castle. The Book of Monsters knows this place, as the great evil wizard Monstrux lived here. The Book sniffs out some powerful magic in the ruins: "The Book of Destruction." With this, The Book tells Jestro they can destroy the NEXO-Knights and then attack the King's Castle and cause massive destruction. Jestro creates destructive monsters and sends them all over the realm, so the Knights must separate and fight single combats all over the place. They Knights lose these battles and learn that they must work as a team! And, just when the Knights are scattered across the Kingdom, Jestro attacks the King's Castle! It looks like all is lost. When Aaron, who has escaped, returns to see Jestro' attack, he realizes he must gather his fellow Knights. Merlok says it's very dangerous, but Aaron says he must take the risk to gather the Knights and save Knighton.

title: "Nick Helm Solid Gold Super Hits" (2012)
plot: International One Man Mega Myth Nick Helm weaves his magic over an audience whilst performing his classic lost hit 'I Fancy The Pants Off Of You'. Featuring Cabaret Seating. Then, the love-lorn dreamboat Nick 'The Hit Maker' Helm performs one of his poems straight from his fragile, tattered heart. Finally, The Nation's heart-throb will not take 'No' for an answer - and he has '15 Reasons' to make you stay. Featuring specifically sourced props and extras.

title: "Nickelodeon Arcade" (1992) {Phil Moore Wears a Gold Shirt (#2.4)}
plot: Phil? Phil, what happened? The Hawaiian shirt is gone. You've got on this shiny gold number that isn't even tucked in, like you just rolled off your waterbed and onto the Nick Arcade set. Was it something we did? Please bring back the Hawaiian shirt.

title: "Night Court" (1984) {Educating Rhoda (#6.5)}
plot: While handling a group of trainee bailiffs, Bull becomes smitten with one, Rhoda, smitten enough to overlook her spectacular incompetence. One thing he can't ignore is when she accidentally loses custody of a psychotic woman who acts out roles in movies. The woman is next reported entering a cheap hotel with Dan.

title: "Night Gallery" (1969) {The Boy Who Predicted Earthquakes/Miss Lovecraft Sent Me/The Hand of Borgus Weems/Phantom of What Opera? (#2.1)}
plot: Herbie is a very special boy. He has the ability to predict the near future. During the taping of a show where he advises the public of his predictions, he repeatedly insists he must go home. The studio heads talk him out of leaving, but Herbie remains uneasy. He tells his audience that tomorrow is going to be the beginning of a new and different world. Human beings are going to live as they were meant to live. Has he told the truth, or is he sparing mankind from the awful reality? A young clairvoyant becomes a worldwide sensation because of his ability, but he suddenly refuses to make any more future predictions. A baby sitter discovers almost too late that she has been hired to baby sit for a family of vampires. After he discovers that a mysterious force has taken control of his right hand, a man desperately turns to a surgeon for help. The Phantom of the opera gets a surprise after he kidnaps a beautiful opera singer.

title: "Night Visions" (2001) {The Maze (#1.11)}
plot: Young college student Susan Thornhill is a shut-in and that's how she likes it. When Wes, a well-meaning student, asks her out, she stands her ground politely refuses. The next day she sees Wes and, feeling awkward, tries to avoid him by going through a hedge maze to her class. Once she finds a way out a very different world meets her. The whole university has become a real ghost town and there's not a soul in sight. When she finally meets another person - her music teacher, she tries to kill her. Susan starts finding dead bodies everywhere on campus and arms herself with a knife. When she finally finds a newspaper, the date on it makes no sense to her. She concludes that the only way for her to get to the bottom of things is to reach the college library. However, what she discovers there disturbs her more than any horror movie. Sometimes all you can do is try to do the best you can with what you have got left.

title: "Nightmare Next Door" (2011) {Hilltop Horror (#5.5)}
plot: When 55-year-old Monica Schmeyer is found shot to death in her living room, the peaceful people of Hanover, Pennsylvania are in a state of panic. Investigators have no idea who would want to kill this gentle woman and they have few clues to go on.

title: "Nightmares" (2016)
plot: Nightmares is an action - horror new media web series starring and executive produced by Ciera Foster ( Foster Features Inc) . The series follows the protagonist " Aella Sky" played by Ciera Foster, a young woman suffering with severe sleep deprivation and psychosis due to chronically enduring brutally violent dreams with every slumber. When Aella assumes a state of complete sleep the world as she knows it no longer exists, as Aella is thrust into an alternate reality of seemingly never ending nightmares. With each nightmare growing increasingly more dangerous than the last, Aella's very survival depends on her ability to fight her way out of the nightmares, to stay awake and to stay alive!

title: "Nikita" (2010) {One Way (#1.9)}
plot: Nikita and Michael temporarily team-up to kill a terrorist who murdered Michael's family many years ago. When Percy learns this information, he sends Division agents to kill Nikita, who ultimately compromises the mission, leading to Michael's capture by the terrorist group. Alex is caught going through medical files inside Division so she creates a lie that involves Jaden and almost blows her cover.

title: "Nine for IX" (2013) {The '99ers (#1.8)}
plot: The world of women's sports was kicked upside down on July 10, 1999. Before a sold-out crowd of more than 90,000 at the Rose Bowl and an estimated 40 million Americans watching on television, the women's soccer team reached a cultural and athletic pinnacle with its penalty-kick shoot-out victory over China to win the Women's World Cup. These players were more than the pony-tailed poster girls celebrated by mainstream media. As told through the voice of a longtime team captain, Julie Foudy, we get an inside look at the strong team ethic and rare "do for each other" mentality that propelled them to victory that day and turned the team into a cultural touchstone. With unprecedented access, the film uses candid, behind-the-scenes footage shot by the players themselves during the tournament to present a unique portrait of the women who irrevocably changed the face of women's athletics. Reuniting key players from the 1999 squad and talking with current U.S. players as well, the film will examine how women's soccer - and women's sports as a whole - has changed since that epic day at the Rose Bowl.

title: "Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu" (2011) {The Art of the Silent Fist (#3.2)}
plot: The Ninja go into hiding but an army of the Digtial Overlord's evil robotic Nindroids are hunting them wherever they go. Their only chance is to learn the secrets of the Techno blades and use them to cut all power to save Ninjao from this technological menace.

title: "Nip/Tuck" (2003) {Duke Collins (#5.8)}
plot: As Christmas approaches, Sean finally discovers the secret romance between Christian and Julia after they decide to come clean about it. Landing in the hospital after a fire, Matt bonds with his horribly burned rehabilitation counselor, Rachel. Sean performs surgery on a man, Duke Collins, who was shot in the face while playing Santa Claus by a disgruntled boy. Meanwhile, Eden suspiciously makes a peace offering with a wary Julia by giving her a gift of a fruitcake. Kimber and Ram reveal their future plans to Julia and Christian. Also, Sean and Christian deal with the presence of a group of overly cheerful Christmas carolers that show up at their practice. Yuletide cheer as Matt faces painful recovery and Sean's rejection. Sean is shocked to finally learn the truth about Christian and Julia, and Eden bakes Julia a most suspicious fruitcake. Confrontation between Julia and Kimber at a Christmas party. Matt realizes it is time to be more of a man.

title: "Nip/Tuck" (2003) {Willy Ward (#4.14)}
plot: Christian convinces Michelle they should both adopt Wilber. Then his biological mother, nymphomaniac Gina Russo, tries begging and raging to get access to the boy. So she's the suspect when Wilber is kidnapped, but James LeBeau really needed him for the illegal organ trade. Matt and Kimber seek help with counselor viz. Sean about their 'boring' sex life. Matt finds his own solution, starring in a private porn movie with Kimber. However the professionals he hired don't stick to promises. Ventriloquist Willy Ward asks Sean to make him look like his hand puppet again, now they're no longer in demand.

title: "Nitro Circus" (2009) {Puerto Rico (#1.10)}
plot: Travis heads back to his Puerto Rican roots to meet up with motocross legend and mentor, Gary Bailey. While there, the Nitro Crew embraces the island's diverse landscape when they go for a Caribbean surf session and hit a dirt track set in the dense tropical jungle with their friend and motocross rider, Tara Geiger.

title: "No Angels" (2004) {(#1.4)}
plot: Beth goes after Paul,a wealthy and handsome medic who is being headhunted for a management post but there is one snag - he is married. Beth's aunt Pat is admitted to her ward with a foot infection and Beth goes out of her way to avoid her,the animosity between the two women being explained when Beth's cousin Kelvin turns up. Senior consultant McManus takes Callum under his wing,betting that he will beat a rival consultant's protege at golf but too much concentration on the tournament leads to Callum making more mistakes on the ward. Kate meanwhile decides to give herself a glamorous make-over.

title: "No Names" (2012)
plot: Mike and Paul are best friends trying to make it into the business, but are barely getting by. When they have no choice but to crash with their friend Vince and his fiancé, the two turn to their manager's connection with a seedy porn producer to get a script financed.

title: "No Tomorrow" (2016) {Pilot (#1.1)}
plot: Evie Covington is a risk-averse quality-control assessor living in Seattle, who appreciates order. Then Evie meets the charming, free-spirited Xavier Holliday, who encourages Evie to "seize the day", because he believes humankind has a mere eight months and twelve days until a runaway asteroid smacks into planet Earth. That's why he made an Apocalyst - a tally of every last thing he wants to do before the world goes kaput. So with the help of her friends and co-workers, Hank and Kareema, Evie must decide whether Xavier is certifiable and whether that even matters, if being with him means living her life more fully.

title: "Noah's Arc" (2005) {Say It Loud (#2.8)}
plot: Take a behind the scenes tour of the second season of Noah's Arc. This insightful look into the characters, stories, and production of this groundbreaking series features interviews with the cast and crew as well as the creator, Patrik-Ian Polk.

title: "Noddy in Toyland" (2009) {Noddy and the Magic Paintbrush}
plot: The cuckoo sees what fun everyone's having and decides to fly off and look for some fun of her won. She tries swimming with the ducks - too cold; pecking the ground for worms, but that's not for her either. And she has no idea how wrong things are going to go without her. Mr Plod's shoes wear through because he doesn't know when to stop his morning round. The guards change twice in one minute then not for hours and Mr Wobblyman's jellies freeze solid. They need her back! Noddy takes to the skies in his airplane and he and the paper planes search for her. Noddy finds her and they all head back to Toytown. Noddy has a great idea for a game cuckoo can play while still letting everyone know the time. Hide and Seek! She is delighted.

title: "None of the Above" (2013) {Shooters, Showers and Shockwaves (#2.4)}
plot: Tim Shaws performs experiments to resolve questions including can a baseball player use a pitching machine to hit targets while in motion, what is the most absorbent of four different materials, how does a helium balloon behave while in motion, how many breaths does it take to fill a diaper bag with air, and what happens when an air hose is left on a car tire.

title: "North Pole Ice Airport" (2012) {(#1.1)}
plot: Each spring, Russian army paratroopers land on a suitably thick ice patch near the North Pole to build a temporary air strip and set up a tent camp. It caters for hundreds of tourists, mainly foreigners, who are flown in from a hotel on the nearest Island, Norway's Spitzbergen. Some arrive by helicopter for an outrageously expensive VIP blitz visit, others go for a more testing explorer-like experience, in the case of a Britis charity fund-raising team even an exhausting trek on foot. The Russian hosts provide for everything, and find a month in the Artcic counts for six on inhabited land.

title: "North Woods Law" (2012) {Lost and Found (#2.209)}
plot: A new class of wardens train for the most demanding part of their job: search and rescues. On the Appalachian Trail a hiker vanishes and the wardens lead one of largest search and rescue operations in Maine's history to find her...but the mystery of what really happened to her deepens as each day passes.

title: "Northern Exposure" (1990) {All Is Vanity (#2.3)}
plot: Holling impresses Shelly with chivalrous 'bravery', but a remark from her makes him inquire about circumcision - not recommended for an adult man according to Joel. After Chris broadcasts the locally unprecedented procedure, Holling dares not pull out. Maggie pretends to her visiting father, Frank O'Connell, she has a 'perfect boy-friend', without warning Dr. Joel Fleischman that he's the man for the job - so he enjoys overdoing it. Mayor Maurice commandeers first Ed as the outdoors 'morgue guard', then Joel as a reluctant 'coroner' to help him start the investigation for a John Doe corpse, who is soon claimed by the locals although nobody knows him.

title: "Not Going Out" (2006) {Anna (#7.4)}
plot: Envious of their interesting life style Lucy befriends Anna and Toby though Lee feels left out so Daisy suggests he invites then to a dinner party . This he does, pretending to be a successful business man with tickets for an upcoming charity event. Feeling sorry for him - and admitting to being hen-pecked - Toby gets the tickets for him and allows Lee to take the credit. Unfortunately at the charity dinner Lee gets very drunk and the lie is exposed but when he takes to the stage to sing Lucy's praises and Anna criticizes him Lucy realizes which of the two's friendship means the more to her.

title: "Not Now John" (2012) {The Endless Raging Bat (#2.2)}
plot: After reminiscing of the Raging Bull 2 audition, John Grimm encounters a waitress with an odd vulnerability while having lunch with acquaintances from his acting class. This discovery leads John to inquire about his own underlying aspirations and that of his buddies. As a result, he decides to mesh these dreams into an offbeat short film that features all three of them.

title: "Nothing Too Good for a Cowboy" (1998) {Charades (#1.2)}
plot: Kit's true identity is revealed. This prompts a trip to town where Rich finds the girl's father. But as the man's true colors are shown, Gloria pushes her partners to give Kit a permanent place on the ranch. Meanwhile, Pan's sometime affair with the widow Franklin heats up again. Slowly, one by one, everyone on the ranch learns the secret being kept by Kit, the best of the three young ranch hands: he isn't actually a "he", but a "she". This secret was only one of two related secrets kept by the ranch hands. Some like Gloria and Pan could see Kit blossoming into womanhood, whereas Rich was totally in the dark. Kit's gender may be a problem for Tommy's raging hormones. But it's also a problem for Rich, who now sees living at the ranch an underage girl whose parents may or may not know where she is. Since Kit is short on information especially why she doesn't want to go home, Rich, after learning her true lineage, needs to speak to her father both to understand Kit's motivations but also to get permission for her to remain on the ranch. The ranch hands aren't the only ones keeping secrets as Pan has one he keeps in Vanderhoof. Meanwhile, Pan and Gloria are arguing on what is more of a priority on the ranch, building a new fence or building an addition to the one-room cabin. Winning this argument becomes more important when bank manager Roland Tewkesbury changes his loan regulations, meaning they only have enough money to do one of the two projects.

title: "Notruf Hafenkante" (2007) {Versuchungen (#7.20)}
plot: Claudia's son Max eagerly starts his police internship in the precinct, alas with only tame old Wolle as mentor, but proves himself a fine researcher. The daily cash receipts of Lars List and fiancee Iris Schwan's trendy restaurant were stolen at night without apparent lock forcing, so the trusted staff, who all have keys, are suspects, firstly Lars's ex Maja Urbancic, whose was found on site and suggests jealous Iris set her up. Tariq finds Maya's wheelchair-bound teen son Kristof, who was injured in traffic accident, carrying an even larger cash sum. .

title: "Nova" (1974) {Creatures of Light (#43.14)}
plot: Examination of oceanic creatures that light up, whether to scare predators, lure prey or attract mates. And efforts to harness nature's light to track cancer cells, detect pollution, illuminate cities and map the inner workings of the brain are also examined.

title: "Nova" (1974) {Rise of the Robots (#43.17)}
plot: Machines with human-like capabilities have long been the stuff of science fiction. Until now. Meet the world's most advanced humanoid robots as they leave the lab, battle real-world challenges, and endeavor to become part of our everyday lives.

title: "Novela" (1963) {El idiota XIX}
plot: Prince Lev Nikolayevich Myshkin is a kind, modest man and an unfortunate sufferer of epilepsy. After spending years in an insane asylum in Switzerland, he travels back to his native Russia to find his ancestors. Experiencing society for the first time, he finds himself an outsider and open to manipulation.

title: "Now and Again" (1999) {The Insurance Man Always Rings Twice (#1.5)}
plot: Michael sneaks a newspaper out of the janitor's cleaning basket, and finds out that Lisa has put his house up for sale. He breaks out again to confront Roger and find out why his million dollar life insurance policy hadn't been paid. Turns out that Grand Empire Insurance Company (and especially Craig Spence) holds a grudge against the Wiseman family because Michael's integrity had cost the company $400 million in an earlier case. Because of this grudge, they're calling his death a suicide and refusing to pay. Michael makes arrangements to deal with Spence his own way.

title: "Numb3rs" (2005) {Man Hunt (#1.13)}
plot: A prison transport bus crashes after maneuvers by two other vehicles, several inmates escape, including the dangerous McDowd. Charlie gets on well with CHP Officer Morris on the scene and works out mathematically it was no accident, both other drivers probably were in the game. Dad is worried Don might be returning to the period he regularly worked in fugitive retrieval, especially now a former colleague, burly federal marshal Cooper, is on the same case. After finding a lesser fugitive, Charlie's mathematical probabilities approach helps reconstructing the remarkable movements of McDowd in LA, which leads to a worrisome motive relating to a DEA case and likely further accomplices... When a prison transport bus crashes as a result of an accident with two other vehicles, some of the prisoners escape. Charlie works with a CHP officer to figure out what happened and he arrives at the conclusion that it was not an accident but staged. Don is worried that one of the prisoners, McDowd is going to go after the witness who helped send him away. An agent who specializes in tracking down fugitives shows up to help Don. But when McDowd kills someone else, they wonder what he is doing. They eventually discover that someone sprung him so that he could take someone out. And when Alan learns the nature of the case, he is worried that Don would be going back to fugitive retrieval which kept him out of contact with his family. When two prisoners escape from a crashed prison bus, one of the prisoners travels continuously through LA with the intent of killing the main witness that put him behind bars. With time running out, Agent Eppes, Charlie and an old friend of Eppes' from his fugitive hunting days attempt to track down the ruthless killer.

title: "Number Please" (1961)
plot: "Number Please," a Goodson-Todman Production, was a Hangman-type game that was an early predecessor-of-sorts to the far-more successful "Wheel of Fortune." Two contestants, one a champion, competed in this game. Host Collyer showed the players a mystery word puzzle, which was always led to the identity of a prize. Contestants, one at a time, called out a number they believed would help them solve the puzzle. The first player to correctly solve the puzzle (e.g., ELECTRIC SHAVER; BACKYARD BARBECUE FOR FIFTY FRIENDS; CHEVROLET IMPALA SEDAN) won the prize named. The highest-scoring contestant of the day was champion; he/she competed until defeated.

title: "Nurse Jackie" (2009) {What the Day Brings (#2.11)}
plot: After avoiding Eddie, O'Hara and the drug dealer who has come looking for his stolen pills, Jackie takes off early for a family vacation upstate. But when Jackie misplaces the stash of pills she brought to get her through the vacation, she starts to unravel bit by bit.

title: "O Negócio" (2013) {Acordo (#2.3)}
plot: Karin's lawyer suggests a settlement, but things don't quite go as planned. Meanwhile, Luna is hired to take someone's virginity, Oscar takes a psychological exam for the chance to be hired by a millionaire, and Magali deals with a loud neighbor.

title: "OOglies" (2009) {Funsize: Episode 17 (#3.17)}
plot: Mr and Mrs Strawberry are watching the sunset... until gooseberry ruins it, Fishing Finger is diving in the kitchen sink and comes face to face with danger and the manic mopping lemons are clumsily cleaning up. Daring, dainty meringue attempts diving with disastrous results, Dr Rhu-barb is chased by his arch enemy trying to 'extermi-grate' him, and Fearless Pete Parsnip impresses the judges with this performing dog trick in the Ooglies talent show.

title: "Obsessed" (2009) {Russ/Karen (#1.4)}
plot: Russ is an extreme hoarder. He has completely filled up his apartment, forcing him to sleep outside. He's also afraid that the Fire Department will come to his house and he won't be able to clean enough in time to pass inspection. If this happens, Russ fears he'll become homeless. Meanwhile, Karen is plagued by her obsessive thoughts about death.

title: "Oceanquest" (1985)
plot: An adventurer-filmmaker-diver recruits a former Miss Universe to travel with him to explore the wonder and terror of the world's oceans. A classic pseudo-documentary, with scenes shot live on location and which (according to the opening narration) "for purposes of dramatic clarity, some scenes have been re-created and the order of events rearranged."

title: "Odd Man Out" (1977) {Ooh La La (#1.7)}
plot: Neville has started to learn French and feels that the company should start exporting their products to the continent. Dorothy and Neville travel to Paris. Things start off badly when the hotel puts them in the same room, and there are no spare rooms. When they go to dinner with a French trade minister, the alcohol flows freely.

title: "Oddities" (2010) {Love Stones (#2.10)}
plot: At Obscura Antiques and Oddities Mike's wife recruits Evan and Ryan to locate the perfect birthday gift for Mike. Later Mike has an eye-popping surprise when he finds a plasticized human organ, and actress Chloe Sevigny springs for a lewd old time gag.

title: "Odyssey: Driving Around the World" (2007) {The Outback (#1.6)}
plot: The cars and the crew meet up in Brisbane, Australia to start the second leg of the expedition. After strict quarantine they head north up the beautiful Gold Coast and pop into the Australian Zoo to meet some wild friends and then continue North to Cairns for a scuba adventure on the Great Barrier Reef. It's not long before they reach the north where they venture out into the jungles to meet with Dr. Hughes Spencer, the real Batman. They discover his affinity for bats, big ones that love people!!! They soon head deep into the Outback where they stumble across a rodeo. Chanda and Nancy decide to sell their Red Bull sponsored energy drink with cheap vodka to the local cowhands as a fund-raiser. Finally something pops up, Uluru. The team meets with a local aborigine tribal leader and gets a rare glimpse of the Mutijula reservation. Then its West along the infamous "Gun Barrel Highway". Known as one of the most grueling and remote roads on earth, the team has over 1500 kilometers of unpaved road to cross before reaching Perth. Camels, storms and aviation gas are just some of the encounters before driving onto a ship bound for Singapore.

title: "Off the Grid with Jesse Ventura" (2014) {Big Media Blindspot: BP Spills Again?! (#1.47)}
plot: Wait a second...did BP spill again? BP -- as in British Petroleum -- as in the same company responsible for the biggest oil spill in world history in the Gulf of Mexico back in 2010? In this Big Media Blindspot, the Governor uncovers a spill right here in Lake Michigan. But that's not all: guess what our money-hungry government just approved...more leases for BP in the Gulf! Has BP paid their dues?

title: "Off the Grid with Jesse Ventura" (2014) {The People Respond to Police Brutality (#1.102)}
plot: First up, Jesse Ventura's "On the Grid" crew covers a Los Angeles vigil for Michael Brown, Ezell Ford, John Crawford, Eric Garner, and all victims of police brutality. Then, the Governor takes on questions and comments from vigilant viewers in a special edition of #AskJesse.

title: "Off2Kali Comedy" (2012) {Audition Day (#1.8)}
plot: If there's one thing that Off2Kali's Richard Young and Huse Madhavji love just as much as making you laugh, it's working together. And you'll see that camaraderie when the flashy entertainment show "Media Entertainment Show" interviews them. That is, until they find out they're auditioning for the same part. Then the actors turn into "actors"...

title: "Oh Baby" (1998) {Dot Coms Are Human Too (#2.22)}
plot: After pressing Brent for a lesson on how to use the company's computer system, Tracy discovers that trustmom.com has its first success with a popular new crib. However, her joy is short-lived after some angry letters reveal that their customer's orders are not being filled. Meanwhile, as Brad ponders a new name to go along with his sex change, Tracy receives an invitation to the wedding of her ex-boyfriend, Rick. In an effort to appease the disgruntled crib buyers, Tracy turns to Nikky for help but gets nowhere. And Tracy's plea to treat their customers like people and not just numbers continues to fall on deaf ears after Brad points out that she doesn't even know the name, only the number, of the man who fathered her child. And when Tracy takes it upon herself to resolve the problem with the distributor, she finds that their automated phone system isn't going to make things easy. Meanwhile, Celia refuses to let Tracy forget the missed opportunity with Rick. When her co-workers fail to resolve the problem, a determined Tracy tracks down the crib distributor's warehouse. Despite some resistance from its staff, she manages to get the cribs shipped at once. Finally, in the wake of Tracy's efforts, the company gets some good publicity care of some very satisfied customers. So, in an effort to do something nice for Tracy, Brent uses his computer skills to track down the name of her sperm donor.

title: "Oh Yeah! Cartoons" (1998) {Pete Patrick Private Investigator}
plot: Kenny befriends Nadya and saves her from the drags of being the new kid in school. Edward and Emo overhear their parents discussing having another baby. Peter Patrick and his sidekick, Persian Puss respond to the case of the pooch kidnapping.

title: "Old Dogs & New Tricks" (2011) {Last Gasps (#2.10)}
plot: Season Finale. Muscles goes to great lengths to interest Bobby (special guest star Thom Bierdz); Rod Rodriquez (Zay Rique) returns to test Brad's new resolution; Ross and Neal come to a crossroads; Nathan breaks in a new shrink (special guest star Terri Garber), then has an explosive confrontation with a drunken Damian.

title: "Omnibus" (1967) {Eve Arnold in Retrospect (#33.21)}
plot: A documentary about Eve Arnold covering her life, her works, encounters and relationships with the different people she has photographed around the world as a photojournalist.

title: "On Mission Xtra" (2009) {Hollywood (#1.4)}
plot: Can God actually use film to infiltrate the mainstream with His Truth? Movies are great outreach opportunities, as we hear from Christian film lovers like Bob Waliszewski from Plugged-In Online. The folks from Sherwood Baptist Church (Facing the Giants and Fireproof) and Missionary Victorya Rogers tell us what it's like to be a part of the Hollywood mission field and what part you can play to influence film content.

title: "On Story" (2011) {The Evolution of Funny: TV Comedy with Larry Wilmore (#3.8)}
plot: Larry Wilmore, the Senior Black Correspondent on The Daily Show and creator of The Bernie Mac Show reflects upon different forms of comedy, his own comic influences, and always looking to maximize comedic potential. Followed by two short films about courage and endurance: Chris Bourke and Kevin Harger's LOVE, EMILY, shadowing young love and how to best navigate its awkward terrain, and Andrea Gomez's 036, measuring the fortitude and grit required to survive the paper-pushing, no-nonsense depths of cubicle number 036.

title: "On the Buses" (1969) {Safety First (#4.10)}
plot: After Stan has had to apply the brakes quickly,causing a big woman passenger to fall on top of him, Blakey devises a new exit and entry system for the buses to leave and return to the depot. Unfortunately Stan forgets this and crashes into Blakey's office. The inspector feels Stan should be fired but union rep Jack points out that he was only following Blakey's orders.

title: "On the Lot" (2007) {14 Directors Compete (#1.6)}
plot: One director is eliminated from the competition. Contestants showcase personal submission films. Director David Frankel (The Devil Wears Prada) appears as a guest judge. Films screened: "Polished" by Andrew Hunt, "Love at First Shot" by David May, "Edge on the End" by Kenny Luby, "Dance with the Devil" by Marty Martin, and "Beeline" by Shira-Lee Shalit.

title: "On the Spot" (2011)
plot: On each episode, Schwartz asks people questions from three different subjects. The subjects include: geography, science, history, math, health, sports, the arts, and many more. Participants of On the Spot do not win prizes or have their answers tallied. The show is similar in format to that of the The Tonight Show's, "Jaywalking" segment and the show Street Smarts. After each question is asked to a number of participants, the correct answer is given along with an explanation.

title: "On the Waterfront" (1988) {(#3.6)}
plot: Magician David Copperpot flies over the Mercy river without the aid of any naughty camera trickery. Very Good Car saves the world from a giant baby chick. Kate Copsick is Rowland Bacon in a hairy mystery. The Flashing Bladess is forced to become an android during the absence of The Flashing Blade. Andy talks about the cliffhangers of "Dallas". Also the return of the Unprofessionals.

title: "Once Upon a Time" (2011) {Quite a Common Fairy (#3.3)}
plot: As the search for Henry continues, Hook suggests tracking down Tinker Bell in the hope that she will lead them to Peter Pan's camp, while Neal devises a plan in order to get to Emma. Meanwhile, back in fairy tale land, Tinker Bell offers to help improve Regina's life.

title: "One Big Family" (1986)
plot: Set in Seattle, retired comedian Jake Hatton is happy living a quiet retirement. His nephew, Don, is a cop and has just gotten married to Jan. When his parents died, he became ward to his four brothers and sisters. Finding themselves up to their necks in raising the kids, Jake comes in to lend a hand and teach them valuable lessons.

title: "One Foot in the Grave" (1990) {Hole in the Sky (#5.5)}
plot: Pippa organizes a meal in a restaurant for Victor and Patrick to get them to be friends but the management assume they are a couple and have a violinist serenade them. The McKendrick twins are doing a loft conversion for the Meldrews and one is a tireless practical joker,to Margaret's annoyance. Then an old lady passer-by shouts abuse at them for shoddy work and Patrick assumes Victor is holding a drugs party. This is all too much for Margaret,who has just lost her job and fears she may turn into a grumpy female version of her husband.

title: "One Life to Live" (1968) {(#1.11103)}
plot: James reveals to Starr that he overheard her profess her love to Cole. Shane is surprised to receive a letter from one of the best art school in England offering him a full scholarship based on his portfolio. Gigi tells Shane that she submitted his comic book work to the school when he was being bullied at school. Rex and Gigi decide to move to England with Shane. Destiny visits Bo after her doctor appointment with Vivian and is surprised to see Matthew there. Neela tries to apologize to Jack but he doesn't want to hear it. Rick tracks down Starr to tell her that he has big news.

title: "One Night Stand" (2010/II)
plot: In every programme Jennifer Maguire descends on a different town around the country and hosts a Facebook flash mob date for three best friends.

title: "One Step Beyond" (1959) {The Justice Tree (#2.16)}
plot: Convicted killer Calvin Gannis is being escorted to this place of execution but escapes after a road accident, finding himself in a ghost town, seemingly inhabited by only the widowed Sally and her young son Joey. However, an oak tree which has been dead for decades suddenly starts to grow again, spelling out justice for Gannis.

title: "One Tree Hill" (2003) {Cryin' Won't Help You Now (#5.16)}
plot: Lucas confronts Dan's announcement about his life expectancy of only 6 months without a heart transplant. He calls Dan a liar until the cardiologist confirms it. Nathan wrestles with his feelings, and Jamie's burning desire to get acquainted with his 'cool' grandfather, while Dan begs for a last chance to repair his shattered family. Nathan and Jamie come up with a daring alternative for the injured Ravens. Mouth suddenly gets a triple break as sports presenter.

title: "One Tree Hill" (2003) {Messin' with the Kid (#6.7)}
plot: Nathan is happy again now that he's playing and actually staring in slamball. So he reminds Haley that she's also supposed to have another go at her dream career - music. Jamie is bullied because of his 'childish' cape by Chuck Scolnik, the biggest kid in his playground. Haley's attempt to reason with his mother only leads to a cat-fight. Superdad finds a way to convince the whole class capes are almost as super-cool as he. Peyton's moving into Lucas' parental home starts confrontations when accused of taking over his space, leading to a weird divided house war. Mouth is welcomed back with his old promotion offer, plus an extra: intern - his ex Gigi, who now finds him sexually irresistible.

title: "One Tree Hill" (2003) {The Worst Day Since Yesterday (#3.8)}
plot: After Lucas surprised Chris with Brooke, even her self-confidence isn't enough to remain assured she hasn't really lost the possible love of her life.
