He learns a great deal about the nanotechnology and why he seems to have these superhuman powers. Miles, Rachel and Charlie also make their way out of Willoughby trying to catch up to Aaron. Rachel feels guilty at having left her father behind. A dying Dr. Horn is in pursuit. Traveling on the train with Roger Allenford, Tom Neville is shocked to see someone from his past.

title: "Rhoda" (1974) {A Touch of Classy (#3.12)}
plot: Sally is staying temporarily with Rhoda while work is being done on her own apartment. During this stay, Sally receives a visit at Rhoda's from her airline pilot ex-husband, Lloyd Zimmer, the two who got divorced because of his philandering despite the fact that Sally sees him as a descent guy otherwise. Lloyd, who philandered in part to overcome his insecurity of being short, comes bearing news: he is getting remarried, and he wants Sally's blessing... to reduce his alimony to her on fiancée Cissy's wants. In discussing the issue with Rhoda and Brenda, Sally has mixed emotions about the situation. She can screw Lloyd by not giving in to his request. But if she does agree, she will never have to deal with Lloyd ever again. Sally decides what she is going to do, but, as a gesture, decides to have a dinner with Lloyd and Cissy together. After meeting Cissy, Sally changes her mind about what she is going to do, which affects Lloyd in more ways than one.

title: "Rhoda" (1974) {Not Made for Each Other (#1.18)}
plot: Timid Myrna Morgenstein, Rhoda's high school classmate with who she recently reconnected at Rhoda's bridal shower, stops by for an unexpected visit in order to break out of her mousy shell. Beyond Myrna's job as a high school English teacher, she has been unsuccessful in life and love. Wanting to provide whatever little assistance she can to Myrna in this new direction she is trying to forge, Rhoda decides to invite Myrna to a small dinner party, which will also include at Joe's behest his best friend, Charlie, although both Charlie and Myrna being there does not make it officially a "set-up" between the two. But Myrna's take charge attitude in eking out this new life for herself has some unintended consequences at the party, the resulting issues which both Rhoda and Joe will have to try and rectify.

title: "Rich Bride, Poor Bride" (2006) {Image Is Everything (#3.4)}
plot: Role reversal doesn't get any more reversed than it does with Christine and Owen. He has various options for his big day designed on paper right down to the color of the bridesmaid's dresses. An event designer by trade, this wedding is more than love and nuptials for Owen, it's his business showcase. He won't stand for a hair out of place and has little tolerance for the creative input of others including his bride Christine. This should make for an interesting dynamic with Wedding Planner Karina Lemke, who is also a designer. Will they clash or come together to create the event wedding of a lifetime?

title: "Rich and Reckless" (2008) {Pilot (#1.1)}
plot: "MUSCLE BOUND" - Extortion is the exercise by the owner at a Miami gym. One of the clients were brought into their extortion scheme to obtain as much money as possible from a few targets. When that client states they didn't sign up for all of this, the client and his wife are kidnapped when he threatens to call the police. This episode goes through twists such as fake deaths, real murders, guns, and high speed chases.

title: "Richard Hammond's Miracles of Nature" (2012) {Super-Bodies (#1.1)}
plot: In episode one, Richard discovers how the Cape vulture has inspired a flying submarine; how a giraffe's neck can stop a jet pilot losing consciousness; how a woodpecker's skull can safely protect a light bulb dropped from space; and how a South American butterfly holds the secret to making any mobile phone waterproof.

title: "Rick and Morty" (2013) {(#3.6)}
plot: Rick makes an appearance in hit UK serial drama Emmerdale and kicks the shit out of Kasim. Meanwhile, Jerry becomes accidentally engaged to Chrissie White and Beth is not happy, while Morty and Summer become involved in a drug ring run by Ross Barton.

title: "Rikets tilstand" (1999)
plot: The closest thing Norwegian television-viewers have to the American show "60 minutes". With some of the most respected (and feared) investigative and criminal reporters in Norway it has revealed everything from corrupt politicians to more warmer stories suchs as the rare 2001-interview of the former drug-addicted sister of then prime-minister Jens Stoltenberg.

title: "Ring of Honor Wrestling" (2009) {Ring of Honor Best of 2009 (#1.40)}
plot: Matches include: The American Wolves (Davey Richards & Eddie Edwards) versus El Generico & Kevin Steen in a tables are legal match for the ROH World Tag Team Championships (Originally aired May 30, 2009), The Briscoes (Jay & Mark Briscoe), Brent Albright & Erick Stevens, El Generico & Kevin Steen, Kenny King & Rhett Titus, The American Wolves (Davey Richards & Eddie Edwards), The Dark City Fight Club (Jon Davis & Kory Chavis), The Embassy (Ernie Osiris & Jimmy Rave) and The Young Bucks (Matt & Nick Jackson) in a Honor Rumble (Originally aired October 5, 2009), The American Wolves (Davey Richards & Eddie Edwards) (c) (w/ Shane Hagadorn) versus The Young Bucks (Matt & Nick Jackson) for the ROH World Tag Team Championships (Originally aired November 23, 2009), Jerry Lynn (c), Austin Aries, Bryan Danielson & Tyler Black in a fatal four way match for the ROH World Championship (Originally aired June 6, 2009), Tyler Black versus Bryan Danielson (Originally aired July 25, 2009), and Roderick Strong versus Bryan Danielson (Originally aired November 16, 2009).

title: "Rinne no Lagrange" (2012) {Welcome to Kamogawa! (#1.1)}
plot: Madoka Kyono lives a busy life as the proud, and only, member of the Kamogawa Girls' High School Jersey Club, a school club dedicated to helping those in need. When a mysterious girl named Lan shows interest in joining the Jersey Club, Madoka is at first thrilled at the thought of having a new club member.

title: "Ripley's Believe It or Not!" (1999) {(#2.22)}
plot: A man accidentally shoots a nail into his head; A secret house 30 feet below the Las Vegas Strip; 1963: gyrocopter boat plane; A BASE jumper crashes into a waterfall; World's fastest artist; Bolivian villagers dig up the dead to retrieve skulls to keep them well; Yamakasi run through France; Nepal polo game using elephants instead of horses; The Ice Man attempts to stay in a meat locker for an hour at -35ºF; A man street skis at 60 mph; Condemned prisoner 'El Fusilado' is shot eight times, but survives; A patient receives a bionic arm after losing one to cancer; Clothing made from jewelry; A Southern California town moons an Amtrak train once a year; Necklace from New Guinea made from larvae.

title: "Ripper Street" (2012)
plot: A new drama set in the East End of London in 1889 during the aftermath of Jack The Ripper murders. The infamous H Division - the police precinct charged with keeping order in the district of Whitechapel- is in a chaotic state trying to keep order after a tumultuous time for London and reported infamously worldwide.

title: "Rise 'n Shine Og" (2009) {BFF (#1.4)}
plot: In order to get tickets to the Fraggle Rock Reunion Tour Og covers a shift for Beth at The Lunch Doctor where she meets her co-worker for the day the spasmodic, enthusiastic and possibly psychotic Brooklyn who is certain that she and Og are meant to be lifelong BFF's.

title: "Rising: Rebuilding Ground Zero" (2011) {Stories from the Pile (#1.3)}
plot: Steven Spielberg presents the National 9/11 museum, which will use physical remnants of the tragedy, including first response vehicles & the original steel footings of the towers 80 ft underground, to tell the story of America's darkest day.

title: "River City" (2002) {(#12.10)}
plot: Robbie and Will's plans for the future meet an unexpected roadblock, which leaves Will questioning his ability to foster. Can he convince himself, and others, that history will not repeat itself? Kirsty struggles to make amends and find her place in Shieldinch, and Dan and Tatiana are forced to see each other in a new light.

title: "River City" (2002) {(#8.16)}
plot: Wee Bob sets off confidently to get his fertility test results and decides not to bother Stella with it. But he is totally floored when Miriam reveals that he should prepare himself for the fact that he might never be a father. Stunned, Bob stumbles back out into a world that seems overrun with kids and tries to talk to Stella. He's frustrated when she can't spare a minute but agrees to meet her later at the garage. Jimmy and Stevie drop off a broken cab with Bob who is humiliated when Stevie saves him from harming himself with tow bar. When Stella turns up fussing over his nephew Callum, a heartbroken Bob can't face telling her the truth and throws himself into researching a solution. Determined to talk to Dr Miriam again, Bob makes another attempt to tell Stella at the Ship, only to find Stevie flirting with her which throws Bob into a fit of jealousy.

title: "River City" (2002) {(2010-09-28)}
plot: It's the day Amber and Lee are planning to leave Shieldinch and move to France but Amber's friends are increasingly worried about her well-being. They decide to stage an intervention. Jo and the community hatch a plan to keep Amber and Lee separate while they talk sense into her. But it goes awry when their genuine attempts to make Amber see Lee is no good for her come across as being patronising and bullying and Amber turns on them all - holding up a mirror to their behaviour. It seems their plan has failed - Lee and Amber head for a cab before departing for France.

title: "River Cottage: Gone Fishing!" (2007) {(#1.2)}
plot: Hugh visits the Hebrides in Scotland where he learns about how the sea and the food it provides have shaped life on the islands. He also sources shellfish and sustainable salmon, and takes over Skye's chippy with only eco-friendly fish he has caught himself.

title: "River" (2015) {(#1.3)}
plot: Having received his psychiatric report River discovers that Stevie had a second phone. It reveals calls from the ex-convict brother she helped put away Jimmy, but he had an alibi for the time of her death. However there is evidence to suggest she led a somewhat risqué double life and River's partner Ira is perturbed that River is keeping facts from Chrissie. The latest manifestation is Jordy Merton, a site foreman who died in suspicious circumstances and whose wife River spares from learning about his secret. The more menacing manifestation of Cream, however, starts to appear more frequently.

title: "Rizzoli & Isles" (2010) {Burning Down the House (#2.15)}
plot: Jane and Maura investigate a warehouse fire in which a fireman, Craig Hill, was killed. Maura finds that the fire likely started from a heater that had been tampered with. The building was a denim factory and the owner, Arnold Whistler, had a number of sexual harassment lawsuits filed against him. Meanwhile, Maura' and her mother Constance are the victims of a hit and run driver. Maura escapes with a few scrapes and bruises but Constance is seriously injured. When she finds her biological father, mobster Paddy Doyle, visiting her Jane begins to wonder if there's a connection. When they locate the car however, they find direct evidence to the warehouse fire leading the police to think that someone killed the fireman and then set out to eliminate Maura who must have come across some critical information.

title: "Rizzoli & Isles" (2010) {We Don't Need Another Hero (#2.1)}
plot: Three months have passed since Jane was shot and she hasn't yet recovered. There is a ceremony honoring her bravery and Maura convinces her to attend. The evening ends in tragedy when a U.S. Army Private, also being honored for an act of bravery while on a tour of duty in Afghanistan, is killed in a car bombing. Despite not being cleared for duty, Jane desperately wants to get in on the investigation. Meanwhile, Jane learns that her parents are getting a divorce. Jane renews her acquaintance with an old high school friend. After taking a bullet in the Season Finale during a siege of the precinct, Jane Rizzoli is honored as a hero at a public event. The celebration is short-lived, however, when disaster strikes. The ensuing case reunites Jane with an old high-school flame, Sgt. Major Casey Jones, who may be just the person she needs to heal her emotional scars.

title: "Road to Avonlea" (1990) {Another Point of View (#3.3)}
plot: Hetty is especially tough on the students in preparation for the history bee against Markdale School in two weeks. Hetty in general has always intimidated most of the students, who now complain to their parents, who in turn complain to Janet. Janet feels that only one person can deal with Hetty: Alec. When the parents elect Alec to the School Board, his first act is to speak openly to Hetty about her teaching methods. Hetty, feeling unwanted, promptly quits. Alec and the School Board did not want Hetty to quit (especially after thirty dreadful replacement teacher interviews), nor did Hetty really want to give up her job. But before things can go back to the way they were, Alistair Dimple waltzes into Avonlea, applying for the job. He dazzles the School Board, who hires him. The School Board is however unaware that he is not a professor as he professes, but a failed Shakespearean stage actor. Dingle ends up treating history class as one big all-participating stage play. The students are having a good time but nonetheless are learning with a new found curiosity. Dingle even eventually wins Hetty over. But when Alec finds out Dingle's real pedigree, he has to decide what to do with the information regardless of Dingle's positive effect on the children.

title: "Road to Avonlea" (1990) {The Disappearance (#4.11)}
plot: Based on a school assignment to write about one's next ten years, Sara worries about her future. With her trust keeping her financially secure, she is afraid that others will always take control of her life. She wants to prove that she can have a life of her own, her chosen profession being writing. She convinces her Aunt Olivia to allow her to assist in covering the local antique show for the newspaper, the featured attraction being famed expert antiques dealer Gerald McDougall Young. In reality, Gerald Young is Jonathan Ravenhurst Blackwell, nephew of business magnate Lady Edith Blackwell. Lady Blackwell wants her nephew to take control of the family business, but against his aunt's desires, Jonathan has a fascination with antiques, hence his need for this pseudonym unknown to his aunt. Complications ensue for Jonathan/Gerald when Lady Blackwell comes to Avonlea to look for her nephew, who goes into hiding upon her arrival. When evidence is found of Jonathan having been in Mr. Young's hotel room, the authorities and some of the townsfolk believe that Gerald Young is a fraud and that he may have abducted Jonathan. Thus Sara's story becomes one from covering the antique show to solving the mysterious connection between Gerald McDougall Young and Jonathan Ravenhurst Blackwell. While Hetty presses Sara to take more interest in her finances, a wealthy young man named Jonathan Ravenhurst Blackwell breezes into town to get away from his overbearing Aunt Edith. Posing as antiques appraiser Gerald McDougal Young, he soon creates a ruckus amongst the townspeople, and foul play is suspected when he disappears.

title: "Roadtrip Nation" (2004) {(#5.2)}
plot: Fashion designers Juliana, Angela and Roweena Foong offer a unique perspective to Kay, who struggles with family expectations as the child of immigrants. The Roadtrip Nation team meets with professional surfer Layne Beachley, and member of the Stolen Generation Vicky Elwood.

title: "Roadtrip Nation" (2004) {Make It Your Own (#12.6)}
plot: The road-trippers try their hand at spinning molten glass with glassblower Jessica Schimpf. The world isn't looking for you, she says, you have to go out and find it--she left a big-time welding gig to follow her dreams. In Texas, the team interviews Austonites on the street and goes for beignets and palm readings in New Orleans before hitting crowd-powered T-shirt purveyor Threadless in Chicago.

title: "Robert Earl's Be My Guest" (2014) {Buffet Bonanza (#1.2)}
plot: Robert Earl takes us to his favorite buffets and shows us how to select only the best items while leaving out the filler. Favorite buffets include Caesars Palace, the five regions of France at Le Village Buffett at the Paris Hotel, and a breakfast you will never forget at The Rio. He'll also share his spot on where he gets the best cupcakes.

title: "Robert Montgomery Presents" (1950) {No Visible Means (#5.16)}
plot: Tom, a smooth talking gigolo, makes the rounds through the speakeasies of 1920s New York. He's loved by Veronia, a woman with a lot of money, but he loses interest when he meets Iris. She presents herself as a person of society on the verge of big film career. Wedding plans quickly follow, until their lies catch up with both of them.

title: "Robin Hood" (2006) {A Dangerous Deal (#3.9)}
plot: Gisborne awaits his execution in a Nottingham dungeon, and meets a fellow prisoner who has a profound effect upon him. Robin thinks he can strike a deal with Sheriff Isabella, but his plans are thwarted when an unexpected stranger from her past arrives, looking for revenge.

title: "Robin's Nest" (1977) {The Bistro Kids (#1.2)}
plot: The day of the restaurant opening arrives and Robin and Vicky are frantic with all the things they need to remember to organize a successful opening. James continues to put pressure on the couple over the day to day functions of the restaurant as well as the status of their relationship

title: "Robot Chicken" (2005) {The Munnery (#2.12)}
plot: The Navy's new recruitment ad. General Zod gets his own exercise show. "There's No Place Like Home" doesn't work out quite right for Dorothy. "Cork" is America's first mentally challenged crime sleuth. Kraken is finally released, and finds it hard to start a new life. "Weasel Stomping Day" is celebrated, with music by Weird Al. Young Kevin makes a wish on a star that comes true, and he tells all his buddies so they can have their wishes granted too. A power shortage causes a crisis for the Enterprise crew, and they have to resort to cannibalism.

title: "Robson Arms" (2005) {Hairpiece of Mind (#1.7)}
plot: Sault, a recent transplant to Vancouver from Toronto, is feeling a little alienated in her new surroundings, both within the city and within the building. Stanley, her next door neighbor, complained to the super that her cigarette smoke is traveling unwanted through the vents. Despite that, Stanley's partner, Geoff, invites Sault over for dinner as a gesture of kindness. Sault's abrasive personality grates on Stanley, but Geoff continues to maintain a friendship with her. This is strengthened when Geoff mistakenly assumes that Sault, like him, is a cancer victim, while in reality she suffers from alopecia. She doesn't correct him since she figures this misunderstanding will strengthen the bond with her one and only friend in Vancouver. He continues to support her in any way he can with her supposed cancer, which gets her deeper and deeper into the lie. But she also sees the mileage she can get out of being a cancer victim in other aspects of her life, that is until Geoff finds out the truth. Sault realizes that it may not be the surroundings that are the problem but rather her.

title: "Rock Center with Brian Williams" (2011) {Cry for Help/Recovery in Boston/Stuck in the Middle with You/Over a Barrel (#2.29)}
plot: "Cry for Help" examines whether orders of protection do enough to shield victims of domestic violence. "Recovery in Boston" goes to Boston to look at recovery efforts in the wake of the Boston Marathon bombing. "Stuck in the Middle with You" looks at the family staying together after a transgender surgery. "Over a Barrel" investigates how oil exploration threatens Ecuador's Amazon Rain Forest.

title: "Rock-Star Cafe" (2012) {Shopped! (#1.2)}
plot: Rhonda and Lilly advise Sam to take necessary action after the restaurant fails a secret shop. As usual the team of servers in uncooperative, however with a final push from Avery, the group begins to make necessary changes. Tyler, remains uncooperative. Will Tyler step up and save the restaurant?

title: "Rocket Power" (1999) {The Night Before/Violet's Violet (#1.13)}
plot: Otto, Sam And Twister Agree To Sneak Out With Eddie, Prince Of The Netherworld, For Mischief Night.The Kids Think Nothing Of Accidentally Destroying Violet's Flower Garden, Until Merv Explains That They've Ruined Her Chances Of Taking First Prize.

title: "Rodeo Kaupoai" (2005) {(#2.3)}
plot: It's another scorcher in the far North as we dive straight into the action in day two of the Oruru Rodeo. Cory bounces back from yesterdays' lack luster performance in a big way. It's baptism by fire when a new cowboy tussles with a bull and gets burnt. Teenage star Hona looks to miss out on his ride after failing to register for the Oruru rodeo.

title: "Rolie Polie Olie" (1998) {The Best Doggone Show in the World (#1.12)}
plot: When Telly gets a little under the weather the Polie's can't watch their favourite variety show. Olie, however decides that the show must go on! With Zowie and Pappy's help, they put on their own show, entertaining Mom, Dad, and the furniture with everything from a Lion Taming act to as South Sea musical revue.

title: "Rollergirls" (2006) {The Rookie (#1.1)}
plot: In her first bout, rookie Venis Envy faces all her fears - wanting to impress her mother, performing well for her team, and rising to the formidable challenge of her track rival and idol, superstar Jammer Lux. As the sisterhood begins to unravel from the inside, can Venis bring them back together?

title: "Rome" (2005) {Stealing from Saturn (#1.4)}
plot: Atia and her family have stayed behind when Pompey and others fled and she now throws a party for her triumphant uncle, Julius Caesar. She clearly has her sights set on the great leader and is puzzled when he sends her a guest list that includes Servilia of the Junii. She soon finds out why. Pompey wants to find out what happened to the gold from the Roman Treasury and sends his son Quintus to Rome to find out what happened. They go directly to Vorenus' home but he has no idea what they are talking about. Pullo arrives however and Vorenus tells him to go directly to Caesar himself and explain. Octavian meanwhile learns of one of his uncle's secrets. Atia throws a party to honor Caesar after he takes control of Rome. There, Caesar asks for auguries to be taken, and Octavian learns about a serious intestinal medical ailment that Caesar has been hiding, as well as his tryst with Servilia. Meanwhile, Quintus Pompey's mission to retrieve stolen gold does not go well when he and his men target Vorenus, who rejects an offer by Mark Antony to return to active duty. Vorenus throws a feast to kick off his new career as a civilian businessman, where Niobe's sister makes a scene. Pullo's good fortune runs out when Vorenus learns of his thievery of the stolen gold. Pullo captures Quintus and delivers him to Caesar, who lets him go with a message and offer of truce to Pompey, knowing he will not accept it.

title: "Rookie Blue" (2010) {Might Have Been (#2.2)}
plot: Everyone's living their "might-have-beens". Andy and Gail go undercover as cocktail waitresses to clean up a drug infested club, but get more than they bargained for when their fellow waitress turns out to be the girlfriend of a vicious criminal. Traci wrestles with feelings for her old flame Jerry; Dov and Chris are at odds when a complaint is made against Dov; and Andy opens up about her commitment to Luke

title: "Room 222" (1969) {Mr. Bomberg (#2.16)}
plot: Walt Whitman welcomes a new civics teacher, Mr. Bomberg, whose previous experience teaching was in New York and New Jersey. Bomberg's approach to teaching civics, however, is to use shouting, insults, and physical isolation of students who aren't prepared for the day's lesson. When this leads most of his class to request a transfer en masse, a parents' committee demands that he be replaced. But Bomberg has a surprise defender -- soft-spoken Pete Dixon, whose own teaching methods are diametrically the opposite of Bomberg's approach.

title: "Roomies" (2010) {Zona de Turbulencia (#2.8)}
plot: Omar comes back. And the gang gets together to greet their friend. Héctor finally faces his past and present, when Miriam and Tania meet. Meanwhile, a dark figure from Mafer's past comes back to haunt the young group.

title: "Rosamunde Pilcher" (1993) {Die Liebe ihres Lebens (#1.60)}
plot: Marian Simmons inherits a house in Cornwall from her mother Heather. There she discovers Heather's love letters to an unknown man and she falls in love with a noble man who makes musical instruments. But the discovery of the man her mother loved' identity will give the situation an unexpected twist. Beautiful views of British countryside, Salisbury, Dorchester and Stonehenge.

title: "Roseanne" (1988) {Altar Egos (#6.25)}
plot: Fred is unsettled by the fact that Jackie turns to Dan, and not him, when she needs help from a man. Upset, convinced that Jackie has feeling for Dan, and half-drunk, Fred confronts Dan, takes a swing at him, and tells Jackie that maybe they shouldn't get married, but offers no explanation. Dan tells Roseanne, who tells Jackie what is really troubling Fred, and they both have a good laugh at the idea. Clearing the air paves the way for Fred and Jackie's wedding.

title: "Roseanne" (1988) {Punch and Jimmy (#7.8)}
plot: Roseanne and Jackie go to Chicago for Parent's Day, to surprise Darlene, and in hopes of meeting her new boyfriend, Jimmy. David wants to learn how to be tough, in order to compete with Darlene's boyfriend, who is a boxer, for her affections. Roseanne assigns Dan to help David feel good about just being himself. D.J. is getting picked on at school by a bully, but refuses to learn to fight back for fear that getting hit will hurt. Fred is impressed with Dan's parenting, until he figures out that Dan is only doing what Roseanne tells him to.

title: "Rosemary & Thyme" (2003) {The Language of Flowers (#1.3)}
plot: The Caldecott family is turning their estate into a health spa. Rosemary and Laura are asked to restore the decayed grand water cascade of their once famous garden. When the ill-tempered matron of the family is murdered, Laura and Rosemary attempt to expose the killer by reading clues left in the flower garden by its long dead creator.

title: "Rosie" (1977) {Woman Pressure (#1.1)}
plot: PC Michael Penrose,nicknamed to his embarrassment Rosie,returns to his native town,the resort of Ravensbay,when he learns that his exotic,pretentious mother Millie is dying. In fact it is a ruse to get him home where Millie and her sister Ida dominate Rosie and hen-pecked uncle Norman. Further woman pressure comes from girlfriend Gillian,anxious to get him to the altar. After a pointless visit from short-sighted informant Merv,Rosie goes to work and,along with slovenly colleague PC Wilmot,is called to a pub disturbance. Here they finally subdue an aggressive drunk after learning that he too is under woman pressure.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Abschied mit Sprengkraft (#1.1777)}
plot: Tine prepares to leave Lüneburg now. Lisa confesses her she smuggled rare earths for Malte. In return Malte makes a trainer confess to prevent Lisa for doping accusations. Inge is back; she doesn't want to live in the house Udo bought. She wants to live in the farm. Erika tells Ariane Hannes is afraid to be left alone and Hannes is disappointed because Ariane stopped designing shoes. Ariane and Hannes make it up with each other. Petrov buys stuff from Radsport Wolff. Britta gives prices for the godfather-ship of the children's hospital. A certificate is for the married couple Flickenschild although Gunter Flickenschild and Merle Vanlohen are not married. Merle runs away. Carla takes an advocate. Britta spontaneous asks people she doesn't know for dinner at her home. Ole drives away with Tine to Denmark. Tine accidentally drops her cell phone in the car. When Ole grabs it, he discovers there is a bomb in the car. Petrov hits Malte down.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Besuch im Gefängnis (#1.2085)}
plot: Gesine leaves Thomas who doesn't explain his mental block. He tells Gunter that feelings for Aylin stood in the way. Gunter advices him to explain it Gesine. Thomas finds her in the hotel lobby and tells her about Aylin, his beloved wife who passed away earlier this year. They agree to meet each other after half a year. Edda is surprised to find the family dinner in Merle's flower store. Henri interrupts the talk between Volker and Arthur because he doesn't want Volker to investigate in the case of his father and Nora. Nora and Arthur conclude it was a wonderful dinner. Nora seeks finance for her school theater project. Arthur has the idea to leave the stages and have your theater play in public wherever there is place: Merle's store, Gunter's estate. Volker and Henri visit their grumbling father Stefan in jail. Stefan wants to know everything from Henri. Volker tells Merle that Stefan was happy to see Henri. Henri tells Edda that his father Stefan is like a stranger for him. Volker and Henri get a quarrel about Stefan. Toni invites Eliane to a film night in Ben's shed to seek out a film for his wife Carla. Ben lends him his shed and a movie projector for his date. Toni manages it to be alone there with Eliane but he didn't count on Eliane who invited Isabelle. Isabelle tells Eliane she thinks that Torben wanted to be alone with her. Ben is mad when he discovers Toni's intention. Toni informs Torben he is in love with Eliane and intents to stay in Lüneburg. Carla is tired after working extra in her restaurant. Only Isabelle is a qualified candidate to help but she has a negative past in relation to Gunter and she is overqualified. Merle visits her the next day in the restaurant kitchen. Merle tells Gunter about Carla's personal shortage and the application of the doubtful Isabelle. Gunter tells Carla that he thinks she should give Isabelle a try. Carla hires her on probe.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Der Brief (#1.2360)}
plot: Erika thinks Hannes is not physical ready for a rock tour. He visits the doctor for a medical check-up. The result is positive. He goes ten weeks on tour; rock on Hannes. Sandra gets a big hand for her zither play on the Burgenland-evening. Thomas has an eye on her and on Johanna's advice makes a date with Sandra. But when he is together with her in Carlas, Gunter shows up. The concert brings Theo enough profit to indemnify for the insurance fraud. But the next invoice for the rock band is for his account. He sees the final curtain drawn when he also has to pay 50,000 Euro taxes within ten days. Eliane doubts to move to Mathis. Holger has breakfast with Sydney. Simone makes her clear that he tries to intercept a letter. Holger fetches Sydney's mail in hotel "Drei Könige" to discover that Simone tricked him. Sydney discovers Holger's lies when he has to confess them. Mathis means she has to trust Holger when she really loves him. The reopening of Merle's garden store. Merle is annoyed because of Simone's plan for a Simone Falkenstein memorial park right next to her store.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Der neue Ben (#1.1184)}
plot: Hope rises for Katja and Philipp but Achim doubts a good outcome of the lawsuit. Alfred thinks he has big business success but Laszlo puts a stopper on it. Merle's chat partner turns out to be her ex. Britta is proud when Ben has a new job.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Die brasilianische Party (#1.2060)}
plot: Theo, Edda and Henri agree to go on as before. Theo meets Henri and Edda in the park on Henri-day and kisses Edda. Henri suggests Edda to go to Hamburg but Edda wants to go to Thomas' party. Edda daydreams about a duel between both guys, that ends deadly for both of them. When they want to start an harmless duel in reality she tells them to quit or else she doesn't want to be with neither of them. Constanze Münzberg informs Isabelle about the crooked situation of her hotel. Gunter tells Merle about it. She knows from Jana (Greve) that Münzberg didn't pay bills the last half year. Gunter talks with Udo about it. He has to withdraw his support for Isabelle as candidate president of the Ancient Listed Hotels of the World. Udo knows someone who could become a new candidate. Constanze visits Gunter in his office. Gunter tries to make her clear that member hotels will be damaged by the way the Münzbergers fulfill their presidency. He has decided to candidate himself. Thomas invites people to his Brazilian party. German/Brazilian Eliane is prepared to help him preparing the party. Gunter and Analena show up late during the party. Isabelle reveals to Merle that Volker always knows how to hide something for other. Isabelle notices that Gunter is not in the mood because of Constanze. Gunter has to go early because of an heating problem in his hotel. Thomas thinks he leaves on purpose. Merle waits for Volker in his hotel suite. She finds his selling contract with a firm in Berlin instead of in Düsseldorf and addresses this to him. Isabelle hears from her mother that Gunter candidates also. She thinks she hasn't any chance now. But Constanze wants her to keep Gunter busy while she influences the other hoteliers. Britta talks with Ben about Volker as the new administrative manager. Ben promises her to support her. Nora finds an old note and a key in the kiosk probably from Lasse's dad. The key fits on an old locker in the back-room and in it she finds documents from last century.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Erneutes Plagiat (#1.2038)}
plot: Volker confesses Merle he can't stand loosing. That made him angry but is also a motivator for his career. They talk about their brothers. Inge and Erika notice that Merle looks like she is in love. With Volker? Volker tries to relax but it doesn't work. Simone asks him again to work for her. He does and ignores what Merle told him. Merle discovers it and thinks Volker wants revenge on Thomas this way. Theo is finally convinced to help but he does it for Carla not for Henri. He informs Edda he will come later. Nora and Edda go with Lasse to Carlas for the Galloway-special. Edda asks Henri to tell Theo she will wait for him. Edda asks Theo to write another poem. Henri talks with Eliane about Edda. She thinks Henri should do more to get Edda. Carla and Torben wake up in the wild. Carla feels excellent. When Carla is finally back she thanks Theo and Henri for saving her restaurant. Theo asks Henri to write another poem for Edda but Henri doesn't want to do that for him. Torben and Carla talk about Theo who has his good and bad sides. Henri catches Theo who vainly tries to write a poem. Henri says he would be better off with a poem from the Internet. He meets Edda. She recites a beautiful poem and Theo asserts that he wrote it. Analena doesn't want to make the hotel booking undone because it is a matter of honor for her. Eliane is sad because mother now hasn't money to do nice things together with her. Analena decides to sleep in the hotel and leaves. The next day: Analena notices Inge is again too late in the laundry service and tells Eliane that Inge lacks respect. But Eliane tolerates it. Gunter sees Analena in the hotel and asks her if she is satisfied with the hotel service. He looks very pleased to talk with her. Carla makes him clear that she is Eliane's mother and spend all her money on the hotel suite. Simone talks on the phone about her Bangladesh-business until Ben comes in. Ben fetches a parcel for him in the kiosk and Lasse asks him to bring Simone her parcel. Nora thinks that is against mail privacy and discusses that with Lasse. Ben discovers that the municipal official has been bribed by Simone. He tells it Merle and Eliane. He opens her parcel from Bangladesh and finds inside a belt with the label "Made proudly with love in Germany". Simone discovers that she and Ben accidentally switched their cell phones. Ben addresses the fraud and bribe to Simone. Simone undresses herself in front of him. Nora tells Lasse enthusiastic about the literature festival she organizes. Lasse only listens and leaves. In the kiosk he presents her his idea of audio-books. She makes him clear that she becomes insecure when he doesn't say anything.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Großvater wider Willen (#1.1862)}
plot: It seems OK for Britta that Ben and Eliane are together. Eliane wants to go with Ben to a concert in Hamburg but Ben fell asleep. She wants to take food out of the supermarket container. Hannes helps her but he says it is formally a disturbance of domestic peace. They discover an old lady there who really needs the food. Hannes lends Jana 8000 Eur. as starting money for her shop. Nathalie tells Jana everything about her child. Sebastian already figures out his son Fabian must be the father of Nathalie's baby. Nathalie doesn't accept the stipend and starts looking for work which she can combine with child day care. She wants to raise her child alone. Jana doesn't think that that is a good idea. She and Sebastian quarrel about it. Hannes, Udo and Erika try to keep Inge from too risky investments. They want to take her with them to the trot course in Hamburg but she simulates a migraine. Aylin took a sabbatical. Gunter bought the hotel and golf course; Thomas is not amused. He offers Gunter 300.000 Eur. but Gunter laughs because he wants at least 500.000 more. Hannes helps Eliane illegally taking food out of the supermarket container. Nathalie wants to raise her child alone. Jana and Sebastian quarrel about that. Thomas offers Gunter 300.000 Eur. for hotel + golf course but Gunter wants far more.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Kindermädchen statt Verlobte? (#1.1921)}
plot: Sebastian hears noise Jana accidentally makes but he and Jeanette go on making love. Erika meets Jana on the street and notices Jana is in stress. Jana says she has to bring a passport to the airport immediately. Dirk did sign the solar park contract. He worries: Where is Jeanette? Sebastian and Jeanette have breakfast together. Jana tells Merle what she did hear and see in Sebastian's house. Her friend Karima will come to Germany. Theo asks Jeanette to meet each other in Carlas. As a trick Dirk is also there. They offer her their excuses. She says she was this night in the guest room of Torben. Jeanette and Theo talk about Frauke. Jeanette thinks her son is in love. Jana acts objective in the relation with Jeanette. She blocks Jeanette's business ideas. It escalates when Jeanette constantly comes with the theme Sebastian. Frauke asked Gunter for a clowns act in the hospital tonight. He asks his acting partner Merle. Justus and Erika have to organize the flower decoration of a wedding. Justus has to drive. He finds the perfect flowers for the wedding against a cheap prize. Eliane is back. She acts joyful but Aylin notices she is sad probably because of her broken relation with Ben. Ben is back from New York. He coughs. He brought his little daughter Lilly with him. Dirk calls him to let him know the solar park work is starting now. Who will care for Lilly? Udo and Inge advice Ben to ask Eliane but at first he hesitates. Finally he calls her. Frauke makes Eliane think he still misses her. Eliane visits Ben; he tells her he needs a babysitter for Lilly. She reacts disappointed. Frauke asks Theo after the money. She thinks he fetched black money from Swiss. He digs up another fake story about gambling with truckers but she doesn't really believe it and kisses him. The heating in the community house malfunctions. Frauke tells Eliane about her relation with Theo. Theo gives Frauke a cap. Aylin is busy preparing her speech. Thomas has much to do in the city hall. Will they have time for each other? Udo falls down with his bicycle in front of mayor Thomas. His bicycle is broken and he blames the mayor for the bad bicycle paths in his city. Aylin comforts Thomas. Erika explains Thomas the knitted shawl for the city hall is to break a world record. Thomas thinks publicity for the city is OK. In Carlas: Thomas orders a cup-to-go from Udo. He spoils the coffee over Thomas' documents.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Noch nicht bereit (#1.2367)}
plot: Carla and Torben offer her to buy her dwelling-house but Johanna needs time to think about that because she realizes she pushed her desire too hard. After a talk with Thomas she decides to become co-owner of the Rosenhaus. Theo asks Kim again to be his model for him but she feels shame for her burn wound. He shows her how you can digitally touch it up. Kim still can't accept her burn wound. Carla confesses Torben she clashed with Britta during their stay in the USA. It turns out they experienced the same thing different and had not the same idea of how to plan during their vacation. Sydney reveals Gunter that Holger's proposal of marriage came to soon for her. Gunter thinks Holger did the proposal to get hotel "Drei Könige" in his possession. Sandra makes Gunter clear it's a problem for her when it hurts Merle seeing them together. Gunter confesses Merle that his flirt with Sandra is just a part of the match he plays with Thomas. Erika moves out of the workshop to sell the flowers on the Salt Market. But it's cold outside. Johanna hesitates to buy a part of the Rosenhaus. Kim struggles to accept her burn wound. Will Carla and Britta reconcile? Gunter messes with Holger's proposal of marriage. His flirt with Sandra hurts Merle. Erika sells flowers in the cold.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Schwung in die Kiste (#1.1953)}
plot: Merle and Gunter convince mayor Thomas to reconsider his retreat. Thomas still hasn't time for looking through Aylin's goods. Many people try to condole him. Udo has the idea of a condolence book. Johanna asks Gunter if this book can be signed by the citizens in a corner in his hotel. At first Thomas is not amused about this idea. Gunter shows him a positive newspaper article about him and his deceased wife Aylin. Nathalie informs Thomas about the environment project of Aylin. Eliane, Ben, Inge and Hannes decide to manage Theo's grill wagon better than Theo does. They agree to come all with an idea and the idea that generates the highest turnover will be definitely implemented. Inge sews a diner's costume in the style of the 50's. She attracts a lot of customers with it. Udo wants to end speculations with empty houses in the city. Udo informs Gunter that the hotel technician didn't do the jobs he was supposed to do; Ben Berger did them instead. Gunter fires the hotel technician and offers the job to Ben who gladly accepts it. This endangers his trip to Brazil with Eliane. Carla wins the culinary contest for vegetarian food: a course from a top cook in Brussel. She finds her husband Torben in Hannes' garden house where he and Hannes talk about survival in nature. Torben is fascinated and doesn't notice his wife has something to celebrate. She tells it him the next day but she is disappointed when he doesn't want to come with her to Brussel. Nathalie wants Sebastian's early warning system as her study object and Sebastian thinks that is OK. He repairs Jana's machine in her workshop. Maurice tells Sebastian not to put too much pressure on his daughter Nathalie. Sebastian finds an article about a caught drugs boss who recently is freed from a brain tumor that threatened his eye sight. On the photo to it is a person that looks like Maurice. That could mean Jana's workshop is bought with drugs money. Fabian can't believe it is really Maurice Greve. Fabian ended on the second place in the Naruto-house boat contest. Sebastian asks Torben for advice in the case of the drugs boss. Torben advices him not to tell it when he has no proof. Despite of that, Sebastian shows Jana the photo and she confirms it is Maurice and the other one is his patient. Then she reads the article headline that shocks her.

title: "Rote Rosen" (2006) {Verknallt! (#1.1960)}
plot: Nathalie doesn't accept Maurice's decision. Jana thinks Maurice is stressed because of the start of the new hospital department. Nathalie is frustrated by Maurice's behavior. Maurice says he worries about his daughter and sticks to his opinion. Jana wants Maurice to support the travel plans of Nathalie and Fabian. He advices Nathalie an hospital in Rotterdam. Jana fears Maurice is still the old Maurice and hasn't changed. Ben brings the rat back to the seller and looks for professional help to catch the rat Killer. Tiger Rat talks with Johanna about his rat. She hands over the rat to him and he gives her money for finding the animal. Tiger Rat leaves the hotel to go to Tokyo. Johanna gives the reception an envelope for Ben Berger. After the demonstration Marlies and Udo go to Carlas. Inge learns to know Marlies there. Udo gives Ben the envelope and Ben finds money in it. Udo tells Ben he thinks a lot about Marlies. Should he tell it his wife Inge? At home Inge asks him if there is something between him and Marlies. Inge makes Hannes clear they agreed not to work for Theo until Theo wants them and their concept back. But Hannes is satisfied with the compromise. He asks Theo how to change Inge's mind. Theo has an idea. Hannes sends Inge a SMS to invite her to his garden house. There Theo sings her a personal song. After that she is in tears and is prepared to work again for Theo. Today the city council wants to assemble for a decision about the airfield. At home Thomas and Torben have a quarrel about the destination of the airfield. They decide to stop it to save their friendship. Vainly Udo tries to convince Thomas to use the airfield for social housing. Thomas talks during a radio interview about his plans for the airfield. He says that Lichtenhagen and Vonlohen use a social project for their personal interests. Merle and Torben feel insulted by them and visit Thomas in the city hall. In Carlas: Sebastian tells Thomas he doesn't think the attack towards Merle and Torben is OK. Does Thomas stick to his principal of fair politics? The decision about the airfield is postponed.

title: "Rough Cut Woodworking with Tommy Mac" (2010) {Computer Table with Al D'Attanasio (#6.10)}
plot: This week on Rough Cut Woodworking with Tommy Mac, Tommy is joined by series regular Al D'Attanasio to build a computer table. Al and Tommy are inspired by their own lives, hoping to have a place to hold all the essentials for a modern life. Though not as hip as some people may think, Al still needs a spot for his computer as well as drawers and a filing cabinet for his necessary paperwork.

title: "Round the Twist" (1989) {Mali-Boo! (#3.7)}
plot: Unable to afford a new surf board, Pete uses an old board found in the lighthouse. That's when he meets the ghost of Moon Doggy, the board's former owner and surf champion who died while trying to surf a tidal wave. But the tidal wave's coming back and Moon Doggy needs Pete's help to surf it once more to finally be free.

title: "Route 66" (1960) {Blue Murder (#2.2)}
plot: Buz and Tod warily transport a horse with a reputation as a killer to its new owner, whose family is as dysfunctional as any clan Tennessee Williams conjured up. The owner's sensuous wife Blossom Bludge toys with Buz poolside, as she explains why she chose her power-crazed husband over her passive brother-in-law. A third brother, the brawny Cam Bludge, stands brooding and mute as the owner struggles to break the stallion, the way he tamed his own family. As usual, the episode features superb on-location photography, this time in Butte, Montana. Tod and Buz are transporting Blue Murder, a stud stallion, from Idaho to the Montana ranch of its new owner, Jim Bludge. Against Buz's judgment, Tod rescued Blue Murder who was going to be put down because he killed a man due to his naturally wild nature. As such, Jim was able to purchase him for one-fifth of his on-paper value. The three Bludge brothers operate the ranch, they who could not be more different from each other. Jim, the eldest, is the alpha male who likes to show who is boss, which now includes to Blue Murder. Frank, the middle brother, is the one glossy on the surface, he who deals with the customers on the ranch. Cam, the youngest, is the seemingly quiet simpleton, who diligently and quietly does his work. Jim is married to Blossom, who is in many ways as wild as Blue Murder and who has a history with each of the brothers, but each in slightly different ways. Blossie was adamantly against Jim buying the stallion for more reasons that one. Blue Murder ends up being a symbol of Blossie's life on the ranch with the brothers, in more ways than one.

title: "Route 66" (1960) {Somehow It Gets to Be Tomorrow (#3.19)}
plot: Tod, still alone,travels to Corpus Christi, Texas for a job at a grain processing plant and encounters a thieving 13 year old boy. The boy and his sister are orphans who dislike their foster parents and are looking for a new life in a different town-and a father figure. Tod is a possible candidate. In Corpus Christi, Texas, Tod helps a young teen-aged boy escape from a group of other boys who are chasing him. He tells Tod the boys tried to steal some money from their tennis club, he trying to fight the group off. But as the boy runs off, Tod learns that it was the other way around: the boy in question was the one who stole the tennis club money, he who also now manages to steal Tod's wallet in the process. Visited by social worker Evan Corelli, Tod learns the boy's story. He is thirteen year old Joby Paxton, he and his younger sister Susie Paxton who were orphaned six months ago when their parents were killed in an accident. Mr. and Mrs. Paxton were working class people who taught Joby how to be self-reliant, hence Joby's quick wit and ingenuity. Corelli placed Joby and Susie in the foster care of a loving couple, the Conwells, who, without children of their own, have tried to provide Joby and Susie with unconditional love. Three weeks ago, Joby ran off and has been on the run since. Corelli knows that Joby now has Tod in his sights as a mark in whatever scheme Joby has in mind. All Corelli asks is that Tod contact him not if but when Joby resurfaces in Tod's life. True to perceptive Corelli's prediction, Joby does reenter Tod's life of his own free will with wallet in hand with no money taken. Spending time with Joby, Tod knows why Joby ran away from the Conwells. Tod has to figure out what to do about the situation: whether just to turn Joby over to Corelli with Joby probably running away again, or to let Joby play out his game whatever it is to see where it leads. If Tod chooses the latter, he may get a few physical and emotional bumps and bruises along the way.

title: "Rox" (2011) {Containers (#1.6)}
plot: Valuable shipments are stolen repeatedly, whole container loads, from the main port. Rox must find the thieves, starting on the assumption it may be an inside job within security chief Steinskopf's team. Rick poses as schoolboy to get a class tour, which yields info on the procedures, while ROX's sensors detect irregularities in trucks entering and leaving the docks.

title: "Roxsy Tyler's House of Horrors" (2017) {Killer Reviews (#1.3)}
plot: Manager gets Roxsy Tyler a gig reviewing Independent Horror Films on her own webcast but as he should have expected... Roxsy quickly makes him regret the decision. Meanwhile, Count Chuckula's well of female victims are drying up when he discovers the charismatic new killer, "Dorian McMichael". Chuck obsesses about finding ways to out-do his new arch rival.

title: "Royal Pains" (2009) {Fools Russian (#4.7)}
plot: Evan wisely accompanies social klutz Jeremiah Sacani to HankMed's patient up for contract renewal, Paige's summer camp 'ex' Brady Wilkerson, who shares Evan's boyish enthusiasm for space travel and is preparing for a second Shuttle passenger flight, but a cool training device incident reveals a problematic condition and Jeremy's poor bedside manner. Boris pages Hank for his first top-secret mission, acting as 'medical consultant' for Boris and his crucial Russian petroleum deal broker, Dmitry Vasilyev, a terribly macho womanizer whose health risks must be checked. Divya volunteers to take her father home to convalesce and hesitantly works on setting straight their wrecked rapport.

title: "Royal Wedding of a Lifetime" (2011) {William & Kate: A Love Story (#1.5)}
plot: It sounds like the plot of a romance novel: she was an ordinary girl from a sleepy English village; he was the most eligible bachelor of his generation. But in a real life love-conquers-all tale, we'll soon witness the marriage of Kate Middleton to the future King of England. This episode will reveal the love story behind the wedding that will win the hearts of the entire world.

title: "Rubbadubbers" (2003) {Skypainter Amelia (#4.11)}
plot: Amelia wants to make pictures like her friends, but she can't hold the brush right! When she is told to paint the sky with nothing but triangles, Amelia decides that she'll try something new. Becoming a sky painter, Amelia discovers there are lots of ways to paint a picture!

title: "Ruby Gloom" (2006) {Venus de Gloomsville (#1.23)}
plot: Venus is pulling out her roots! The screenplay writing contest deadline is in two days and she hasn?t written a word. She just can?t seem to find her writer?s voice. Frank and Len, Poe, and Skull Boy offer to help. But their story suggestions have more to do with their voices than hers. Frank and Len suggest turning her story which is a variation on the Cinderella story into a science fiction fantasy. Skull Boy offers up a film noir take. And Poe? Well lets just say he?s standing on the front of a ship wearing an Admirals hat and singing. In the end Ruby?s encouragement to write what she knows spurs Venus to find her voice and finish the screenplay with not a moment to spare.

title: "Rugrats" (1990) {Accidents Happen/Pee Wee Scouts (#6.27)}
plot: After Chuckie wets the bed one night, the Rugrats decide that Chuckie has to have a boring day so he won't have an exciting dream and forget to wake up and go potty./After the Rugrats see home movies of Stu's scouting days, they decide to be scouts.

title: "Rules of Engagement" (2007) {Nature Calls (#6.4)}
plot: When the gang decides to take a trip to Vermont to check out the fall foliage, they find themselves wishing they had never left home. Meanwhile, Russell has renewed faith in his marriage to Liz.

title: "Rumpole of the Bailey" (1978) {Rumpole and the Show Folk (#2.3)}
plot: Rumpole travels to the north of England where he is re-united with his one time clerk, Albert who now works for a firm of solicitors. He is set to defend Maggie Hartley, actress accused of killing her husband. The prosecution case rests on the evidence of a theater employee who overheard the shots and to whom she admitted her guilt. Rumpole's defense rests primarily on her husband's brutish behavior and fondness for drink and carousing.

title: "Run My Renovation" (2010) {One Shower to Rule Them All (#4.12)}
plot: The Bradshaws' master bathroom is dark, cold, and wastes a lot of space. Even though the Bradshaws have done most of the renovations already, they asked the Run My Renovation team and the online community to help them out. Licensed contractors John and Joanie turn this bathroom around replacing the bathtub, expanding the shower, and custom building a side-by-side sink. With the counter tops replaced and the room brightly painted, this bathroom will brighten their day.

title: "Runaway" (2009) {(#1.2)}
plot: Molly reluctantly agrees to let Sean tag along as she tries to make her way back to her old family home. Back at home, Sean's mother is desperate to find him, especially when her boyfriend, Gary, learns the truth about Sean being bullied at school. When a motorway blocks their path, Sean and Molly use a badger tunnel to cross, but when it rains the tunnel starts to flood.

title: "Rupan sansei: Part II" (1977) {Black Panther (#1.18)}
plot: Arsène Lupin III has found the perfect birthday gift for his girlfriend Fujiko Mine. It is the Black Panther, a unique emerald that, if seen from a certain angle, seems to contain a panther. Lupin steals the emerald and hides it within a statue, intending to come back for it later. But when the emerald gets accidentally transported to a nude resort, Lupin, Jigen and Goemon must go undercover (in a manner of speaking) to retrieve it. Complicating the matter as always is Inspector Zenigata, who is joined by the interfering Inspector Conaiseau.

title: "Rupan sansei: Part II" (1977) {The Lupin Funeral March (#3.28)}
plot: Lupin, Jigen, Fujiko, and Goemon go to see the famous Kyoransky perform with his amazing conducting abilities on the orchestra. Lupin however discovers that his music is leading him to death. As the people around him attack him whenever they hear Kyoransky's music. Lupin investigates by recording Kyoransky's moves on video and then analyzes it. Soon Lupin discovers that it's a form of hypnosis,the conducting stick of Kyoransky's, manifest through sound waves beyond the range of human hearing. Now that Lupin's solve that mystery, now he wonders what Kyoransky has against Lupin.

title: "Rurôni Kenshin: Seisô hen" (2001)
plot: Kenshin and Kaoru are married. Kenshin leaves Kaoru with their son, Kenji, to lead a revolution in China. But both of them suffer from a seemingly incurable disease. 15 years later, Kenshin tries to return home to his wife before she dies of grief. Flashbacks of Kenshin's previous encounters with friends and foes occur while Kenshin struggles to make it back home.

title: "Rush" (2008) {Don't Show Him Your Badge (#3.7)}
plot: In trying to get more information on Kronin's gang Michael enters the world of underground boxing but ends up being identified as TR and inadvertently putting his life in danger. Meanwhile, as the team track Kronin's gang to a warehouse Shannon ends up saving Kronin's life when he is nearly attacked by a vengeful ex-associate and she ends up being kidnapped by Kronin. Elsewhere, Michael takes the plunge and asks Audrey out for a drink.

title: "Ruth Rendell Mysteries" (1987) {Simisola: Part Two (#9.4)}
plot: Chief Inspector Wexford and Insp. Burden continue the investigation of Melanie Akande's disappearance and the death of the last person to have seen her alive, employment counselor, Annette Bystock. While they find the man who broke into Bystock's house, he claims that the door was unlocked - and she was dead - when he got there. When they find the body of a young black woman, they believe they have found Melanie but have in fact made a terrible mistake leading Dr. and Mrs. Akande to accuse the police of racism. The young woman, only 17 years old, was beaten to death but yet another murder of a black woman deepens the mystery.

title: "Résistance" (2014)
plot: Paris. 1940. Lili is 17 years old. In occupied France, she encounters war before love, and joins the Resistance. Through the interconnecting destinies of its teenage heroes, Resistance tells the story of young people going to any lengths to defend their country.

title: "S1ngle" (2008) {Een jaartje ouder (#2.5)}
plot: Fatima gets stuck with a hearing impaired elevator repairman on the hospital roof. Nienke is asked to babysit her neighbor neighbor's daughter Annemoon. Stella is extremely annoyed when the hospital staff keeps reminding her of her birthday.

title: "SFBN Talks High School Sports" (2014) {Neumann-Goretti Girls Basketball (#1.13)}
plot: Ari Bluestein is back hosting SFBN Talks this week and Emily Henning joins him as co-host. With high school basketball as the main topic, Ari and Emily break down the top teams in the Philadelphia Public League to start things off. Later we send our Jack Kapp out to Neumann-Goretti High School in South Philadelphia to talk to some of the members of the top high school girls basketball team in the country. On this week's Writer's Corner, Ari is joined by Kate Harman of the Philadelphia Inquirer. Ari asks Kate about the top high school girls basketball teams in the area and their chances at winning their respective classification state championships. Ari, Emily and Ed Morrone, the sports editor for the Northeast Times, then give their predictions on who will be the teams to beat in the Philadelphia Public and Catholic League boys basketball playoffs.

title: "SOKO Leipzig" (2001) {Harte Jungs (#16.6)}
plot: In Dresden a SEK-man was shot with a sniper rifle. There are indications that the killer comes from its own ranks. Jan Maybach and Ina Zimmermann determine as external investigators on the case and reveal systematically the conspiring SEK-troupe.

title: "Saber Rider and the Star Sheriffs" (1987) {Brawling Is My Calling (#1.8)}
plot: The Star Sheriffs are assigned to investigate a business tycoon named Maddox, who is believed to be working for the Outriders. Saber, Colt, and Fireball go undercover as a trio of drifters. They get into a fake bar fight, which catches the attention of Maddox's foreman. The foreman gets them hired with Maddox's operation. As they head back to their hotel, the foreman reveals that he is also an agent of Cavalry Command. Later that evening, someone takes a shot at Fireball through the window of the hotel room. The Star Sheriffs give chase, and find Maddox and his men waiting for them. He's also captured April and RAMROD.

title: "Sabrina's Secret Life" (2003) {Sabrina: Part Two (#1.14)}
plot: Hilda & Zelda have been warning Sabrina about using magic she's not ready to use. Sabrina promises she won't, but she doesn't exactly keep that promise. Thanks to some spells that go awry, Sabrina ends up with a week's worth of detention - in both schools for the same days. Sabrina sees only one solution - to create another version of herself. Unfortunately, Sabrina II turns out... not... just... right... There's a screw loose somewhere in this doppelganger. In fact, it soon becomes clear, she's the bad Sabrina. To make things worse, Cassandra finds out and, thinking Sabrina is up to something, makes her own double (Cassandra II), which of course turns out to be a painful, problem causing goody-goody. So as the good Sabrina tries to make amends for past transgressions, and the bad Sabrina is out there committing more of them, the two Cassandras get in the mix and make things worse. Sabrina and Cassandra (each horrified at the "opposite" version of them) must together find a way to reverse the spells and set their reputations straight.

title: "Sabrina, the Animated Series" (1999) {Witch Switch (#1.6)}
plot: Sabrina, sick of her seemingly mediocre existence decides the grass must be greener on the other side. She casts a spell that switches her life with Gem's. Sabrina soon becomes bored with Gem's spoon-fed lifestyle and wants to go home. But Gem, now holding Sabrina's witch-power doesn't want to give it up! Sabrina must trick Gem into switching lives again.

title: "Sacred Sites of the World" (2016) {Chaco Canyon (#1.5)}
plot: Embedded on a canyon floor in New Mexico are the broken ruins of ancient structures, buildings constructed over 1,000 years ago by the Pueblo civilization of Chaco Canyon. For over 300 years, this community grew and prospered under the leadership of a shadowy elite. But something happened that led to claims of bloodshed, human sacrifice, and even cannibalism. What happened? Our team of experts visits the remarkable landscape that this ancient civilization once called home to see what caused its swift and violent demise.

title: "Safety First" (2013) {Het bedrijfsevent (#1.2)}
plot: Safety First is hired for a pharmaceutical firm's grand product presentation, hosted by celebrity actor Koen De Bouw. Simon Smos get caught in another loyalty conflict between his mates, with whom he spends evenings watchings movies etcetera, and 'hero' boss Dirk, who feels unfairly excluded and therefore resolves to prove he can be 'loose' to but overdoes that embarrassingly over the top. Ingrid guessed Koen is only a namesake of Luc's kindergarten classmate, yet lets them bond before telling the truth, thus ruining a friendship which never pre-existed.

title: "Sailor Moon" (1995) {Jupiter Comes Thundering In (#1.21)}
plot: Queen Beryl has been in contact with Queen Metalia, the dark power behind the Negaforce who has given foresight as to how Beryl can control the universe. In order to find the Silver Moon Crystal, an item of immense power, Beryl must first locate the seven Rainbow Crystals which carry her imprisoned servants, the Shadow Warriors, demons of immense skill and superhuman strength. The problem is after the war on the moon, the Shadow Warriors were reborn into the guise of humans on Earth with no memories of their former selves. Zoicite has been tasked with locating these beings and retrieving the rainbow crystals in the process. Meanwhile, Serena meets a new friend in the form of Lita, a transfer student who was kicked out of her old school for 'excessive violence' and the two become good pals. Things get even more interesting when Lita falls for Game Machine Joe, a local kid who's good at crane machines but is masking a strange power inside of him that he can't explain. When Zoicite comes after him, Joe makes a discovery about himself...and Luna and the Sailor Soldiers make a startling discovery about Lita!

title: "Sale of the Century" (1969)
plot: In this quiz/game show, contestants had to answer relatively simple questions on general knowledge categories. Correct answers earned the contestants a few dollars. The show's gimmick was that the contestants could then exchange some of their money for expensive prizes which would be offered at extreme discounts. The contestant who finished the show with the most cash could then return to compete in the next show. "Sale of the Century" was the American game show that, after its network cancellation in the United States, became a phenomenal hit on Australia's Nine Network. 3 contestants, 1 a returning champion, competed to answer general knowledge questions (asked rapid-fire style). Each contestant was given an initial score of $25; correct answers were worth $5, wrong answers deducted $5 from the score. The game was interrupted at certain intervals for Instant Bargains, which allowed the player in the lead to buy a prize at a heavily-discounted take-it-or-leave-it prize (e.g., a $1,175 color TV/stereo console for $14) always at the risk of later losing the game at times, the host offered cash or reduced the asking price as an additional incentive to buy the prize. Toward the end of the front game, the questions were increased to $10 added or subtracted appropriately. After an undefined time limit had expired, the contestant with the highest cash score was the day's champion and earned the right to shop in the "Sale of the Century"; the losers received their cash score and any Instant Bargain prizes. In the "Sale of the Century," the champion could use his cash score winnings to buy specially-discounted luxury items (e.g., a $2800 dining room suite for $85) or bank the cash and return on the next show and accumulate more by winning future games and having access to more expensive prizes including a luxury car and a cash jackpot that began at $25,000 and increased by $1000 per show until claimed; a champion who earned enough cash could elect to take home all the prizes offered in the "Sale of the Century," which together was often worth more than $50,000. Late in the NBC run, the format was altered so that 2 male/female couples competed with late-game questions worth $20 and the winning couple going shopping; the original format was used in the one-season syndicated version. Though a modest hit in the U.S. (in both the 1969 and 1983 versions), the show became a huge hit on Australia's Nine Network; the Australian version was the brainchild of Reg Grundy, who purchased the rights to the show shortly after its network cancellation in 1973.

title: "Sam Delaney's News Thing" (2015) {Migrants (#2.10)}
plot: Sam asks if anyone has a solution to the migrant crisis besides setting fire to it, Alastair Campbell dishes the dirt on the Blair years and Bobby Mair sticks up for badgers. With guests Rod Liddle, Vanessa Feltz, Felicity Ward and Alastair Campbell.

title: "Sammansvärjningen" (1986) {Första delen: Vi behöver ett verktyg (#1.1)}
plot: King Gustaf III is increasingly unpopular, especially with a group of aristocrats who dislike him after the unsuccessful Russian war of 1788. They meet regularly under the leadership of general Pechlin to discuss a plan to assassinate the king and stage a coup. But the king know about Pechlin thanks to his spies and disregard him as an old fool.

title: "Samson en Gert" (1990) {Burgemeester bloot (#4.55)}
plot: The mayor claims he'll have the best costume at the annual carnival ball. He also wants to bade at Gert's, but his bath is filled with fish he minds for Marlene. So he tries an old-fashioned child-size tub in the town hall. Alberto bring a whole rack of costumes he borrowed from the operatic society, but wants to be the boss of whatever Gert and Samson dress up as. The mayor's attempt to bade in quiet backfires embarrassingly.

title: "Samson en Gert" (1990) {De grote TV-quiz (#14.11)}
plot: Gert's joy about being drawn as candidate for the great TV quiz soon cools down when he realizes the entry he made for him and Samson has been validated only in Samson's name. The station decides the far from knowledgeable dog must play himself, which means poor changes. The mayor hears this and Van Leemhuizen's deep disappointment not to be drawn himself, and especially that the winner may invite three friends along on a trip to Japan. So the mayor drags his clerk to Gert's to coach Samson, which proves hopeless. On the big day however, Samson either misunderstands the questions or tries to ask something, each time stumbling onto the right answers. Another surprise awaits the home-front.

title: "Samson en Gert" (1990) {De sprekende computer (#13.17)}
plot: Gert is delighted with his PC with voice software. Van Leemhuyzen is tired of retyping letters for the mayor and jumps at the chance to test Gert's PC while 'baby-sitting' it. Glutton Alberto manages to pose as the computer's voice so he can control Van Leemhuyzen trough a programmed to do-list. While Gert figures out what happened and asks questions only a real computer could answer, the mayor learns to appreciate his secretary's dictated correspondence work and orders a PC for the town-hall.

title: "Samson en Gert" (1990) {Gemeentesecretaris Suzy (#13.12)}
plot: Foxy bitch Suzy is hired, solely on account of her female charms, by the besotted mayor as second town house employee. Although to lazy to do any work, she gets 'rival' Van Leemhuizen fired, so she can have his job. When the major presents her to everybody, she only makes enemies by rudely insulting them all. So when the mayor invites everybody to a party, planning to propose to her, they all refuse. But her cruelest surprise is still to come- for him.

title: "Samson en Gert" (1990) {Manteltje voor Samson (#5.23)}
plot: Gert ordered a cake to welcome Marlena back after a foreign trip. The shop got four from the city's best baker and hires clumsy Alberto to deliver one. Unfortunately, cakes keep ending up in his face when people's moves surprise him. Samson is horrified to be 'given a surprise', a horribly ridiculous home-knitted, girlishly-pink jacket.

title: "Samson en Gert" (1990) {Ward de bodyguard (#13.14)}
plot: Van Leemhuyzen wants to play 'bodyguard Ward' for mayor Modest, who refuses as he only expect a visit from his brother, sailor Basil. When Gert also questions his guarding skill, they but he can't protect the mayor one hour from cake throwing. To be sure of winning, Van Leemhuyzen convinces the brothers to secretly switch places, while Gert thinks up his own voice impersonation and creamy trap. That fails, but trick keep being traded.

title: "San guo" (2010) {Wang Yun Plans the Chain-Linked Strategy (#1.8)}
plot: Wang Yun & Lü Bu are having food & wine at Wang Yun's residence & Diao Chan offers to dance as a thank to Lü Bu's gifts he brought for Diao Chan's birthday. Afterwards, Lü Bu and Diao Chan are alone & Diao Chan reveals how she came to be Wang Yun's adopted daughter. Lü Bu has been steadily falling for Diao Chan and now proposes marriage. Diao Chan agrees but says that they must inform her father first. Wang Yun accepts and suggests that Lü Bu do not tell his godfather Dong Zhuo about it just yet. Wang Yun reveals the 2nd part of the "Chain-Linked Strategy" to Diao Chan in hopes that they can restore the Han dynasty. He will offer her to the tyrant Dong Zhuo to make Lü Bu jealous in the hopes that he would turn against Dong Zhuo. Diao Chan reluctantly agrees. The next day after court, Wang Yun invites Dong Zhuo to his residence for wine & to view the plum blossoms. When Dong arrives & sees Diao Chan he immediately falls for her and tells Wang Yun that he will bring her to the palace & make her Imperial Concubine for the emperor, even though having her there would really be for Dong's benefit, not the emperor. Lü Bu hears about this & is furious at Wang Yun and confronts him. Yun explains that he could not refuse the Prime Minister. Lü Bu then asks Dong Zhuo for her but he refuses saying that it's too late.

title: "Sanford and Son" (1972) {Lamont, Is That You? (#3.6)}
plot: Fred's pal Bubba sees Lamont and his friend Rollo coming out of what turns out to be a "gay bar", where they had gone by mistake. He reports this to Fred. Adding to this to other "evidence", Fred is worried his son his homosexual... and sets about "curing" him without Lamont knowing it. Lamont is disgusted when Rollo tricks him into going to see a dirty movie. He is even less impressed when Rollo accidentally steers him into a gay bar called The Gay Blade. Bubba sees this and, fearing the Lamont and Rollo might be gay, reports back to Fred. Fred begins to have fears that his son and Rollo might be gay so he pulls a series of unsuccessful tricks to get him to open up. Later, when Bubba and Fred go to check out The Gay Blade, Rollo spot them walking in and assumes that they might be gay. When he reports back to Lamont, the tables turn and Lamont begins to fear that Fred might be gay. Fred and Lamont try having a talk to open up about things when evidence suddenly crops up that neither is actually gay.

title: "SantApprentice" (2006) {Grandma Nicole (#1.33)}
plot: Grandma Nicole, a retired pilot, decides to hand out presents to children every single day. She becomes a major competitor for Santa, who doesn't seem the least bit worried. Of course, we have to trust in the magic of a Christmas present. But Nicolas, confronted with Tim-Tim and Nic-Nac's excitement, decides to take action. He discovers a very sweet old lady with an irresistible smile.

title: "Sapphire & Steel" (1979) {The Railway Station: Part 8 (#2.8)}
plot: Sapphire succeeds in making contact with the darkness at a great personal risk. Steel negotiates with it by promising a powerful source of resentment in exchange for a return to present day. The solider finally reveals what it is the darkness has promised all the ghosts but Steel gives them a better offer. The darkness follows through with its part of the bargain and Sapphire and Steel must uphold their part as well, even if their actions damage time itself.

title: "Sara" (2007) {(#1.149)}
plot: Lieven makes Ellen admit she was just too chicken to tell Thomas about Ann and Nils replacing him both as runner and lover. Thomas is desperate in Arne's pub. Steven gets absolutely nowhere with spasmodically inflexible Margot and warns Helena that must lead to union action, she invites him for a happily embraced home meal. Britt first sneers at Alexander for his dull love-life, then apologizes and offers dinner, which after an initial icy refusal is coolly accepted, there she compliments his CEO potential, wisely mistrusted but "that's exciting". Even now Arne makes her a generous spread payments proposal without fusion, amateur Margo only 'considers it' haughtily mistrusting. Sara enjoyed the walks enough to try Jacob's next suggestion, mediation, after accompanying him checking out photo-shoot sights by jeep.

title: "Sara" (2007) {(#1.30)}
plot: Simon and Lieven are off to Milan, Sara is named the CEO's representative. She shows Felix's fabrics to designer Marnix, who is immediately convinced, but calls the prices excessive; Felix wines and dines her and throws in a fancy watch, to Britt's utter shouted fury. Thomas meets his dad Patrick (still ignoring each-others identity), who works in the storage of the shop where he'll regularly pick up paper for Présence, and is naturally drawn to him. Alexander has Brit ask other fabrics quotes. Simon suspects Felix's 30% rebate is at the expense of the quality...

title: "Sara" (2007) {(#1.86)}
plot: Sara is devastated, takes a day of 'to work for Ecomoda', Lieven calls that proof Présence no longer comes first and worries about Arne's influence. Lut convinces Hans it's about time to tell Sara about them two. Margot presses Leon and even Alexander -who disagrees, hoping to become acting CEO- to help convince Simon to take his fiancée prospecting in France. Britt is obsessed with Steven. Marnix decides Ann is the only one left to look for locations in Thomas's place: streets with colorful house fronts this time. While scouting, Ann hears from Sven's mate Niels De Rovere that Sven just left on an Erasmus (EU exchange program) scholarship to Finland after she told him off, Niels helps with her search. Simon brings Sara back by daringly- appealing to her love for him.

title: "Satisfaction" (2007) {Cyclone Chloe (#2.8)}
plot: Josh is back early from his rock tour and surprises Chloe, who turned jealous of the late Tipi after Nat tells her and throws him out. Sean takes him in and tries to coach a reconciliation, in vain. Blind, weird regular client Robbie Barnes isn't fooled by Chloe pretending to be Tipi, but after consideration accepts the alternative. Facing her mess with Fiona after Terence's cardiac crisis, Lauren has nightmares about the kids.

title: "Saturday Night Live" (1975) {Anne Hathaway/The Killers (#34.4)}
plot: Sketches include: Vice Presidential Debate (with Queen Latifah and Tina Fey cameos), Anne Hathaway Monologue, The Lawrence Welk Show, Bailout Press Conference, Guest House, An SNL Digital Short: Extreme Activities Competition, Weekend Update with Amy Poehler and Seth Meyers, Weekend Update: Orville Willis Forte IV, Mary Poppins, Sioux City News 3, Mark Wahlberg Talks To Animals, I'm Not Gay, The Less Provocative Songs Of Katy Perry. The Killers perform "Human" and "Spaceman".

title: "Saturday Night Live" (1975) {Catherine O'Hara/R.E.M. (#16.17)}
plot: Sketches include: Frank and Nancy, Catherine O'Hara Monologue, The Dancer (repeat), Sprockets, 1991 MTV Spring Break: Live from the Kennedy Compound, It's Pat, Deep Thoughts by Jack Handey, Weekend Update with Dennis Miller, Weekend Update: David Spade with What's In and What's Out, The Justice League of America, Frank Gannon, P.I. P.I., In Conclusion Theatre (with Randy Quaid cameo), Daily Affirmation, Wedding Dress To Funeral. R.E.M. performs "Losing My Religion" and "Shiny Happy People" with Kate Pierson.

title: "Saturday Night Live" (1975) {Ed Helms/Paul Simon (#36.21)}
