Charlotte advises Werner to stop the battle against Friedrich and Beatrice. Werner asks Friedrich and Charlotte their opinion about selling sausages in the hotel garden; Charlotte thinks the idea isn't bad but Friedrich means they should discuss this later because other things have priority. Werner wonders why Charlotte and Friedrich suddenly seem to go along with each other. He tells Poppy that Friedrich and Charlotte are against her sausage stand but Poppy did already talk with Charlotte. Werner confesses her he is against her idea. Natascha discovers André did want Michael only as fake mayor candidate to avoid that he has to compete with Hildegard. Werner gives André election advises. Natascha bought traditional costumes for her and Michael to improve Michael's image. Alfons thinks they better work on an election program. André cancels the photo shoot near the grave of his deceased love Nicola because he thinks it is not appropriate to use this for his election campaign.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Der Unfall (#1.2178)}
plot: Nils doesn't let anything out to Niklas who wonders what is really going on. He thinks Julia still loves him. Nils blames himself for his suggestive talk. He talks with Julia about it. They make it up with each other. Niklas makes Julia clear they are just brother and sister; his divorce has nothing to do with their former love for each other. Julia makes him clear that he should have in mind what it all means to her; she has a relation with Nils not with him. In the community house Niklas and Nils offers each other their excuses and drink a glass of wine together. Julia wants to proof Nils he is the only one for her; she asks Tina to help her with it. She surprises Nils with a new bags line "Inspired by Nils". Maybe Natascha can have her job back. She gets a parcel from her daughter Marlene who has a sunny vacation. She and Ian decide to go south. Becky is not happy about that and vainly tries to threaten Natascha. Ian buys the car from Jonas. Becky wants to do a photo-shoot but Ian doesn't want to drive her to the shoot. She finds a solution. But Jonas doesn't want to give her the car keys. She grabs it out of his hand, drives away and promptly runs into Natascha. Alfons is surprised; Hildegard did come back one day earlier than expected. André complains to Friedrich that it is unfair Niklas gets a higher salary for the same work. Niklas and André quarrel again on the expense of Jonas. Jonas quits his job. He notices Sebastian is looking for a waiter and bar personal, and shows him what he can. Jonas gets the job. Niklas offers André to put in a word for him at the hotel management but he doesn't want his help and says he can do things better than Niklas. They go to Charlotte and ask her to be the referee in a cooking contest.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Die Spieluhr (#1.2259)}
plot: Niklas tells Michael he doesn't want a big stag party. Poppy hides her pregnancy for Werner. Tina thinks Poppy should tell it Michael and Werner but Poppy thinks this will be the end of her marriage. She invites Poppy to stay the night with her. Julia asks Tina to go to Munich tomorrow to seek out a bride's dress. Julia want to ask Poppy too but Tina says to her that Poppy doesn't feel herself very well. Julia makes her clear she doesn't want a wild hen's party. Michael and Tina spontaneous decide to organize a low profile bachelor party for this afternoon. Tina asks Nils to come to the party but Nils doesn't want to because of his former relation with Julia. Norman finds Poppy in the community house. Poppy seems to be in panic but Norman can't get out of her what happened; she leaves. Tina lures Julia to the garden in front of the hotel. Julia is surprised by a low profile party with a couple of friends and of course Niklas. At that moment Nils passes by during his jogging. Julia embraces him and invites him to the party; Nilklas has no objections. Later: Poppy shows up. She tells Michael she is pregnant from him and wants an abortion. Luisa finds Sebastian practicing a magic trick. They have a nice talk together. Luisa has to pay far more for the funeral of her mother than she can pay. Julia advices her to ask Friedrich for advanced money. Luisa finds him in his office being annoyed during a telephone call. He makes a negative remark to her but apologizes himself immediately to her. She doesn't ask him money but withdraws herself. She wants to sell a broken musical clock, a reminder object. Hermann meets her and tells her he already paid the funeral bill. She talks with Sebastian about it and asks him for a job. He advices her to do the flower decoration on the wedding party. She immediately leaves to ask for that but forgets her musical clock. Charlotte thinks it is OK she does the flower deco. Friedrich has 50% of the hotel shares again thanks to Hermann. Hermann asks in return to give Luisa the job in the garden. He wants her to become his heiress. He never found out who is Luisa's real father. Friedrich looks a little nervous. Sebastian comes to Luisa in the laundry room and shows her a trick. Suddenly her musical clock is there, she opens it and it starts to make music. Charlotte finds Friedrich at the grave of Marta Reisiger, Luisa's mother. He tells her he might be the father of Luisa. It seems that the coup in San Cortez was successful for Barbara and her husband. Will she be powerful enough to have influence in the case of her half-sister Patrizia. Stefan thinks he and Patrizia should stop their relation to have a chance during her juridical process. Patrizia shows him a newspaper article about San Cortez and informs Stefan about her sister. Stefan now knows who the strange one on his voice-mail is. Patrizia suggests Stefan to disappear to San Cortez together before the process start. Hermann invites Beatrice to Madame Butterfly. He gives her a small box. She opens it and there are earrings inside. He asks her to wear them when they go to the opera. She undoes herself from clothes. Later: Hermann comes down from the stairs and grabs to his heart. Michael catches him and advices him to calm down.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Eine alte Liebe (#1.2365)}
plot: Michael hesitates but Luisa stays persistent. Michael agrees to do the operation. He wants Gerber to assist him. Sebastian is there for Luisa. David goes to the hospital but Luisa is already in the operation room. He blames Sebastian for what happened to Luisa and sends him out of Luisa's room. The operation went well. Gerber promises to seek help for her fears. Luisa wakes up and David hears her mention Sebastian's name. She can move her legs and arm again. Patrick gives Tina the stolen keys and leaves. Alexandra hears Tina and Norman talk about it. Patrick seeks a coin; he knows Alexandra inherits from her grandmother and she doesn't know that. He checks out and "leaves". He changes himself in the bathroom into Nils and visits Alexandra. Arwed tells Charlotte the little castle he inherited ruined him financially. André gives Charlotte the idea to hire Arwed. He thinks Arwed is not really poor. Charlotte hires him as restaurant manager. Alfons still bothers Xaver. Young Xaver and Poppy learn to know each other. He applies for senior gymnastics but loses his wedding ring in the gym. Poppy thinks he wants money from old, rich women. Alfons addresses this to Xaver and wants him to be ashamed. He tries to avoid that Xaver and the elder lady have dinner together.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Gekränkt (#1.2591)}
plot: Oskar confesses Tina the whole story about Philipp's death and what he did with his corps. Tina runs into David. Both, Oskar and Tina, are confused and worried. David sees Oskar in the forest later. Is Tina still prepared to marry Oskar? William invites Werner and Susan to the big party. Adrian ignores Susan on the party. William and Clara are often together there. Natascha promises Michael to be there for Fabian who undergoes a complementary examination. Michael is not happy to see that Nils took it over from her. Natascha wants to celebrate because the publisher wants to bring her memoirs on the market. When Fabian tells Michael that he wants to move back to the boarding-school Michael blames Natascha for that and accuses her of egoism. Nils helps Natascha getting rid of her frustration she got from that; where does that end? Back soon: André.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Manipulation (#1.2620)}
plot: Melanie is caught by Beatrice but makes up a story about bad housekeeping. Friedrich and Beatrice suspect that Melanie cooperates with Werner to set a trap for them. Melanie is pleased when she notices that André worries about her. He asks her to restart their relationship. David saves Nils by telling Charlotte that one of his friends did lose an earring here. Nils promises David to avoid Natascha. Despite of that he meets her on the street and he acts surprised when Michael tells him that Natascha won the poker tournament. Desirée tries to discourage William who applies for the job as leader of the fitness area. Adrian suggests Clara to make fashion records for her Internet site together with William; William agrees to model with Adrian for her. The two brothers have reconciled. Adrian wants to edit the filmed material for a commercial. Desirée hacks his computer and discovers the accidentally extended end where Adrian tells Clara that Desirée is complicated. Beatrice edits the digital record so that it looks like Clara telling Adrian that she loves him. Desirée shows the end result to William. The Sonnbichlers think Tina expects a child from Oskar but they see she isn't happy. Tina sees through Oskar when he doesn't want to come with her to her gynecologist.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Rückkehr der Jugendliebe (#1.2488)}
plot: Charlotte refuses to abuse foundation money to save the hotel. Beatrice sold jewels and wants to give Friedrich 50,000 euro but he refuses it. He gets the stolen 100,000 euro back from Isabelle but still needs half a million to pay the full tax debt. He wants to sell hotel ground but Charlotte refuses to agree. Because of the financial trouble she has to disappoint Nils who wants to go with her on a journey. David can't go to Norway because the authorities don't allow him to leave Germany. Tina sees that Clara is in love. As page Clara meets the young man as guest in the hotel suite and forgets to take the tip he tries to give her when she recognizes him as her youth love Adrian. He understands she must be Clara. When he meets her later they make an appointment. Her mother Melanie quickly realizes it's a date which makes her glad. He turns out to be an hotel tester. Clara is disappointed when he tells her he sees her as his little sister. A well-known professor asks Michael to join his team. Friederike advised Michael to the professor. He fears he will have less time for Natascha but she motivates him to grab this chance. He hears via Luisa who's behind this and addresses this to Friederike. Natascha hears from her that the side-effects of the medicine will increase. Michael withdraws himself from the team.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Unerwiderte Gefühle (#1.2222)}
plot: André assures mayor Werner the municipal has to pay 200,000 Eur to Jonas who's arm is paralyzed because of negligence. Werner offers Jonas a basket full of food and expensive wine, and Jonas can make use of Nils Heinemann's service for free during his therapy. Werner doesn't want to pay smart-money but Hildegard puts pressure on him. Tina gives Jonas a cake. Norman visits mayor Werner in Werner's office. Norman is astonished to hear that Jonas has a whiplash and a paralyzed arm. Werner fires him without notice. Alfons accidentally drops documents on the floor. Werner asks him to change the mind of his wife Hildegard. He drops the documents again and bumps his head. Werner puts pressure on him by making him clear that paying smart-money would mean the end of municipal facilities. When the telephone rings Alfons drops the documents again. Norman gives Jonas a plant and tells him he has been fired; this also ends his study. Tina meets Norman in the brew house. She wants to help him to find a place to sleep. Alfons talks with his wife about Jonas. He stumbles in the snow. Jonas pays Tina a visit the next day and finds Norman there. Accidentally he blabs to Tina that his arm isn't paralyzed. Michael has the idea to dance in the video with Nathalie. They dance to a tango in the community house. Their faces come closer to each other but just before kissing André withdraws himself. Natascha packs her suitcase to go to a wellness hotel. She meets Michael outside and tells him she has enough of him. Charlotte says to Patrizia that she hates Friedrich after he tried to kill her. Julia reports herself to the police. But Niklas assures the police she's his sister Sophie and has a mental illness. Niklas explains her Patrizia killed Sophie to get Sophie's fund, and unknowing Julia undermined Patrizia's plan by giving herself out as Sophie. So Julia has to keep pretending to be Sophie. Nils has no understanding for that. Sebastian and Charlotte quarrel in public about the night they were in bed with each other and the consequences of it. Charlotte even shouts angry. They stop when they are sure Patrizia did hear them and has gone. Julia gives Charlotte Sophie's diaries and asks her to give them to Friedrich. Sebastian explains his sister Julia he helped Patrizia because he was in love with her but regrets everything now. But Julia doesn't forgive him. What could Poppy do for charity? Werner asks Charlotte to help Poppy.

title: "Sturm der Liebe" (2005) {Zeit für die Wahrheit? (#1.2174)}
plot: Sebastian is happy to tell is sister Julia the therapy is in the final stage. Jonas offers him to get his car from the police office, repair and sell it. He and Sebastian agree Jonas gets money for his job. Julia reminds Sebastian that when he is cured they have to confess their deceit. Ian tries to explain Natascha that his daughter is from a former relation that is over now. Natascha suggests him to act in front of Becky as if they just know each other good. She thinks Becky wants something from Ian. During a walk Ian asks Becky why his credit card is blocked. She explains him she has been blackmailed by a couple of guys. She says she already understands Ian and Natascha have a relation. Later in the bar: Natascha tells Becky that Becky used Ian's money for her model career. They go to Ian but Becky doesn't want to confess it Ian. Natascha tells it him. Ian reacts disappointed. Poppy and Werner agree that they only don't sleep together in the night before the wedding. Poppy tries to know more about Werner's family. His children are older than she is. Niklas promises Patrizia to fetch the farewell letter tomorrow. He and Patrizia embrace each other and go to bed with each other. Friedrich tells Niklas that Patrizia's suicide attempt was fake and only to prevent him from leaving her. Niklas doesn't believe it but Friedrich tells him it was his idea. According to Niklas Friedrich is nothing better than Patrizia if that is true. When Niklas meets Patrizia he asks her if she faked her suicide attempt. She denies it and says Friedrich wants to disperse them. Friedrich offers Julia his excuses. She accepts them. He talks with her about Patrizia's fake suicide attempt. He urges her to try to convince Niklas that Patrizia is a wicked woman. Julia does that but Niklas blocks it. Alfons hands over a box to Niklas. It contains the suicide letter. Niklas asks Michael if the dose of medicines Patrizia took to commit suicide was high enough. But as a doctor he is bound to the code of silence; he doesn't tell it Niklas. Niklas invites Patrizia and Friedrich to the office. He pulls the letter through the shredder, says he believes Patrizia and leaves the office. Patrizia nags Friedrich by telling him that she took his son away and she will do the same now with their daughter. Suddenly Niklas shows up with the real letter and gives it Friedrich. He heard them talk via the communication set on the desk. Now he knows Patrizia deceived him. He packs his bags and tells her he never loved her. He only married her to distract himself from "Sophie". Patrizia threatens him to commit suicide for real.

title: "Style Code Live" (2016) {Lucky Brand Jeans & High-Low Fall Beauty (#8.1)}
plot: Tonight on Style Code Live, we're taking up to 50% off select Lucky Brand items. Tune in for our edit of the best Lucky Brand jeans and jewelry to try this fall. Then makeup artist Neil Scibelli shares the best in fall beauty. Plus, Pink Peonies blogger Rachel Parcell shares her must-have scarf for fall.

title: "Style Wars" (2013) {Editorial Shoot - Cult Movie Theme (#1.1)}
plot: On their first challenge, the stylists are tasked to create an accessory from haberdashery and props with inspiration from a given cult movie within a 30 min. time period. Winner of this task will have an advantage on the main challenge. For the main challenge, with a budget of $100, stylists must rummage and bargain through car boots for garments and accessories to complete their look on the challenge photo shoot. Stylists need to collaborate with their model, the hair and make up artists as well as the photographer to complete their vision.

title: "Suburgatory" (2011) {Pilot (#1.1)}
plot: Tessa and George have been on their own ever since Tessa's mom pulled a "Kramer vs. Kramer." So far George has done a pretty good job of raising Tessa without a maternal figure in their lives, but suddenly he's feeling a little out of his league, especially after he finds a pack of condoms in her room. So it's goodbye New York City and hello suburbs. At first Tessa is horrified by the big-haired, fake-boobed mothers and their sugar-free, Red Bull-chugging kids. But little by little, she and her dad begin to find a way to survive on the clean streets of the 'burbs. Sure, the neighbors might smother you with love while their kids stare daggers at your back, but underneath all that plastic and caffeine, they're really not half bad. Being in the 'burbs can be hell, but it also may just bring Tessa and George closer than they've ever been.

title: "Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye" (2002) {The Heist (#1.11)}
plot: Two security trucks, carrying a great deal of money, and their drivers go missing while on the job. While Jack and the rest of the team search for them, Sue helps Lucy with her sign language when the two go to a deaf club where speaking is not permitted.

title: "Sugarfoot" (1957) {Ring of Sand (#2.1)}
plot: Tom rides out to Job Turner's desert house to deliver the old man a letter from his son, telling him that he'll be arriving on the next stage. But then a group of outlaws arrives, one of them wounded. The outlaws force Tom and Job to lead them through the desert to the border and keep the wounded man alive, not knowing that both men have learned that the outlaws killed Job's son during a stage robbery, and that Job has no intention of leading them to anything but death.

title: "Suits" (2011) {Buried Secrets (#3.11)}
plot: Things get complicated when Harvey (Gabriel Macht) mixes business with pleasure and gets caught between Jessica (Gina Torres) and Scottie (guest star Abigail Spencer). Painful memories plague Mike (Patrick J. Adams) as he uses a case to exorcise demons against an old foe, while Louis' (Rick Hoffman) suspicions threaten to expose Mike.

title: "Sumit Sambhal Lega" (2015) {Maya's Teacher Visits the Walias (#1.44)}
plot: Maya tells Sumit that her school teacher, Mrs Mathur will be visiting them. She introduces her to Sumit. Later, Sumit introduces Jasbir and Dolly to Mrs Mathur. Maya is jealous when Mrs Mathur praises the Walias. Seeing this, Sumit too praises Maya.

title: "Sun Records" (2017)
plot: A recreation from one of the world's greatest jam sessions. On December 4th, 1956 Carl Perkins' career was flying high from his hit "Blue Suede Shoes." New to the scene, Jerry Lee Lewis is brought in to work on a new song with Perkins. Then, low and behold, super star Elvis Presley and country music legend Johnny Cash stop by the studio for a visit. The songs they sang on that epic day became the concept for Million Dollar Quartet, a fun, inventive retelling of their impromptu recording session.

title: "Sunday AM" (2005) {(#3.8)}
plot: Suzanna Reid read the latest news headlines and BBC correspondent Alan Johnston, broadcaster Esther Rantzen and author Ken Follett reviewed the Sunday news papers with Andrew Marr. Alan Johnson talked about his 114 days of captivity in Gaza and his extraordinary release. Scottish First Minister Alex Salmond MSP talked to Andrew about devolution in Scotland and his parties' plans for full independence in the future. Andrew interviewed actor and director Robert Redford about his new film "Lions for Lambs" which he hopes will provoke political debate and inspire a new generation of film makers to produce this genre of films. Deputy Labour leader Harriet Harman MP talked about her election, the current state of Labour in the polls, possible changes to the Abortion Act which reached its fortieth birthday this week, and various womens' issues such as trafficking.

title: "Sunday Morning Futures with Maria Bartiromo" (2014) {(2016-03-27)}
plot: Former Texas governor 'Rick Perry (II)' (qv) on the 2016 presidential campaign; former House Speaker 'Newt Gingrich' (qv) on the GOP establishment; Republican presidential candidate Sen. 'Ted Cruz (II)' (qv) (R-Texas) on the race for the White House. Panelists include 'Ed Rollins' (qv), 'Monica Crowley (I)' (qv) and 'Gerard Baker (III)' (qv).

title: "Sundown" (2013)
plot: SUNDOWN is a original web episode western series produced by Westerns On The Web. This series is being made in the tradition of the Classic late 1950s and early 1960s western television series shows episodes. The series starts out with Marshal Jim Lane and Bob McLynteck escorting outlaw Ben Reese to jail in Sundown.

title: "Super Duper Sumos" (2001) {Miniature Golf Madness (#2.11)}
plot: Booma gets a job as an underwear model. When Bad Inc.'s monster de jour has really big, butt-slapping hands, Booma refuses to put his butt in harm's way. Kimo and Mamoo must try Booma's patented butt moves in order to fight, but it ends in disaster. Finally, when the monster destroys one of Booma's billboards, Booma becomes a fury unleashed and the big-bottomed bros trounce their foe.

title: "Super Power Beat Down" (2012) {Batmobiles Racing (#1.1)}
plot: The concept of the SPBD web series is to take two super powered legends and make them battle! The show is hosted by Marisha Ray, with two debaters, Damian Beurer and Andy Liegl. Together they battle with their sci-fi/fantasy knowledge and comic wit to see who they think the winner will be. In addition, experts from specific fields will guest star and contribute valuable information.

title: "Super Why!" (2007) {The Sheep Who Lost Little Bo Peep (#3.21)}
plot: Whyatt and his puppy Woofster have a playdate with Wolfy, but they can't find him anywhere. What should he do? To answer this question, the Super Readers jump into the book The Sheep Who Lost Little Bo Peep where they meet two silly little sheep who can't find their Bo Peep. The Super Readers use their super powers to help the sheep and Bo Peep find each other.

title: "Superbook" (2011) {The Road to Damascus (#1.12)}
plot: When a delinquent teen enters Chris and Joy's life they don't see any chance of him changing his ways. However, SUPERBOOK takes our heroes on a journey to the early days of Christianity, where they encounter a man named Saul of Tarsus, who also seems to be an impossible hard-case. His violent actions towards the church take a startling turn on the road to Damascus. There, the kids witness Saul's miraculous conversion and follow him to his healing and baptism at the hands of Ananias. Once the persecutor, Saul, now called Paul, finds himself becoming the persecuted, and our kids are instrumental in his exciting escape over the city wall and away from others bent on rooting out Christianity. The kids' involvement in this exciting story of conversion brings them home with a renewed hope that amazing change is always possible with God.

title: "Superhuman Samurai Syber-Squad" (1994) {Take a Hike (#1.49)}
plot: While Sam is working with Jennifer at school, the rest of the gang goes on a nature hike. Meanwhile, Malcolm and Kilokahn's newest virus monster is sucking up all electricity. With no power, how can the gang enter the digital world? And without Sam, who'll be Servo?

title: "Supernanny" (2005) {Christianson Family (#1.11)}
plot: Jo visits the Christiansen family. Colleen and Chris are struggling with their two boys: 7-year-old Corey and 3-year-old Chase. The boys disrespect their parents by talking back, kicking, pinching, and biting them. Even though Chase is 3 years old, he still drinks from a baby bottle. Chris and Colleen are at odds with disciplining the boys and the whole family tends to yell a lot. Can Jo help this family?

title: "Supernanny" (2005) {Wischmeyer Family (#1.4)}
plot: Jo visits the Wischmeyer Family. While husband John works as a civil engineer, mother Melora is a stay-at-home marketing rep and mom to her three children: 9-year-old Jared and 4-year-old twins Ashlyn & Alaia. Alaia is extremely defiant: screaming, kicking, hitting her mom and whenever Melora attempts to discipline her, Alaia ignores her. At bedtime, Ashlyn acts up, refusing to go to bed and demanding her mother sleep with her. Jared feels left out because of his sisters' misbehavior. Can Supernanny help this family?

title: "Supernatural" (2005) {Faith (#1.12)}
plot: After Dean is fatally injured on a case, Sam thinks he's found a cure in a preacher who performs miracles. However, after they discover that these miracles are not as 'holy' as advertised, the brothers race to stop them before another innocent life is sacrificed. When Dean is accidentally electrocuted fighting a monster, he permanently damages his heart. When he's diagnosed as only having a month, at most, to live, Sam searches for a means to save him and finds Roy Le Grange, a faith healer who may actually be the real deal. After Le Grange heals Dean, the brothers discover that Le Grange is using black magic to bind a "Reaper" to do his bidding... and each healing comes with a terrible price of someone else's life. While chasing a demon and rescuing two children, Dean is accidentally electrocuted, having a severe infarct. The doctor diagnoses a maximum on one month of life, and Sam searches for a doctor, calling the friends of their father. He is advised to visit the healer Rev. Roy Le Grange. Dean is saved, but sooner the brothers disclose that the Reverend's wife, Sue Ann Grange, is using black magic to call "The Reaper", exchanging the healing of their clients with the life of another person.

title: "Supernatural" (2005) {Out with the Old (#7.16)}
plot: After a ballerina is found dead from dancing herself to death, Sam and Dean look into the case and discover the ballet slippers she wore were cursed. When Dean accidentally touches the shoes the power of the curse starts to take hold of him.

title: "Supernatural" (2005) {The Song Remains the Same (#5.13)}
plot: Anna comes to Earth to kill Sam to avoid that Lucifer uses his vessel. However, Dean and Castiel protect Sam and Anna travels in time to kill John and Mary Winchester before they get married and conceive Sam. However Castiel sends Sam and Dean back in time to protect their parents. But Anna is very powerful and the Winchesters are helped by an unexpected angel. The angels send Anna back in time to kill John and Mary Winchester before they can conceive Sam knowing that if Sam was never born then Lucifer won't be able to use him as his vessel. Castiel sends Sam and Dean back to 1978 so they can stop Anna, and the two brothers are reunited with their parents. Mary recognizes Dean as a hunter since he visited her in the past once before but tries to keep the truth from John.

title: "Superstore" (2015) {Olympics (#2.0)}
plot: Amy gets the opportunity to meet her childhood idol; Glenn struggles to balance his excessive patriotism; Jonah discovers a secret about Mateo's past; Dina works to create a memorable closing ceremony.

title: "Surgery Saved My Life" (2006) {Awake Brain Surgery (#1.5)}
plot: Dominic Bakewell played guitar in the 1980s rock outfit Berlin. Now age 48, he's left the wild life of rock 'n' roll behind. As a husband and father of a 2-year-old son, he writes children's songs and still loves to play guitar. Three months ago, however, Dominic was struck by a series of sudden seizures. MRI scans found a tumor the size of a plum on the left frontal side of his brain - right next to the area that controls his guitar-playing hand. It's so close to other vital areas like speech that leading UCLA neurosurgeon Dr. Linda Liau proposed doing the surgery while he was awake. Dr. Liau wants to make sure she cuts the entire tumor out, but she also want to preserve as much of his normal brain function as possible. If Dominic is conscious during surgery, the medical team can interrogate him to find out what each part of his brain does, before making an irreversible cut. This film is a startling exploration of one woman's lifelong fight to conquer brain tumors, both by breathtaking surgical technique and by her pioneering development and testing of brain tumor vaccines. It's also a cutting-edge journey into mapping music and creativity in the human brain. Above all, it's about one man's struggle to stay alive to raise his son.

title: "Surviving Marriage" (2015) {Alex and Lorena (#1.9)}
plot: Alex and Lorena are on the verge of divorce after eleven years of marriage and two children together. Lorena does not respect Alex's opinions and is constantly criticizing him. Alex wants Lorena to respect him as the man of the household without having her constantly mother him. Can the couple work as a team to survive the wild and fix their relationship?

title: "Survivor" (2000) {Running the Camp (#21.9)}
plot: One castaway makes a difficult decision that backfires, allowing another castaway the opportunity to devise a strategy to flush out the hidden immunity idol and blindside a rival.

title: "Survivors" (2008) {(#1.5)}
plot: The survivors are living in a country house when a band of, chiefly young, people turn up, a ragged crew 'led' by John, a supposed visionary. Despite initial misgivings Abby lets them camp in the grounds where Al tries to get cosy with one of the girls, Louise.Another girl, Linda, is heavily pregnant. Anya is worried about revealing that she is a doctor because of the value this will place upon her but nonetheless delivers Linda's baby. John becomes increasingly bizarre in his behaviour and is eventually revealed to be a paranoid schizophrenic.

title: "Suspense" (1949) {Her Last Adventure (#4.46)}
plot: Eva, a wealthy middle-aged woman, marries a man she barely knows and moves into his family estate, a dark, run-down mansion on the Massachusetts coast. She learns James was recently engaged to a young woman, but he dismisses it as an unimportant mistake. Investigating noises in the cellar, she finds the corpse of a young woman, half-buried in the coal pile.

title: "Suspicion" (1957) {Heartbeat (#1.7)}
plot: Thinking he has been cured of a heart condition, as his test results were mixed up with those of another patient, Jamea Merrick goes to celebrate, by spending the day at an amusement park. There he meets younger Emily,and they proceed to enjoy the park's many activities.

title: "Svaty 6" (2013) {(#1.10)}
plot: In this series of Bugko and Mityai coming to meet with a new threat in the person of Larisa's mother. Loving mother-in-law takes in slavery of Mityai and patronage above a grandchild Artem. How to liberate a friend and banish mother-in-law from the house of Buhankiny - this question is baffle Ivan.

title: "Swamp Men" (2010) {Bee Bomb (#1.5)}
plot: As the crew at Billie Swamp Safari prepares for the busy Memorial Day weekend, two of the park's most popular chickees (traditional Seminole huts rented by overnight guests) are being invaded by rogue gators, raccoons and bees. The Swamp Men team must extract the unwanted visitors before guests arrive.

title: "Swamp People" (2010) {Family Feuds (#1.6)}
plot: It's halfway through the grueling alligator season and the stress is taking a toll on families throughout the swamp. Joe and Tommy are fighting... and even Troy is frustrated. Meanwhile, nuisance gator hunter Howard McCrea is tracking a deadly gator.

title: "Swamp Thing" (1990) {Destiny (#3.7)}
plot: Temporally displaced Confederate Civil War soldiers appear in the swamp, one of whom is a previous residence of Will's house. Will helps the man to discover the mystery behind his wartime disappearance and make peace with his past so he can pass on.

title: "Sweat Equity" (2006) {Wasteland Renovation (#9.12)}
plot: Brittany & David moved into their home just a year ago & only had to do a bit of decorating to make it complete. But, their backyard is a jungle. But, they plan to stay in their home awhile so they'd like to make the backyard a place for them to live - while also boosting their potential equity down the line.

title: "Sweet Valley High" (1994) {Skin and Bones (#1.3)}
plot: JESSICA falls for the hot new art student at Sweet Valley High. DAKOTA DANCER is a very talented artist and when he offers to paint Jessica's portrait and show it at the Annual Sweet Valley Art Show, she can't resist bragging about it to everyone in school. She poses for him in a bikini at the beach. By the time the day of the art show arrives, everyone in school has shown up to see the portrait of Jessica. When the painting is unveiled, it portrays Jessica posing nude on the beach! Jessica is mortified because everyone in school thinks she posed for the portrait; and ELIZABETH is furious because her body is the same as Jessica's and she fells exposed as well. Jessica demands Dakota change the painting, but he refuses. Elizabeth confronts Dakota and captures on tape his confession that Jessica wasn't naked when he painted her. Jessica then invites him on a picnic, suggest they go skinny-dipping and when he drops his boxers, the gang capture him on film. Jessica and Elizabeth use the pictures to blackmail Dakota into painting a bikini on Jessica's portrait.

title: "Switch" (2012) {(#1.5)}
plot: Fed up with watching Grace and Gerry in unashamed public displays of affection Jude calls upon museum creator Mike for no strings sex and a possible relationship but his violent mood swings lead her to bring in Aaron to pose as a boyfriend to help dump him. Needing the cash Hannah agrees to tutor Cricklewood witch's daughter Tuppence to get her into a good coven. Tuppence is tactless and friendless but,having helped the others create a truth spell - which makes Gerry admit his love for Grace - she comes to see it is better to be in a friendly coven than an elite one.

title: "Sword of Freedom" (1957) {Marriage of Convenience (#1.17)}
plot: Two powerful Italian families are to be united by a marriage of convenience. The principals in the wedding have never seen each other and Marco is hired to paint a portrait of the bride to be - a beautiful woman who, unfortunately has a nasty scar on her face. Marco can't decide whether to include the disfiguring mark in his portrait.

title: "Syd2030" (2012) {On Top (#2.11)}
plot: All good things must come to an end...and what a rocky semester it has been for our Law students. As exams roll around, as the Law Ball date is set and as Bridget's final bruises heal it seems as if all is back to normal in the 2030...or is it? #SYD2030

title: "T-Bag Bounces Back" (1987) {The Ousting of Major Happy (#1.1)}
plot: T.Bag has got her powers back thanks to a new High Tea plant. She takes over Major Happy's home in a music box, scatters the 8 bells (musical notes) from his Glockenspiel and makes T.Shirt her tea caddy once more. Only Deborah has enough pluck to search the 8 worlds on the side of the music box to find the lost golden bells.

title: "T.J. Hooker" (1982) {Blue Murder (#3.10)}
plot: When several criminals are being gunned down, everyone wonders who is doing it. And when Hooker was with one of them before he was taken out, even he wonders. He gets a line on a possible witness and they find her, she says that the man was killed by a pair of cops. Later they use Hooker to get one of their targets that's when he sets out to get them.

title: "TAG: The Series" (2014)
plot: In the year 2018, the economy has hit its lowest point, unemployment is at the highest its ever been since the market crash. America has "impeached" it's president, and rallied behind a man Simply Called "Greer" who they believed would make America great again. Over time Greer eventually takes over the remainder of America and Europe through force. With all this power he is able to create a new world order, where the world is a now dystopian communist society. With the help of the I.T. Corp. which is a policing force bred to keep strict order and hunt down all those who threaten the society. Through years of schooling, all the way to adulthood, the I.T. corps strip humanity of all desires. He believes without desires there can be no temptation, and no temptation means no one can break the law, thus peace is created.

title: "TS Seduction" (2007) {The Live Shoot (#2.8)}
plot: The Live Shoot, Starring La Cherry Spice with Little Billy and Isis Love. This is an edited version of our first live shoot. La Cherry Spice and Isis Love played out all your fantasies as they were being requested. For those of you who missed it, enjoy.

title: "Tabatha Takes Over" (2011) {Barkingham Palace (#4.9)}
plot: Domestic partners Tee Sorge and Tania Raskin tried to translate their passion for dogs into a doggie daycare and grooming business, but they quickly learned that it wasn't as easy as they thought. Now they are on the verge of losing everything as Tabatha quickly discovers that Tania is a management nightmare who is alienating the staff and Tee has no backbone. Their arguments about how to manage the business are spilling over onto the staff.

title: "Table for 12" (2009) {Betty's Birthday (#1.1)}
plot: It's Betty's birthday at the Hayes' house and Eric sends her out for a day at the spa. While Betty's gone, Eric tries to supervise and maintain order over the ten children as they attempt to make a giant card and bake a cake for their mother.

title: "Taboo" (2002) {The Third Sex (#5.10)}
plot: There are not only two genders any more. In India Hijras have their male genitals removed, dress as women and consider themselves genderless. In Indonesia, a community of people recognizes five genders. In Albania, a woman became a sworn virgin, choosing to live as a man in order to have the same rights as men.

title: "Taggart" (1983) {Double Jeopardy (#4.3)}
plot: The body of Rowena Bain is discovered in a wood. The forensic evidence suggests suicide, but Taggart is suspicious. The victim's sister thinks that Rowena's husband, Maurice, killed her. The case against Maurice grows when it is discovered that his first wife also disappeared in mysterious circumstances.

title: "Tainted Love" (2011) {All the Same (#1.10)}
plot: Every story different, but very much the same. An Indian sex trafficking victim tells of her ordeal and how she was fooled into thinking it would be something much different. Experts Bradley Myles and Alexandra Gelber comment on this all too common occurrence.

title: "Tajemnica twierdzy szyfrów" (2007) {(#1.1)}
plot: March 1945. Captain Johann Jorg working in Jelenia Gora, a secret service's agent takes the picture of a convey with a new type missile. Pursued by the convoy's guards escapes with jumping to the lake. Wounded man reaches the liaison officer's house where he passes her the pictures. Nazis transport the scrambler to the Tschocha Castle near Jelenia Gora.

title: "Take a Chance" (1950)
plot: Each contestant starts with $5 which they can take and run, or they can bet it on the next question. If they answer correctly, they can then bet on the next question. Some of the prizes were gags, others legit. If they answer five questions correctly, they get to face the jackpot question worth 1000 bars of Sweetheart soap and $1000. Actor Don Ameche hosts. Sponsor is Nestle's Nescafe coffee.

title: "TaleSpin" (1990) {Double or Nothing (#1.26)}
plot: Baloo's favorite record gets smashed and it turns out there's only one more record like it in the entire world and it's priced at $100. The problem is that his little buddy Kit only has $50 to lend him. Rather than work for the other $50, Baloo promises to turn Kit's money into a fortune the easy way, and give Kit double his money back!

title: "Tales from the Crypt" (1989) {Came the Dawn (#5.10)}
plot: Roger a rich businessman notices the beautiful seductress Norma at the side of the road as he drives to his log cabin. It's pouring with rain and she's soaked through. To Roger's libidinous joy she accepts his offer of a lift. However the femme fa-tale has other ideas but little does she know that the lecherous millionaire has a very jealous and possessive wife...

title: "Tales from the Cryptkeeper" (1993) {It's for You (#3.11)}
plot: Gary is like any other 14-year old boy yearning for some privacy. When his parents give him a new phone for Christmas with his own private line, Gary is ecstatic. Ignoring his parents warning that he is not permitted to make prank phone calls, Gary and his friend Steve think of all sorts of pranks to pull with his new phone.

title: "Tales of Tomorrow" (1951) {The Crystal Egg (#1.9)}
plot: A crystal egg reveals live tableaux of the planet Mars. A 19th Century scientist is obsessed with investigating the crystal, but the antique shop owner who came across the seemingly worthless glass hopes to sell it ASAP to a tall, insistent stranger, for whom no price is too dear. The delay while the scientist experiments on the egg makes the buyer even more desperate.

title: "Tales of Wells Fargo" (1957) {Rifles for Red Hand (#5.33)}
plot: In the sixth, of only six episodes, directed by 'William Witney' (qv))in this series, Captain Rawlings ('Carleton G. Young' (qv)), of the U.S. Calvary, asks Jim Hardie ('Dale Robertson (I)' (qv))to find out if a woman operating a gambling casino,Leah Harper ('Ziva Rodann' (qv)), is shipping illegal guns to the Indians via Wells Fargo.

title: "Tales of Wells Fargo" (1957) {Two Cartridges (#2.2)}
plot: A stage is held up by a lone outlaw, Al Porter, which is carrying a strongbox with $10,000 in it. The shotgun takes a shot at the outlaw but is instead wounded in the shoulder by a single return shot. The stage continues to town where Jim Hardie is waiting with the depot agent for it. Upon learning it was robbed, he decides to go alone after the robber as a posse would be seen. About four hours behind the robber he finds his trail which was not well hidden. Shortly after finding the empty strongbox, he comes upon the robber camping after having picked up a second horse. Porter may be green but he is a thinker and refuses to give up trying to escape. However, Porter stirred up the local Sioux when he stole the second horse from them. He and Hardie are now trapped with little ammo.

title: "Tales of the Texas Rangers" (1955) {The Kid from Amarillo (#2.9)}
plot: The Texas Rangers are asked to help after two federal agents are killed investigating silver smuggling along the Mexican border. While Ranger Pearson tracks the progress of a chain gang building a road from no place to nowhere, Ranger Morgan goes undercover as a boxer to get closer to the man suspected of being the ringleader of the smugglers.

title: "Tales of the Unexpected" (1979) {Pattern of Guilt (#5.8)}
plot: Keith Briscoe is a police doctor who is involved with the case of a serial killer who murders women and leaves clues at the scene of the crime. He is anxious to divorce his second wife Elaine in order to get back to Faye, the wife he left for Elaine but Elaine is not going to give him a divorce. Maybe the facts that he has learnt whilst working on the case can provide him with a means to an end.

title: "Tales of the Unexpected" (1979) {Youth from Vienna (#6.13)}
plot: Television interviewer Caroline Coates is promoted to being her station's news anchorwoman and is anxious to look her very best. Dr. Humphrey Baxter, a brilliant scientist, is working on a formula, to be marketed as 'Youth From Vienna', to stop the ageing process. Caroline, however, whilst happy to make use of Humphrey, sees the younger, better-looking Alan Brodie as a fitter partner. Humphrey is obviously unhappy at this and forces Caroline to make an unforeseen decision.

title: "Tallahassee 7000" (1961) {Bootleg Whiskey in the Everglades (#1.19)}
plot: Rogers goes undercover in prison to gain the confidence of a prisoner with inside knowledge of a bootlegging ring. With the acquiescence of the jail's authorities Rogers leads a jailbreak, hoping his new-found partner will lead him to the gang's headquarters.

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {(#1.130)}
plot: Kwong San tries to bring up the topic of his will again but Bee Li gets upset - she doesn't understand why he must talk about this 'inauspicious stuff' (at least to her) right on Christmas day. Melissa gets discharged from the hospital but things do not get any easier for Xue Ling and Adam as the week's pent-up frustrations result in a big argument between both of them. Meantime, Arjun is stuck in TCH after going along with another of Ann's fake dates. To kill time, he hangs up with Chris and both of them bond over a game of darts.

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {(#1.192)}
plot: After Melissa and Adam fail to return home, Kwong San takes it out on Xue Ling, chiding her for not making her marriage and family a priority. He goes one step further and gets Xue Ling to hand over all the work stuff to Jay. And as part of his elaborate plan to break up Xue Ling and Adam, Peter Tay introduces to divorce lawyer to Xue Ling. Nadiah thinks the reason why Wafiq broke up with her is because of Yasmine, and a guilty conscious Wafiq is somewhat 'happy' that Nadiah feels that way.

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {(#1.25)}
plot: Despite his resistance, Diana accompanies Arjun to his dinner gathering with his high-class friends, and to her horror ends up paying equal share, even though she consciously orders the cheapest item on the menu. Li Yan is still very much against their relationship, somehow agreeing with Meera and citing the difference in their family background as the main divisive factor. Jay commiserates with Li Yan and they grow closer. Meanwhile, in the coffee house, a mysterious female voyeur emerges. Over at KS foods, Xue Ling and Wafiq are tasked by Kwong San to woo this potential investor, Peter Tay, whose arrogant and demanding style sends them into a tailspin. In the meantime, Sulaiman and Norleena's supposed sex problem becomes the gossip of the day at the coffee house, putting Salmah in the middle of the couple crossfire.

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {(#1.306)}
plot: Chris is discharged from hospital, but more problems await him at work. Dhevan refuses to return his money and Chris is saddled with the health supplements. To make things worse, he's defeated in the MMA ring by a most unlikely opponent. Ben and Li Yan urge Diana to make the first move and apologise to Kwong San and resolve their disagreements amicably before they leave for the trip. In Taiwan, Diana notes the tension between Adam and Xue Ling, and tries to get Adam to open up about what's been bothering him. Will it be a free and easy holiday for the Lims and Diana in Taiwan or will tempers flare?

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {(#1.367)}
plot: Excitement abound as Pam and Shruti head for the chalet. However, Pam's mood dips when Mark turns up at the chalet. The rift between the two deepens when Pam rejects Mark's apology. Over at the Lims, Bee Li is put in a spot when she is appointed to host this year's TLC Christmas Party and tries to rally the family to help.

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {(#1.48)}
plot: Bhaskar seeks the help of Li Yan and Salmah to help Meera part-take in some outside activities so she wouldn't be cooped up at home and start overthinking with her idle mind. The ladies then join up with the Tanglin Ladies Circle group helmed by Bee Li. Eddie gets worried and guilty when he thinks it's him who caused Mrs Pereira's meltdown because of that unexpected social-escort date. And Meera gets really upset again when she finds out that Bhaskar actually went for lunch with Rachelle but he told her he went for a meeting.

title: "Tanglin" (2015) {Episode 365 (#1.365)}
plot: Ben is distraught and is an emotional mess after finding out that he isn't Grace's biological father. Meanwhile, Li Yan blames herself for pushing Ben to accept Vanessa and Grace, and Gina can't help but feel guilty about confronting Vanessa at the wedding. She thinks that could have triggered Vanessa to run away from Ben. Pam gets angry when she runs into Eddie and Michael talking to Mark. She is disappointed that they are still hanging out. To appease her, Eddie and Michael have no choice but to come up with an explanation on why they can't totally ignore Mark.

title: "Tanked" (2011) {Tracy and His Octopus (#3.27)}
plot: Funnyman Tracy Morgan was so impressed by his ATM shark tank that he's coming back for round two! This time, it's a new home for his beloved octopus. To get this tank installed on time, Brett and Wayde will have to move in with Tracy for a few days!

title: "Tara Duncan" (2010) {The Four Parchments (#1.17)}
plot: Tara, Cal and Sparrow have got their hands full with Selenba, who is back again, trying to gain control of the transfer portals. This time around, Fafnir, staying over at the Manor in the throes of a personal crisis (she wants to return home to Otherworld!), is the one that will get the young Spellbinders out of trouble as she is the only one who has the power to walk through walls.

title: "Tashi" (2014) {Attack of the Mummies! (#1.47)}
plot: When Tashi and Jack discover an ancient amulet in a tomb, they awaken the sleeping mummies and are chased back to the village. The amulet is stolen by the Baron to control the mummies and power the village with electricity. Will Tashi and Jack be able to put the mummies back to rest?

title: "Taste for Adventure" (2006) {King Pacific Lodge (#1.2)}
plot: Just south of the Alaskan panhandle, British Columbia's North Coast is a maze of forested islands and winding sea channels, with little evidence of human development to be seen for hundreds of miles. Every summer, the King Pacific Lodge is floated by tugboat through this wilderness and moored to an island inhabited only by black bears and bald eagles. With no roads to the lodge, host Chris Turner instead takes a floatplane to the front door, and sets up base camp for a few days of adventure and good eating! First up is a hike through the surrounding rainforest, where wild berries and mushrooms line the established bear paths. The old-growth trees here can exceed 1500 years in age. A kayak excursion to neighboring Campania Sound is next, where Chris and his guide keep a lookout for orcas and Dall porpoise. The lodge's chef, Jonathan Chovancek, has his own ideas of exploration that involve wading, knee-deep, into tidepools and giving Chris his first taste of sea urchin, directly from the ocean. Back at the lodge, Chef uses urchin to finish his salmon soup, which is enhanced by edamame and alaria seaweed.

title: "Tatort" (1970) {Preis des Lebens (#1.959)}
plot: A rapist and murderer is released from prison after having served his term of 15 years. The day after, he is found murdered in a trash bin. The two commissars in Stuttgart know where to look for suspects: im the parents of Mareike, whom the murder victim abducted, abused and killed so many years ago.

title: "Taxi Orange" (2000)
plot: 13 strangers live in a house in Vienna. They have to lead a taxi company, and may use the money they earn with that. Except of that, they have no contact with the rest of the world (no newspapers, no TV, no radio). Every week one of the residents is voted off by a fellow resident, who was voted as winner of the week by the audience. The last one to remain in the house wins 1.000.000,-- ATS.

title: "Tea & Coffee" (2011) {Tea & Coffee: Part II (#1.2)}
plot: When Tea comes under the scrutiny of his inner-twins, he is drawn into a confrontation with the one creature that has always stopped him from his ultimate creative identity. Will he welcome their combined strength or will he go deeper into his secret chamber of recluse? Meanwhile, Coffee finds that all his well laid plans have fallen into wreckage as comes face to face with the opportunity of a lifetime. Will his inner-child be able to save him from the unexpected career vortex that now threatens to swallow his ego? Two creative brains at the crossroads of decision. Starring Emmy Award winning film maker/musician, CHRIS RUTUSHIN and Pop Artist/indie comics legend, CHRIS YAMBAR. When Tea comes under the scrutiny of his inner-twins, he is drawn into a confrontation with the one creature that has always stopped him from his ultimate creative identity. Will he welcome their combined strength or will he go deeper into his secret chamber of recluse? Meanwhile, Coffee finds that all his well laid plans have fallen into wreckage as comes face to face with the

title: "Teacup Travels" (2015) {Ear Ornament (#2.7)}
plot: Great Aunt Lizzie tells the story of Charlotte and the Adventure of the Ear Ornaments. Charlotte meets a mathematician named Ho who teaches her how to count in Mayan. But while Ho may be brilliant at Maths, Charlotte discovers when it comes to Lacha, his favourite person in the whole world, he has miscalculated the date of her birthday. Ho needs to find a present for Lacha and Charlotte goes on an epic quest to help.

title: "Teatro de siempre" (1966) {La comedia de las equivocaciones}
plot: Aegeon of Syracuse has come to Ephesus to seek his son, who went in search of his missing twin and mother months ago. Unfortunately, Ephesus has just declared war on Syracuse, and will instantly put to death any Syracusean found within their borders unless a ransom's paid. Meanwhile, the son, Antipholus, and his servant, Dromio (also an identical twin), keep running into strangers who seem to know them...

title: "Teen Mom" (2009) {For the Best (#4.11)}
plot: Bentley's birthday leads to a blowout between Maci and Ryan. Farrah spends time with Sophia before saying goodbye for a month. Amber and Gary come up with a custody plan for Leah. Catelynn and Tyler help their parents cope.

title: "Teen Titans" (2003) {Kole (#5.6)}
plot: The Titans find Dr Light trying to increase his powers by tapping into the Aurora Borealis. But his equipment can't handle the power and he flees, and falls through a hole. The Titans chase him into a prehistoric world where they encounter Kole, a girl with the ability to change into crystal, and her companion. Dr Light wants to use Kole to tap into the Aurora Borealis.

title: "Teenage Kicks" (2008)
plot: During the last two decades, aging punk rocker Vernon, has spent much of his time in the pub whilst living off his high-flying wife! Now, following a particularly nasty divorce, middle-aged divorcée Vernon moves into the student accommodation with his teenage kids, much to their disgust and dismay, in order to carry on living his rebellious (so he thinks) lifestyle.

title: "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" (1987) {The Turtles and the Hare (#4.27)}
plot: The Turtles travel to a FairyTale Dimension in an attempt to save the city from Shredder's Docilizer, while also making friends with a local citizen of that dimension, Hokum Hare (based on the Hare character from "The Tortoise and the Hare").

title: "Telephone Time" (1956)
plot: Between 1956 and September 1957, this filmed show featured plays by John Nesbitt, the host of the show. Starting in September 1957, plays by other authors were presented.

title: "Temple Talk" (2014) {Happy Holidays (#2.3)}
plot: In the last Temple Talk of the Fall semester, the hosts go over Thanksgiving and other upcoming holidays, including what to wear, what to do, and other holiday tips. New movie releases are also covered, and later, Temple Talk leaves the studio to speak to students on campus about their holiday plans and resolutions for next year. Then, special guest Gary Clark from Temple's Diamond Marching Band joins the hosts to share some of the pretty amazing experiences he's had lately. The Marching Band has been on a roll recently, having appeared in the movie Wolf of Wall Street and in Rolling Stone magazine, among other things. Through this exposure, Gary got the chance to appear in the new film adaptation of the musical Annie. Gary walks us through the whole experience and explains what he thinks has allowed the Diamond Marching Band to get so much attention. Finally, Temple Bhangra performs live on the set. Bhangra means "explosion of joy," which is evident in the dance moves. It is a form of folk dance that originated in the Punjab region of northern India and is traditional when celebrating the harvest and sometimes marriages.

title: "Tenko" (1981) {(#2.5)}
plot: The women are split over whether Dorothy should have the termination she desires though Sister Ulrica breaks her penance of silence to console her,which she appreciates. Verna guesses and borrows money from Hasan to pay May,a local abortionist,to do the necessary,helped by Dr. Mason. The new district commander arrives, Yamauchi, now a major,who replaces Nakamura with Sato. Sister Ulrica confesses to the visiting priest how she broke her penance and is transferred to a convent to remove the temptation of involvement with worldly matters. All the women are sad at her departure.

title: "Terapie" (2011) {Dita - týden první (#1.5)}
plot: The fifth episode is set in a place different from the preceding ones and the protagonist's role is completely reversed. Marek visits in an old tenement house his former colleague, Dita (Kamila Magálová) for whom he once worked as assistant and then parted company with her professionally. The widowed psychologist is retired and is writing a study related to her late husband Ivan. Marek recapitulates the cases that he is working on with his clients and intimates some doubts about his own procedures. He complains to Dita about his lack of patience and a loss of the necessary self-confidence. She questions him about his real relationship with Sandra. During the talk, in which their past disagreements re-emerge, he contemplates some more general problems faced by psychotherapists. Marek confesses to her about the disagreements with his daughter and the fact that his marriage is going through a serious crisis.

title: "Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles" (2008) {Pilot (#1.1)}
plot: Sarah Connor and her son John have been living peacefully in the same community for two years. It is now 1999 and Sarah begins to feel uncomfortable when her boyfriend, Charley Dixon, proposes. Having relocated to Red Valley, New Mexico John finds school an adjustment but a pretty classmate, Cameron Phillips, shows an interest. When a Terminator shows up to kill John, Cameron reveals a surprising secret about herself and a way for the Connors to disappear completely.

title: "Terra X - Rätsel alter Weltkulturen" (1982) {Der Super-Wall - Chinas grosse Mauer - Teil 1 (#26.23)}
plot: The Great Wall, only partially preserved, is today's icon of China. It was built by the Han dynasty (2th c. BC) from their capital Chang-An against the northern nomadic barbarians, then the Hsiang-Nu, previously paid off or given Chinese princess bride to spare China and the Silk road their incursions. To spare the Confucian mandarins-administrated empire this humiliation, cavalry and mobile tactics were successfully adopted to repel the barbarians. Now a northern fortification was needed, a daunting drain even on its vast resources requiring massive forced labor and immigration (about 2 million) to support laborers and garrisons. In fact it was only one of many non-continuous, even shifted wall projects against various threats, as from Mongolia. Even serving on the wall was so bitter many defected, and its military purpose failed utterly. In fact the effort remained a net weakening.

title: "Terra X - Rätsel alter Weltkulturen" (1982) {Goldrausch am Yukon}
plot: In 1897 the Yukon territory (Canada) gold-rush peeked after huge deposits of nuggets were found in Klondyke river, near Alaska. Thousands of poor people hastily went there, even if many had to sell about all they owned for voyage and equipment. The land routes being inhumanely severe, river boats were built rapidly, many of which stranded in the rapids, earning their owners either a fortune or ruin.

title: "Terra X - Rätsel alter Weltkulturen" (1982) {Supertiere 2 - Wilde Tiere (#31.4)}
plot: Evolution's main invention was sexual reproduction, to create a sophisticated, dynamic genes pool. It requires partner selection, for which species use endlessly varied methods. Most have mating criteria to indicate the fittest males, such as anatomic features, dancing and other rituals, nest building or courting gifts. Some raise the stakes by giving the top male exclusivity in a harem and/or make mating rights with several females dependent on fights between rival males. Like in human cultures, there exit form of monogamy, polygamy and even infidelity.

title: "Terror Twinz" (2006) {First Day (#1.1)}
plot: It's Rebbeca's and Jason's first day, and the're both trying to make a friend, Rebbeca is trying to be best friends with the most popular girl in the school, Gabriella, and Jason makes friend with Ben, and they both have a big obbsesion over Horrid Henry

title: "Terry and June" (1979) {The Family Way (#9.7)}
plot: When June's new cleaning lady, nosey Mrs. Bunce, hears her talking to her daughter Wendy, who is pregnant, Mrs. Bunce's gossip leads to people believing that it is June who is in the family way. To add to the confusion Terry's pet goldfish is also revealed to be pregnant, leading to general misunderstandings before the truth is revealed.

title: "Texaco Star Theatre Starring Milton Berle" (1948) {(#1.24)}
plot: Berle welcomes singer Ella Logan, comic Red Buttons, magician Russell Swan, comics the Arnaut Brothers, and acrobat/dancers the Crackerjacks. Logan sings "Sunny Side of the Street" and "Little Bit of Heaven." In a sketch, Buttons tries to get money from loan shark Berle. Milton begs out of magician Swan's guillotine act.

title: "Texaco Star Theatre Starring Milton Berle" (1948) {(#5.2)}
plot: Berle's guests this week include singer/dancer Carmen Miranda, actors Gregory Ratoff, Roland Winters, and Jack Collins, comic Gene Baylos, comic actors Ruth Gilbert and Cliff Norton, hillbilly singer "Texas" Jean Valli, Bobby Sherwood, Phyllis Goodkind, and child actor David Winters.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.117)}
plot: Iris thought she should keep her dinner date with Elliot. Reena announced her engagement to Striker and Vicky. When Vicky wondered if Reena accepted Max's marriage proposal to spite Justin, Reena accused her mother of not wanting her to be happy. Vicky insisted to Reena that she never intended to hurt Striker. Kate feared that Ginny could never rebuild her life with Barrett. Barrett went to receive sodium pentothol to help him recall repressed memories. Reena and Max set a wedding date. Iris met with Elliot and lied that she has to sail back to Houston for more hospital tests with Kevin.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.171)}
plot: Barrett bars Ginny from going into Houston for lunch with Reena. Reena tells Vicky that she loves Max but isn't sure she can live with him. Jim and Pete discuss a secret shipment that Alex can't ever know about. Kate encourages Max to give in a little where Reena's concerned. Jim backs Elena's demo tape. Ginny meets Reena for lunch but is watched by Barrett. Elena tells Billy Joe that she's being watched at the trailer. Later they learn that Bernie has returned to Houston. Barrett loses his temper with Steve. Max takes Reena home and to bed. Barrett lies to Ginny that he never left ranch today.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.225)}
plot: Dennis is released from jail, and Elliot breaks the news that his real father is Alex. Reena cautions Iris to never trust Justin. Nita defends Billy Joe to Joe, but Elena begins to believe that Billy Joe has Bernie's money. Dennis assures Elliot that he will always be his father. Vicky counsels Reena about her life with Max and their future with children. Dennis asserts that he still loves Paige but doesn't know how to begin rebuilding their life together. Elliot lectures Iris to butt out of Dennis' marriage. Nita remembers the lumpy mattress and tells Joe that the money must be hidden it. Joe phones for medical help, kidnaps Elena, and leaves Nita behind.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.28)}
plot: Terry told Rikki that Alex plans to offer him a job after he's released from the hospital. Justin wanted Iris to help him find out whether or not Alex owns the Top of the World. Dennis decided to to Mac to get the money he needs to buy Western Art. Ryan confided in Ginny his plan to uncover the sheik's killer. A drunken Vicky wailed to Sam that Striker somehow found out about the affair. Max confronted Justin.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.333)}
plot: Lurlene's grandfather goes missing. Brette visits the Marshall ranch and meets Lurlene. T.J. talks to Ashley about working at Marshall Oil. Justin becomes jealous of T.J.'s presence in Ashley's life. Ashley lets Paige know that Iris was responsible for reuniting her and Justin. Brette wanders around the Marshall property and finds a dead body. Ashley encourages Justin to speak with T.J. about working together. Kate breaks the news to Lurlene that the body found was her granddaddy, and he had $15,000 on him. T.J. informs Reena that he's leaving World Oil to work for Justin. Bubba raids Ashley's files.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.388)}
plot: Rikki plays dead in the morgue. Myles is on a stakeout of Ruby and Lurlene's apartment. After the men leave, a horrified Rikki finds Beau's decayed body. T.J. and Justin recognize that Ashley is upset and hiding something. Myles breaks in to Ruby and Lurlene's apartment while they're at The Coop. Rikki confides in Brette that the body in the morgue is definitely not Myles, then explains its grotesque condition. Myles searches the apartment and finally finds the Fire Compass. Before he can leave, Gretchen enters the apartment with a gun and shoots Myles.

title: "Texas" (1980) {(#1.60)}
plot: Ginny decided to go find Jeb who won't answer her phone calls. Maggie urged Nita to have a pregnancy test before telling Billy Joe that she might be pregnant. Elena came close to making a confession to dawn about Billy Joe. Dennis and Elliot made up for lost time as father and son. Kate suggested that Courtney accompany Ginny on her trip to check on Jeb. Alex was frantic to find Iris after realizing that Dennis could be his son.

title: "That '70s Show" (1998) {Baby Fever (#3.7)}
plot: When Kelso finds Jackie has used his beloved van to give another boy a ride and badly damaged his prize possession, he demands damages, but snake Hyde 'calculates' he is only entitled to $65, his ex however is awarded over $8,000 for all kinds of 'expenses' she invested in their former affair by her own choice plus accidental damages as in the party fire. Kitty is enchanted by a friend's baby which Laurie promised while drunk to mind; to Red's horror, her maternal instinct flares realizing her biological clock is ticking fast, till he cures her by an alternative he doesn't prefer at second thought: grandchildren... Kelso demands money from Jackie for smashing his van. Laurie must babysit for a friend of Kitty's; seeing a baby around the house makes Kitty think she might like to have another one. Eric gets in trouble by assuming Donna plans to be a stay-at-home mom if and when they have kids.

title: "That '70s Show" (1998) {Hyde's Father (#3.3)}
plot: When the basement boys use fake IDs to drink alcohol, Hyde recognizes barman Bud: his dad, who abandoned his ma and him and hasn't even phoned since he returned a year ago. Kitty is determined to bring them together, despite Red -who has to put up with Leo too- and bitter Steven himself. After a while, the Hydes decide to live together... Donna is cool about Playboys in the basement, but makes a girlish fuzz about Eric still having some in his room. Fez goes by the book (Playboy again) to seduce Jackie, but that's the wrong target. As Hyde takes the gang out for a drink, they learn the bartender is actually Hydes biological father. Hyde struggles to forgive him for abandoning him, but decides to take the extra room. While all this is going on, Donna also struggles with the fact Eric has pornographic magazines hidden underneath his bed.

title: "That '70s Show" (1998) {Sally Simpson (#6.12)}
plot: Kelso introduces a fellow police cadet to the gang, a tomboy named Suzy Simpson. Comedy ensues when Kelso tries to set up a date between Suzy and Fez. Kitty becomes defensive when a stress management specialist visits Red.

title: "That '70s Show" (1998) {Won't Get Fooled Again (#6.13)}
plot: Fez shooting a bunny turned police cadet Suzy off completely, she only wants to hurt people. Fez blames his poor mate and failing cupid Kelso, who tries to wait patiently and brings peace offerings, but gets them thrown back (in words, two are kept as Jackie advised as part of ruthless revenge) so now Michael gets mad at him too. Donna's late period makes her and Eric believe she's pregnant; he panics worst and blabs to Kitty, who first suggested they move, then promises not to tell but writes it down for Red and Bob, who only suggests to pass the baby for Donna's sister. After Donna gets worked up because Eric said she had to give up her career, it turns out to be a false alert. Suzy tricks Kelso and Fez to meet 'with her', then too much truth from each of them proves to be- good in an unexpected way...

title: "That Girl" (1966) {Kimono My House (#1.19)}
plot: Because of the pigsty that is Don's apartment, Ann feels he should hire a maid. As Don seems not to want one, Ann goes behind his back and hires one for him anyway through an agency. Not having the will to fight Ann, Don ultimately gives in at least for the one week trial basis. His maid ends up being Miko Yamagata, a young, proper and beautiful Japanese woman. Don is enthralled with her, which makes Ann a bit jealous. But their situation runs into a snag when Don and Ann learn that Ann actually requested a live-in maid. Beyond the short term issue of where Miko is going to stay, Ann goes through mixed emotions concerning Miko when first she learns that Miko needs a steady job or an American husband to stay in the United States, second she learns that someone named George is coming from Japan in a week's time (George who Ann and Don believe is Miko's fiancé), third she learns that George is actually Miko's brother, and fourth and finally Miko states she's found an American to marry, which Ann believes is Don. Ann's roller coaster of emotions will end only when she learns conclusively of Miko's stay in America plan.

title: "That Girl" (1966) {The Night They Raided Daddy's (#4.21)}
plot: Ann's father is at home on a Saturday night, which should be the busiest night at the restaurant. Lew's talk about retirement further shocks Ann since the restaurant is his life. Ann and Donald go to the restaurant to speak to Lew's longtime maitre d' Harry to see if anything is the matter with Lew. What they find out is that the restaurant is nearly empty, a situation that has been in existence for the past half year, while one of their rivals, Tony's, which doesn't have nearly the quality of food as La Parisienne, has to turn customers away. It's because Tony's has a hip, young vibe punctuated by the live rock music, as opposed to the staid saxophone/accordion combo playing at La Parisienne. Ann wants to try and help her father by convincing him to update La Parisienne by hiring a rock combo of his own, but she wants for him to think it was his own idea. With advice from Donald and Ann on the specific group, Lew does hire the Blue Boys, the least offensive group to his own sensibilities. The Blue Boys do end up changing La Parisienne's fortunes, but that may be short-lived based on the surprise finale they have in store.

title: "That's Gotta Hurt" (2007) {Medical Mysteries}
plot: Rio Grand Gorge, New Mexico: A BASE jumper opens his chute too late; London, Ontario: A woman has an ectopic pregnancy; Northampton, Pennsylvania: A man loses his balance and finds himself impaled on a horseshoe stake; Crystal, Minnesota: A snow tuber lands on the back of her neck; Dallas, Texas: A man swallows a piece of wire that becomes embedded in his heart; Ketchum, Idaho: A vet operates on a python that has swallowed an electric blanket.

title: "That's So Weird!" (2009) {Drool Aid}
plot: A new beverage sensation hits Weird - Drool Aid, the fruity drink you make from your own spit. Yum! We visit the local mall food court where a giant seagull has taken up residence and Adamo Ruggerio from YTV's The Next Star is found wandering the halls of Depressi High.

title: "The 101" (2015/II) {Leaving the Nest 101 (#1.1)}
plot: Leaving the Nest 101 (the pilot episode) follows Royal as she moves to LA for college. Problems occur when she gets offered a management contract, but he wants his 17 year old problem client to move in. Now she must decide whether to take her in and start her own path to success or pass on the opportunity and stay on the straight and narrow.

title: "The 3 Minute Update" (2012) {August 31, 2013 (#2.243)}
plot: HOLLYWOOD- Justin Timberlake accepted the Video Vanguard Award at the MTV Video Music Awards! Lady Gaga has announced her eagerly anticipated comeback concert will feature a surprise guest! Plus Miley Cyrus' performance at the MTV Video Music Awards has been slammed by fans and critics alike. SPORTS- Kevin Kolb, quarterback for the Buffalo Bills, suffers a severe concussion. New York Yankees star second baseman, Robinson Cano, was hit in the left hand by a J.A. Happ pitch. Plus New York Jets quarterback Mark Sanchez suffered a bruised throwing shoulder! BUSINESS- Shares of Tesla rose 3.9% to $168.07 a share! Javier Martin-Artajo, the JPMorgan employee involved in the "London Whale" scandal is not willing to be extradited to America. Plus TiVo announced a subscription growth of 33% this past quarter. FASHION- Shares of Tesla rose 3.9% to $168.07 a share! Javier Martin-Artajo, the JPMorgan employee involved in the "London Whale" scandal is not willing to be extradited to America. Plus TiVo announced a subscription growth of 33% this past quarter. TECHNOLOGY- Sirius XM has been sued over alleged underpayment of digital royalties. Plus a new app for iOS named Pounce allows shoppers to take pictures of items they see in print with their iPhone, and then will be offered the option of buying the product online through its retailer. GAMING- SAINTS ROW 4 is now available on Xbox 360, PS3 and PC. Konami has announced it will reissue CASTLEVANIA: LORDS OF SHADOW - MIRROR OF FATE HD. Plus DARK SOULS II has a beta headed to gamers this fall!

title: "The 3 Minute Update" (2012) {July 16, 2013 (#2.196)}
plot: HOLLYWOOD UPDATE- J-Biebs has been caught red, white, and blue handed after a photo surfaced of the pop star cradling a beer July 4th! Plus it certainly is a "Thriller" to now know that Michael Jackson could have been a billionaire had he lived to tour the globe! SPORTS UPDATE- Metta World Peace has joined the New York Knicks after being amnestied by the Los Angeles Lakers! Chicago Bulls guard Derrick Rose is ready to get back to work after an entire season of being injured. Also, The Oakland Raiders are trying to get a new 50,000-person stadium built! TECHNOLOGY UPDATE- Apple fans have to wait a little longer for the next generation iPad Mini. Find out who is the new addition to Hewlett-Packard's board of directors! Also, Radiohead has taken their music off of music streaming websites! GAMING UPDATE- Find out which games caught the most attention during this year's E3 conference! Plus, XBox signature game series, Halo, is bringing the Champions bundle to Halo 4 for only 800 Microsoft Points. Gamers should expect a greater amount of freedom in the upcoming DARK SOULS 2!

title: "The 3 Minute Update" (2012) {October 8, 2013 (#2.281)}
plot: HOLLYWOOD- Halle Berry welcomes son Maceo Robert Martinez! Britney says no drinks for you, B**CH. Is Justin Bieber getting Ariana Grande into drugs? International Emmy nominations announced! SPORTS- Michael Vick out with hamstring injury. USC deals with its coach impersonations. Oakland Raiders release Matt Flynn. BUSINESS- Boeing reels from multi-billion dollar deal with Japan Airlines. Xerox investigates Affiliated Computer Services for accounting injustices. Robert Zoellick to join Goldman Sachs! Alcatel-Lucent plans to cut 10,000 jobs. FASHION- Lacoste crocodile to appear on a new line of boxers and briefs. Christie Brinkley to team up with HairUWear for wig and extension line. New York to host Kid's Fashion Week! TECHNOLOGY- German trade union threatens holiday strike for Amazon. Samsung vies for presidential veto on ban of imported devices. New organization, Alliance for Affordable Internet, announced by Google. GAMING- Beyond: Two Souls available on iOS and Android! Disney buy-out kills Day of the Tentacle remake. Milestone Games has announces MXGP- The Official Motocross Videogame.

title: "The 50 Greatest Moments at Madison Square Garden" (2006) {Moments #40 to #36 (#1.3)}
plot: Moment #40 1994 NHL All Star Game Mike Richter MVP. Moment #39 1983 Millrose Games Best of including Mary Decker & Carl Lewis. Moment #38 1993 Ewing becomes Knicks' all-time leading scorer. Moment #37 2006 Billy Joel's record-breaking 12 sold-out shows. Moment #36 1994 Reggie Miller's dramatic games vs the Knicks.

title: "The A-List: New York" (2010) {Cattiness on the Catwalk (#2.5)}
plot: Ryan enlists the A-Listers to walk in his runway show, but with Austin in the same room as Derek & Nyasha, the real show ends up backstage. Shifting alliances & unexpected betrayals cast Austin out of his social circle and onto a path to self-destruction.

title: "The A-Team" (1983) {Showdown! (#3.9)}
plot: Captain Winnetka's Wild West Show is being terrorized by a trio of A-Team impostors. The real Team decides to go find out what all the bad press is about. Colonel Lynch has one last chance to catch the A-Team and is expecting them to show up. Therefore, Hannibal joins the circus in disguise as Rufus Cantrell, Murdock as Indian warrior 'Runnin Round, Face as a rodeo clown and B.A. as a shoveler. Meanwhile, Murdock is upset at not being seen as an actual member of the A-Team by the press, nor the impostors.

title: "The ABCs of Online Dating" (2014) {Together (#1.1)}
plot: After a sudden breakup, Cara decides that she is going to take her love life into her own hands and join an online dating website. But she doesn't want to do it alone....so she candidly talks her two roommates, Ava and Bree, into joining the site with her. A great bonding experience or a recipe for disaster?

title: "The Addams Family" (1964) {Amnesia in the Addams Family (#1.22)}
