He stays calm, because he can see Femke is stressed out. When a client calls to cancel his deliveries, because the delivery was late yesterday and the fact she hired a Moroccan, she goes totally overboard. Youssef tries to comfort her. He also informs Sam about the situation. Kasper is finally allowed to go with his moped to school. Nona finds his moped too slow and when school is out, she goes with Jimmy who has a faster moped. Yvette is disappointed, because she and Simonne lost last night with cards. She thinks she had a better chance with Mo, but he was with Aisha. Jenny gets a package, but is afraid to open it. Finally Victor opens it and finds a ruby inside. Is it false or genuine and where does it come from?

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#12.57)}
plot: Lawyer Karin Baert meets up with Frank in his hide-out and discusses his options. It doesn't look good. Aisha goes to Kasper's school and tells the headmaster about the bullying. Kasper denies everything and he wants her to leave him alone. Marie her neck hurts from the stress and Luc gives her massage. Waldek goes to see a osteopath and feels a lot better afterward. Simonne tells Cois it's over between her and Mo, but later that evening Mo comes to see her and he stays the night on the couch. Nancy goes half drunk to Marianne and wants to talk to her.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#13.111)}
plot: Everyone is still very much impressed with Sandrine's sudden death. And the bad news travels fast. Odette blames herself, because she thinks she caused the most stress for her and that's why she died. Now she didn't just take Geert's mother, but also his daughter. Marianne comforts her. It was no-ones fault. It ran in the family. No-one could foresee this could happen so fast. Marie is in tears about Sandrine. Luc tries to comfort her, but he's more busy with his money problems. Without Sandrine's input in the firm, they won't hold long anyway. He thinks it might be best to sell Marie Design, but Marie has her heart set on it. Then he thinks Marie should buy his shares, but she hasn't any money left thanks to him. She leaves him at the hotel, because she spend enough time with his ingenious plans. Marie tries to explain Mo, Waldek and Cois they're just going through a bad patch and things will pick up in a while. But when they start asking questions where Luc is and who the men where who emptied the warehouse, she breaks up in tears. Peter sold Leontien's apartment. The first one they sold together as a team. Sofie goes with a couple of potential buyers to Frank's house. When they're there, Frank warns them Franky is upstairs and he doesn't know about the sale yet, so he could be very upset. Yvette is in the living room crying, because a close relative has just died. Sofie wants to go on with the view, but the buyers think it might be best if they come back later. When they're gone, Yvette and Frank are laughing. Cois thinks he made a bad impression with Julia's daughters. Julia suggests he should cook for them. She always enjoys his cooking. He's willing to give it a try. Sonja put on different music at the Fit & Fun and she also cleaned some rooms Sam just cleaned yesterday. She thought they were still filthy. It's getting a bit too much for Sam. He can't stand her interfering anymore. When Eric tells Sam Martine was there yesterday, he is surprised. He hadn't seen her. Eric tells him that Sonja showed Martine the door.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#13.166)}
plot: Rosa and Waldek have been sick with worries and up all night, because Kasper hasn't been home. In the end Waldek finds him in the office at the container park. When he's back home, he doesn't want to talk. Mo is alone at Sanitechniek. Waldek is late and Mo thinks Cois doesn't dare to come because of Frank. Simonne is not as excited with Leo's new contract as Frank is. She thinks friendship is more important and wants Frank to make up with Cois. Leo tells Femke about his new taxi company. Marianne and Leo sign the contract for the lease of part of Ter Smissen. Aisha is still thinking about Youssef's proposal. What about her studies if she goes to Morocco? Sofie asks Aisha about Annemie. She tells her, Annemie is not particularly good at her job.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#13.44)}
plot: Frank talks to Cois about how aggressive Luc was against Leontien. Then there's a knock on the door and Luc steps in. He wants to talk to Frank at Florke's grave that afternoon and leaves immediately again. Frank goes to the cemetery, but only out of respect for Florke. Luc asks Frank why he takes the side of Leontien and Marie when, only a short while ago, he couldn't stand the two of them. Frank never listened to his side of the story. Both women stepped on Luc's heart. He has done everything to get the company for Marie and him and now Marie wants him out only because he has a little bit more of the company. And he only wants co-parenthood to Lowie, but Leontien is not open to any reason. Luc knows Frank wants Simonne back and that's why he gave him the job at Marie Design. Frank is also in the position to see his son on a regular basis, so he should feel with Luc's situation. And after all they are still brothers. Frank listens to him and decides to give Luc one final chance. But only if he swears to stop the violence and the threats. Luc swears on Florke's grave to behave himself. Luc says he always has Florke in his heart and she knows what he feels. Frank talks to Leontien and asks her to be a little more lenient to Lowie and Luc. Leontien still doesn't trust Luc, he's too clever and he might just got Frank on his feelings. But on the other hand, Luc wouldn't dare to swear on Florke's grave and then break his promise. Or would he? Victor, Rosa and Waldek haven't slept after the note Victor found. They agree not to tell Jenny. She feels good now and they will handle Marleen when it comes to it. But when will that be and what will she do? Waldek goes to her house, but she's not there. The woman next door tells him she's on vacation to Spain and if he doesn't go, she will call the police. It's clear she's on Marleen's side. Victor and Jenny go shopping, but Victor is more busy checking the surroundings than with Jenny and she notices. He still doesn't tell her about the note. Sam still wants to go through with the renovations to the loft to get it ready when Dorien moves back in. Eric and Martine still don't believe in their relationship and tell Sam to pay for the renovations himself. Ludo and Sonja also don't believe in the relationship and try to talk Dorien out of it, but it doesn't work. When Dorien is out for the first time and at the loft, the atmosphere is very tense between Eric, Martine and her. She tries to be alone with Sam for a moment to get away from them.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#13.99)}
plot: Luc and Marie don't believe that Leontien changed her identity. To prove this, Simonne shows them Leontien's last email. Now they have no choice but to believe it. To Luc there is no point to anything anymore. He will never see his son growing up and Marie Design is also doomed. Marie still wants to fight for her company. Odette calls Marianne and asks everyone over for diner before she leaves again. Geert is angry and doesn't want to go. Aisha thinks that Youssef talks far too much about Femke. He tells her, he just feels sorry for Femke. Aisha tells him that instead of always talking about it, he should do something. Angry she just leaves him standing. He doesn't understand it. Sam tells him Aisha is in love with him and that everyone already noticed that. Youssef is stunned. He had always thought of her like a sister and nothing more. Dorien tells Sam she's been very busy and was too tired to call him. She's been expressing her thoughts in her diary. She lets him read it. She thinks she's going more backwards than forwards. Sam comforts her and gives her courage. Nancy wants Femke to live with her, so she can save some money. Femke would rather sleep under a bridge. She thinks the landlord can't get her out of her house. Amber and Kasper go to the hay-loft. Kasper promises Amber he won't do anything what she doesn't want him to do. Suddenly Jenny is there, because Amber's friend is at the café and she needs to talk to her. Jenny knows what is going on and advices Kasper to get some condoms, but he's scared to buy them.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#14.152)}
plot: Kris and Waldek come back to Sanitechniek and see Bruno has brought a toilet bowl to Mo as a present. Kris sees how comfortable Mo is around Bruno. Luc teases Waldek when he notices Waldek feels left out when Mo, Kris and Bruno go back to the home to install the toilet bowl. When they're back, Mo takes Kris upstairs to calm her down, while Waldek is left with the unfinished work. Finally Kris gets good news from the home. Bruno has calmed down thanks to Mo. Femke asks Nancy to get the key from Sanitechniek, so she can search there for the money Luc hides there. Nancy asks Mo for the key, so she can lock up after she's done, but since Mo lives there, he will lock up. Peggy and Rosa finally have a good talk and Rosa promises not to interfere in her life anymore. Sam wants to go to the party at Marianne's for Eric, but Dorien has an important match tomorrow for which she has to prepare. They decide to go each other ways.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#14.30)}
plot: Femke comes in the café and sees Luc and Mike. She says hello to Luc, but not to Mike. Luc notices this and thinks Mike is not particularly Femke's favorite at this time. Mike tells him Femke is wearing his necklace, so he still has a chance. Jenny asks Femke about the necklace. With Mike present, Femke says she wants to sell it, but hasn't found the right buyer yet. Mo tells Luc, Mike tried to sell him property. Luc tells him to be very careful with Mike. He can't specifically tell him why, but he has a bad feeling about Mike and he doesn't want Mo to be cheated by Mike. Mo appreciates this and tells Luc he made a decision about a proxy for Luc. He can have one for a maximum of 5.000 EUR and one to sign deals. After Eric and Martine heard Sofie was probably seen at the coast, they want to go there and pick her up. But the police didn't say where she was seen exactly and if it's really her. That evening Geens has bad news for them. It isn't Sofie. Claire is a bit disappointed about the doctor's ball. Geert wanted to go home early, because he had a headache. Marianne and Ann think this is a bit strange, because Geert normally never has headaches. Katrien is sick at home and Jens is with her. When Julia comes in, she notices the two get along very nicely. She's also a bit sick after her night on the town with Simonne. Kasper has to say goodbye to Rosa and Waldek. It's difficult. When Nona finally shows up, she says she's not going with him, because her parents don't allow it. And since she's still a under age, she can't do anything about it. He's angry with her, but decides to go on his own. He wants to see the world. When he's gone, Waldek completely blames Peggy for the fact he lost his son. She should have left, not Kasper. And the fact she murdered her baby doesn't make it better. Than Peggy says she still has her baby.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#14.85)}
plot: It's Sofie's funeral. Afterward there is a coffee-table at Ter Smissen. Leo finds out Mike conned him out of all his money. The examining magistrate lets Mike go out on bail. Mike goes to his room at Ter Smissen, but can't find his money. He thinks Femke took it and goes in search of her. He enters the café first. Everyone is stunned to see him. Mike tells them very smug he has been released, because he's innocent. He doesn't see Femke and goes to the garage. Sam and Peter need fresh air and go outside. Peter walks over to the stables. Luc also feels he can't stay and leaves the café. Martine notices a knife is missing and goes to the kitchen to get one. Mike tries to strangle Femke when she says she doesn't know anything about his money. Someone comes in and Mike releases Femke. She falls unconscious to the floor. After Nancy heard Mike is free, she goes to the garage and finds Femke distraught on the floor and a dead Mike beside her. Martine hears noises coming from the garage and sees Nancy standing over Mike holding a knife.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#15.31)}
plot: Luc, Mo and Kris are stunned Freddy's son hasn't got MS at all, but is just a drug addict who attacked and stole from Bianca. Mo is sick of his lies, but Luc tells him they still need him. He's a good plumber. Kris is particularly very angry with Freddy, because he didn't show any respect for the ones who are really sick or handicapped. At Ter Smissen Rosa doesn't want to serve Waldek. Peggy tries to encourage him. Katrien is back from Ireland, but seems very quiet and not very enthusiastic. Paulien asks Katrien about what happened. Katrien confides in her. She did it with Tim, but it was rather disappointing. Paulien tells her the second time will be better. Julia shows her ideas to Femke. She's pleasantly surprised and wants to hire Julia.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#15.86)}
plot: Mo thought about Kris her proposal to take over his shares, but hasn't made his mind up yet. She always dreamed about a business of her own, but her father held her back on this. Mo thinks she wants his shares to get back at her father. Kris seriously thought about it and really wants the shares, but Mo thinks it's better not. Luc senses more tension between Mo and Kris. Femke thinks Els is a very interesting person, but Peter is not very happy his mother is staying with them. Paulien is very happy she had Christmas diner with her family yesterday. She tests Jens on the books he should have studied, but he knows nothing. He hasn't studied anything for the exam he has to take.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#16.140)}
plot: Freddy tries to stir things up between Luc and Waldek by asking how Peggy's doing. Waldek says he will ask Rosa, because she confides in him but Luc just wants to wait and see. Luc asks Rosa to come home, where he's prepared a fancy meal for her. While enjoying a glass of champagne and on one knee, he presents her a beautiful ring and asks her to marry him. Peggy talks to Geert again. She's very sorry she had to give up Sandrine. Bram and Franky are busy planning their adventure holiday in France but Franky asks Jens not to tell anyone and especially not Bram that he's gay. Franky is afraid he might lose his best friend. Julia's photo's turned out very well. Paulien and Katrien want to use them for a dating site, but Julia keeps having doubts about that. Peter tells Nina he's going to sell the loft for Femke. Nina asks if it didn't feel strange to be in the same room with Femke after all that happened. He says it didn't and that he just wants to look at the future with her. Femke closes up the Noorderzon when she notices someone is still there. It's Rafael.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#16.195)}
plot: Bram is scared. He wanted to tell everything about him stabbing Frank from the start, but Franky stopped him then. Simonne tells Bram she will keep quiet, but only because she just has her family back. Bram feels very guilty. Paulien still wants to make up with Bram, but although it pains him, he doesn't want anything to do with her anymore. She's completely in tears and tells Julia she doesn't want the baby anymore. She wants an abortion. Ann tells Mayra she's falling in love with her and it's best to stop seeing each other. When Mayra drops Ann off at home, Ann kisses her as a goodbye. Mayra is a bit bewildered. Rosa and Waldek invite everyone to their coming-back-together party at Ter Smissen. Except for Luc and Marianne. Peggy has a run-in with Marianne when she wants to take Sandrine to the party. And when Marianne is bad-mouthing Rosa, Peggy slaps her in the face. She tells Marianne, if she ever gets on her wrong side again, she will tell everyone about her underhand deal with Julia. Yvette doesn't want to go to the party, but she trusts Leo to be there without her. Leo on the other says to Jenny he feels more at home at Ter Smissen then with Yvette. They get along even more these days. Marianne phones Leo that the deal is off and she won't sell to him. A drunken Freddy crashes the party. He thinks he deserves a drink, because it's because of him that Rosa and Waldek are back together again. After a few pints to many, Waldek throws him out. Just at that moment Luc comes round the corner, because he wanted to take a look at the party he wasn't invited to. Luc and Freddy stand eye to eye. Freddy runs back inside with Luc on his trail. He enters one of the guest rooms and Luc follows him. It's payback time. Luc wants all of his money back, but since Freddy has no job anymore, he has no money. Luc gets angry and gives him a violent shove. Freddy falls hard on the floor and doesn't move anymore. Luc thinks he's dead and quickly goes away. There's dancing going on in the café and as Luc passes the open door on his way out, he sees Waldek and Rosa dancing. Rosa and Luc look directly at each other. A split second later when she looks again, he's gone. Bram has a good time at the party and even asks Franky to dance with him for fun. Exactly at that moment, Frank and Simonne step in. Frank can't stand it seeing his son dancing with another boy and leaves immediately. Franky and Simonne go after him. Frank says to Franky he might as well stab another knife in his back. They get very angry at each other. Simonne can't stand it anymore and shouts it was Bram who stabbed him. Franky swears it was him, but Simonne persists it was Bram. Franky runs away, grabs Bram and together they flee on Nancy's moped. When the words sink in, Frank goes to his car and wants to follow the two boys. Femke goes to Rafael's room, because she wants to make him clear once and for all he doesn't mean anything to her anymore and he should go back to Spain. He ends up in a rage and starts playing with his fire-lighter again. When Femke stands outside to become from her confrontation with Rafael, she looks up at his window and sees flames. She runs back inside to his room. She wants to get him out, but he grabs her and won't let her go. If he can't live with her, than he will die with her. Marianne comes to pick up Sandrine and also sees the flames. She warns everyone at the party and they rush out. Suddenly it dawns on them that Femke, Rafael and Sandrine are still inside.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#16.73)}
plot: Eddy send Nancy a letter. She gets even more depressed by it and starts drinking again. Britney gets ill at school and Nancy takes her to the supermarket to get some groceries in. She accidentally mixes up shopping trolleys and notices at the check out she misses Britney. The customer who brings back Britney calls her a bad mother. Katrien has enough of Bram and when they're only in the apartment, she tells him what she thinks of him. Tim and Gitta think it might be better for Jens to look for an apartment on his own. That way Tim and Gitta have the apartment to themselves and Jens doesn't have to meet Bram in the corridor anymore. Peggy can't think straight anymore, but she lets no-one talk any sense into her either. Ann doesn't know if she's going to give Peggy visiting rights to Sandrine, even if that might be the only way to get Peggy on the right track again. Simonne offers Bram the shares of Sanitechniek. He needs time to think about it. Nina compliments Peter in different ways, until he can't take it anymore. He tells her, he has no feelings for her anymore and that her flirting has no effect on him.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#17.127)}
plot: Anja suddenly shows up at Sanitechniek. Luc is surprised, but he's even more surprised and disappointed when she asks for Frank's phone number. Waldek, Franky and Frank come in and Luc delicately tells Anja Frank is happily married and has three grown up children with three different women and he's also a grandfather. Anja sees no point in hanging around and leaves. Leo made his mind up and tells Jenny he's going to Scherpenheuvel. She's a bit worried, because he's not that young anymore and asks Waldek and Frank to go after him. When Luc hears about Waldek and Frank taking a day off, he's not happy. They tell him to take it up with Franky, because he gave them the day off. Ellen swears Tibo she hasn't told Jana anything. Jana is just curious and the reactions between the two made her think. Lynn is applying for a job with Peter. She's studying law and wants to earn her studies with work. Nancy explains to Martha how she got Eddy's engine running again. She got him a beer and when Nancy got home, she was all sweating from her work. Eddy couldn't keep away from her. Martha reads the cards about Femke and finds a death card between them. Femke suddenly gets cramps and feels dizzy. Peter and Rafael are both frightened.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#17.181)}
plot: Kasper wants to borrow Waldek's car for some grocery shopping, but Waldek needs his car. Then he asks Leo if he can work for him. He wants to do something other than chores around the B&B. Leo will give him a try, but he needs to start at the dispatch. This is not what Kasper had in mind, but at least he's in. Eddy plans to go to all the pubs he knows to try to sell his beer. Nancy doesn't find the prospect of her sitting alone all evenings for the coming few weeks very pleasant. Eddy sees already big business, but Nancy is not that optimistic. Eddy asks David if he can do the accounts, because he doesn't know how to. Mayra slowly gets some more self-confidence with Sandrine. She tells Ann she hasn't been in contact with her sister for a long time, because of the death of Brechtje. Marianne doesn't want to go in to discussion with Geert about the flowers she got from him through Nancy. She put them in the waiting room. Ann talks to Geert about it. He understands it probably would have been better if he bought them himself. Geert asks David how he can renew his relationship with Marianne, because she still means a lot to him. That evening Geert tells Marianne he wants to do more things with her and he has something planned for Wednesday, but he won't tell what it is. Jana asks Bram if it wouldn't be better if he searched for a studio, so they can be alone more often.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#17.55)}
plot: Katrien and Paulien just see how Julia tries to sneak Guy out of the door in the morning. They were just up a bit too late. The girls ask him for breakfast. Later they ask Julia if this was a one time off. Julia hopes it's going to be longer than that. Guy wants to sell his house and split the money with Mayra 70-30, because he put more money in. Ann and Mayra are angry about this. Rafael is with Nancy and she pampers him right away. Femke tries to reach Rafael, but he doesn't answer his phone. She learns from the police that he's out and goes to Nancy's place and finds him there. He doesn't want to speak to here. He wants to be surrounded by people he can trust. Later he goes to Paulien to thank her. Guy is also there. Rafael tells all of them he told the police Fien had another appointment after him and that they're following that trail now. Bram hasn't payed his rent to Luc yet and Franky reminds him. Tibo asks Bram his side of the version of what happened at that fight where Franky took the blame for. Bram is not happy that Franky told Tibo almost everything. Tibo and Franky visit Yvette again and have a pleasant afternoon. Jenny notices the advert for their new B&B. She thinks it's from Leo until they discover the small print. That rooms can be rented by the hour. Rosa immediately suspects Marianne wrote this and goes to her. She warns Marianne to stop interfering or she will lose even more in the process.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#18.109)}
plot: Luc tries to mediate between Lowie and Julia. He will cook, Lowie must do his schoolwork, while Julia rests. Julia thinks Lowie needs rules. Luc thinks it will be alright now. While Julia sleeps and Luc is at work, Lowie goes to the Frens. Simonne feels useless after the disaster at the Frens. Frank finally asks Luc if she can work at Sanitechniek. Luc had no objections in the first place. Waldek talks to Peter, but he tells him he has no problems. Tim arranged a job for Femke at the Frens. Peter is drunk and accuses Femke of denying him a baby a second time. Marianne is certain Rosa and Geert are an item. She wants to have a drink again. Ann and Marianne fight over the bottle and Marianne suddenly sees she's going too far.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#18.163)}
plot: Luc gives Bram a boiler from their own stock rather than a good one. Eddy would have rather given Bram a good one, but he's too chicken to go against Luc. An he needs the money for the cruise he promised Nancy. Eddy denies to Frank he's still busy with the fraud, but Frank doesn't believe him. Frank is angry with him. Rosa and Waldek try to jog his memory by going to the car park of the Frens, but it doesn't work. Judith, Kurt and the children have fun in the B&B until Kurt sees Waldek. Kurt is nervous, but Waldek doesn't recognize him.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#18.37)}
plot: Simonne is still angry with Frank, but she has to admit the situation can't stay the way it is. Franky has made a rota of how he and Tibo can take care of Yvette and Simonne, but Tibo can't just take time off work. They all see this doesn't work anymore. But when they ask Yvette what she thinks about going to a home for just a while, she gets upset and tells them she absolutely doesn't want to go to a mental institution. Leo has problems with his stomach. He has to go to hospital to do some tests. Waldek is taking over the dispatch and Jenny asks him if he wants to do it a little longer now Leo is sick. He promises to do so. Guy calls Taxi Leo with a disguised voice and under a false name and asks for a taxi. Mayra drives to the house and walks up to the door. She doesn't see Guy hiding behind a tree with a knife in his hands. Bram wants to organize a party for Jana at the Noorderzon and Jens enjoys himself squeezing Bram for the money. At the brewery meeting David is voted out with two to one votes and he has to go.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#18.91)}
plot: Julia finds it very difficult Katrien is leaving so soon. Luc tries to comfort her. At the Frens they have a farewell party for her. Simonne sees Luc and Lowie together at the party and thinks they're doing well. She goes home, because she feels tired. When she puts cards away in the drawer where Leontien's letter should be, she can't find it. The rest party on through New Year. Lowie catches a girl who otherwise might have fallen from the dance floor and Jana is instantly jealous. Marianne is still annoyed Rosa danced with Geert at the wedding party. Ivo asks Marianne to the New Year's reception. She's not sure. Ann feels very useless. Marianne and Mayra think they should go away for a weekend, but she thinks running away doesn't solve anything. Tibo has the chance to go to Zürich for two weeks to replace a colleague. Franky and Jana think he should go.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#19.145)}
plot: Luc realizes Lowie will never forgive him. He tries so hard to do good for everyone, but whatever he does, no-one is ever willing to forgive him. Julia thinks it might not be that bad, but she didn't see the hatred in Lowie's eyes yesterday. Luc knows he has lost his son forever. Peggy seems to feel a lot better after she went to the woods with Toon yesterday. And she made a decision. When Femke comes to talk, Peggy tells her exactly what's on her mind and promises her she will be very sorry for what she did to her. Toon also tells Peter what he thinks about what he did to Peggy. Paulien suggests to Jens they go out together after work, just to break the routine. When she suddenly notices he has some feelings for her, she's disappointed. Sam is still embarrassed about being caught in the woods by her neighbor.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#19.23)}
plot: Luc, Eddy and Frank are found guilty of fraud, forgery, receiving and violation against the Trade Description Act. Eddy gets a 850 Euro fine and Frank 1250 Euro. Luc is also found guilty of wrongful death and gets six month suspended, a fine of 2750 Euro and he has to pay 12.500 Euro to Jack's parents. Lowie thinks Luc only confessed to get him and Julia back. Luc tells him it isn't so, but Lowie can't see him as his father anymore. Luc is devastated. Jenny tries to proof they can do without Julia. Beata, Waldek's sister, calls him. She wants to sell their parents home in Poland. Waldek thinks about buying it. Kurt wants to help Mayra by advertising for her for a small percentage.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#19.78)}
plot: Peggy talks to Toon with whom she can talk freely. She still finds it very difficult to accept she's blind. Peter tells Peggy she pushing everyone away the way she's acting. Rosa doesn't know what to do anymore around Peggy. Stan and Judith went Christmas shopping. Paulien has an idea to get the Frens running again. Frank sees a picture of a woman in Toon's locker and mocks her. Toon gets angry and walks away.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#20.131)}
plot: Tim and Sam don't talk to each other. Tim wants to help her, but she won't let him. While Rosa and Waldek try to have a quiet breakfast, Julia tells them Peggy hasn't shown up and she can't do everything alone. Even Waldek helps until Peggy finally shows up. He thinks she did it on purpose, while she says she just didn't hear the alarm clock. Renzo tries to cheer her up when she feels wrongly accused. Sandrine still doesn't want to see Peggy. Marianne tries to settle herself in her bedroom again. Nancy gives her the silent-treatment.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#20.186)}
plot: All the things Simonne repressed from so long ago, all comes back now. She had a child when she was just 15. The father died just two weeks for the birth. They told her then, the baby was stillborn. Only Angèle knew she was pregnant. Yvette didn't know anything. She can't stand the strain and collapses. Sam wants to concentrate on the future, Tim and their child. Femke is very busy now she's alone at the dispatch and all the work with the workshops. Luc has to pitch in. Julia is very excited and nervous about the workshops. Renzo is still a bit angry with Femke and tries to make an appointment with Wendy to talk things over. Rosa and Peggy are very busy with the B&B now Julia has quit, so Waldek has breakfast alone.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#20.46)}
plot: Lowie didn't sleep a wink last night, because he's worried about Julia. Finally Luc calls him to say she's stable. Adil hasn't heard from Paulien and feels a bit sad. Judith is worried about Emma now she seems to have a relapse. What if Emma never gets better again? Mayra doesn't like work anymore now Peggy has it in for her. Simonne tries to mediate between the two, but it's not easy. When Renzo has his breakfast at the B&B, he gets talking with Peggy. They discover they went to the same places in Spain. When Jenny finds out he is Femke's brother, Peggy thinks Femke sent him and is angry. Waldek doesn't want her near Renzo.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#21.10)}
plot: In the future Luc will always have to rely on others. He will never walk again and maybe not even speak again due to the brain-damage. Lowie wants to rebuild his house so he can take care of his father. Frank thinks this is a great responsibility and suggests to Simonne they will take him in. Simonne thinks not only his brother needs him, his son also needs him. Hélène doesn't like it at all there are flowers from Marianne at Geert's funeral and that Nancy made a speech after all. She lets slip she has a new mobile. Simonne talks to Sam, but she only seems a bit tired. Yvette is packing for Winterlicht. She gives Sam a pendant she got from her grandmother to give to her grandchild. At first Eddy is very nervous to give a talk at the press-conference, but gradually he gains confidence.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#21.154)}
plot: Everyone at the commune gets to know Kaat. The one reacts different from the other one. Frank learns from Sam Kaat lives with them. Simonne isn't interested in Frank when he only has interest in himself. Lowie makes diner. Luc will also be there. To Kaat it will be strange to see him again. Femke finds it very difficult to look at Peter. Tamara is pressing charges against Toon for filming her without her consent. Hélène made breakfast and helps packing boxes for the move, but Judith keeps her distant. Emma is very glad she's around again, but Stan doesn't know what to make of it. Maggie won't open her door to Karin. She needs an idea to get her out.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#21.208)}
plot: Hélène pleads with William to flee with her and leave everything behind. William makes her very clear that his last attempt of killing her went wrong, but the next time it will. Marianne sees it all from a distance and Hélène knows this. She also secretly taped the conversation on her mobile. Yvette makes diner at Lowie's house. Toon sees Kaat when he's invited for diner, but leaves as soon as he sees her. Yvette learns Lowie goes to Valencia for a year and makes him promise to come back. Femke and Peter don't agree on the Fugu subject. Paulien thinks Adil is jealous, while he says he's not. Peggy tells Rosa she's thinking about moving to Morocco with Bianca.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#21.69)}
plot: Lowie has to fill in some papers he got from the sanatorium for Luc. He doesn't understand it, but Olivia will help him, if he'll dance the tango with her at the party at the Frens. At work Eddy can't get along with Adil very well. Wendy attends to Toon at the hospital. Judith also visits him. She thanks him and almost kisses him. William arrives to meet Rosa. Paulien and Julia finally make up. Mayra tells Charité she could babysit Lucas as an extra job. She declines, because she's not allowed. But she thanks Mayra for thinking of her.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#22.123)}
plot: Luc thinks he sees Julia in the streets, but Bob tells him it's impossible, because she is dead. Luc is angry, because he's convinced he saw her. That evening Julia suddenly stands before Paulien alive and well. Paulien is angry with her, because everyone thought she was dead. A lot of people went through hell because she was nowhere to be found. According to Tamara her relationship with Bob is nothing more than an experiment, but Bob has real feelings for her. Just before they go to Venice, Mayra asks Ann to marry her. Ann is totally surprised but says yes.

title: "Thuis" (1995) {(#22.67)}
plot: Tim and Dieter keep asking Waldek where Julia is. There is a lot of evidence against him, but he keeps saying he absolutely doesn't know where Julia is or what happened to her. Peter defends him, but he has doubt about Waldek's innocence. Charité overhears Joseph and Marianne talking about Adam. Charité tells him it's absolutely not his fault that Adam left them.

title: "Thunderbirds Are Go" (2015) {Ring of Fire: Part 1 (#1.1)}
plot: A powerful underwater seaquake turns a busy day for International Rescue into a perilous one. Gordon's mission is to rescue a research team trapped in an undersea lab, but in doing so he discovers a chain of seismic destabilisers positioned along the bottom of the ocean floor. Lady Penelope is contacted to help the Thunderbirds find the person responsible.

title: "Tic Tac Dough" (1956)
plot: The classic quiz show hosted by Win Elliot. In this game, the contestants are faced with a tic-tac-toe board with a different category in each square. To put their mark (X or O) in the square they want, they must first answer a question in the category listed there. For each question they answer correctly, they win a cash prize. The first contestant to put their mark in three squares in a row gets to keep the cash and move on to a bonus round for even bigger prizes. The first version of the classic game show, a general knowledge quizzer married to tic-tac-toe. Two contestants, including a returning champion competed (the champ was "X," his challenger the "O"). The host announced nine categories (a variety of pop culture and academic subjects); each player, in turn, selected a category and answered a question in that subject. A correct answer added $100 to the pot (or $200 if it were the center box, which had a two-part question tied to it); an incorrect answer left the box empty and available for his opponent. The first player to get tic-tac-toe was champion and faced a new challenger; there was no end game here, as in the later versions. Tie games were played if necessary, with the pot continuing to accumulate (sometimes well over $10,000) until claimed. "Tic Tac Dough" returned in 1978 to CBS and syndication, some 19 years after it was forced off the air in the wake of the Quiz Show Scandals.

title: "Tiger & Bunny" (2011) {Love is blind (#1.14)}
plot: Ten months have passed since the epic battle between the heroes and the terrorist Jake Martinez. Tiger and Barnaby, now hailed as the heroes who saved Stern Bild, find their lives occupied with interviews and other media events, one of which is forming a special idol unit with Blue Rose.

title: "Till Death Us Do Part" (1965) {Outback Bound (#6.0)}
plot: Else's sister Maud and her husband Ted have emigrated to Australia but Maud is not well and Ted rings up to ask if Else can over there and help them out. Alf is not keen to let his wife go but, for Else, the journey is two-fold - not only will she be helping her sister out but she will be taking a well-deserved break from Alf and despite his entreaties she boards the plane to take her Down Under.

title: "Timber Kings" (2014) {High Rollers (#2.5)}
plot: Just hours from Manhattan, Beat creates a country retreat for a demanding French financier, while Joel's Australian client makes a last minute request for a three-car garage. In the meantime, Peter conspires to create an oversize surprise for Andre 50th birthday.

title: "Time Team America" (2009) {The Bones of Badger Hole (#2.2)}
plot: At Badger Hole, Oklahoma, the Time Team America crew excavates what may be the largest Folsom-period bison kill site in North America. Long extinct, Bison Antiquus roamed the plains 10,000 years ago. How were Paleoindian hunters able to kill so many of these massive bison-weighing 1500 pounds each-without the help of bows and arrows or even horses? The lives of these ancient ancestors seem elusive, but by investigating bison bones, arrowheads and more, the Team discovers clues about their habitat, hunting range, and their ingenuity that will help us understand them. At Badger Hole, Oklahoma, the Time Team America crew excavates what may be the largest Folsom-period bison kill site in North America. How were Paleoindian hunters able to kill so many of these massive bison-weighing 1500 pounds each-without the help of bows and arrows or even horses? By investigating bison bones, arrowheads and more, the Team discovers clues about their habitat, hunting range, and their ingenuity that will help us understand them.

title: "Time Team" (1994) {Templecombe, Somerset (#3.3)}
plot: Templecombe Somerset is the site of a priory that dates back to the 12th century. The exact location of the original building has been confused by later construction. The Time Team set themselves the task of untangling the ruins and coming to grips with the history of the location.

title: "Time for Passion" (2011) {Attack of the Johnson - Jugement Day (#1.2)}
plot: Johnson teeches four elements that every successful film has and warns the dangers of choosing to act in movies that do not have these four elements. (This leads to disaster.) Then, after having to deny countless invites from fans and friends (something Johnson does every day), Johnson agrees to meet with his best friend, YORKSHIRE, for lunch. There he reveal one of his many passion projects.

title: "Timeslip" (1970) {The Wrong End of Time: Part 3 (#1.3)}
plot: Part 3 - When a young girl vanishes near a derelict naval station in St. Oswald, a fantastic series of events is set in motion which sends teenagers Simon Randall and Liz Skinner back in time to 1940 and the very night when the base was taken over by a group of German marines.

title: "Timmy Time" (2009) {Timmy Goes Camping}
plot: Harriet and Osbourne take the class to a neighbouring field where they have put up a splendid tent. Timmy builds his own tent from the picnic rug and won't join in with the others' games, until a rainstorm starts and Timmy tries to brave it out on his own.

title: "Timothy Goes to School" (2000) {Professor Fritz/Two Tutu Friends}
plot: Mrs. Jenkins? students are making science projects to display at Hilltop School's open house and Fritz, the class inventor, is going to impress everyone with his rocket ship. When a test flight goes haywire in front of the entire class, Fritz feels humiliated and abandons his experiment. With some encouragement from his friends, the budding scientist finds the confidence to go back to the drawing board.;Doris is inspired to take ballet lessons after watching Grace dance in front of the class. A growing friendship between the two girls comes to an abrupt end when Doris embarrasses Grace by telling their school friends about an amusing mishap in dance class. Both girls discover that dance class isn't as much fun without each other's friendship.

title: "Tiny Plastic Men" (2012) {Business Gayest (#3.3)}
plot: Jesse and Gaston invite the guys for a karaoke night, while Susie babysits M'Beku in the Prototype Room. Mr G and Alex, drinking after hours, mistakenly think Susie is an intruder and stage a drunken attack on the Prototype room to defend the company.

title: "Titanic: Blood and Steel" (2012) {Burden of Proof (#1.9)}
plot: Lord Pirrie asks Mark, due to his Admiralty experience, along to the London hearings about the Olympic's crash. The lord gets lord of the Admiralty Winston Chrurchill to sift all blame on the inexperienced captain, in national and industry interests. he finds disinherited society lover Kate happily working as variety star. Mark's search for his daughter looks hopeless, so he considers leaving to London with lover Sophia, who is offered a chance to study design there. The yard staff is disgruntle to be kept away from the Titanic's launch (just into the dock), a media event, as there's no work time to loose. The Home Rule controversy keeps swelling.

title: "To Play the King" (1993)
plot: Francis Urquhart, the unscrupulous but cunning Conservative Prime Minister, has his survival threatened by a liberal monarch and an upcoming General Election.

title: "To Tell the Truth" (1956) {(1962-10-22)}
plot: Gene Rayburn joins regular panelists Kitty Carlisle, Peggy Cass and Tom Poston this evening. In the first round, three gentlemen introduce themselves as Mr. George Tweed, who eluded capture by the Japanese on Guam for over two years. He lived on his wits, in the jungle and eluded the Japanese for all of that time. At the first sight of an American naval vessel, he swam out to sea, was rescued and told U.S. authorities the secrets of Japanese maneuvers and strategies. . For his valor, he was granted the Legion of Merit medal and was hailed a war hero. As well, he wrote the book, "No Man is an Island." Only the two gentlemen on the panel, Mr. Poston and Mr. Rayburn, correctly identified the real Mr. Tweed. The second round presents three young women, who claim to be Native American, all dressed in authentic Native American garb. The young women identify themselves as Ramona Edith Soto. Bud Collyer points out that two of the Native American costumes worn by two of the contestants are over 200 years old. Their claim to fame is to be Miss Indian America, whom Tom Poston, Peggy Cass and Kitty Carlisle identify successfully. Finally, the third round presents three gentlemen who claim to be Mr. Tracy Barnes, hot air balloon expert and named the year's National Hot Air Balloonist. Once again, the two gentlemen, Mr. Poston and Mr. Rayburn, accurately peg the real Mr. Tracy.

title: "To the Ends of the Earth" (2005) {Close Quarters (#1.2)}
plot: The ship is becalmed and another vessel is sighted, which turns out to be British - the Alcyone, whose commander announces that the war with France is over. The two vessels anchor alongside and a ball is held for the passengers. Here Edmund meets the sweet Marion Chumley, though he has a rival for affections in Deverel. However, when the two ships part Deverel is exchanged for the Alcyone's officer, the urbane Benet and Edmund confides in Summers his regret at having to say goodbye to Marion. A storm blows up, during which the unfortunate steward Wheeler, considered a Jonah, is thrown overboard and Prettiman severely injured, being nursed rather unexpectedly by Miss Grnham. A mast is also broken and Benet and Summers disagree over the best way to mend it.

title: "Toast of the Town" (1948) {(#11.32)}
plot: Lillian Roth sings a great rendition of "Sing You Sinners", Chordettes sing "Lollipop", Darcell sings "Mam'zelle", Sani sings " I Remember You", Carol Hanedances to "Sunny Side of the Street", Bagdasarian(As Dave Seville) sings 'Witch Doctor"< Wayne & Shuster do a private eye style take off on the death of Julius Caeser.

title: "Today" (1952) {(2015-04-20)}
plot: Kate Bolick; 'Taylor Schilling' (qv) (_"Orange Is the New Black" (2013)_ (qv)); 'Nia Vardalos' (qv); 'Rove McManus' (qv) (_"Lie Detectors" (2015)_ (qv)); 'Kathryn Hahn' (qv) (_"Parks and Recreation" (2009)_ (qv) and _"Happyish" (2015)_ (qv)); 'Sophie Simmons' (qv) and 'Shannon Tweed (I)' (qv); 'Joy Bauer' (qv). Also: "Make Your Today"; "Broadway Week: the cast of "On the Town" perform; "Favorite Things".

title: "Today" (1952) {(2015-07-23)}
plot: 'Jimmy Pardo (I)' (qv) (_Road Hard (2015)_ (qv) and _Now More Than Ever: The History of Chicago (2016)_ (qv)). Also: 'Deep Purple' (qv) perform; 'George Ezra' (qv) performs; Natalie tries kite-boarding; "Today Tech" with 'Katie Linendoll' (qv); "Today Food" with 'Donal Skehan' (qv); "Summer of Secrets"; National Hot Dog Day; "Ask Lou" with 'Lou Manfredini' (qv); "Ambush Makeover".

title: "Today" (1952) {(2015-10-27)}
plot: 'Ellen DeGeneres' (qv); _"The Voice" (2011)_ (qv) judges; 'David Spade' (qv); 'Seth MacFarlane' (qv); the cast of _"Days of Our Lives" (1965)_ (qv); 'Squire D. Rushnell' (qv). Also: "Today Food" with 'Donatella Arpaia' (qv); a performance by 'Seth MacFarlane' (qv); "Tamron's Tuesday Trend"; "Kathie Lee and Hoda Give It Away".

title: "Today" (1952) {(2016-02-02)}
plot: Author 'L.A. Reid' (qv) (book, "Sing to Me"); model 'Lauren Hutton' (qv); comic 'Grace Helbig' (qv). Also: Hollywood homes; colleges; Better Homes & Gardens' best new products; "Today Food" with 'Tim Love (I)' (qv); home repair with 'Lou Manfredini' (qv); 'Durrell Babbs' (qv) (aka Tank) performs.

title: "Today" (1952) {(2016-05-04)}
plot: 'Lionel Richie' (qv); director 'Rob Reiner' (qv) (_Being Charlie (2015)_ (qv)); 'Jessica Biel (I)' (qv) (_A Kind of Murder (2016)_ (qv)). Also: "Today Food"; a performance by the cast of "Tuck Everlasting"; "Pop Fix"; homemade Mother's Day gifts; "Hope to It"; "Who Knew"; graduate gadgets.

title: "Today" (1952) {(2016-07-28)}
plot: Coverage of the 2016 Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. Also: 'Matt Damon' (qv) (_Jason Bourne (2016)_ (qv)); mentalist 'Oz Pearlman' (qv); 'Nick Cannon (I)' (qv) (_"America's Got Talent" (2006)_ (qv)); "Behind-the-Scenes of Game Shows"; "Today Food" with 'Elizabeth Chambers (III)' (qv); Olympic-party ideas; a performance by 'Colbie Caillat' (qv); decoding body language; "Bobbie's Buzz"; "Ambush Makeover"; "Ok or Not Ok".

title: "Today" (1952) {(2016-11-15)}
plot: Musicians 'Mick Jagger' (qv) and 'Keith Richards (II)' (qv); actors 'Lily Collins (I)' (qv) and 'Alden Ehrenreich' (qv) (_Rules Don't Apply (2016)_ (qv)); music group 'New Kids on the Block' (qv); model 'Gisele Bündchen' (qv); actress 'Kathy Bates (I)' (qv) (_Bad Santa 2 (2016)_ (qv)); actor 'Dean Cain (I)' (qv) (_Broadcasting Christmas (2016) (TV)_ (qv) and _The Incantation (2016)_ (qv)); Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade float preview; World Adoption Day; Thanksgiving etiquette; "Today Food" with 'Ben Ford (III)' (qv) and 'Siri Pinter' (qv) Daly; 'Kevin Garrett (VI)' (qv) performs.

title: "Today" (1952) {(2017-02-28)}
plot: Rep. 'Paul Ryan (XXIII)' (qv) (R-Wisc.), speaker of the house; actors 'Lisa Kudrow' (qv) and 'Craig Robinson (I)' (qv) (_Table 19 (2017)_ (qv)); Today Food; TV personality 'Nick Lachey' (qv); actress 'Jennifer Beals' (qv) (_Before I Fall (2017)_ (qv) and _"Taken" (2016/I)_ (qv)); 'Little Mix' (qv) perform; actor 'Ray Liotta' (qv) (_"Shades of Blue" (2016)_ (qv)); actress 'Zoey Deutch' (qv) (_Before I Fall (2017)_ (qv)).

title: "Toddlers and Tiaras" (2009) {Universal Royalty State Pageant (#1.3)}
plot: Austin, Texas is home of Universal Royalty's state pageant. Texas is a staple in the pageant world and the competition is sure to be fierce. The judging happens on stage while the drama ensues off stage as each mom tries to prove their baby is beautiful.

title: "Tokyo Ghoul: Root A" (2015) {Deeper Layers (#1.4)}
plot: Aogiri commences their invasion of Cochlea and free a majority of the imprisoned ghouls while Amon and Akira visit the prison to learn more about Aogiri's plan from Donato Porpora. Amid the battles between the CCG, Cochlea security and ghouls, Kaneki meets a ghoul named Orca with orders to break him free, but is attacked by him instead.

title: "Tombstone Territory" (1957) {Doc Holliday in Durango (#1.29)}
plot: June 19, 1882 - Outlaw Ed Mace is passing through Tombstone when he kills two men in a saloon, one of those being Clay Hollister's deputy. Mace leaves town headed for Durango where he intends to kill Doc Holliday. Mace is looking for revenge for his bother's death back in Texas. Sheriff Hollister, having been deputized as a US Marshal, goes after Mace and his gang.

title: "Toned Up" (2013)
plot: It's crunch time for best friends and business partners Katrina and Karena, the fearless duo behind Toneitup.com. While some entrepreneurs have a business plan, these girls use their street smarts, not book smarts to push themselves and their brand to wild extremes.

title: "Too Close for Comfort" (1980) {Tenants, Anyone? (#1.6)}
plot: Mildred Rafkin, the sister of the former tenant of Jackie and Sara's apartment, returns to claim her late brother's belongings, including all the furniture. With an unfurnished apartment, the girls find another apartment to rent, albeit in a seedy and high-crime neighborhood.

title: "Toonami Pre-Flight" (2015) {TV Shows Looking Forward to in 2017 (#1.100)}
plot: On this week's episode of Pre-Flight, Jason and Gil discuss Mobile Suit Gundam F91 and the TV shows they're looking forward to in 2017. Next, catch a Run the Jewels 3 line-up promo and music video. Plus, see what's coming up on the next episode of Dragon Ball Super. Finally, stay tuned for another installment of One Man's Trash where Gill reviews Rise of the Tomb Raider.

title: "Top Chef Duels" (2014) {Art Smith vs. Kevin Gillespie (#1.9)}
plot: It's a battle of the good ol' boys, as true Southern Gentlemen duel it out in the kitchen. In a Duels first this season, a "Top Chef" Master takes on a "Top Chef" Runner-Up, and these bearded brethren are out for blood. First, Kevin puts Art through hog hell, challenging him to butcher and then prepare a dish with porcine. Then, Art throws down the gauntlet to Kevin to a critter fry. When the cast of "Grey's Anatomy" sits down for dinner, they get just what the doctor ordered. Kevin and Art prove either way that the South will rise again.

title: "Top Chef" (2006) {Campfires, Cream Cheese and Countryside (#11.6)}
plot: New Orleans super-chef John Besh introduces the chef'testants to one of his favorite farms where they are tasked with making a dish out of a prized local crop - the creole tomato. For the Elimination Challenge, the farm to table theory continues as the chef'testants try to impress the upper-tiered chefs in John Besh's restaurant empire.

title: "Top Chef" (2006) {Palm Power Lunch (#7.7)}
plot: The chef'testants attempt to create culinary delights that can be speared with a toothpick and served at a Congressional party for the quickfire challenge. For elimination, they must prepare a power lunch at the city's elite Palm restaurant.

title: "Top Coppers" (2015) {The Passion of the Chris (#1.6)}
plot: Justice City is hit by Chris, a female cyber-hacker, who puts out all its power and threatens to nuke it unless Mahogany, who jilted her years earlier, goes on a date with her. Mahogany duly agrees but loses contact with his colleagues and, when Chris reneges on the deal and threatens to push the detonator button, only Rust's feeble attempts to dodge the tax-man by posing as a robot cop and Chief's inability to use a computer can save the city from total destruction.

title: "Top Gear USA" (2008) {Car vs. Plane (#1.8)}
plot: Rutledge road tests the Porsche Panamera Turbo. Tanner and Rutledge are having a race to see which is the fastest way to get from Los Angeles to Las Vegas, a car or a plane with Rutledge choosing the plane while Tanner takes the car, which is a Ferrari California. Tanner reviews the BMW X6M. Bret Michaels is the Big Star, Small Car.

title: "Top Gear" (2002) {(#11.4)}
plot: It will be another epic race across Japan. James and Richard, traveling on the most reliable public transport in the world, against Jeremy, in the new Nissan GT-R (the super car that set the fastest time around the Nürburgring). Jeremy test the new Alfa Romeo 8C.

title: "Top Gear" (2002) {(#20.4)}
plot: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May bring relief to flood-stricken areas of Britain by building a car that can turn into a hovercraft. Also in this show, Jeremy is on the track in the insane Mercedes SLS Black and the 739 horsepower SLS Electric while Hollywood star Hugh Jackman is the star in the Reasonably Priced Car.

title: "Top Gear" (2002) {(#8.7)}
plot: Richard and James test the Ford S-MAX, Mercedes-Benz B-Class and Vauxhall Zafira VXR in their search for the best people mover. Jeremy test drives the Lamborghini Gallardo Spyder. James races two French Parkour acrobats across Liverpool in a Peugeot 207 1.6 litre diesel. The team are challenged to build a Caterham Seven kit car in the time it takes The Stig to drive one from Caterham, Surrey to the Knockhill racing circuit in Scotland, but a last minute twist changes the result.

title: "Top Sailing" (1980)
plot: This film was the second in the 1980 series of Top Sailing, titled as 'Creek Crawling' and also known from the script as 'Creek Crawler Extraordinary'. Michael and his son Richard Bentine meet up with the Pebble Mill host Donny MacLeod and cartoonist Mike Peyton for some fine sailing and reminiscences amongst the creeks of the Suffolk coast. The voyage in the 26-foot cutter Kylix II of Maldon, designed by Maurice Griffiths, commences at Gashouse Creek in Harwich. Sailing tips and wartime anecdotes pepper the cruise as the companions take in the Stour, Deben and Orwell rivers. The culmination brings them face to face with the famous Thames sailing barge race starting from Pinmill and leading in a majestic procession to the sea-bound Medusa buoy and the setting sun. Michael picks out one graceful vessel, evocatively named 'Reminder', and muses "It is a reminder, it is a reminder of the ethos of Britain: it's something that we're in real danger of loosing, I think. It would be a tragedy if we did." A grand and stunning sight.

title: "Top wo Nerae!" (1988)
plot: In the future, Earth is under attack by gigantic aliens. Noriko Takaya, daughter of a famous captain in the battle against the aliens, enlists in the military to combat the aliens, but must struggle with her memories, the pressures of training, the ridicule of her classmates, and herself to make herself ready to be a mech pilot. She is eventually partnered up with her rival/idol, and given control of one of two Gunbuster mechs, Earth's most powerful weapon to combat the aliens. With the fate of the earth in her hands, Noriko flies off to meet her destiny...

title: "Topic Time with Harrison Young" (2010) {Actress Erin Macey (#2.47)}
plot: The Massachusetts-based cable television show stars Harrison Young. The native New Englander usually conducts hour-long interviews with a variety of talented individuals who work in businesses that specialize in advertising, art, comedy, dining, fashion, health, lifestyles, literature, marketing, movies, music, promotions, publishing, radio, sports, television, and live theatre. The interviews are conducted either in-studio or on location.

title: "Topic Time with Harrison Young" (2010) {Behind the Scenes: Marketing Company DARK TOWER PROMOTIONS (#2.44)}
plot: The Massachusetts-based cable television show stars Harrison Young. The native New Englander usually conducts hour-long interviews with a variety of talented individuals who work in businesses that specialize in advertising, art, comedy, dining, fashion, health, lifestyles, literature, marketing, movies, music, promotions, publishing, radio, sports, television, and live theatre. The interviews are conducted either in-studio or on location.

title: "Topic Time with Harrison Young" (2010) {Makeup Artist Cynthia Morales (#4.43)}
plot: The Massachusetts-based cable television show stars Harrison Young. The native New Englander usually conducts hour-long interviews with a variety of talented individuals who work in businesses that specialize in advertising, art, comedy, dining, fashion, health, lifestyles, literature, marketing, movies, music, promotions, publishing, radio, sports, television, and live theatre. The interviews are conducted either in-studio or on location.

title: "Topic Time with Harrison Young" (2010) {Musicians Marc Bridge & Perry Desmond-Davies (#3.11)}
plot: The Massachusetts-based cable television show stars Harrison Young. The native New Englander usually conducts hour-long interviews with a variety of talented individuals who work in businesses that specialize in advertising, art, comedy, dining, fashion, health, lifestyles, literature, marketing, movies, music, promotions, publishing, radio, sports, television, and live theatre. The interviews are conducted either in-studio or on location.

title: "Topic Time with Harrison Young" (2010) {Topic Time Commentary (#30) (#2.22)}
plot: The Massachusetts-based cable television show stars Harrison Young. The native New Englander usually conducts hour-long interviews with a variety of talented individuals who work in businesses that specialize in advertising, art, comedy, dining, fashion, health, lifestyles, literature, marketing, movies, music, promotions, publishing, radio, sports, television, and live theatre. The interviews are conducted either in-studio or on location.

title: "Torchwood" (2006) {Miracle Day: The Middle Men (#4.6)}
plot: Jack confronts Stuart Owens, PhiCorp's chief executive, who admits that he is as ignorant as everybody else as to the reason for Miracle Day. All he can tell Jack is that the answer should be in a cryptic document, the Blessing, which originated in Italy. Rex learns that the California overflow camp incinerates the 'undesirable' sick - illegal immigrants, criminals - and Vera. Rex and Esther are caught by Maloney but are saved by Maloney's appalled aide, Ralph, who shoots his boss and helps them escape. Gwen springs her father from Cowbridge but on return to America gets a call to say that her whole family has been captured and will only be released if she helps trap Jack. Knowing exactly what happens to Category 1 patients in the overflow camp, Rex uses a video recorder to document what is happening. Esther knows that something has happened to Vera Juarez and tries to learn more from the camp director, Colin Maloney. Jack meanwhile introduces himself to the Chief Operating Officer of Phicorp, Stuart Owens, who says that Miracle Day is something far greater than just his company. He suggests that Jack search for something called the Blessing. Having successfully rescued her father from an overflow camp in Wales, Gwen returns to Los Angeles but learns on arrival that her entire family has been kidnapped. The ransom: turn over Jack Harkness.

title: "Total Divas" (2013) {Eggs Over Freezing (#3.1)}
plot: Season three kicks off with Nikki planning for a future without current boyfriend John Cena. Meanwhile, Eva's life is turned upside down when she must decide between family and her husband. And tensions are high when a former diva returns to the roster, and later reveals a dark secret.

title: "Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell" (2012) {(#2.34)}
plot: On Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell, the comedian breaks down the issues and absurdities in politics, pop culture, race and religion, features interviews with a variety of stars and upstarts, and highlights a multi-cultured cast of correspondents, both in studio and on the street.

title: "Totally Spies!" (2001) {Mime Your Own Business (#4.6)}
plot: A mime plans to turn everyone into silent mimes with his accordion after a failed performance in order to get revenge, another way to stop Alex from telling Sam & Clover's secrets! In the b-story, Sam and Clover are mad because Alex tells their secrets. Villain: Jazz Hands.

title: "Touch" (2012) {Perfect Storm (#2.4)}
plot: Now that Calvin has the Aster Corps access card which he hands over to Martin, Martin is tasked with retrieving all Calvin's computer files from Aster Corps. Calvin warns Martin to avoid his old partner, Tony Rigby, as Tony, who did not appreciate Calvin's public departure, would exact some form of retribution if he found that Martin was there helping Calvin. Once at Aster Corps, Martin makes a last minute decision to take a different tact not only in getting Calvin's files, but also any files related to Amelia. Lucy pieces together the seemingly random murders similar to Claudia Corliss', which she is sure is linked to the mystery man in her photograph, but she does not yet know the connection to Amelia or the identity of the man. The Bohm's old friend Avram in New York receives a visit from Guillermo Ortiz, who Avram can tell is an enemy of the thirty-six. With only Jake's cell phone number, Avram tries to warn Jake and Martin that Ortiz is probably on his way. Jake, now attending public school, slowly begins to open up to those around him, especially Soleil. Kase decides to do his own experiments with Amelia. And Martin and Calvin individually each arrive at a major discovery, and have to figure out what to do with the information. Martin's decision could affect his relationship with Lucy.

title: "Touching Evil" (1997) {Innocent: Part 2 (#3.2)}
plot: A second victim is discovered,slain in exactly the same fashion as the first and earning the murderer the tag of the Garbage Bag Killer. Creegan concludes that although the women's husbands were from vastly different walks of life,the killer's motive was not due to hatred of the women but of the men that they left behind - leading him to grief counsellor Michael Lawlor,before another,shocking murder robs the unit of one of their own.

title: "Tough Rides: Brazil" (2016) {Manaus to Porto Velho (#1.4)}
plot: Ryan's rest on the Amazon River boat has come to an end. It is now time to test of Ryan's resolve and put his survival skills to the test, but not before a quick flight over the Rio Negra River. After exploring the Amazon rainforest from the air Ryan meets up with Leo, a tree climbing and jungle survival expert. Leo takes Ryan 50m up in to the Amazon canopy as they climb "The Iron Tree" and then spend a night drinking jungle alcohol made from the Sacacura Mira tree bark. Ryan barely survives his night in the jungle, and his reward is a soul crushing muddy 900km journey along the most dangerous road in South America, known as the "Road of Ghosts" - The BR-319. Ryan Pyle is back on his motorcycle. After successful adventure motorcycle journeys through China (Season #1) and India (Season #2), Ryan is keen to set out and explore the complexities and diversity of Brazil. This incredible journey will take Ryan from the sunny beaches of Rio de Janeiro, through the mining towns in Minas Gerais, into the deep Amazon and back through the southern metropolises of Florianopolis, Blumenau and Sao Paulo.

title: "Tour of Duty" (1987) {Saigon: Part 2 (#2.2)}
plot: Carol Anderson informs Zeke that she is marrying a nice guy; he wants her to be happy. Stacy Bridger travels to Saigon to meet her father, Sgt. Jake Bridger. He was killed by VC a week before. Except Bridger is in hiding and getting information about the VC to pass on to Command. McKay sends Goldman on a wild goose chase down the Fu Loc Highway so that he could be alone with Alex; McKay didn't know VC were all over the area. He flew to the rescue. That night, the VC launch a coordinated attack in Saigon, on Tan Son Nhut (the American base), and in cities throughout South Vietnam.

title: "Toy Stories" (2009) {Scalextric (#1.4)}
plot: James builds a Scalextric racetrack around the full length of the disused Brooklands racetrack in Surrey. Much of the former racetrack has now been built on, so his track needs to cross an ornamental pond on a pontoon bridge, climb a staircase in an office block via a spiral ramp and run through the streets of a housing estate. He then races two cars around the 3-mile track.

title: "Trailer Park Boys" (2001) {Gimme My Fuckin Money or Randy's Dead (#6.6)}
plot: After Randy refuses to be a character witness at Laheys reinstatement hearing, Lahey turns to Bubbles - for his help Bubbles comes up with a peaceful price. Due to Rickys prank calls, Sam comes to the park to get what he is owed from Randy.

title: "Transformers Prime" (2010) {Legacy (#2.20)}
plot: Transformers Prime deepens the epic mythology of both the AUTOBOTS and DECEPTICONS, while starting fresh for a new generation of viewers and future fans. OPTIMUS PRIME, BUMBLEBEE, ARCEE, RATCHET, BULKHEAD, and many others are back to "roll out" against MEGATRON's latest attempt to conquer Earth. And MEGATRON proves to be more powerful than ever, having acquired a rare element that allows him mastery over life itself. 'Team Prime' may be few against the DECEPTICON hordes, but they find increased strength via bonds forged with three human teenagers. Make no mistake, TRANSFORMERS PRIME WILL deliver heavy metal action, and nail-biting suspense -- but it also promises to take the human drama to levels as yet unseen by the franchise.

title: "Transformers" (1984) {Trans-Europe Express (#2.43)}
plot: The Autobots are racing in the Europa 2000 in order to protect American racer Auggie Cahnay and his technologically advanced car. Meanwhile, the Decepticons search Turkey in order to find the Pearl of Bahoudin. Waiting near the finish line, Megatron dispatches the Stunticons to interfere with the race. The Stunticons manage to steal Auggie's car while Megatron unearths the Pearl. He wants to use the metal from Cahnay' car to contain the Pearl. The Autobots take the Pearl and unleash its power. Ultimately, Bumblebee destroys the pearl before it can destroy the Earth.

title: "Transformers: Rescue Bots" (2011) {The Reign of Morocco (#1.13)}
plot: Transformers Rescue Bots follows the adventures of four young Transformers and their human counterparts- a family of emergency responders. HEATWAVE, CHASE, BLADES and BOULDER are tasked by Optimus Prime to study the ways of humanity and protect manking on the island of Griffin Rock, a highly advanced hub of technology where anything can happen. Whether it be rampaging Dinobots, volcanoes accidentally brought to life, or floating lobsters, the Rescue Bots will never hesitate to ROLL TO THE RESCUE!

title: "Trapper John, M.D." (1979) {Double Bubble (#6.10)}
plot: A young boy is brought to the hospital, needing a transplant from a close relative. They discover that his father is a reclusive millionaire. J.T. calls his office and is taken to his home where he tries to implore the man to help his son.

title: "Trauma: Life in the E.R." (1997) {Never Say Never (#7.5)}
plot: University of Oklahoma Medical Center, Oklahoma City: An 18-year-old girl is injured when she is thrown from a horse; A woman broke her wrist in a fall; A motorcyclist suffers a traumatic amputation when he loses control and is thrown from his bike; A 57-year-old woman is injured when a semi hits her vehicle; A tractor overturns on a farmer when he hits a ditch while backing up;

title: "Travel the Road" (2003) {The Quest: Road to Tibet - Part 1 (#2.4)}
plot: The journey continues as missionaries Tim Scott and Will Decker return home to America. We now find them struggling to adjust to life in Los Angeles where everything seems so foreign. After surviving a near fatal car accident these two daring missionaries say a painful goodbye to those they love and once again journey into the unknown. Armed only with a backpack, a change of clothes and their Bibles, Tim and Will depart for the most dangerous and remote lands on the planet. From the prehistoric jungles of Borneo to the snow covered mountains of Tibet and through the war-zones of Afghanistan the guys encounter Taliban gunfights, Siberian blizzards, bandits and sacrificial burials as they risk their lives to preach the gospel.

title: "Treasures of Ancient Greece" (2015) {The Long Shadow (#1.3)}
plot: As the Romans greatly admired Greek art, they allowed their empire to be culturally 'hellenized' just as they conquered the known world. Elements would be retained as Christianity adopted Roman traditions. The rest would be rediscovered during the Renaissance and a few masterpieces such as the Laakoon group and a bathing Aphodoite would gain extreme influence as perfect examples. Artists like Michelangelo were proud to follow in the footsteps of Praxiteles and other Greek masters, while even the prudish Catholic church overcame taboos like nudity, notably in mythological and Biblical scenes.

title: "Treehouse Masters" (2013) {Meditating Maple (#4.3)}
plot: Pete finds the perfect treehouse spot in West Seattle for a couple seeking a meditation space - 20 ft up in a twisting pair of maples. The NTS team channels their chakras, creating a healing space fit for both humans AND four-legged friends alike.

title: "Treme" (2010) {Don't You Leave Me Here (#3.8)}
plot: Desautel's on the Avenue opens softly. Sonny pawns instruments to buy jewelry. LaDonna Batiste-Williams gets threats from a stranger and support from Albert Lambreaux. Sofia Bernette gets evicted for her own protection. Terry Colson finds a case collapsing and his popularity declining. Desiree confronts Robinette.

title: "Trial & Retribution" (1997) {Siren: Part 1 (#12.1)}
plot: Gunmen in a car force an ambulance off the road, killing a paramedic. The ambulance overturns and the gangsters shoot and kill patient Sebastian Cole. It becomes clear that Cole and his friend Ross were working as drug smugglers but D.C.I. McGill is annoyed when Mike and Roisin crash in to interview Ross as McGill had had him under surveillance. Cole's girlfriend, Imogen, is an 'It' girl frequently seen in the pages of tabloids. She is distraught at the death and her mother tells the police that she was innocent of all knowledge of the drug running. The team are not so sure but need proof.

title: "Tricky TV" (2005) {(#1.4)}
plot: Stephen's special guests, The Cheeky Girls, help him perform a trick with playing cards - by sitting on them. Plus Stephen shows how to turn a handkerchief turns into an egg with a touch of magic. Also, The Cheeky Girls help out with an interesting twist on a classic stage illusion when Stephen saws both girls in half and switches their lower halves.

title: "Trisha's Southern Kitchen" (2012) {Day Trip to Memphis (#7.2)}
plot: A trip to Memphis, to visit Graceland and other Elvis haunts, inspires Trisha to cook a banana-pancake sandwich filled with a spread made of peanut butter and maple syrup. Other recipes include: tamale-style pulled pork; and an indulgent vanilla milkshake.

title: "Tropic of Cancer" (2010)
plot: Simon Reeve makes another trip around the world, like in Tropic of Capricorn, but now in the Northern hemisphere, along the Tropic of Cancer. Simon thus visits Mexico, the Caribean, Northern Africa, Arabia, India, Bangla Desh, Burma, Laos, Vietnam, Taiwan and Hawai. Local conditions, people, wildlife, history, culture, politics, ecology prove quite varied.

title: "Trucks!" (1999) {Second Chance Silverado Part 3: Color Match Painting (#2009.4)}
plot: With our Silverado the right shape, itâEUR(TM)s time to make it the right color again. WeâEUR(TM)ll show you how to paint only the parts you need to and how to blend the color for a seamless and invisible repair so no one can tell whatâEUR(TM)s new from whatâEUR(TM)s original.

title: "True Blood" (2008) {Nothing But the Blood (#2.1)}
plot: Detective Andy and the Merlotte's waitresses find the body of Miss Jeanette without her heart in a parked car. Lafayette is still missing; actually he is chained in the basement of a house with two other guys. Sookie visits Bill and meets Jessica; Bill explains that he is teaching the young woman to be a vampire, but the jealous Sookie questions why he had not told her before. Sam recalls his past with Maryann when he was a seventeen year-old teenager. Tara flirts with Egg, who also lives in Maryann's manor. Jason joins the church Fellowship of the Sun and schedules a seminar with the followers. Detective Andy and the Merlotte's waitresses find the body of Miss Jeanette without her heart in a parked car. Lafayette is still missing; actually he is chained in the basement of a house with two other guys. Sookie visits Bill and meets Jessica; Bill explains that he is teaching the young woman to be a vampire but the jealous Sookie question why he had not told him before. Sam recalls his past with Maryann when he was a seventeen year-old teenager. Tara flirts with Eggs, who also lives in Maryann's manor. Jason joins the church Fellowship of the Sun and schedules a seminar with the followers.

title: "True Crime with Aphrodite Jones" (2010) {West Memphis Three (#2.6)}
plot: When the dead bodies of three young boys turn up in a ditch, the town of West Memphis is turned upside down. Law enforcement arrests and tries three teenage boys, despite the fact that no solid evidence ties the teenagers to this horrific crime.

title: "True Life" (1998) {I'm Deaf}
plot: Sixteen year old Chris, who was born deaf, has made the decision to get a cochlear implant. If successful, it will allow him to hear for the first time. Amanda, who was also born deaf, discovered how to dance by the vibrations of music. Now she has the opportunity to compete for a spot on an NFL dance team, but is afraid that her deafness will keep her from making the cut.

title: "True Talent" (2011)
plot: Three celebrity artists travel the country to discover incredible raw musical talents. These lucky few are then tutored and refined to be the best they can be. They then face the ultimate challenge: performing alone on stage. Three separate audiences, representing three different age groups, get to vote, but they cannot see the contestants. When more than half of any age group signals that they like what they hear, the audience pod rotates and the singer is revealed. The catch is - all 3 audiences must approve if the singer is to progress in the competition. True Talent is all that matters, and it is rewarded with a major cash prize. Music talent show where three celebrity artists travel the country to discover incredible raw musical talents. These lucky few are then tutored and refined to be the best they can be. They then face the ultimate challenge: performing alone on stage. Three separate audiences, representing three different generations, get to vote, without seeing the contestants. If more than half of any age group signals that they like what they hear, the audience pod rotates and the singer is revealed. The catch is - all three generations must approve if the singer is to progress in the competition. True Talent is all that matters, and it is rewarded with a major cash prize.

title: "Truth and Power" (2016) {Activists or Terrorists? (#1.5)}
plot: A journalist and a punk-rock academic who are passionate about animal rights become government targets for their efforts to expose controversial treatment of animals. Undeterred, they use freedom of information laws to uncover a troubling link between the U.S. government and big agriculture that has silenced animal rights activists.

title: "Tsukuyomi: Moon Phase" (2004) {Onii-sama, sorette doko no chihô no temari uta? (#1.21)}
plot: Having drunk Kouhei's blood turns the tables on the fighting as Arte, now self-actualized, follows her own motivations against the instructions of the Master. This action produces a new ability in Kouhei and inspires Hazuki to take on the Master's agents at full power. To compensate for the impending loss, Jeda takes a hostage and turns one other into one of his puppets.

title: "Tumble Leaf" (2013) {Icy Igloo/The Big Dig (#1.8)}
plot: ICY IGLOO: Fig and Maple use a slippery block of ice that Fig's found as the inspiration for the igloo that Fig has always wanted to build. With the help of a playful Ice Skipper, they slip and slide their way through the construction of a special "Figloo" at Glacier Grove. THE BIG DIG: Fig and Hedge set out to build something on the beach with a shovel that Fig's found. When a little cloud threatens to rain on their parade, Fig and Hedge decide to cheer the sad little cloud by building a tall cloud tower made of sand.

title: "Turbocharged Thunderbirds" (1994)
plot: Tripp and Roxette find themselves on Hacker Command, a space station orbiting Thunderworld. Their job is to monitor the world and report to International Rescue when danger arises, usually from a scheme from The Atrocimator and his assistant The Hood.

title: "Tutenstein" (2003) {I Did It My Way (#1.4)}
plot: Tut doesn't like the modern world. He finds it very uncomfortable. So Tut changes modern world back into ancient Egypt. As usual, nothing goes as planned and everything gets out of control. Tut finds out that this Egypt doesn't work for him, either.

title: "Twice in a Lifetime" (1999) {School's Out (#1.8)}
plot: Spinster Eloise Hawke taught History at Charlottesville High School for over twenty years. She was uncompromising in her attitude - she admits that she may have been cruel but fair - and universally despised by her students and colleagues. For her entire life, she lived with her critical father, Dr. Eldridge Hawke - himself a History professor - who didn't allow her to see Gary Ray, her one true love when she was younger. She had no idea that Gary had tried to contact her as her father tore up his letters before she could see them. She credits this lack of love on her hard nature. Othniel sends her back to the beginning of her teaching career at Charlottesville High, when Eric Lee was her student, Eric who in this current lifetime grew up to become a homeless man due in part to the harshness of her teaching methods. He begged for assistance in her class so that he could continue with his true passion of playing on the football team, which she denied. She is sent back as Eileen Kotter, the Board of Education's Accreditation Supervisor - a teacher's evaluator - her first person to evaluate is Eloise Hawke. But all Eileen Kotter has on her mind is getting back at her father for denying her younger self the one love of her life.
