In her plan, she learns something about why he acted the way he did toward her. But in enacting her plan, Miss Kotter will have to help Eric without the assistance of Miss Hawke.

title: "Twisted Mines" (2015)
plot: Detroit Hip Hop dancer, Omari finds himself struggling with relationships among: his high maintenance girlfriend, his step-mother, and other associates. With Omari being on house arrest from a previous encounter with the local police, He battles the consequences that were delegated by the judge. The trouble of being on house arrest and incessantly making an effort to get back on the right path in life is a responsibility easier said than done. .

title: "Two Guys, a Girl and a Pizza Place" (1998) {Au Revoir Pizza Place (#3.2)}
plot: Pete returns from Paris with a French girlfriend, Colette. However, she doesn't speak English and Pete doesn't speak French and, when he finally gets a translator, Pete finds out that she is racist. Berg employs a new boy in the pizza place called Germ and Berg is having trouble with the generation gap. When Germ organises a naked band to play at the pizza place Berg decides that he has had enough of the place. Sharon final commits 100% to Johnny and proposes to him - the wedding is on.

title: "Two Marriages" (1983)
plot: This series follows two families, the Daleys and the Armstrongs, who are neighbors. The Daleys are a blended family, Ann is a construction engineer who has a son Scott from a previous marriage, who's a little rebellious, Jim, who works at his family's dairy farm has an adopted Vietnamese daughter, and they have a son Willie. The Armstrongs consists of Art who is a doctor, his wife Nancy, who wishes she can have a career like Ann, and their children, Eric and Shelby who has a crush on Scott.

title: "Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps" (2001) {Purgatory (#4.5)}
plot: Rather than go to the graduation ball Louise throws her own party with Janet, taking charge of the guest list. She invites Jonny and Kate,feeling that Jonny has become a nicer person since going out with her though everywhere everybody looks Jonny and Kate seem to be at it and the party is no exception, Kate going out of her way to spite Janet by sleeping with Jonny in her bed. Gaz feels guilty about two-timing Donna and ends up back with her,having written her essay for her.

title: "Two and a Half Men" (2003) {Aunt Myra Doesn't Pee a Lot (#4.20)}
plot: Alan's dream of freedom is about to come true now his ex Judith is getting remarried to Dr. Herb Melnick. He worries that Charlie, who is having sex with Herb's sister, Myra, will somehow ruin it for him again. Getting Jake prepared for the ceremony is just a dirty routine problem. Charlie stands in for the sick relative who was to walk bridesmaid Myra to the altar, just to infuriate Judith. He's after some fun but gets a bitter aftertaste.

title: "Two and a Half Men" (2003) {Is There a Mrs. Waffles? (#5.8)}
plot: Alan and Jake hardly take note of Charlie's success on TV as singing children idol 'Charlie Waffles', but a flow of fat checks awakes fraternal envy. Yet when manager Bob 'Artie' Pliskin waves the contract to make Charlie do the one thing he fears in public, performing live, Alan supports him, only to become jealous again seeing even a drunk Charlie's partially scatological repertoire scores with his adoring audience.

title: "Two and a Half Men" (2003) {Slowly and in a Circular Fashion (#9.13)}
plot: Walden wants to steer his company into new investments, but is blocked within the board by his vindictive ex Bridget and his own mother Robin, whom she bribed with doubled primate research funds. Walden's British lover Zoey however finds a way out in the company bylaws: he founder can name an additional board member and cast the deciding vote. Looking for a spineless pawn, Walden chooses Alan, who is delighted with the $50,000 annual fee and board room treats. Bridget and Robin try to bribe Alan with a Porsche and intimate attention.

title: "Ty the Pie Guy" (2015) {Lunch Box Blues (#1.14)}
plot: Dan Povenmire (Disney's Phineas and Ferb) stars as Harry Huckleberry in this special Ty the Pie Guy episode! Harry needs advice on packing a good lunch for his kids. With these tips from Ty, you can get a head start on making the best lunches ever!

title: "U.S. Marshal" (1958) {Good Indian (#1.29)}
plot: Apache and Pima Indian families accuse each other of rustling cattle from their respective ranches. The situation is exacerbated when a boy and girl from different tribes fall in love with each other. Marshal Morgan must find the culprits before an all-out range war breaks out with the two lovers caught in the crossfire.

title: "UFC Ultimate Insider" (2012) {Cejudo/Pettis/Esparza/Velasquez (#4.407)}
plot: Olympic gold medalist Henry Cejudo's remarkable rise to Octagon contention; the lights burn bright in Milwaukee for Lightweight champion Anthony "Showtime" Pettis; inaugural UFC Women's Strawweight champ Carla Esparza in studio; Heavyweight champ Cain Velasquez watches his teammate Daniel Cormier collide with Jon Jones in Full Blast.

title: "UFC Ultimate Insider" (2012) {On the Brink: Pettis vs Melendez (#4.406)}
plot: Anthony Pettis and Gilbert Melendez offer unfiltered access to their lightweight championship blockbuster at UFC 181; Ben Saunders' historic Omoplata submission analyzed in Gracie Breakdown; former welterweight champion Johny Hendricks unlocks his warrior code.

title: "UFC: Road to the Octagon" (2012) {Johnson vs Benavidez 2 (Road 9) (#1.9)}
plot: Before the Ultimate Fighting Championship arrives in Sacramento, California for anaction packed event on December 14th, witness the lives and training camps of six of the world's most electrifying athletes in UFC's Road to the Octagon: Johnson vs Benavidez 2. UFC Flyweight champion, Demetrious Johnson fights to bolster his spot as his division's greatest mixed martial artist by defeating perennial contender Joseph Benavidez in a rematch of their 2012 inaugural flyweight title bout.Step inside their homes and training camps as the two prepare to settle their heated rivalry. In the co-main event, California's resident superstar Urijah Faber faces rising star Michael McDonald. Faber looks to cement his storied career with another run at a UFC title shot but he faces a formidable foe in McDonald, who represents a new breed of up-and-coming fighter. Observe the family support and internal drive that has brought each to the UFC's biggest stage on the threshold of a bantamweight title shot. In another highly anticipated matchup with potential itle implications, knockout artist Matt Brown and former interim champion Carlos Condit square off in amatch up of dangerous welterweight contenders. Brown's resolve during tough times has translated to a gritty fighting style and impressive win streak while Carlos Condit seeks another shot at UFC gold while balancing family and fierce training. Before they descend upon Sacramento and these career defining moments, learn how life's triumphs and struggles have shaped and prepared these extraordinary fighters in their Road to the Octagon.

title: "UFO" (1970) {Ordeal (#1.19)}
plot: Following a wild night out with a girl called Sylvia, Foster is receiving a refreshing sauna bath at the SHADO health farm. Drifting into semi-consciousness, he comes to to find he has been abducted by an alien and is on a UFO, which is shot down onto the Moon's surface. He survives but has to be extremely careful how he removes the helmet he is wearing. Clumsy removal would kill him because of the breathing liquid it contains. However, as he drifts in and out of consciousness, it appears that he never left the sauna.

title: "URBO: The Adventures of Pax Afrika" (2006) {Human Racers (#2.20)}
plot: When Malice decides he's going to turn the annual iKaponopolis race into an advertising smorgasbord, the citizens rebel and start their own underground race. Unlikely adversaries team up to claim the title of race champion, and Pax learns an important lesson when he smugly refuses to practice and loses out to the better-prepared Ric and Keitu.

title: "US Tzu Chi 360" (2009) {BOMLA: One of a Kind (#3.98)}
plot: We go back to the Barack Male Leadership Academy in Dallas, TX, this time, to learn more about the man who had the idea of redefining education for the youth in one of Dallas' poorest areas. Not only he is a role model for his students, for many of them, he is a father figure and they follow his example.

title: "US Tzu Chi 360" (2009) {San Francisco: Happy Family, Part I (#4.114)}
plot: Tzu Chi in San Francisco entered Hunter's Point and decided to help educate the children of Malcolm X only 3 years ago. However, they never stopped there. Roxanne Buchwitz and other Tzu Chi Volunteers realized that the children faced many difficulties that could not be solved through the limited time they had together in school. Against all odds, the Volunteers decided to go into the heart of this dangerous neighborhood and do home visits. This was the beginning of Happy Family. They saw many unspeakable living conditions. Some of the kids have never slept on a bed in their whole life! This pushed the Volunteers to do furniture delivery and turn their house into a home. Now Tzu Chi Volunteers are able to help the children grow in school as well as with the Family. It's a Happy Campus and a Happy Family.

title: "Ubiistvo Kennedy: 13-aya versiya" (2003)
plot: For more than 40 years, the death of a beloved American president still puzzles and intrigues hundreds of researchers around the world. There is still no single completely believable explanation of how and why Kennedy was killed. The official versions is doubtful to say the least... This film tells about different versions presented by American researchers and includes an interview with an inmate of an American prison who is serving a life sentence. This inmate claims that he was the one who shot the President.

title: "Udaari" (2016) {Meera Struggles While Imtiaz Makes His Move (#1.9)}
plot: Arsh and Haris patronise Meeran about her singing, whereas Milli supports her. Sheedan tries to correct daily chores by applying her traditional methods. Zebo plays in the rain. Imtiaz tells her to get into the room as Sajida was not home. He rapes her and threatens her to keep her mouth shut or he would kill Sajida. Meeran is depressed as she found herself not capable for the band. She is consoled by Milli. When Sajida arrives home, she finds Zebo sick. Arsh yells at Meeran for singing wrong and discourages her which hurts Meeran. Arsh apologises to Meeran when he finds her crying and encourages her that she has a hidden talent.

title: "Ugly Betty" (2006) {The Lyin', the Watch and the Wardrobe (#1.5)}
plot: It's Halloween and Betty is in for a series of frightful experiences, ranging from showing up dressed for the Mode costume contest . . . only to learn there isn't one, to dealing with her growing attraction to Henry, while a jealous Walter fumes -- and, worst of all, tracking down a watch Daniel left at one of his many girlfriends' apartments (he just can't remember which one). Meanwhile, Daniel pays a visit to his mom in rehab, and Wilhelmina is horrified to learn that she can't fit into a designer gown

title: "Ultimate Restorations" (2014) {The Schooner Coronet: Racing Into History}
plot: The show follows the restoration of a second yacht, this time a racing schooner named the Coronet. It is the last of its kind. Built in 1885, she won transatlantic races, was one of the first US registered yachts to sail around cape horn, and has circumnavigated the earth. After barely surviving, she is now being rebuilt and restored to once again sail the ocean.

title: "Ultimate Rush" (2011) {Wakeboard (#1.20)}
plot: Two of the greatest wakeboarders, Adam Errington and Parks Bonifay take a road trip together, showcasing and filming their wakeboarding skills in some of the most spectacular locales in America. First to Washington's Radar Lake - a wakeboarding Mecca, then to Lake Powell with pro wakeboarder, Danny Harf. They create astonishing moments on the most beautiful bodies of water in America as new settings raise athletes to greater heights.

title: "Ultimate Survival Alaska" (2013) {Rogue Warrior (#3.6)}
plot: In leg six, the teams are inserted into the heart of Alaskan gold country. Slashing through a thorny gantlet of devil's club, they charge for the insertion flag. Then the teams begin leg seven on remote tundra in the shadow of Mount McKinley. The area is known for being some of the most brutal, inhospitable terrain in Alaska.

title: "Ulysse 31" (1981) {The Seat of Forgetfulness (#1.11)}
plot: When the Odyssey is passed by one of the remote controlled Trident Transport vessels Ulysses decides to follow it. The Odyssey follows the pilot-less ship all the way to the home of the gods, Olympus itself. Zeus orders Ulysses and the children to leave immediately but Ulysses refuses to listen. The group find themselves upon a deadly game board but with Nono's help they manage to escape. They discover what has happened to all those who have entered Olympus before them, a workforce of eternal slaves forced to operate the vast looms of the gods weaving the threads of life for the Three Fates. An immortal army of the dead attacks Ulysses and he becomes separated from the children. The gods then offer him a choice between two seats - one will allow him to return home the other will return the children to him.

title: "Un-Natural Selection" (2011)
plot: "Un-Natural Selection" follows Joe and Sarah, two recently single 30/40 something's as they stumble through the confusing & intimidating world of internet dating. They seek advice from their small circle of friends on how to present themselves online, rules about coffee dates, sexting, strategic touching, etc. Each character has a very different take on how to pursue the opposite sex. But Joe & Sarah must ultimately find a way to be true to themselves while going outside their comfort zones to find that special someone.

title: "Uncle Grandpa" (2010) {Uncle Grandpa at the Movies (#2.16)}
plot: Uncle Grandpa and Pizza Steve annoy Mr.Gus during an afternoon at the movies.

title: "Undead Noise" (2012)
plot: A young, aspiring reporter named Amanda Dyar begins her own Internet radio program to help her achieve her lifelong dream of getting the perfect interview. Amanda creates Undead Noise, a news show featuring interviews with celebrities from horror films and the video game industries, became an instant success. Undead Noise seemed like the perfect outlet to help her reach her goal and let off some on-air steam as Mistress Barbie, as she is known on the show. However, Amanda will find out that reaching her dream may be more difficult than she previously imagined. Contacting and booking guests are just the beginning of problems keeping her from reaching her dream, and they may cut her dream short before she even gets a real chance at it. Undead Noise follows the life of one aspiring reporter looking for the perfect interview as told through her Internet radio program also called Undead Noise. As she soon finds out, her dream may be harder to achieve than she first anticipated as she experiences many problems along the way including technical difficulties, late guests on a live show, and her quirky co-host. Of course, her problems are not limited to what actually happens on the show, and sometimes it becomes a struggle just for her to show up to her own show on time. Mistress Barbie, her interview moniker on the show, may end up being the person that learns the meaning of pain and suffering before her dreams can be realized.

title: "Under the Dome" (2013) {Move On (#3.1)}
plot: After following Melanie through the tunnels, most of the residents of Chester's Mill find themselves outside the dome. Barbie finds Julia dead but along with the other survivors, he moves with his life. A year later, he's working for a private security firm rescuing kidnap victims. He's in a new relationship with Eva Sinclair and decides to to return to Chester's Mill for a memorial service that is being held on the first anniversary of their escape. While newly arrived Christine Price provides counseling to the townsfolk, Barbie begins to realize that everything around them is just too perfect. When the exit collapses and the Dome disintegrates, many town-folk are killed, a few cut off inside with Julia, and Jim murders Junior. Yet a year later, many more congregate for a memorial, having started new lives, such as Barbie commanding a private special ops-style rescue team. Only Ben Drake claims it's all a huge hokes, as even his asthma was mysteriously cured, but he collapses fatally before he can can address the gathering. A company therapist manipulates survivors, even Joe's grief over his sister. A creature in Melanie's shape operates a strange control room, apparently shaping an alternate reality. Jim destroys everything recalling the past, wounded Junior and Julia soldier on.

title: "Underbelly" (2008) {Squizzy Makes the Front Page (#6.6)}
plot: The police regularly raid Squizzy's Caulfield House, upturning Lorna's life, looking for something, anything that will lead them to Squizzy Taylor. Detective Bruce befriends the pregnant Lorna and tries to convince her to turn her husband in. She may be devastated by Squizzy's disappearance and the fact he's taken a lover, but she is a loyal wife no less and won't budge. Ida's loyalty reconfirmed, the police's case in disarray and with a film to be made, Squizzy decides to turn himself in, convinced he can beat any court case. In classic Squizzy style, he arrives at police headquarters at a time of his own choosing, on his own terms, with a contingent of press to witness the event. And as he predicts he is immediately bailed yet again. But he discovers there's a price to fame when a former admirer turned stalker guns him down in the street. Although Squizzy survives, the film does not - the government censor bans it in the public interest for its unsavoury association with such a notorious criminal as Mr. L. 'Squizzy' Taylor.

title: "Undercover" (2016/I) {(#1.3)}
plot: In 1996 Michael is killed by a cell-mate in police custody at Hackney but Brightman orders a cover-up by the officers involved. Maya attempts to expose the true facts helped by her journalist friend Julia but Julia is compromised into dropping the story. Julia also has suspicions about Nick's account of himself but Maya loves him and the feeling seems to be mutual. Twenty years later Abigail Strickland, one of the Hackney officers ,contacts Maya to tell her about Michael's death and Nick's true identity but Maya has to travel to Louisiana for a further stay of Rudy's execution and asks Nick to see her. As a result Maya never gets the message but Julia tells her she has seen Nick with Abigail and this has a bad effect on Maya.

title: "Underworld Inc." (2015) {Las Vegas Hustle (#2.7)}
plot: From card cheats to armed robbers, criminals across America make a beeline for the Casinos of Las Vegas. To defend themselves casinos have become crime-fighting organizations. Criminals react to casino crackdowns with more inventive means of attack. The casinos need to stay on top. At stake is their very survival.

title: "Undressed" (1999) {The Set Up (#3.24)}
plot: Segment 1: Things between Gale and Skeet are going fine, but when Gale is assigned a project with a guy named Mitch, Skeet gives Gale a pager so that he can know where she is, and whom she is with. Mitch and Gale are working on a clay model of 'The Hanging Gardens of Babylon'. Gale accidentally spills a drink on the model, and they start to pat it down with their shirts. Mitch looks at Gale, and notices how beautiful she is. Skeet then walks in on them, and asks what is going on. Gale explains things, but it leads to an argument, and she leaves saying that she might just leave him. "The Set Up": Nicole's friend, Elyse is visiting her for two weeks, and Nicole is shocked that Elyse's tendencies haven't changed. She is still a craze sex maniac. She brings home a guy she met while sharing a taxi, and right after sex, she kicks him out. Segment 3: Things between Dean and Kendra aren't going to well, and they both know they love each other, but Kendra is explaining that if they didn't tell anyone they been going out will be perfect. Meanwhile, things with Colin and Frank aren't going to well, and Colin can't understand why Frank doesn't want to show PDA (Public Display of Affection).

title: "Ungiven" (2013)
plot: TV Mini-Series "Ungiven" is inspired by one of the most heroic events in the recent history of Bulgaria, the rescue of Bulgarian Jews from the death camps during the Second World War. The series includes all the major events in the political scene between 1940 and 1945. In "Ungiven" there are three parallel storylines - world politics, the stages through Bulgarian people save Jews and the fate of two families. Characters are played out against the backdrop of historical events. All characters in the film are complex, multifaceted and interesting. The actors demonstrate fortitude and professionalism. Saturated with the live drama of lives are played out against the backdrop of actual historical events. In March 2013 Bulgaria marks 70 years since the, although different in their political and social affiliations, refuse to be passive witnesses of genocide. Unique history and was filmed for the first time. All persons and events in the series are chronological, factual and historically accurate. "Ungiven" introduced the world to the Bulgarian feat while reminding audience glorious and worthy deeds of our ancestors - saving 48,000 souls. Bulgaria is the only country in the world that does not allow Jews to be taken in the death camps.

title: "United States of Tara" (2009) {Crackerjack (#3.2)}
plot: Tara starts her psychology classes in fine form as one of her alters, Shoshana the psychologist emerges. She's thoroughly embarrassed but her teacher, Dr. Harris seems quite relaxed about it all. Until his next class where his comments about DID upset her. Meanwhile, Max continues losing customers to a competitor who has a solution for him: sell out to them and take a full-time job with them. The deal doesn't include Neil however. Kate decides she wants to go to Japan as an English teacher. Marshall and Lionel are assigned to make a film together. As Tara walks into her first Abnormal Psychology class, she transitions into her psychiatrist alter Shoshanna and begins lecturing her fellow students, only to be interrupted by the actual professor, Dr. Hattaras, who uses Tara's incident to embarrass her in front of her classmates as well as to vocalize his skepticism about D.I.D. At the same time, high school film students Marshall, Lionel and Noah set out to make a movie that their narrow-minded teacher won't soon forget. Max has his own worries when his biggest lawn-care competitor Larry, offers to buy Max's business which, if Max accepts, would put his best friend Neil out of a job. The timing couldn't be worse, since Neil has just moved in with Charmaine, to help bring their baby into the world. This adds to Kate's desperation to get out of Charmaine's house, and she finds an opportunity to teach English in Japan, an idea that leaves Max & Tara less than thrilled.

title: "Univer" (2008) {(#5.16)}
plot: Tanya and Sasha welcome a son, but the parents can not deal with it. Then Sylvester Andreyevich called to look after her grandson. Alla, without the permission of Michael, sings in the cafe. He came to the same place with his friend. While Gosha distracting Michael, Alla performs with Kuzya. But he tore his pants.

title: "Univer" (2008) {(#7.22)}
plot: Ksenia sent to Michael a parcel from America, where he found a ring given once to her. She's getting married and asks her not to worry. Michael with hot finds nothing better than to propose to Yana. Valentine sudden twists of abdominal pain, Masha did not believe him and refused to call an ambulance. Then it turns out that he is really sick.

title: "Univer" (2008) {Tanina beremennost (#1.48)}
plot: Dad sends Sasha catalog of the best hookers in Moscow to he compared them with Tanya. Tanya becomes hysterical and complains Allochka that if this goes on, the pope will send his son not only catalogs, but also probes. But the worst thing is that Michael "borrowed" Sasha condoms without his knowledge, and after a stormy argument Sasha and Tanya "put up" without them ...

title: "Unnatural Causes" (2008) {When the Bough Breaks (#1.2)}
plot: Infant mortality rates among African Americans remain twice as high as among whites. African American women with graduate degrees still face a greater risk of delivering pre-term, low birth-weight babies than white women who didn't finish high school. In this medical detective story, researchers are circling in on the added burden of racism through the life-course as a long-term risk factor.

title: "Unsolved Mysteries" (1987) {(#2.15)}
plot: Newport WA 1935 Creamery Robbery. Deputy Sheriff George Conniff shot and killed allegedly by a Spokane policemen Clyde Ralstin. Ralstin was robbing the creamery with two others when Conniff surprised them. Ralstin's involvement was not discovered until 1989. The uncovering of the murder was showcased in the book, "Breaking Blue" by Timothy Egan.

title: "Untamed & Uncut" (2008) {The Moaning Cowboy (#1.26)}
plot: Nashville, Tennessee: A bull rider ends up underneath a bull after he gets knocked out when the bull hits hits him in the head with a horn; Forbes, Australia: At a horse race, the lead horse stumbles, causing a pile-up; Port Elizabeth, South Africa: At a wildlife park, an elephant calf is unable to get out of a watering hole that it has slipped into; Phoenix, Arizona: A police dog tackles a man claiming to have a bomb; A zebra bites a crocodile's eye after the crocodile grabs a front leg; Playa Del Rey, California: A sea lion is trapped in a power plant's water basin; Doral, Florida: As an alligator is being loaded onto a tow truck, it smacks its trapper's face with its tail.

title: "Untold Stories of the ER" (2004) {Frozen (#8.14)}
plot: Doctors struggle to save a young man brought to the ER frozen and pulseless; a man gets deathly ill while attending his own anniversary party; an embarrassing hidden secret prohibits a heart attack patient from being rushed to the OR for surgery.

title: "Unusual Suspects" (2010) {Christmas Mourning (#5.2)}
plot: In Georgia, just days before Christmas, Beverly Eller is found murdered in her apartment. After years of tireless investigation, a critical piece of evidence helps investigators unravel the bizarre chain of events that led to Beverly's tragic murder.

title: "Unwrapped" (2001) {Bacon (#20.2)}
plot: Stories include: Bacon Ice Cream from Woodside Farm Creamery, Microwave Pork Rinds from Lawrey's in Portland, OR, Archie McPhee, in Seattle, WA, Bacon of the Month Club, Big Fat Bacon on a Stick at the Fair and Bacon Cupcakes from Tee & Cakes Bakery in Boulder, CO.

title: "Unwrapped" (2001) {Sweet and Salty (#16.4)}
plot: Stories include: Snickers from Mars Candy, Fran's Chocolates in Seattle, WA, Potato Chip Cookies from Immaculate Baking Company, Jeni's Ice Cream in Columbus, OH, Chocolate Fudge Covered Peanut Butter Pretzel Sandwiches from Snyder's of Hanover in Hanover, PA and Wolfgang Candy Company in York, PA.

title: "Up on High Ground" (2014) {Underlying agreements (#1.6)}
plot: Kaidence meets Jaris at home for the first time and the two quickly become friends. Erin and Griffin quickly become a couple of forevers. Bogroe is caught by the nosy neighbors on his way out to a money making side gig. Catcalls and bribery from Hayley force his hand to the coercion of cash to keep his secret gig an unknown to Dillon and Landon. A show-choir competition before the state finals reveals Ellie is giving Ms.Fritz pointers from her previous championship year before transferring. The group show-choir competition between East Valley Academy and Mount Vernon High-school appear flawlessly performed with the cliffhanger results left to be read by Principal Guidry.

title: "Upstairs, Downstairs" (1971) {Facing Fearful Odds (#4.12)}
plot: Richard receives another visit from Mrs. Virginia Hamilton, the war widow he had met some months before. She again seeks his assistance but this time on a far more personal matter. Her 17 year-old son, an acting Sub-Lieutenant in the Navy, has been arrested and will face a court-martial charged with cowardice in the face of the enemy. He suggests that Virginia hire the family solicitor, Sir Geoffrey Dillon, to represent him and she quickly agrees. In the end, Richard can only but admire Virginia's strength of character and demeanor. Downstairs meanwhile, Ruby is taken to task for stealing food though she claims she has been using it to feed the animals at the zoo. With Edward away visiting his family, Hudson has also had to put up with Daisy's frequent and lengthy absences. The truth comes tumbling out when Hudson receives a visit from a military policeman to advise that Edward is absent without leave. It seems that Edward's regiment is to return to France and it's up to Hudson to try and knock some sense into Daisy and get her to convince Edward to return to his camp. Virginia Hamilton, who enlisted Richard's help as Civil Lord for a government scheme a year ago, has returned to the Eaton Place in behalf of her son, Michael. He is barely 18 years old and is facing a naval court martial for cowardice during a recent action. She is seeking legal advice and Sir Geoffrey Dillon agrees to represent Michael in the proceedings against him. Meanwhile, Edward has left to visit his family, but Hudson and Mrs. Bridges sense some odd behavior at Daisy's end. Moreover, Ruby is hoarding scraps of food and it doesn't go unnoticed -- not in these desperate times of extreme rationing. James is very disagreeable in his convalescence and resents that Hazel has accompanied Virginia to her son's trial in Dover. His behavior is extremely erratic and he is given to incoherent and very unsettling comments. In the end, Michael is found guilty of cowardice, but is spared expulsion, his extreme youth merits the consideration of the tribunal. Edward, however, is in serious trouble -- seems despite his indisposition, he's to be sent back to France and tried to dodge the authorities. Hudson tells Daisy that the ultimate punishment for Edward is the firing squad and Daisy discloses where he's hiding. Mrs. Bridges surmises that Ruby has been sending him the scraps of food she was storing. Despite a spirit that has galvanized all in the war effort, Daisy bitterly notes that a class-based double standard still exists. Michael Hamilton is found guilty with a slap on the wrist, but her husband, who is not at all well, can face dire consequences for being sent back to the fighting that has scarred him. Hudson protects Edward, but it's not a happy ending for Virginia Hamilton. Richard breaks the terrible news to her that Michael has been killed in the most recent action, perhaps to compensate for the recent verdict rendered against him. Virginia is devastated and Richard marvels at the dignity, character and extreme bravery of this exceptional woman -- a widow who has now sacrificed both her husband and teen-aged son for King and country.

title: "Urbain" (2005) {Modelhuwelijk in de verf (#1.4)}
plot: Urbain is too lazy to get up early enough to drive son Maurice to soccer. So he gets babysitter Kiki to do it and pretends that was her idea, but wife Nicole sees trough his lies. Just then manager Didier has arranged for a TV crew to film Urbanus's 'model-harmonious showbiz family', but only Urbain is willing to cooperate to boost his career.

title: "Urusei yatsura" (1981) {I'm Lum-chan the Notorious/It's Raining Oil in Our Town (#1.1)}
plot: In the first episode, only high-schooler Ataru Moroboshi can stop an alien invasion by playing tag with the gorgeous princess of the invaders, Lum. Against very long odds, he wins, only to find he now has an unexpected wife. While she's away, Ataru accidentally calls a space taxi. The fare: the Earth's entire supply of petroleum!

title: "Ushuaïa, le magazine de l'extrême" (1987) {Les Amchi (#1.1)}
plot: Due to extreme isolation since it was cut off from the Silk route, Ladakh, a Buddhist former kingdom in the Indian Himalayas, largely preserves its mainly Tibetan pastoral culture. The traditional healers and spiritual leaders, 'Amchi', often father-son, are the only medical help available to their small, tight, self-sufficient, highly mobile herdsmen communities raising yak cattle and goats. They apply the principles, laid down in 12th-century Buddhist writings, of traditional Tibetan-style medicine largely influenced from both China and India. It involves gathering and processing medicinal herbs and minerals. Further effect in hoped, in this deeply devout culture, from rituals and the involvement of the monastic community.

title: "V" (1983)
plot: Aliens pretending to be friendly come to Earth and are received openly. The aliens have masqueraded themselves to look just like humans. When it is discovered that the aliens' planet is dying and that they have come to rape the Earth of its natural resources, the war for Earth begins. An important key to the humans' success is distinguishing their own from who the aliens are. A seemingly benevolent alien race forces Earth into fascist rule. In Los Angeles, a brilliant medical student unintentionally becomes the leader of one of the world's most effective resistance movements against the invaders. With the help of an intrepid journalist and a motley group of people from different walks of life united in the cause, they help to reveal the secret of the Visitors--who turn out to be a reptilian race--and aid in the global effort to save Earth for future generations. The main cities of Earth are surprisingly visited by 51 huge alien spacecraft, and their leader introduces themselves as a friendly people looking for cooperation with Earthlings. Soon, they blame scientists of sabotage and uprising against the Visitors. Journalist Mike Donovan and medical student Julie Parrish disclose the real intentions and the reptile appearance of the aliens, while groups of people organize resistance against the hostile invaders.

title: "V.I.P." (1998) {It's Val's Wonderful Life (#3.21)}
plot: While making an at first sight inoffensive exchange, Val is left on a yacht with a bomb, caught by her stiletto. She's presumed dead, so VIP loses its front star, hence within a month, clients and staff starts to desert to other jobs. Meanwhile Val has amnesia, stranding on a Mexican beach, where simple fishermen take her in. However, revenge is in the making.

title: "V.R. Troopers" (1994)
plot: Industrialist Carl Ziktor's virtual alter-ego Grimlord worked on the creation of an army made of warrior robots. And, before he became missing for two years, Ryan Steel's father worked with Professor Hart to prevent Grimlord's efforts by developing the ultimate weapon using the most advanced technology man had ever seen to stop him. Now, with the help of his friends J.B. and Kaitlin, Ryan and his friends use the VR power to prevent Grimlord's army from crossing over into our reality from Virtual Reality--and ruling it. However, will Ryan ever find his father?

title: "VH-1 Behind the Movie" (1999) {American Pie (#1.4)}
plot: Four guys, one school, several women, and a three week deadline. The mission: to lose their virginity by the end of prom night. It was "do it or die" for a pack of close-knit, perpetually horny friends in Universal's 1999 raunchy, coming of age comedy, American Pie. Since the genre of gross-out teen farces began in 1981 with Porky's, American Pie broke the mold, or this case, the pie crust.

title: "VOD Indie" (2012) {Making the Connections (#2.2)}
plot: VOD Indie brings together dispirit trailers connecting together to share the word of indie film. Meet filmmaker Jeremiah Mercer as he discusses his venture.

title: "Valentine" (2008) {Pilot (#1.1)}
plot: Aphrodite, the Greek Goddess of Love, and her family are sent down from their residence on Mount Olympus to the city Los Angeles to use their skill of magic to make sure that true love continues to blossoms on Earth. Taking the alias of Grace Valentine, Aphrodite is forced to ask a local romance novelist, named Kate Provicence, for help which angers Grace's son Eros the Cupid (aka: Danny Valentine), a charming Lithoario who trades his bow-and-arrow for a love gun. But Grace's cheerful daughter, Phoebe, is happy to have outside help, as well as her cousin Leo Francisci ('Hercules'). But Grace has other complications when her former lover, Ray Howard ('Hephaestus') returns wanting to make up for lost time. Meanwhile, the Valentines try to spark love between a pair of long-time friends, named Roland and Joanna, who are soul mates and Kate is happy to help bring the couple together.

title: "Valerie's Home Cooking" (2015) {Too Hot to Cook (#3.3)}
plot: Recipes, for when it's too hot to cook, are tested by Valerie and her friend, 'Faith Ford' (qv). The menu includes lobster club sandwiches; savory pickle spears; a classic Greek salad; honey citrus Southern iced tea; microwave potato chips; and lemon icebox cake.

title: "Van Helsing" (2016) {Stay Inside (#1.3)}
plot: When the hospital's power source is damaged, Vanessa and the survivors only have three hours of reserve power for the UV lights - the only thing keeping the vampires at bay. While Vanessa and Axel head into the ruins of Seattle to scavenge parts, the others are left to fight: against both vampires and amongst themselves.

title: "Vanderpump Rules" (2013) {Fully Engaged (#4.11)}
plot: Stassi has been sniffing around SUR, but Lisa Vanderpump wants her to keep her distance. Scheana and Ariana discover that their friendship may be more damaged than they ever knew. With the SUR crew headed to Hawaii for Jax & Tom's birthdays, James plots to get invited on the trip. Kristen attempts to make peace with Sandoval, newly engaged Katie takes her engagement ring on a victory lap at SUR, and Faith and Lala skinny dip in the most unlikely of places.

title: "Vanguard" (2006) {This (Illegal) American Life (#5.6)}
plot: There are 12 million people living unlawfully in the United States. In this Vanguard episode, Mariana van Zeller explores the lives of two: a senior at UCLA named Ilse and a strawberry picker named Filemon. In their stories, van Zeller finds testament to both the power of the American Dream and the absolute failure of American border policies.

title: "Varga" (2008)
plot: Varga is a powerful being from outer space who lands on Earth who through the help of a kind-hearted girl, will protect mankind from the forces of evil. As Varga, she will also go through different life experiences that will test her character while she saves the world in secret. Princess Vara is a powerful human beings from outer space: Planet Vargon lands on Earth through with her destined is willing to protect mankind from the forces of evil to help from a kind-hearted earthling girl named Olga as Varga is an alien super-heroine to save the world in secret gifted with superpowers to beat up the villains and villainesses to continued their journey together to fight the bad guys.

title: "Vega$" (1978) {Consortium (#2.17)}
plot: Roth is planning to put a hotel casino in Toronto and to help him with financing, he organizes a consortium of businessmen. But they're having a hard time on deciding who should be in charge. Roth wants Paul Bracken, one of his people and Dan's brother in law to be the one. But one of the members of the consortium, Mel Brandon, wants to be the one in charge. So sets out to make Paul undesirable by going after Dan and everyone around him, Bea and Binzer.

title: "VeggieTales" (1993) {The Asparagus of La Mancha (#1.1)}
plot: Bob and Larry receive a letter from a girl named Lucy. Her friend Sarah is acting weird. The other girls stopped liking her and want Lucy to do likewise. Archibald attempts to solve the problem with a story from his Big Book of Oddities, saying if your friend's acting weird shoot them to the moon. However, Bob has a better story, The Asparagus of La Mancha. Pancho must help his friend, Don Quiote, as their café competes with a new restaurant, The Food Factory. We learn the importance of sticking by our friends.

title: "Venom Hunters" (2016)
plot: Every year, venomous snakes kill over 100,000 people and hospitalize thousands more. Despite this staggering number, the deadly venom is also used to save lives in the production of anti-venom. There's a problem though: anti-venom supplies are dwindling every year, making the stakes even higher for brave professionals who harvest this equally deadly and precious substance. New Discovery series VENOM HUNTERS will follow four brave teams of expert snake hunters who have the guts and skills to chase down the world's most venomous snakes and collect this highly toxic liquid. Each team has unique motivations and thrives on the thrill of the hunt, but they all share the same goal: saving the lives of others. The series premiere of VENOM HUNTERS debuts Wednesday, Feb. 17 at 10/9c on Discovery. From the Florida swamplands and the plains of Oklahoma, to the Australian outback and Arizona desert, the fearless venom experts will put their lives on the line to track, catch and harvest the venom from these deadly reptiles. The demand for venom is at an all-time high as it is now being used to not only create anti-venom, but also as a key part of cutting-edge medical research that aims to treat diseases such as diabetes, heart disease and even cancer. With over 600 species of venomous snakes worldwide, these hunters will be risking their lives with every step - one wrong move could be their last.

title: "Verborgen verhalen" (2009) {Drie musketiers}
plot: 'For wherever there is jealousy and selfish ambition, there you will find disorder and evil of every kind.' (James 3:16) Until recently Adriaan and his brother formed the Three Musketeers with Suus, the girl next door. But Adriaan and Ferry are very different: Adriaan receives high marks at school, and Ferry is more occupied with playing guitar in his band. Adriaan becomes jealous when he thinks that Suus is in love with the popular Ferry. When Adriaan sees them kissing, he becomes mad and acts like a fool. But eventually Adriaan finds out that they were just pretending and that Suus likes him most.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {(#1.3687)}
plot: Now the press knows about the Italian money pit, the bank withdraws the crucial credit agreement. Sebastian suspects Tristan of being the leak, ignoring he's blackmailed by Tanya. Philipp helps the foundation out when the ladies refuse to trade his charming company for Nicola's. Ansgar triumphs when Ludwig accepts responsibility and plans to hand over the management to Ansgar. Elisabeth however beats him to the punch at the press conference and takes the blame herself.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {(#1.3747)}
plot: Chrolli are exhausted by the combined duties of jobs and foster-fatherhood. The Von Lahnstein wood form's first big deal celebration is overshadowed by Ludwig's worries for expelled Tristan; who sees no alternative then accept to move in with Tanya. Lydia is delighted with Matthias's place.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Auf der falschen Fährte (#1.4410)}
plot: Andi wrestles with his conscience and evidence die, while Frank is clearly dangerously suspicious. Tristan is touched that Alexa seems to chose him over a new life overseas. Elisabeth, Charlie and Rebecca are ready to hire Eva as prototype seamstress, until a journalist uncovers her escort past.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Das Fest der Liebe (#1.4210)}
plot: After a cautious firm Christmas party speech, Sebastian would go on Swiss holiday, but Tanja prefers to stay at home as she smells Ansgar is up to something big. Indeed he stages a major accountancy error which he prevents SEbatsian filing, so as to convince Ludwig he puts the firm's interests first. Emilio and the Wolfs are getting attached to Christmas foundling Max. After a woman overhears Thomas's suggestion to adopt him being turned down by Viktoria, the boy is stole from his pram. Bella refuses Charlie's generous gift, a vintage scooter she bought from Luca, but reconsiders after finding out from Clarissa how unselfishly Charlie saved pregnant pseudo-thief Jessica's job. Butler Justus pokers with Hannes and the cook.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Der letzte Weg (#1.4376)}
plot: Andi and Bella return home sulking, Oli's mediation attempt has no result. Ansgar tries to wriggle out his forced wedding by telling blackmailer-bride Tanja she canceled it due to her remaining feelings for ex Sebastian. Emilio and the Wolf clan attend Viktoria's funeral with friends, even Juri, but Thomas runs off into the forest for his own, private goodbye ritual with flowers.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Du kriegst mich nicht (#1.4577)}
plot: Emilio picked a fight with Per on Kim's birthday, so she rages as spoiled brat, but Thomas makes her see sense and appreciate her husband's sometimes misplaced devotion. Ben got imposed a restraining order but still manages to intrude the firm and castle by package and accomplice, so police protection for Elsiabeth is requested, but Frak is furious to be personally assigned due to Lahnstein connections. Dispairing over Ansgar's plans, Alexa agrees to conspire against him with Tanja.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Enttäuschte Hoffnung (#1.3786)}
plot: Thanks to Philipp, Berger fails to shoot Nicola and is sent off the castle with a beating by Ansgar. The lovers face the blackmailer together, without the ax, and realize she never meant to let him off anyhow. Sensitive Christian and cheeky Andi make Dana admit she has the hopeless hots for her sister's lover Hagen.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Geister der Vergangenheit (#1.4393)}
plot: Emilio and the Wolf sisters got Thomas to agree to hire domestic help in principle, but he systematically turns away every applicant. When Biggi arrives, he's out, and the youth considers her just right. Ansgar assures Sebastian to be over Eva. Next a fight leads her to turn away from Ansgar too and resume escort work. Juri enjoys a traditional Sebian engagement with Martha and mates. To her horror, he has another war trauma nightmare and she finds his keepsakes and weapon concerning his parents' murder, but gets him to dispose of those. Both still ignore, like Sasha, that he has the other dog tag half.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Ich folge meinem eigenen Willen (#1.4430)}
plot: Despite initial reluctance, Sebastian accepts Ansgar's demand to act as comatose Tanja's guardian and arrange a quick divorce, albeit on favorable terms in case she ever wakes up. Ricardo and Justus, who reluctantly resort to hypnosis, help Dana and Jessica realize adopting Max is best. Hearing from Thore that Marlene announced 'they' are moving to New york, Rebecca objects to being mistaken for her lesbian lover's luggage.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Kopfschuss (#1.4332)}
plot: Sebastian starts hoping, despite his guilt for causing the accident, that Ansgar's condition will disable him as president for good, so when Ricardo's tests suggest recovery prospects, Sebastian proposes to bribe the professor who will pronounce on Ansgar's mental disability. In jail with Sasha, Juri misses a major LCL meeting, but Martha presents his latest designs in his place. Emilio being beleaguered by the Wolf sisters renders the home into a noise battlefield, so pregnant Viktoria sneaks out to his burrito home.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Mutterliebe (#1.3810)}
plot: After Tanya's fall, Sebastian feels guilty and worries, especially for their baby, unlike her, although neither is diagnosed actually hurt. Ansgar brings just what she needs: their son Hannes. Tristan advises Marlena to accept granting a pop magazine a 'home story', which would help the family image as well as her career, but she refuses because Hagen dislikes the exposure. After Dana betrays that to the reporter, the only alternative for such a 'pre-marital rift' headline is accepting after all.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Schatten der Vergangenkeit (#1.3841)}
plot: Ansgar drops by at HQ just to enervate Sebastian's team. Tristan has found a reputable music producer who offers Marlena an ideal part. Yet instead of enjoying their budding success, the ingrate singer wines it's 'just another' musical. Hagen and friends keep pondering how to handle Dana now she's staying 'for the stallion's sake'. Thomas calms down Kim after Viktoria's scolding, unsuspecting his wife is hiding a pregnancy of her own.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Tanz am Abgrund (#1.4532)}
plot: Oli tries a last time to kiss straight Sasha, who makes crystal clear the gay experiment is over. So the house mates throw a goodbye party for Oli. Emilio and the Wolfs have a hard time convincing Kim she's not guilty of Ansgar fate, which looks like death in the forest cabin fire.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Verlass mich nicht (#1.4213)}
plot: Andi gloomily hears Oli almost sympathize with Bella's disregard for his warnings concerning Tristan, who meanwhile wins some sympathy from her when asked about his 'alleged' psychotic history. Riccardo is not amused after his night shift when Jessica bangs on his door for an urgent medical certificate, as Hagen tipped off Tanja the baby may be in danger if she flies along on a dream mission to Dhubai. A poor forgery in stead of the gynecological referral sees her spot taken by Viktoria. Tristan isn't given time by Elisabeth to come to terms with Ludwig's condition, Rebbecca enjoys some quality time only to and even harder back in reality.

title: "Verbotene Liebe" (1995) {Wenn ich's nicht besser wüsste ... (#1.4588)}
plot: Olli, who was already advising Bella to forget about attractive doctor Jo, meet him in a gay bar and learns her lover is bi, and interested in him. Tim saves the day by presenting Rebecca's public rudeness to him as a lover's quarrel, yet only gets more ingratitude from her. Alexa manages to win Elisabeth confidence and an LCL job by apparently betraying Tanja.

title: "Verdades Secretas" (2015) {Alex Exige Que Fanny Exclua Giovanna Do Book Rosa (#1.17)}
plot: Giovanna faces Alex. Carolina asks Angel if she is dating Guilherme. Alex seeks psychological counseling about Giovanna. Darlene tells Hilda and Carolina that Guilherme is a good guy. Amanda advises Alex to get closer to Giovanna and show interest in his daughter's life. Alex demands that Fanny remove Giovanna from the pink book and offer her modeling jobs. Alex calls a family meeting and Pia is surprised by the changes in her ex-husband's behavior. Alex asks Giovanna to travel with him to Angra and suggests that she invite her friends. Giovanna decides to invite Angel to travel with her.

title: "Vermist" (2008) {Bart (#3.1)}
plot: Steve's fiancée Jolien's legally dead ex, Bart Geeraerts, is spotted after being missing for six years, so the wedding is delayed. Nick has been cleared by IA and returns on the job, albeit under drug supervision. he stills braves Coppens's instructions by telling Steve, who informs Jolien, but she's kidnapped soon after. Nick and Steve investigate, although the team is officially off the case, discovering not only Bart's fake Brazilian identity but also he must be entangled in dirty cops' organized drug crime.

title: "Veronica Mars" (2004) {Charlie Don't Surf (#3.4)}
plot: When Logan is informed that his inheritance is running low, he become suspicious and enlists Veronica's help to sort through his financial records. Veronica uncovers that large sums of money have been going to a man named Charlie Stone. Meanwhile, Keith is hired by Harmony to investigate her cheating husband.

title: "Veronique Von Venom: Horror Hostess Hottie" (2012) {Backstabbing Bitches Must Die! (#1.11)}
plot: Miss V is joined by her backstabbing bitch friend Clarisse, who provides a review of the erotic novel PHANTOM. They also review the new Eclipse Series box set WHEN HORROR CAME TO SHOCHIKU, featuring the creepy Japanese classics THE LIVING SKELETON and GOKE, BODY SNATCHER FROM HELL. After all those goodies, Miss V confronts Clarisse about her relationship with her ex, Zeus, and finds out that they are indeed officially dating! Needless to say, someone is getting their ass fired!

title: "Vessel Fitness" (2006) {Pilates Plus (#2.6)}
plot: The secret to Pilates Plus is that it works from the inside out, integrating your core with every move. The deep-toning approach goes far beyond the surface muscles, working hard-to-reach areas that traditional exercises can't reach. Infused with yoga-inspired postures and core-conditioning exercises, this invigorating workout produces real results and will leave you feeling relaxed and refreshed.

title: "Vic the Viking" (2013) {Cow Express (#1.39)}
plot: On his way back to Flake, Halvar loses the ring he plans to give Ylva for their anniversary... in a cow's stomach! the crew doesn't have a choice but to take the cow with them and hope to get the ring once it poops. The travel with the cow is an expedition in itself, but back in Flake, they also have to hide the cow from Ylva, who thinks it's a very unusual (and rather lame) anniversary present. As the banquet is about to start and the ring hasn't reappeared yet, Vic has to work his genius to get the cow to "deliver her package". As promised, Hagar brings a ring from the latest plunder raid for his and Ylva's jubilee anniversary. Alas, while he playfully tosses it, the ring ends up gobbled by a cow and must leave 'the natural way'. Unable to wait, he buys the 'milk factory' and Vic lures it aboard, but digestion by seven stomachs proves tauntingly slow, cutting it short to the ceremony, despite a fruit trick.

title: "Vic the Viking" (2013) {War of the Berries (#1.71)}
plot: Halvar takes the children of Flake with their teacher, Mrs Flart, on an island for a field trip. On the island, two teams are made for the children to compete and bring back a flag from the top of the island and a bucket full of berries. Gibly is with Mrs Flart's team and Vic and Ylvi are with Halvar's team. But soon, the picking of berries turns into a game of Viking-style paint ball, and each child hit by berry juice is eliminated. The last standing are Gilby and Vic. Vic wins after Gilby tries to cheat as much as he can. Vic's teacher Flart asks Halvar for a naval lift to the annual school;excursion island, where the kids harvest ripe red berries, then assigns Vic and Gilby captains of two rival teams. Abusing the rule that soiled pupils are excluded, Gilby tries eliminating Vic's team by bombarding them by sling. Halgar joins Vic's team. His warrior skills may help, he's also a big target and falls into a pit.

title: "Vice News" (2013) {Odessa's Georgian Leader: The Governor}
plot: Ukraine's government has found a novel way of trying to deal with corruption. They've hired a number of foreigners to head government agencies, ministries and even an entire region, in the hopes that their status as outsiders will make them less susceptible to the temptation to award contracts to their best friends, who presumably are not in Ukraine. In the port of Odessa, Mikheil Saakashvili has been appointed governor of the city and the surrounding region. Saakashvili was once the president of Georgia, but fled the country when a new government pressed charges of corruption against him. VICE News' Simon Ostrovsky spent a day with with the president-turned-governor to find out how he was handling his new job.

title: "Vice" (2013) {China's Ghost Towns/Egypt on the Brink (#1.6)}
plot: Fifteen years ago, China changed its policy so people could buy their own homes. Real-estate investments boomed, and new cities began popping up. The problem is: people don't live in what have become 'ghost cities.' Over two years ago, Arab Spring climaxed in the overthrow of President Mubarak in Egypt. But for many Egyptians, the situation has actually gotten worse.

title: "Victoria Wood's Nice Cup of Tea" (2013)
plot: Comedy legend Victoria Wood travels the globe to explore Britain's love affair with tea in a two part special on the little plant that changed the world. From the back streets of Kolkata to the mega city of Shanghai, Victoria reveals how the cozy cuppa united east and west, triggered wars and helped us win them. Along the way she peeks into a fascinating world of chai wallahs, opium smokers, Assam tea pickers and grumpy elephants. She asks: how did this strange exotic leaf become such an important part of British life? In Britain, Victoria visits Woburn Abbey, Blackpool and Harrogate - where she mugs up on the history - and learns how to slurp and spit. She shares a cuppa with Graham Norton and Doctor Who actor Matt Smith. In New York, home of the tea bag, she warms the pot with musician and self-confessed tea addict Morrissey. What is it about tea we love so much, and how did we all end up hooked? Put the kettle on for a nice cup of tea with Victoria Wood.

title: "Victory at Sea" (1952) {Full Fathom Five (#1.21)}
plot: See the submariners training, relaxation styles, and preparation for warfare. Admiral Lockwood the Commander, Submarines, Pacific Fleet (COMSUBPAC) announced that unrestricted warfare against Japanese merchant and war shipping was authorized.

title: "Videofashion Collections" (2011) {Paris Collections Spring/Summer 2017 (#11.15)}
plot: In this issue of Videofashion Collections, get right up close to see these fashionable moments from Paris Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2017. Designer David Koma draws inspiration from deep sea life and oceanic creatures for his athletic and sculptural collection for Mugler. The Rochas woman is prim and polished for spring, with 1940s silhouettes and extraordinary colors at the center of designer Alessandro Dell'Acqua's vision. Etam celebrates 100 years of French lingerie. Plus, We Are Muze offers a coterie of Dutch design talent a chance to debut their latest collections in Paris.

title: "Vikings" (2013) {A Good Treason (#4.1)}
plot: Entry to Valhalla eludes Ragnar but as he lies in his sick bed in Kattegat events unfold beyond his control. Bjorn orders the arrest of Floki for Athelstan's murder while in Paris, Rollo betrays the last of his Viking supporters to strengthen his position in the French Court. Meanwhile, in Hedeby, Kalf announces joint Earldom with Lagertha, but is power-sharing Kalf's true intention and is Lagertha actually willing to share what once was hers? The Vikings are back home, where Bjorn orders Floki arrested for the murder of Athelstan. Count Kalf of Hedeby proclaims he'll rule it jointly with comrade in arms Lagertha, leading to a bloody confrontation with schemer Einar who overthrew her in his favor, where Horik's heir Erlund swings the balance in Kalf's favor. After fever-nightmarish weeks, Ragnar comes trough but scolds Bjorn for forcing him to order Floki executed. Bjorn leaves to test himself at wilderness endurance, shortly afterward Floki escapes. In Paris, Rollo, whom Bjorn left in command, again disapproved by Ragnar, despite total lack of command of Frankish language or culture, converts to Catholicism and weds an unwilling princess. When loyal Eirik warns Rollo the men grow discontent with what starts to look like treason, Rolle surprises the camp with a Frankish army.

title: "Villervalle i Söderhavet" (1963) {Familjerådet (#1.1)}
plot: The schoolmates Villervalle and Nisse are preparing an amateur production of a play about Robinson Crusoe. After dinner Villervalle takes part in a family council. His father, Dr Ernst Botman, then announces that he has been appointed by UNESCO as a nutritional expert at an archipelago near Tahiti in the Pacific. Villervalle is happy, because now he will experience how it is to be a Robinson Crusoe in real life. When the father tells him and his sister Lenalisa that they cannot come along because of their schoolwork, they get disappointed. The grandmother intervenes and says that she can take care of the teaching. The children want to bring their dog with them to the Pacific, and the grandmother her cats. They have already put the animals in cages, when the father says no. By mistake the cages are anyhow brought to the train station. In the last minute the cages are discovered and carried off the train.

title: "Virgin Territory" (2014)
plot: Explores the real-life stories of 15 young adults from across the country as they navigate the complexities of relationships and one of the most complicated and emotional decisions of their young adult lives: whether to have sex or remain a virgin. Virgin Territory will delve into the mindset of four young people each week, some who are hanging on to their v-card for as long as possible and others who are desperately hoping to lose it.

title: "Viva Bomma" (2013)
plot: In Granny's Kitchen Wisdom two generations are brought together to avoid the disappearance of all those original old family recipes. The grandmother and her grandson or granddaughter are brought together for a cooking afternoon. While preparing and revealing the secret ingredients of the old family recipe, the great memories and little family stories get relived, what makes it even more nostalgic and heart fulfilling to watch.

title: "Voltron Force" (2011) {The Hunkyard (#1.6)}
plot: Hunk takes the cadets on a bonding mission to his secret junkyard called The Hunkyard to learn teamwork and to build "crush cars" so they can have their own vehicles. However, cadet bonding day comes to a halt when an army of Waderoids powered by Haggarium attack them and form together to make a massive scrap monster out of junk. When the rest of the Voltron Force arrives, they take the beast down by taking on a new form that makes Yellow Lion the body and head of Voltron and forms "Rock Wrecking Maces" as his battle weapon.

title: "Voltron: Defender of the Universe" (1984) {Princess Joins Up (#1.5)}
plot: Keith and the team scour the surface of Planet Arus, looking for brave citizens willing to help fight Zarkon. Scared due to the recent attacks, only Princess Allura herself is willing to join Voltron Force. When King Zarkon's best gladiator is turned into a Robeast by Haggar, not even Voltron can stop it. Only if Allura can find a way to help will Arus be saved. Zarkon selects his strongest robot-monster by elimination and has Haggar gives it extra powers and features to outdo Voltron's. The Voltron Force tries to convince the Arusians to leave their caverns and offer help to them so they have an easier time warding off attacks, but without success. When the Robeast attacks, Voltron is formed quickly but seems destined to lose. Allies are few, but will be needed for Arus not to fall under Zarkon's power.

title: "Voroniny" (2009) {(#1.11)}
plot: Kostya discovers that the ring that he gave Vera a fake. It urgently needs to change it. Meanwhile, Galina Ivanovna recognizes that the earrings that Nikolai Petrovich gave her an anniversary is also a fake. It is all grist husband to buy new earrings.

title: "Vrazdy v kruhu" (2015)
plot: The Zodiac Murders series does not aspire to rank among other popular crime serials; it seeks to become one of a new, modern style. The line connecting all its parts are the signs of the zodiac. Each of the twelve episodes deals with a mysterious crime, of characteristics associated with the respective sign. Apart from the standard crime investigation elements, in each episode we can follow a "private" line, represented by an amorous triangle kept secret, formed by major Holina, the intelligent and competent head of the investigation team, his subordinate captain Rostia Bor, confined to wheelchair due to an accident, and his wife, psychologist Sabina, who studies and uses astrology for psychological personality analysis, thus helping the two detectives in their work.

title: "Válótársak" (2015)
plot: Bálint Sáfár, the charming businessman has several affairs, and when his wife Zsófi - with whom he has two children - finds out about his infidelity, she breaks up with him. Bálint decides to move to one of his houses on sale. On the same day Bálint's subcontractor Joci, who renovates his houses, breaks up with his girlfriend Szonja and decides to stay at this same house. Joci has some serious issues in his private life. His girlfriend Szonja couldn't get pregnant for years, and after her hormone therapy, he just can't live with her anymore. Dávid Jakab, successful businessman realises that his wife, Tamara hates him and wants to get a divorce on their 16th anniversary. Dávid asks Bálint if he could stay at his house while he tries to save his marriage. The series follows these freshly-divorced guys' lives as they try to solve their relationship problems.

title: "W817" (1999) {(#3.1)}
plot: Ellen says yes to Tom's marriage-proposal. He tells the boys he wants a simple marriage. She talks about a fairytale marriage with the girls. Steve is in competition with Jörg who wants to use the same subject as his thesis. They have to draw lots to see who can have the subject, but Steve usually loses bets. Now Carlo is gone, Akke makes Birgit partly manager like Carlo was. She's very enthusiastic with her new status.

title: "W817" (1999) {(#4.20)}
plot: Kim thinks it's her fault her parents are separating. Steve tells her it's not her fault. When he tells her, her father is not the easiest person to live with, she draws her conclusions. Birgit met Dieter. He makes her feel a lot better. When he comes by to take her for diner, Akke sees him. He thinks Dieter is a very freaky guy and warns Birgit. She sees nothing wrong with him. Tom and Jasmijn accidentally get involved with a student-demonstration for better vegetarian food in the canteen. Jasmijn even becomes their spokesperson although the subject doesn't interest her.

title: "WAGs" (2015) {Moving on Out (#2.8)}
plot: "Hollywood Medium" star, Tyler Henry, makes an emotional visit to the WAGS. Nicole makes a drastic decision that could end her relationship with Larry. Olivia faces a big decision about her future with Marcedes, and Sasha puts on a musical performance.

title: "WKRP in Cincinnati" (1978) {Johnny Comes Back (#1.14)}
plot: With Johnny gone, Andy finds a replacement for the morning shift in Doug Winner. Meanwhile, Johnny returns after getting quickly fired in L.A. for saying something obscene on the radio. Johnny and Andy discover that Doug is taking Payola in the form of cocaine from a record promoter. The Doctor gets his morning shift back!

title: "WTFark!" (2014) {My Scary Valentine (#1.13)}
plot: A Penn State Grad student left a box of chocolates labeled "whore" in a girl's apartment then returned an hour later and refused to leave. The residents locked themselves in a bedroom after he began acting weird and sniffing their furniture.

title: "WWII's Greatest Raids" (2014) {Rangers Lead the Way (#1.1)}
plot: US Army Rangers spearhead the biggest amphibious landing in history - the allied Invasion of France. They must conquer vertical cliffs before taking on the determined enemy. Then destroy the guns that threaten to blow the Allied fleet out of the water.

title: "Wagon Train" (1957) {The Artie Matthewson Story (#5.7)}
plot: While out scouting Duke finds Angie Matthewson, Flint's foster mother, near death. After staying with her overnight, Duke running late returns to the train to get Flint. Before she dies, she asks Flint to find her son Artie, with whom Flint has never gotten along. Angie tells Flint Artie is in the boom town of Richfield Diggings. Flint arrives to find the sheriff's posse returning with a dead body and he receives a very cold reception from everyone. Eventually a bartender lets Artie know a stranger is looking for him. Artie is busy with his girlfriend Melanie Sanders who is concerned about Artie's safety and the conflict between him and her foreman, Nick Fears. Artie sends the sheriff to bring Flint to him. Flint crosses paths with Melanie before meeting Artie and learning he has been elected mayor. Flint tells Artie that their mother has died while asking for Artie. It becomes apparent that he is up to his old ways hiring gunmen to enforce his rule but the businessmen and people of the town believes he has cleaned up the town and revere him including Melanie. Artie and the sheriff want Flint gone but not necessarily for the same reasons while Nick wonders about Flint's intentions.

title: "Wagon Train" (1957) {The Duncan McIvor Story (#7.25)}
plot: Duncan McIvor saves Duke and Bill from an attack by hostile Indians, and he is welcomed onto the wagon train. However, McIvor does not tell them at first that he is an Army lieutenant transferring to Fort Chacon which is a disciplinary post. Several people riding with the train purchase items previously stolen from the Army from two men who go by the names Garrett and Whitey. Duke learns about it after all the goods have been sold so he runs the men off. Upon hearing about it McIvor suggests Duke should have arrested the men and confiscated the goods. After Charlie and Barnaby find two soldiers staked out Indian style McIvor reveals his identity and confiscates the items, much to Bill's displeasure as the people are not compensated. However, when McIvor informs the Colonel in charge at nearby Fort Chacon of this, he is ordered to stop his investigation and soon finds himself court-martialed when his West Point roommate betrays him.

title: "Wagon Train" (1957) {The Jud Steele Story (#5.31)}
plot: A posse is pursuing two men who have hid due to winded horses. The posse misses them but the men know they need fresh horses as the posse will be back. They come upon Charlie using a horse to collect firewood but he refuses to trade and is backed up by Bill Hawks. The men decide to spend the night with the wagon train so their horses can recover. Bill and Duke recognize the leader as Jud Steele who is a wanted gunfighter. That night Bill catches them trying to steal two fresh horses. He confronts Steele who for some reason doesn't cock and pull the trigger letting Bill kill him. They bury the body and Bill decides to ride to the nearest town to report the shooting. Upon riding into town he finds a monument and gravestone for the man he killed. The sheriff and the town say Steele was killed five years earlier while sheriff during a payroll robbery but Bill isn't convinced and knows they are hiding something.

title: "Wagon Train" (1957) {The Race Town Story (#8.4)}
plot: Bill accompanies Barnaby to Sam Race's tent city of "entertainers", where a girl from the train that Barnaby likes has taken a job, not as a singer, as she had thought, but as a saloon girl. Bill hopes to keep Barnaby out of trouble with the gambling and con games Race runs, but trouble and humiliation is just what they both find.

title: "Wagon Train" (1957) {Wagon to Fort Anderson (#4.36)}
plot: Flint comes across four survivors of an Indian massacre, the two Ellison sisters and two Carder brothers. One of the sisters is deaf and mute. The brothers are the only survivors of their Army unit. The older brother, Joe, wants to desert and take advantage of the situation in order to break away and look for gold. The younger brother, George, is simple-minded and good-hearted but loyal to the older one who raised him. Flint tries to lead the four to safety, but Joe Carder tries to mislead the Ellison sisters into believing that Flint is leading them into danger.

title: "Waiters" (2012) {New Recruits (#1.3)}
plot: Quentin and Paul are having a slow Friday night at Sauce and decide to hold a round of interviews for new kitchen and wait staff. Little do the interviewees know, Quentin and Paul have no intention of hiring anyone and just want to pass the time. As the night goes on, drunken stupor replaces sobriety and the restaurant becomes a night club.

title: "Wake Up Tahoe" (2013) {Celtic Harpist Anne Roos plays LIVE on Wake Up Tahoe (#1.71)}
plot: Celtic harpist Anne Roos about playing the harp, life in Lake Tahoe, and Anne's three books on wedding planning, with two music videos for "She Moved Through the Fair" and "Fields of Gold" plus Adra with her daily update on "10 things to do in Lake Tahoe"

title: "Waking the Dead" (2000) {Mask of Sanity: Part 1 (#6.7)}
plot: James Jensen has just been released after spending 20 years in a psychiatric institution. He had admitted to killing three men and in the course of his trial, he attacked a male nurse that had been assigned to care for him. The judge ruled he was unfit to stand trial and was incarcerated indefinitely. On his release however, the widow of Henry Goss, one of the three victims, receives the wallets of each of the dead men. James has no recollection of the events leading up to his original arrest and can't explain some elements of his confession. James is however haunted by memories of his time at the Hickley Home for Children, where he grew up. The fact that all three of the original victims were in some way connected to the children's home does not escape the police's attention. James Jenson, a long-term patient, is released from a secure psychiatric unit. On the same day the wallets of his murder victims are sent to the widow of one of the deceased. Is there a connection? Is Jenson still a danger to society? And are there more killings to come?

title: "Walang hanggan" (2012) {Emily Wants Daniel to Be Ready with His Face Off with the Montenegros (#1.30)}
plot: Margaret sees Genia's note and says her sister is making trouble once again. Marco tells the caretaker he will meet with his aunt soon, after arranging the family's move to Manila. Emily begins training Daniel to care for her farm. He insists on going back to Olivares but Emily says he has to equip himself with the right tools to fight back home. Tomas and Katerina also move to Manila, the former following Nathan's wishes. Tomas continues to waste Nathan's money at the gambling tables and starts to woo Johanna. Genia finally meets with Marco and reveals to him that Daniel is his son.

title: "Walker, Texas Ranger" (1993) {Rainbow's End (#6.10)}
plot: A horse owner tries to bolster his horses' value by making sure they win all their races. But when another owner puts a crimp on his plans he kills the man and the trainer who was in his pocket. Walker investigates, and at the same time he tries to help his friend, who wants to put his horse Rainbow's End in the Texas Derby.

title: "Walking with Dinosaurs" (1999) {Cruel Sea (#1.3)}
plot: Oxfordshire, U.K.- 149 million years B.C. This episode follows a shoal of young fish-like Ophthalmosaurus as they struggle to survive the Late Jurassic seas, evading predators like the gigantic Liopleurodon. On land, the dinosaur Eustreptospondylus scrapes out a living as a scavenger, occasionally preying on pterosaurs like Rhamphorhynchus.

title: "Wallykazam!" (2014) {Mission for Mom (#1.19)}
plot: It's Mother's Day and Wally wants to give his mom her favorite flower, a doozydaisy. But the flower won't bloom! Plant expert Libby Light Sprite says there's only one thing that can make it bloom - the Wonder Puddle. Libby leads Wally and Norville on a journey to the fabled puddle, which lies deep within magical Sprightly Grove. It should be an easy trip, but they get trapped in giant bubbles, must out-sing the melodious Singing Shrubs, and have to get past three flower-hungry wild Borgelorps. Wally overcomes all these obstacles, determined to make the flower bloom and give his mom the happiest Mother's Day ever!

title: "Wan pîsu: One Piece" (1999) {Merciless Fight to the Death! Luffy vs. Crocodile (#2.63)}
plot: Straw Hat crew rush to Alubarne, where the final battle will take place. But Luffy is captured by Crocodile, so he tells the others to go without him. Battle between Luffy and Crocodile begins, with Crocodile overpowers him with his devil fruit's ability, sand.

title: "Wanderlust" (2016) {Raymond Tallis (#1.4)}
plot: Alicja meets Raymond Tallis, a neuroscientist and philosopher who doesn't believe in God and calls himself an optimistic humanist. After his retirement he became a full-time writer and poet, and he writes about art, culture, spirit and nature. Alicja is a guest in his home in Manchester and accompanies him in The Athenaeum Club, a gentleman's club in Pall Mall in London, where Darwin and Dickens were members.

title: "Wanted: Dead or Alive" (1958) {Fatal Memory (#1.2)}
plot: Josh Randall rides into Fort Considine, a deserted military camp. All soldiers left some years ago, except the retired Colonel Sykes and his daughter Jody. Sykes has sent a telegram to Josh, asking him for help. Someone has spread a poster announcing 1000 dollars in reward for Colonel Sykes, dead or alive, but the poster is a fake. The man who made the poster obviously wants some bounty hunter to kill Sykes, instead of doing it himself. After some investigation among printers in the area, Josh finds out who printed the poster. The printer says he was forced to do it by a man called Ben Hood. Josh had met Ben during the war. He deserted from the army to get married. In a trial he was sentenced to 20 years in prison for desertion, on a proposal by Colonel Sykes. But Josh finds out that Ben Hood died 10 months ago in jail, so he cannot be the one behind the poster.

title: "Wanted: Dead or Alive" (1958) {Triple Vise (#2.25)}
plot: Josh and Jason are asked by Al Hemp in jail in the U.S. to kill a man for $500. Josh refuses as that is not his type of business. Al explains he is about to hang for a crime the man committed because Al agreed to take the man's place until he returns. Instead, the man ran to Mexico. When Josh asks why Al agreed to such a crazy plan, Al's excuse is that he has done it all his life as the man is his brother Billy Hemp. They agree to try to find Billy and return him to the U.S. Upon arriving in the Mexican village where he is thought to be, they enter the cantina. They ask the bartender but he refuses to give any information about hemp but offers them drinks and a room. Jason tries to convince Josh that they must stay alert so they need to skip, drinks, women, and gambling. However, Josh feels the job may require an unique approach. He asks for a drink while making small talk with the barmaid Juanita. After they decide Hemp is not in town, Josh loses him at a cabin. Back in town events take an explosive turn as they hunt for Hemp.

title: "War and Remembrance" (1988) {Part 6 (#1.6)}
plot: Pug Henry returns to Washington where President Roosevelt asks him to take an assignment at the U.S. Embassy in Moscow. There, the U.S. Ambassador is none too pleased with the lack of acknowledgment from the Russians on the benefits of lend-lease but Pug is impressed with the work they are doing. All efforts to get Natalie, Louis and Aaron out of Lourdes fail and they learn that all of the internees are being transferred to Baden Baden in Germany. At Pearl Harbor, Byron reports for duty as Executive Officer on a new submarine, the Moray, commanded by his old friend "Lady" Aster. What he doesn't realize is that his friend is having an affair with his widowed sister-in-law, Janice.

title: "Warlocks Rising" (2013) {The Hard Life (#1.1)}
